title: Super Soft Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 315 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
40 g unsalted butter, softened at room temperature
55 g butter, softened at room temperature
115 g thickened cream  o 115 g whipping cream
20 g butter, softened at room temperature
steps: Place plain flour and salt in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/2.0 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Add milk, yeast, egg, butter and sugar, mix 2 min/40°C/speed 2.
Add reserved flour mixture, mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Let stand for 5 minutes.
Knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Transfer dough to a pastry mat and fold pastry mat to wrap dough like a parcel. Place dough in Varoma dish.
Place 250 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma with dough into position, warm 20 min/70°C/speed . Rinse mixing bowl.
Line a baking pan (18 cm x 28 cm) with parchment paper and set aside. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in butter, brown sugar and ground cinnamon. Mix well and set aside.
Transfer dough onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out dough into a rectangle (30 cm x 38 cm, 2 mm thick). Using an offset spatula, spread reserved cinnamon filling over the dough surface.

Preheat oven to 180°C. Starting from the long end, roll dough up tightly along longest edge and slice into 15 equal pieces, then tightly place into prepared baking pan (cut side up). Cover pan with pastry mat and allow rolls to rise for another 20 minutes or until nearly doubled in size.
Place thickened cream in mixing bowl, warm 20 sec/40°C/speed 2. Once rolls have risen, pour warmed cream over rolls, leave for 5 minutes to soak. Rinse mixing bowl.
Bake for 15-17 minutes (180°C) until light golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream cheese and butter in mixing bowl, whisk 1 min/speed 4.
Add vanilla extract and icing sugar, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Spread frosting over cooled rolls and serve immediately.
tips: You can omit the cream cheese frosting. Instead, spread the leftover sticky cream at the bottom of the baking pan onto the cinnamon rolls once you have removed them from the pan.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Risotto bolognese
ingredients: 100 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 celery stalk, cut into pieces (approx. 50 g)
250 g risotto rice (e.g. Arborio or Carnaroli)
1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place beef mince and 1 tbsp olive oil in mixing bowl, cook 4 min 30 sec/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place carrot, celery and shallot in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and sauté 2 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add rice and sauté 3 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add water, stock cube, tomatoes, bay leaf, salt and pepper and stir 5 sec//speed 2. Cook 22 min/100°C//speed .
Remove bay leaf, add reserved cooked beef mince, 30 g grated parmesan and butter, and use spatula to stir. Serve immediately with remaining Parmesan cheese.
tips: Replace the celery with green pepper.

title: Kek Pisang Lembab (Moist Banana Cake)
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Grease a loaf tin (10 cm x 23 cm) with oil and lightly dust with flour. Set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs, sugar and vegetable oil in mixing bowl, mix 5 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add bananas, mix 15 sec/speed 5.
Add plain flour, baking soda and baking powder, mix 45 sec/speed 3. Transfer batter to prepared loaf tin.

Bake for 45-60 minutes (150°C) or until a cake tester skewer comes out clean when inserted in the centre of the cake. Allow cake to cool in loaf tin for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Slice and serve.

title: Honey BBQ Chicken
ingredients: 800 g chicken thighs, boneless with skin
50 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 pinch toasted sesame seeds, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add light soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, honey, dark soy sauce, rice wine, sesame oil and black pepper to the bowl and mix. Set aside in refrigerator to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Place marinated chicken and marinade in mixing bowl, cook 20 min/Varoma//speed . Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve hot.
tips: Serve on top of steamed rice.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Soft Sweet Buns
ingredients: 60 g salted butter, cut in cubes (2 cm), plus extra for greasing and brushing
steps: Grease a baking tin (25 cm x 25 cm x 5 cm) and set aside.
Place water, yeast powder, caster sugar and salted butter in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add high protein flour, plain flour and salt, knead Dough /5 min. Transfer dough onto a pastry mat, wrap dough with pastry mat like a parcel and let proof for 15 minutes or until doubled in size. Divide into 16 equal portions and shape into balls. Arrange dough balls in rows of four in prepared baking tin. Cover with pastry mat or cling film, let proof for 30-45 minutes until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 170°C.
Bake for 15-20 minutes (170°C) until light golden brown. Transfer baked buns to a cooling rack. Using a pastry brush, lightly brush bun surface with butter. Allow to cool completely before serving.
tips: You may cover the buns with aluminium foil or parchment paper during the last 5 minutes of baking time if they begin to brown too much.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Butter Cake
ingredients: 250 g butter, softened and cut in cubes, plus extra for greasing (see tips)
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Lightly grease and line a 20 cm x 20 cm square cake tin with baking paper. Set aside. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in milk. Add eggs and vanilla extract to the bowl, set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place softened butter (room temperature) and sugar in mixing bowl, beat 2 min/speed 3.5.
Mix 40 sec/speed 3.5, adding reserved egg-milk mixture one egg at a time through hole in mixing bowl lid onto rotating blades to beat the mixture into a smooth batter.
Add self-raising flour, mix 30 sec/speed 2. Mix with spatula if necessary to combine well (see tips). Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer cake mixture into prepared square cake tin.

Bake in a preheated oven at 170°C for 30 to 40 minutes or until a cake tester skewer or toothpick comes out clean when it is inserted in the centre of the cake. Allow to cool in cake pan for 10 minutes before transfer to a serving plate and cool completely. Cut and serve.
tips: To soften butter, take it out of the refrigerator and leave it at room temperature for half an hour.
Do not repeat TM setting in step 4 to avoid overmixing on batter.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guideline, you may make necessary adjustment depending on the type of oven you are using.

You can weigh the flour on a piece of baking paper or plastic bag. Continue with step 4, transfer the flour through hole of mixing bowl lid. This helps the flour corporate with batter within the shortest time.

title: Mee Goreng Mamak
ingredients: 2 fresh red chillies, cut in pieces
100 g chicken breast fillets, with skin, cut in pieces (2-3 cm) (opcional)
2 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought, adjust to taste
300 g whole prawns, cleaned and shell removed
50 g fresh chives, cut in 3 cm length
50 g fresh mung bean sprouts (taugeh), rinsed with water and drained
steps: Place garlic cloves and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, red chillies, onions and chicken, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 2.
Add yellow noodles, dark soy sauce, chilli sauce, chicken stock powder, prawns and water, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add chives and bean sprouts, cook 1 min/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: To make prawns crunchy and bouncy, marinate with 2 tbsp of sugar for 1-2 hours in refrigerator. Rinse away sugar before use.
Chilli sauce recommended in this recipe to be tomato based chilli sauce.
For healthier version, remove chicken skin before cutting.
Fresh noodles work best for this recipe. If you use chilled noodles, thaw it in room temperature for 20 minutes, rinse with hot water and drain through Varoma dish before step 3.

title: Thai Steamed Fish With Lime
ingredients: 5 bird's eye chillies (chilli padi), adjust to taste
600 g barramundi fish (siakap) (1 whole fish), gutted and descaled, scored (see tips)
1 fresh green lime, cut in thin slices, to garnish
steps: Place coriander leaves, garlic cloves, bird’s eye chillies, red chillies, sugar, lime juice, fish sauce, 100 g water and chicken stock powder in mixing bowl, blend 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert 2 lemongrass stalks into the cavity of the fish. Place remaining 2 lemongrass stalks on a steaming tray (Ø 20 cm), arrange fish on top of lemongrass. Place the steaming tray in Varoma dish.

Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma. Carefully open Varoma lid, discard steaming liquid. Pour reserved garlic lime sauce onto steamed fish.
Set Varoma into position, steam 2 min/Varoma/speed 1 until cooked. Garnish with green lime slices. Serve immediately.
tips: Scoring the thickest part of the fish with 3 bone-deep cuts allows more of the flavour to be absorbed by the flesh and reduces steaming time.
To check whether the fish is cooked, its eye should pop out. The flesh should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks.

When selecting the tray to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); ensure the size of the tray is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Thai Green Curry Chicken
ingredients: 150 g fresh coriander, roots and stems included
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
3 - 6 bird's eye chillies (chilli padi), adjust to taste
150 g long beans, cut in 2 cm length
500 g chicken thighs, boneless and skinless, cut in strips (2 cm)
80 g green capsicum, cut in pieces
steps: Place cooking oil, coriander, lemongrass, bird's eye chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, galangal, ground cumin, ground coriander, white pepper powder, sugar, shrimp paste, 50 g coconut milk, fish sauce and lime juice in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 6 min/120°C/speed .
Add long beans, zucchini, chicken strips, green peppercorns, kaffir lime leaves, basil leaves, water and 150 g coconut milk, cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Add capsicum and cherry tomatoes, cook 1 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: If you can't find fresh coriander, replace with 150 g Chinese celery or fresh green chillies in step 1.
You can replace zucchini with brinjals, prolong time to 15 minutes in step 3.

title: Killer Toast
ingredients: 35 g butter, cut in cubes, plus extra for greasing
steps: Grease a loaf tin (19 cm x 10 cm x 10 cm) and set aside. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in butter. Set aside. Break egg in mixing bowl, without tare the weighing scale and top up with milk to 180 g.
Add sugar and yeast, mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 3.
Add flour and salt, knead Dough /3 min.
Knead Dough /2 min, meanwhile, add butter one cube at a time through hole of mixing bowl lid.

Knead Dough /2 min. Transfer the dough to pastry mat, cover and rest for 10 minutes. Divide dough into 3 equal portions. Flatten dough with a rolling pin into long rectangular shape, and roll into log shape. Repeat the steps for the remaining dough until finished. Transfer into greased loaf tins and proof for 1 hour or until the dough fills up 90% of loaf tins. During the last 10 minutes of proofing, preheat oven to 170°C.
Bake in preheated oven (170°C) for 40-45 minutes. Remove loaves from tins and allow them to cool on a cooling rack before slicing and serving.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Cover loosely with aluminium foil during baking if the toast browns too fast.
Salted toast: reduce sugar to 10 g in step 2 and use 1 tsp salt in step 3.

title: Chicken Porridge
ingredients: 1 - 2 pinches white pepper powder, adjust to taste
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place white rice, salt, sesame oil, chicken breast, chicken stock powder and water in mixing bowl, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 25 min/98°C/speed 1.
Shred 10 sec//speed 4. Add white pepper powder to taste. Garnish with spring onion. Serve hot.

title: Mee Hailam (Hailam Noodles)
ingredients: 200 g baby bak choy, horizontally halved, rinsed
300 g squid, cleaned and cut in rings
100 g fish cakes, cut in thin slices
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, bird‘s eye chillies in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and white pepper powder, cook 4 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add baby bak choy, prawns, squid, yellow noodles and fish cakes, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Let it stand for 2 minutes before serving.
tips: Fresh noodles work best for this recipe. If you use chilled noodles, thaw it in room temperature for 20 minutes, blanch in hot water for 1 minute and drain with Varoma dish before step 4.

title: Kam Heong (Golden Fragrance) Prawns
ingredients: 250 g large prawns, unpeeled, deveined (see tip)
15 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
10 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only, bruised (opcional)
steps: Place 10 g cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add prawns, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic clove, shallots, ginger, bird’s eye chilli and dried shrimp in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 30 g cooking oil, lemongrass, curry powder and curry leaves, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved prawns, light soy sauce and sugar, stir fry 2 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving dish, serve immediately.
tips: To make prawns crunchy and bouncy, marinate with 2 tbsp of sugar for 1-2 hours in refrigerator. Rinse away sugar before use.

title: Stir fried broccoli with carrot
ingredients: ¼ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec//speed 5. Carefully avoiding to touch the blades, remove garlic skin. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add broccoli florets, carrots and salt, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: To achieve softer texture of the broccoli, prolong up to 1 minute cooking time in step 3.
Add 50 g of fresh mushrooms and/or red peppers in step 3 to enhance its colour and nutritional value.

title: Fast and easy stir fried mee hoon
ingredients: 200 g cabbage, cut in 5 cm length
50 g carrots, cut in strips (5 cm)
150 g Asian fish cake, cut in thin slices  o 150 g chicken breast fillet, skinless, cut in thin slices
steps: Place garlic cloves and shallots into mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, cabbage, carrots and fish cakes, sauté 4 min/Varoma//speed . Meanwhile, soak mee hoon for 1 minute and drain through Varoma dish. Set aside.
Add water, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and white pepper powder, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add reserved mee hoon, cook 3 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed .
Mix well with spatula to ensure that all noodles are covered with water then cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer fried mee hoon into a serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: Water volume may vary slightly depending on the type of mee hoon used. Adjustwater volume accordingly. If mee hoon looks too dry, add 50 g of hot water and keep warm for 5 minutes before serving.
In step 4, mee hoon must be added immediately. Once temperature drops, mee hoon may be undercooked and break apart.
Omit step 5 if mee hoon is cooked thoroughly.

title: Oil-free honey chicken wings
ingredients: 700 g chicken wings (approx. 8 chicken wings), halved at joint
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken wings, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce. Add salt to the bowl and mix. Marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or refrigerated.
Place rock sugar, shallots and garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop Turbo/1.0 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved marinated chicken wings and marinade, cook 14 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add honey and Chinese rice wine, mix 30 sec/Varoma//speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: To thicken the sauce, remove the chicken wings (without its sauce) from mixing bowl, and further cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 1. Pour the sauce onto chicken wings and serve.
For spicier version, add 2 dried chillies, soak to soften in step 3.

title: Brazilian Cheese Puffs
ingredients: 70 g Gruyère cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Grease a 24-hole mini muffin tray and set aside.
Place cheese in mixing bowl, grate 10 sec/speed 9.
Add milk, oil, egg, tapioca flour and salt, blend 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 5 sec/speed 8.
Fill each muffin mould full with batter. Bake for 12-15 minutes (220ºC), or until puffy and just lightly browned.
Remove from oven and serve warm.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature is a guideline and may vary depending on types and brand of oven.
You may replace Gruyere cheese with Cheddar cheese or Emmental cheese.
Best served warm. Store in airtight container in room temperature, preheat in oven before serving.
Serve with soup, a salad or at a barbecue or party.
Batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

title: Ginger sesame oil chicken
ingredients: 700 g chicken, with skin and bone, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and sugar. Marinate and set aside for 30 minutes in a cool place or refrigerated.
Place ginger and sesame oil into mixing bowl, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, cook 15 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Curry Chicken
ingredients: 3 whole chicken legs, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
15 - 20 dried chillies, deseeded and soaked to soften, cut in 5 cm length
1 stalk fresh curry leaf, leaves only
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, smashed
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken and curry powder. Add salt and marinate in a cool place or refrigerated for at least 30 minutes. Set aside.

Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots, candlenuts, turmeric, galangal, vegetable oil and 20 g water in mixing bowl, grind 20 sec/speed 10 to get a smooth paste. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add curry leaves and lemongrass, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add marinated chicken, potatoes and 100 g water, cook 12 min/Varoma//speed .
Add coconut milk and sugar, cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot with steamed rice.
tips: If desired, add 5 g shrimp paste (belacan) in step 2.
Replace coconut milk with plain yoghurt.
If free-range chicken (kampung chicken) is used, add 1 minute cooking time in step 4.
For more curry gravy, add 200 g coconut milk in step 5.

title: Chicken Rendang
ingredients: 10 g dried chillies (approx. 10 pieces), deseeded, soaked to soften
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
800 g chicken thighs, with skin and bone
steps: Place coconut oil, garlic cloves, shallots, galangal, turmeric, ginger, fresh red chillies, dried chillies, candlenuts and lemongrass in mixing bowl, chop 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of the bowl with spatula.
Chop again 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of the bowl with spatula.
Sauté 8 min/120°C//speed .
Add chicken thighs, cook 18 min/120°C//speed .
Add toasted coconut paste, coconut cream, salt, palm sugar, kaffir lime leaves and turmeric leaf, cook without measuring cup 10 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Brownies Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 180ºC. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place 200 g dark chocolate chips into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7.
Add butter, melt 5 min/50°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place caster sugar, vanilla extract, salt and eggs into mixing bowl, whisk 10 min/speed 4.
Add flour and baking powder, mix 6 sec/speed 3.
Add reserved melted chocolate mixture, mix 6 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add 150 g dark chocolate chips, mix well with spatula. Use a small spoon or ice cream scoop to place dollops of batter on prepared baking tray (3 cm apart).

Bake for 12-15 minutes until cookie surfaces crack. Remove from oven, allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to let cool completely. Serve immediately or store in an airtight jar.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.
In step 7, replace 150 g dark chocolate chips with 150 g white chocolate chips or butterscotch chips.

title: Quick Steamed Buns (Mantao)
ingredients: 20 g olive oil  o 20 g vegetable oil
steps: Place 130 g water, sugar, dried yeast and oil into mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add flour and salt, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough onto lightly floured surface, flatten with a rolling pin into thin sheet and roll up with hands. Divide dough into 10 pieces with spatula and form each dough into mantao shape. Place mantao shape dough onto lightly greased Varoma dish and tray, cover with Varoma lid and allow them to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes or until dough doubles its original size.
Place 600 g water into mixing bowl, place closed Varoma into position and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve warm.
tips: For best result, use specific dumpling flour (eg. Bluekey® Pau flour)
Avoid adding sugar onto blades and drizzle olive oil over knife blades to help kneading.
Wholemeal steamed buns: Replace 250 g of medium protein flour with 200 g of medium protein flour and 50 g of wholemeal flour in step 2.
Fruity steamed buns: Add 100 g of dried fruits, for example, raisins, cranberries or wolfberries, in step 2.

title: Super Soft Butter And Milk Buns
ingredients: 30 g butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
100 g butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place water and 20 g high protein flour in mixing bowl, heat 1 min/75°C/speed 2. Let it stand until temperature drops to 40°C.
Add milk, whipping cream, sugar, egg and yeast powder, mix 30 sec/speed 2.

Add 270 g high protein flour, milk powder, salt and butter, mix 30 sec/speed 6. Then knead Dough /4 min. Grease a bowl and both hands with butter to prevent sticking, shape dough into a ball and place in prepared bowl. Cover with cling film and let proof until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Clean mixing bowl.
Punch to deflate the dough ball. Divide the dough into 18 equal portions (30 g each). Shape into balls and let rest for 15 minutes. Cover dough balls with cling film.
Place plain flour in mixing bowl, cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer into a bowl and let it cool completely.
Place the bowl with cooked flour onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in icing sugar, butter and milk powder. Mix well, divide filling into 18 portions (15 g each). Shape into small balls and set aside.

Flatten a dough ball to 4 mm thickness. Place a ball of filling in the centre of flattened dough. Wrap the filling with the dough into a ball shape and pinch the edges firmly to seal the bun. Repeat the steps with remaining ingredients until finished.
Grease a baking tray with butter and arrange dough balls with filling on it. Spray with water, let proof in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 40 minutes). Preheat oven to 160°C.

Mix egg yolk, milk and 1 pinch salt in a small bowl. Bake buns for 5 minutes (160°C). Brush reserved egg mixture on dough surface, continue baking for 15 minutes or until light golden brown. Serve warm.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
The buns are sprayed before baking to moisten the dough and prevent it from drying out during proofing.
Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Mango frozen yogurt
ingredients: 500 g frozen mango, in pieces (3-4 cm), frozen in a single layer
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen mango and yogurt and mix 30 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula.
Insert butterfly and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Serve immediately garnished with mint leaves or store in freezer for ½ hour if firmer consistency is desired.
tips: For a different flavour, replace frozen mango with frozen fruits of your choice, in pieces (3-4 cm), frozen in a single layer.

title: Braised Yee Mee
ingredients: 150 g pork fillets, cut in slices (1 cm)  o 150 g boneless chicken drumsticks, cut in slices (1 cm)
20 g light soy sauce, plus 1 tsp for marinating
2 pinches white pepper powder, adjust to taste
10 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
½ tsp salt  o ½ tsp chicken stock powder
400 g dried yee mee (Chinese e-fu noodles)
100 g prawns, deshelled  o 100 g fish cakes, cut in thin slices
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish  o 1 sprig coriander leaves, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork fillets. Add 1 tsp light soy sauce, sesame oil and 1 pinch white pepper powder to the bowl and mix. Marinate and set aside for 10 minutes in a cool place.
Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, ginger and marinated pork fillets, mix with spatula to make sure pork fillets are well coated with oil, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .

Add oyster sauce, 20 g light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, salt, water and 1 pinch white pepper powder, cook 6 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, soak yee mee in hot water for 1 minute. Drain with Varoma dish and set aside.

Add choy sum, reserved yee mee and prawns, without measuring cup, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Meanwhile, lightly stirring with spatula through the hole of mixing bowl lid. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with spring onion. Serve hot.
tips: For a thicker noodle gravy, add 1 teaspoon of cornflour (starch) in step 4.

title: Four Course Meal (Chicken Rice)
ingredients: 1 chicken stock cube  o 1 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in whole chicken legs and light soy sauce. Add white pepper powder to the bowl and marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or in the refrigerator.
Place eggs, 260 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl, mix 6 sec/speed 4. Pour egg mixture to 4 heat-resistant bowls, that fit into Varoma tray and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place fresh ginger and garlic in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/1 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cooking oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Insert simmering basket. Place washed rice, add 1000 g water, sautéed ginger and garlic, 1 tsp salt, chicken stock cube, pandan leaves and mix well with spatula.

Place marinated chicken legs into Varoma dish and make sure the chicken do not fully cover the vents of Varoma dish. Insert Varoma tray with egg mixture onto Varoma dish. Place Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Keep rice warm until it is ready to serve. Set Varoma tray with steamed egg aside.
Add yellow onions, potatoes, tomatoes and carrots to mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish with chicken back into position, close Varoma lid and continue to cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma. Cut chicken in pieces and transfer to a serving plate. Transfer soup to a bowl. Serve hot with rice, steamed egg and chicken.
tips: Few variations that you can marinate the chicken, replace 10 g soy sauce with 10 g chicken stock powder or 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp sesame oil and 1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao).
Stainless steel bowls work best for steaming. If porcelain bowl is used, extend steaming time up to 5 mins.

title: Ayam Madu Berempah (Honey Spiced Chicken)
ingredients: 5 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
900 g chicken wings (approx. 10 wings), halved at joint
50 g tomato purée  o 50 g tomato ketchup
steps: Place dried chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, ginger and water in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, ground black pepper, ground cardamom and ground cinnamon, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken wings, tomato purée, brown sugar and salt, cook 10 min/Varoma//speed .
Add honey, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: You can transfer chicken after step 4 to a roasting pan and rack, and roast it in a preheated oven (200°C) for 5 minutes until the skin is lightly charred.

title: Masala Squid
ingredients: 300 g squid, cleaned, skin removed, score in a criss-cross pattern and cut in pieces
1 fresh red chilli, cut in slices
1 fresh green chilli, cut in slices
steps: Place squid in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside, drain off liquid.
Place shallots, garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, curry leaves, chilli powder, ground turmeric and fish curry powder, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add drained squid, oyster sauce, tomato sauce, salt, red chilli and green chilli, cook without measuring cup 3 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: Best served with steamed rice.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Homemade Pandan Kaya
ingredients: 15 - 20 pandan leaves, drained, wiped it dry and cut in 10 cm length (see tips)
150 g eggs (approx. 3 medium-sized eggs), room temperature (see tips)
180 g thick coconut cream, room temperature (see tips)
steps: Place empty mixing bowl in position, without measuring cup and set speed 10. Meanwhile, add pandan leaves through hole in mixing bowl lid onto rotating blades. When all pandan leaves are finely chopped, reduce speed gradually before pressing the speed selector to stop. Transfer finely chopped pandan leaves to a muslin cloth and squeeze out juice into a bowl. Reserve 20 g pandan juice (see tips) and set aside. Clean mixing bowl and wipe dry with clean kitchen cloth.
Place caster sugar and eggs in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add thick coconut cream and 20g reserved pandan juice, without measuring cup, cook 45 min/98°C/speed 1.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Allow kaya to cool (see tips) before transferring into 2 airtight jars (250g each) and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
tips: To get more juice, use freshly bought or harvested pandan leaves. The longer it keeps, the lesser juice and duller green it is.
If pandan leaves not available, may refer to pumpkin kaya recipe.
The weight of eggs must be 150 g. If more than 150 g, remove some of the egg white until 150 g. If less than 150 g, add egg yolks until 150 g.
Highly recommend tetra pak or any first draw thick coconut cream.
Extend 10-15 minutes cooking time in step 3 to thicken kaya if required.
The kaya will further thicken after cooling.
Best served with crispy buttery toasts and a cup of aromatic coffee or tea.

title: Char Kway Teow
ingredients: 200 g whole prawns, cleaned and shell removed
20 g fresh chives, cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, shrimp paste, white pepper powder and mushroom seasoning powder. Mix well. Season kway teow with the prepared sauce evenly. Stir in bean sprouts and mix well with spatula. Set aside.
Place garlic cloves and shallots into mixing bowl, chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and chilli paste, sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk. In sequence, add prawns, chives, reserved seasoned kway teow and bean sprouts, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed 

Cook 1 min/Varoma/ /speed, meanwhile, pour lightly beaten egg slowly onto mixing bowl lid, let it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. If necessary, lift measuring cup up slightly to assist egg drizzling down.
When mixing bowl temperature drops to 90°C, remove butterfly whisk, transfer kway teow to a serving plate and serve immediately.
tips: To make prawns crunchy and bouncy, marinate with 2 tbsp of sugar for 1-2 hours inrefrigerator. Rinse away sugar before use.

title: Vietnamese Lemongrass Chicken
ingredients: 500 g whole chicken legs (approx. 2 whole chicken legs), with skin and bone, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, cut in pieces
½ fresh red chilli, deseeded, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, fish sauce and garlic cloves. Add curry powder, salt, sugar and dark soy sauce and mix. Marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Place cooking oil, lemongrass and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 8 min/120°C/speed .
Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, stir fry 13 min/120°C//speed . Garnish with chopped red chilli. Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.
Patting dry the chicken before marinating helps to make the dish less watery.
If you use kampung chicken, increase cooking time to 14 minutes in step 4.

title: Frozen strawberry daiquiri
steps: Place strawberries, lime juice, rum, sugar syrup, strawberry syrup and ice cubes in mixing bowl and blend 25 sec/speed 8.
Pour strawberry daiquiri into cocktail glasses and serve immediately.
tips: To make your own sugar syrup, place 300 g water and 300 g sugar in mixing bowl and cook 18 min/Varoma/speed 1 without measuring cup until sugar has dissolved completely. Allow syrup to cool and transfer to a clean bottle. Sealed well, this colourless syrup will keep a long time in the fridge.Serve with a straw if desired.

To make your own sugar syrup, place 300 g water and 300 g sugar in mixing bowl and cook 18 min/Varoma/speed 1 without measuring cup until sugar has dissolved completely. Allow syrup to cool and transfer to a clean bottle. Sealed well, this colourless syrup will keep a long time in the fridge.
Serve with a straw if desired.

title: Roti Canai (Roti Prata)
ingredients: 220 g butter, softened, plus extra for greasing  o 220 g margarine, softened, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place water, condensed milk, sugar, plain flour, 20 g butter and salt in mixing bowl, knead Dough /3 min. Let stand in mixing bowl for 5 minutes.

Knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough onto a pastry mat, roll into an oblong shape. Divide dough into 10 equal portions. Place a tray on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 200 g butter. Place dough balls on tray and coat generously with butter. Cover with cling film, refrigerate for at least for 2 hours or overnight.

Place a dough ball on a lightly greased surface and lightly flatten it, pressing and pushing the dough with the heel of your palm to make it flatter. Stretch dough as thin as possible to obtain a thin translucent membrane (windowpane). Spread some more softened butter or oil on dough to help stretching. Scrape and push the upper end of the dough to the middle. Do the same to the lower end, forming a wrinkled thin log. Starting at one end of the log, roll into a spiral shape and tuck the other end inside. Repeat for remaining dough balls. Let rest for 10 minutes.

Take one dough spiral and flatten into a circle (Ø 10-15 cm). Grease a frying pan with some butter or oil and heat over medium fire. Place flattened dough in pan, pan-fry for several minutes and then flip with a slotted turner to continue cooking until light golden brown. Serve warm.
tips: Best served with dhal, curry or sambal.

For fluffy roti canai, stack a few cooked roti on a working surface. Using both hands compress the roti from two sides (like clapping your hands with roti in between). Ensure this is done while the roti are still warm. Cover roti with a kitchen towel to keep warm.
In step 3, you can also lift up one edge of the dough and gently pull to stretch it even more.

title: Nasi Lemak
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only and sliced
40 - 80 g dried chillies, large and mild heat, deseeded and soaked to soften
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice, coconut milk, ginger, pandan leaves, lemongrass and salt to it. Stir well with spatula.
Set Varoma dish into position, add eggs to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 18 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Remove Varoma and place eggs in cold water before removing egg shell. Cut into halves and set aside.
Remove simmering basket with spatula. With aid of spatula, transfer cooked rice to a thermal serving bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a small bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in tamarind paste and water. Mix, deseed and set aside. Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots and cooking oil in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add light soy sauce, sugar, salt and tamarind-water mixture, cook 13 min/120°C//speed 2.

Add deep fried anchovies and onions, cook without measuring cup 2 min/120°C//speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. In a serving plate, add a portion of cooked coconut rice, sambal and reserved eggs, garnish with sliced cucumber and roasted peanuts. Serve hot.
tips: Instead of deep fried crispy anchovies, try toasting the anchovies in oven for 15 minutes at 150°C or until light golden brown. The anchovies will become crispy once they are cooled.
Add 1 tbsp of coconut oil in step 4 after rice is cooked to enhance the coconut aroma.
A thermal serving bowl is ideal to keep the cooked rice warm.
Replace coconut milk with virgin coconut oil. Omit 200 g coconut milk and add 1300 g water in step 1. In step 4, add 60 g virgin coconut oil to the cooked rice and mix well.

title: Hand Ripped Cabbage
ingredients: 350 g cabbage, ripped in pieces (3 cm x 3 cm)
steps: Place cooking oil, garlic cloves and dried chillies in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add cabbage, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. .
Add light soy sauce and sugar, stir fry 30 sec/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer to a serving bowl, serve hot.

title: Nasi Kampung (Kampung Style Fried Rice)
ingredients: 100 g long beans, diagonally cut in thin slices (3 cm)  o 100 g water spinach, cut in pieces (3 cm)
some toasted dried anchovies, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, red chillies, bird‘s eye chillies, dried anchovies and salt in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed .
Add long beans, sauté 2 min/120°C/speed .
Insert butterfly whisk, add cooked rice, without measuring cup, stir fry 2 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk, garnish with toasted dried anchovies and serve hot.
tips: The ingredients in step 1 can be replaced with 100 g of green chilli sambal. Skip step 1 and go straight to step 2, reduce sautéing time to 3 minutes.

Cooked rice preparation: Insert simmering basket, place 300 g long grain white rice (eg. parboiled, basmati or jasmine) and 1200 g water in mixing bowl, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Allow to cool completely before using in step 3. Do not refrigerate overnight.

title: Taiwanese three cup chicken
ingredients: 10 g fresh ginger root, thinly sliced
10 g fresh chillies, deseeded and cut into pieces
800 g chicken legs, skin on, bone in, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ginger, red chillies and sesame oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken, stir fry 5 min/Varoma/speed .
Add Chinese rice wine, dark soy sauce, rock sugar and light soy sauce, stir fry 10 min/Varoma/speed .
Add basil leaves, stir fry 1 min/Varoma/speed . Serve hot.
tips: This is a traditional Taiwanese dish, you may increase rice wine to 30 g and replace dark soy sauce and light soy sauce with 30 g of Taiwanese soy sauce paste and 30 g of Taiwanese soy sauce.

For more intense taste, marinate before cooking. Season chicken with 1 tbsp of light soy sauce, 1 tsp of Chinese rice wine, ½ tsp of salt, ¼ tsp of sesame oil and 1 pinch of white pepper powder and set aside for at least 3 hours in refrigerator.

title: Nut bolognese
ingredients: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm) (optional)
150 g hazelnuts or other nuts to taste (e.g. walnuts, almonds, mixed nuts)
150 g leeks, cut in pieces (3 cm)
15 g fresh basil leaves, plus extra for garnishing
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place nuts and herbs de Provence in mixing bowl then chop 4 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and leeks in mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved nuts and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add tomatoes, tomato purée, basil, sugar, ground pepper and vegetable broth powder then sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water and cook 10 min/120°C/speed 1. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and reserved grated cheese. Serve with pasta or rice (see tips).
tips: For a spicy version, add cayenne pepper or chilli flakes in step 6.
Cook spaghetti or rice in a pan on the stove while the Bolognese is cooking in Thermomix®.
Try seasoning with Japanese Gomashio condiment (sesame salt).

title: Chicken, Mushroom and Chinese Sausage Rice
ingredients: 600 - 650 g whole chicken legs (approx. 2 whole legs), cut in pieces (4 cm)
20 g salted fish, toasted (see tips), cut in small pieces
5 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed, cut in slices
100 g Chinese sausages (approx.. 2 sausages), casing removed, cut in thin slices
30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
350 g parboiled rice, Basmati or Bario, rinsed
1 - 2 sprigs spring onions, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken legs, 20 g light soy sauce, 20 g oyster sauce and 10 g dark soy sauce. Add ½ tsp white pepper powder and sesame oil to the bowl and mix. Set aside for 5 minutes.
Place garlic cloves and ginger slices in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salted fish and cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add mushroom slices, Chinese sausage and reserved chicken, cook 5 min/120°C//speed  .
Add water, 30 g light soy sauce, 30 g oyster sauce, 20 g dark soy sauce, ½ tsp white pepper powder, rice wine and sugar, boil 7 min/100°C//speed .
Add rice, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 15 minutes. Transfer cooked rice to a serving bowl and mix well with spatula. Garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.
Before step 3, place salted fish on a baking tray and toast in a preheated oven (180°C) for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Condensed milk
steps: Place butter and water into mixing bowl, heat 3 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Add raw cane sugar, milk powder and salt, blend 30 sec/speed 10 until smooth. Scrape down sides and bottom of mixing bowl with spatula. Transfer into sterilised sealable jars and set aside, uncovered, to cool (approx. 30 minutes). Seal jars and store in refrigerator until ready to use (see tip).
tips: You can store this condensed milk in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

title: Smooth cauliflower soup
ingredients: 20 g olive oil, plus extra for serving
60 g shallots, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
200 g potatoes, cut into small pieces (1-2 cm)
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place olive oil, butter, shallots, cauliflower and potato into mixing bowl, sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, stock and nutmeg and cook without measuring cup 30 min/100°C/speed 1. Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 5-9, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to 4 soup bowls.
Add a dash of olive oil, sprinkle with chives and serve hot.
tips: In addition to white cauliflower, there are also coloured varieties - purple, orange, green - all suitable for adding a colourful touch to this recipe.
When purchasing the cauliflower, make sure it is firm and compact without dark marks that indicate an extended storage period. The outer leaves must be tight to the head.

title: Hakka Char Yoke (Braised Pork With Black Fungi And Fermented Bean Curd)
ingredients: 30 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
1000 g pork belly, with skin, cut in pieces (3 cm)
30 g dried black fungi, soaked to soften
50 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
70 g fermented bean curd (nam yee), with gravy
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5.
Add pork belly, black fungi, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, rice wine, lump sugar, fermented bean curd and water, cook 45 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Traditionally this dish requires pork belly to be deep fried before cooking and some oil to sauté fermented bean curd. With Thermomix®, no additional oil is required as the fat from pork belly is sufficient to prepare this dish.
To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork belly and 600 g water into mixing bowl, blanch 30 min/45°C//speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.
Best served with steamed rice or dried noodles.

title: Curry chicken
ingredients: 750 g chicken legs, skin on, bone in (approx. 3 whole legs), cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
15 - 20 dried chillies, deseeded and soaked to soften, cut into 5 cm length
2 stalks fresh lemon grass, white part only, cut into 5 cm length and smashed
300 g potatoes, cut into small wedges
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken and curry powder. Add salt to the bowl and mix. Marinate in a cool place or refrigerated for at least 30 minutes.

Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots, candlenuts, turmeric, galangal, vegetable oil and 20 g water into mixing bowl, grind 20 sec/speed 10 to get a smooth paste. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add curry leaves and lemongrass, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved marinated chicken, potatoes and 100 g water, cook 12 min/120°C//speed .
Add coconut milk and sugar, cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.
If you can’t find coconut milk, replace with plain yogurt, adjusting amount to taste.
For more curry gravy, add 200 ml coconut milk in step 5.

title: Kopitiam Style Soft Boiled Eggs
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, place eggs in it, cook 12 min/70°C/speed 3.5.
Immediately remove simmering basket with spatula and place it with eggs under cold running water to stop cooking. Serve or use as needed.
tips: Add 1 minute cooking time for eggs that are taken straight out of the refrigerator.

title: Garlic, olive oil and chilli spaghetti
ingredients: 1 bunch parsley, leaves washed and dried (opcional)
steps: Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and chilli into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water and salt, bring to a boil: 7 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add spaghetti through hole in the mixing bowl lid when the water boils. Cook for the time shown on the packaging/100°C//speed  until “al dente”. Pour into a serving bowl, dress with the remaining olive oil, add chopped parsley and stir. Serve hot.
tips: When done, if the water has not been completely absorbed, leave in the mixing bowl for a few minutes until sauce is fully absorbed.
To make the garlic easier to digest, remove the central shoot if present.

title: Cooking White Rice
steps: Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, add washed rice into it, cook 18 min/100°C/speed 3.
Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, transfer rice into a thermal serving bowl and allow to rest for 5 mins before serving.
tips: If you would like to steam in Varoma set, add 1 drop oil on rice before cooking, change temperature to Varoma in step 1.
The rice water can be used as a base for soup or as thickening agent for your dishes.

Cooking time may vary, depending on types of rice grain used and your preferred texture and consistency.For example:Brown/5 Grain Rice: Cook approximately 30 ~ 35 mins;Glutinous Rice: Soak for an hour and cook approximately 25 ~ 30 mins.Basmati: Cook approximately 15 mins.
If there are foams formed during cooking, reduce temperature to 98°C.

title: Tau Eu Bak (Braised Soy Sauce Pork Belly)
ingredients: 600 g pork belly, with skin, cut in pieces (5 cm x 2 cm)
steps: Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add pork belly to it and blanch 15 min/50°C/speed 4. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Rinse pork belly and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place eggs in Varoma dish. Place reserved pork belly, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, garlic cloves, cinnamon stick, star anise, cloves, white peppercorns and 600 g water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma with eggs in position and cook 20 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.

Start Slow Cook /1 h/98°C. Meanwhile, place eggs in cold water before peeling. Place peeled eggs into a thermal serving bowl. Transfer cooked pork to the thermal serving bowl to colour the eggs with gravy for 10 minutes. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Spiced carrot salad
ingredients: 400 - 500 g carrots, peeled, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
1 green apple (approx. 180 g), cut into quarters
1 pinch ground cayenne pepper, adjust to taste
20 g pistachio nuts, shelled, unsalted, or other nuts (e.g. walnuts, almonds)
steps: Place carrots, apple, raisins, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, olive oil, coriander, salt, black pepper and pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Serve immediately or refrigerate 15-20 minutes before serving.
tips: This salad can be stored in the refrigerator for up to three days.

title: Chicken porridge with century egg
ingredients: 200 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut into pieces (4-5 cm)
1 - 2 tsp sesame oil, toasted, adjust to taste
2 salted duck eggs, cooked, shell removed and cut into cubes
2 tsp chicken stock paste (see tips)  o 2 tsp chicken stock powder
10 g fresh ginger root, finely shredded
2 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, finely chopped, to garnish
2 spring onions, finely chopped, to garnish
steps: Place chicken, light soy sauce and sesame oil into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place rice and water into mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add eggs to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 16 min/100°C/speed 3. Remove Varoma and place eggs in cold water before removing egg shell, cut eggs into cubes (5 mm).

Add reserved minced chicken, reserved century eggs, salted eggs, chicken stock paste, salt, white pepper powder and ginger, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and spring onions before serve.
tips: Replace chicken with fish or meat of your choice.
Warm century eggs with shell, especially if you are using duck eggs, it eases cutting into cubes without egg yolk sticking to knife.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.

title: Moroccan chicken and couscous
ingredients: 600 g chicken thighs, skinless, boneless, cut in bite size pieces  o 600 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in bite size pieces
10 stalks fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
1 lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
steps: Combine garam masala, ground turmeric, salt and black pepper in a small bowl. Spread half on a soup plate, toss the chicken thighs in the spice mixture until completely coated and arrange them in Varoma dish, make sure that a few holes remain unobstructed to allow steam to circulate. Reserve remaining spice mixture.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh couscous, 250 g water and sunflower oil in it, mix together with a fork and set aside.
Place parsley in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and onions in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 1 tbsp sunflower oil, remaining spice mixture and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish. Fluff couscous with a fork and transfer and distribute it on Varoma tray.

Add 380 g water, green olives, chicken stock paste, lemon zest and juice in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam 20-23 min/Varoma//speed 1. Remove Varoma, add the cooked chicken, half of the steamed couscous and half of the reserved chopped parsley to sauce in mixing bowl, combine using spatula.
Serve the chicken and couscous hot in sauce, with the remaining steamed couscous. Garnish with remaining chopped parsley.
tips: This tasty dish can be served, hot, warm or cold.
Substitute the chicken for salmon.

title: Teh Tarik (Pulled Milk Tea)
ingredients: 4 tbsp loose tea  o 12 tea bags (see tips)
150 - 230 g condensed milk, adjust to taste
steps: Place loose tea and water in mixing bowl, cook 7 min/90°C//speed 1. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a jug.
Place tea, evaporated milk and condensed milk in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 8. Pour into serving glasses. Serve hot.
tips: Use Ceylon tea for best result.
If using tea bags, discard them after cooking in step 1.

title: Tomato and bacon spaghetti
ingredients: 150 g onions, cut into quarters (1 onion)
1 tsp smoked paprika powder  o 1 tsp sweet paprika powder
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
2 - 3 tbsp Parmesan cheese, shaved, to garnish
steps: Place onions, garlic and oil in mixing bowl then chop 5 sec/speed 5. Sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add bacon and sauté again 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add tomato purée, tinned tomatoes, water and smoked paprika then cook 7 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add salt, pepper, then spaghetti through hole in mixing bowl lid. Cook according to time on packet/100°C//speed 1. If pasta is not cooked, leave to sit for up to 5 minutes. Serve hot with Parmesan shavings sprinkled on top.

title: Braised pork belly
ingredients: 10 g fresh ginger root, thinly sliced
500 g pork belly, skinless, cut into pieces (3 cm x 3 cm)
steps: Place ginger, pork belly, rock sugar, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, Chinese rice wine and water into mixing bowl, cook 45 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.
To remove the smell from raw pork, before cooking place pork belly and 600 g waterinto mixing bowl, blanch 30 min/45°C//speed . This will also remove impuritiesand blood within the meat.
Add 1 piece of star anise and 1 piece of cinnamon stick for spicy version of braised pork belly.

title: Köttbullar (Swedish Meatballs)
ingredients: 500 g minced meat (beef, pork, lamb or chicken) (see tips)
1 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped, plus extra for garnishing
1 pinch ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking dish with baking paper. Place onions in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down side of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add minced meat, bread crumbs, parsley, ground allspice, ground nutmeg, garlic powder, ground black pepper, salt and egg, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Roll mixture into approx. 30 balls (2 teaspoons per ball) and transfer onto lined baking dish. Cover with cling film and place in refrigerator until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place olive oil, butter, flour, beef broth, thickened cream, Worchstershire sauce and Dijon mustard in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/90°C/speed 4. Season with salt and ground black pepper.

Bake meatballs in preheated oven for 10 minutes (180°C), turning meatballs and continue to bake for another 15 minutes until browned all over. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with gravy and sides of choice (see tips).
tips: Best served with cranberry jam and mashed potatoes.
You can combine different types of minced meat, e.g. half minced beef and half minced pork.
Pan frying: place a large frying pan over medium heat and add cooking oil. Add meatballs and cook for approx. 6-8 minutes, turning, until browned all over.

title: Dried Chilli Chicken with Potato
ingredients: 600 g chicken, with bones, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
10 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
200 g potatoes, floury or wazy, cut in slices
1 sprig chopped spring onions, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and sugar. Mix and set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ginger slices, dried chillies and sesame oil, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add potatoes, reserved marinated chicken and marinade, cook 13 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, mix cornflour and water in a small bowl.
Add cornflour mixture, cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Vietnamese Lemongrass Pork Strips
ingredients: 300 g pork shoulder fillets, cut in thin strips
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, cut in thin slices
1 bird's eye chilli (chilli padi), cut in thin slices (opcional)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork. Add salt and ground black pepper. Mix and set aside for 15 minutes. Pat dry with paper kitchen towel.
Place cooking oil, garlic cloves and lemongrass in mixing bowl, heat 2 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed .

Add marinated pork strips, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water, fish sauce, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and sugar in mixing bowl, heat 1 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add reserved pork strips, drizzle with lime juice and bird’s eye chilli. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Sweet And Sour Prawns
ingredients: 300 g large prawns, whiskers removed, cleaned and deveined
20 g white rice vinegar  o 20 g rice wine
150 g fresh pineapple, cut in cubes
150 g green capsicum, cut in small pieces
150 g red capsicum, cut in small pieces
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns. Add salt and white pepper powder to the bowl and mix.
Place 10 g cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved prawns, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 10 g cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add tomato sauce, chilli sauce, light soy sauce, brown sugar, white rice vinegar, cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pineapple, green capsicum, red capsicum and reserved sautéed prawns, cook 3 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Hokkaido Milk Loaf
ingredients: 20 g butter, softened at room temperature, plus extra for greasing
500 g high protein flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place 15 g sugar, 1 tsp dried yeast, milk, whipping cream and 1 egg white in mixing bowl, mix 1 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2.
Add 10 g butter and high protein flour, knead 4 min/. Transfer dough to a large bowl, cover with damp kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 2 ½ - 3 hours).
Place reserved dough, 75 g sugar, ½ tsp dried yeast, 1 egg white, salt and milk powder in mixing bowl, knead 3 min/.
Add 10 g butter, knead 3 min/. Transfer dough to a large bowl and let the dough rest for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, grease two loaf tins (19 cm x 10 cm x 10 cm) with butter and set aside.

Punch down to deflate the dough. Divide dough into 2 portions. Lightly flour a pastry mat, flatten dough with rolling pin and roll up dough to form smooth, non-sticky logs and place them into prepared loaf tins. Cover with damp kitchen towel and let rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour) or the dough fills 80% of the loaf tins. Preheat oven to 180°C during the last 10 minutes of proofing.
Bake for 30-35 minutes (180°C). Remove loaves from tins and allow them to cool on a cooling rack before slicing and serving.
tips: For a square sandwich loaf, cover loaf tin with flat cover, bake in preheated oven for 30-35 minutes (200°C) in     step 6.
Wrap dough with pastry mat in step 3 for faster proofing.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Serve with butter and jam.

title: Mapo tofu
ingredients: 600 g silken tofu (approx. 2 boxes), cut into pieces (approx. 1.5 cm)
2 tbsp chilli broad bean paste (e.g. Sichuan chilli bean paste)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in minced pork. Add light soy sauce, white pepper powder and Chinese rice wine. Mix well and marinate for 15 minutes and set aside.
Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and reserved marinated minced pork, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add tofu, oyster sauce, chilii bean paste, salt and sesame oil, stif fry 5 min/100°C/speed . Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer into a plate and garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.

title: Chai Masala (Masala Tea)
ingredients: 2 tbsp Ceylon black tea leaves  o 4 Ceylon black tea bags
3 tbsp brown sugar, adjust to taste
2 cm cube old ginger, fresh, sliced (opcional)
steps: Place cinnamon sticks, cloves and cardamom pods in mixing bowl, grind 5 sec/speed 6.
Add water, milk, Ceylon black tea leaves, brown sugar and ginger, cook 10 min/98°C/speed 1.5. Pour through a tea strainer and strain masala tea ito a jug. Serve hot.
tips: If you can't find Ceylon tea, replace it with other strong black tea such as Assam, so that the spices and sweeteners do not overpower it.
Prolong cooking time by 1 minute in step 2 for a stronger spice flavour.

title: Creamy carrot and lentil soup
ingredients: 1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
2 sprigs fresh coriander, plus extra to garnish
pita bread croutons, to garnish (see tip)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in lentils and rice. Transfer to a sieve, hold under running water to rinse and set aside to drain.
Place onions, garlic and oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add cinnamon, cumin, allspice and sauté 5 sec/120°C/speed 1.
Add carrots and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lentils, rice, vegetable stock, salt, black pepper and water, mix with spatula and cook 25 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add lemon juice, fresh coriander and blend 1 min/speed 5-9, increasing speed gradually. Serve with pitta croutons and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
tips: To prepare pitta croutons, cut pitta bread into small pieces and fry in peanut or vegetable oil until golden and crisp. Alternatively grill or toast the pitta bread.

title: Ginger Sesame Oil Chicken
ingredients: 700 g chicken, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g fresh ginger, peeled and shredded
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, add chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and sugar. Marinate and set aside.
Place ginger and sesame oil in mixing bowl, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add marinated chicken and its sauce, cook 15 min/120°C//speed . Transfer chicken to a serving plate. Serve hot.

title: Crispy Ikan Bilis
ingredients: 200 g yellow onions, cut in wedges, separated
4 - 5 fresh green chillies, cut in pieces
steps: Place cooking oil and dried anchovies in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer fried anchovies to a bowl and set aside.
Add onions, chillies and sugar, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved fried anchovies, mix 30 sec/Varoma/speed . Transfer to a plate. Squeeze out calamansi juice and serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ellin Chong.

title: Soft date cake with walnuts
ingredients: 220 g butter, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
220 g flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Preheat oven to 180ºC. Grease a bundt cake tin (Ø 22-24 cm) and sprinkle with flour. Set aside.
Place walnuts into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a bowl and reserve.
Place dates and water into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, butter, egg and vanilla and mix 40 sec/speed 6.

Add 60 g reserved chopped walnuts and mix with spatula. Transfer mixture into prepared cake tin and bake for 45 minutes (180 ºC) or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in tin for approx. 20 minutes before transferring to a serving plate.
Pour date syrup on top of cake and sprinkle with remaining 40 g chopped walnuts before serving.

title: Tomato-egg soup
steps: Place oil and tomatoes into mixing bowl, stir fry 5 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add water and salt, cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add lightly beaten eggs and cook 1 min/100°C//speed 1. Serve hot.

title: Homemade Soy Milk
ingredients: 3 pieces pandan leaves, tied into knots
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh 200 g soy beans. Soak with water for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain off the water and set aside.
Place soaked soy beans and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 8.

Add 600 g water, blend 10 sec/speed 3. Place a muslin cloth in a big bowl, pour soy bean mixture in muslin cloth and squeeze until soy milk has fully extracted. Discard soy bean residue and set aside soy milk. Clean mixing bowl.
Place reserved soy milk and pandan leaves in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position to prevent splashing, cook 25 min/90°C/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add sugar, mix 1 min/speed 2. Discard pandan leaves and pour soy milk to a glass jug. Clean mixing bowl immediately once cooking is done. Serve hot or cold.
tips: Soy milk residue can be used as fertiliser for gardening or to make vegetarian food such as omelette, steamed buns, vegetarian meatballs, porridge etc.
To remove soy bean hulls, insert butterfly whisk, place soaked soy beans and 300 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min//speed 3.. Discard bean hulls and drain off water.

title: Tamarind Pork Curry
ingredients: 600 g pork shoulder loin, cut in strips (1 cm)
1 - 2 tbsp tamarind paste, adjust to taste
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork shoulder loin. Add fish sauce to the bowl and mix. Set aside. Place another bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in hot water. Add tamarind paste to the bowl and mix. Deseed and set aside.

Place onions, shallots, garlic cloves, dried chillies, red chillies, ginger, galangal and water in mixing bowl, blend 15 sec/speed 10 or until a fine paste is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, lemongrass and curry powder, sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add marinated pork and reserved tamarind juice, cook 8 min/120°C//speed .
Add kaffir lime leaves, coconut milk, salt and lump sugar, cook 3 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork shoulder loin and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C//speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.

You can also prepare the curry paste in advance. Triple the amount of the ingredients in step 2 and 3, prolong sautéing time in step 3 to 20 minutes. Divide curry paste into 3 portions, cool and refrigerate for next use.
Tamarind prawns: replace pork shoulder loin with 600-800 g prawns and 100 g stink beans (petai), reduce cooking time in step 4 to 5 minutes.

title: Thai Style Fried Mee Hoon
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
200 g cabbage, cut in chunks (5 cm)
steps: Place dried shrimp, red chillies, shallots, ginger, ground turmeric and lemongrass in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 6-10, increasing speed gradually or until a fine paste is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tomatoes and oil, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 2. Meanwhile, soak mee hoon in ambient water for 1 minute. Drain through Varoma dish, set aside.
Add 3 kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, palm sugar, dark soy sauce, cabbage and water, cook 7 min/100°C//speed .

Add prawns and reserved meehoon, stir fry 3 min/120°C//speed . Transfer mee hoon to a serving plate, garnish with torch lily buds, 3 shredded kaffir lime leaves and drizzle with lime juice. Toss well and serve immediately.
tips: Repeat step 1 for a smoother paste.
Different mee hoon (rice vermicelli) brand requires different soaking time, adjust time (1-2 minutes) accordingly.

title: Honey Garlic BBQ Pork Ribs
ingredients: 500 g pork spare ribs, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)
50 g honey  o 50 g dark brown sugar
1 ½ tsp red fermented bean curd (nam yee)
2 tsp Chinese rose essence wine (mei gu lu)
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork spare ribs, honey and garlic cloves. Add red fermented bean curd, peanut butter, oyster sauce, light soy sauce and rose essence wine and mix. Marinate for at least 3 hours or overnight in refrigerator.

Place reserved marinated pork spare ribs and marinade in mixing bowl, cook 25 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C. Line a roasting pan with aluminium foil, place a roasting rack on it and set aside.

Using spatula, mix the pork ribs in the mixing bowl until pork ribs are coated evenly with sauce. Transfer pork ribs onto prepared roasting rack. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes (180°C) or until slightly charred. Serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork spare ribs and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C/ /speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.
Chopped garlic cloves: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6.
If you can't find Chinese rose essence wine (mei gui lu), replace with Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao).
If you do not have a roasting pan with rack, replace with a griddle pan or a baking tray, line with aluminium foil.

title: Tom Yum Goong
ingredients: 3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, smashed
40 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in thick slices
100 g straw mushrooms, fresh or canned, cut in slices
100 g nam prik pao (Thai chilli paste)
120 g tomatoes (approx 1 tomato), cut in wedges
400 g prawns (approx 10-12 prawns), with heads and shells, deveined
200 g squid, cleaned, cut in rings (0.5 cm)
steps: Place lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, bird’s eye chillies, straw mushrooms, nam prik pao, tomatoes and shrimp broth in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add prawns, squid and fish sauce, cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add lime juice, cook 30 sec/100°C//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: Shrimp broth preparation: place 10 g cooking oil and 50 g shrimp heads in mixing bowl, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Add 1300 g water, cook 40 min/100°C/speed 1. Strain shrimp broth and discard the shrimp heads.
For a faster version, use 1300 g water with 1 tsp stock powder to replace shrimp broth.
You can also use fresh oyster mushrooms, fresh or canned button mushrooms to replace straw mushrooms.
Bangkok-style Tom Yum Goong: use 50 g nam prik pao in step 1, add 3 tablespoons evaporated milk in step 3.
Tom Yum Gai: use 600 g skinless chicken thigh strips to replace prawns and squid in step 2. Extend cooking time to 8 minutes.

title: Quick rainbow salad
ingredients: 200 gram carrots, cut into pieces (2 cm)
200 g red peppers, cut into pieces (3 cm)
200 g broccoli, cut into florets, plus stems sliced (0,5 cm)
160 g apples, stems removed, cut into quarters
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place carrots, red peppers, broccoli, apples and sunflower seeds into mixing bowl.
Add olive oil, lemon juice, honey, mustard, salt and pepper and mix 5 sec/speed 4.5. Serve immediately for freshest flavor.
tips: If not serving immediately, cover salad and chill in refrigerator for up to 24 hours; stir before serving.Scrape down mixing bowl with spatula after first mix and repeat 5 sec/speed 4.5 if a finer texture is required.
If not serving immediately, cover salad and chill in refrigerator for up to 24 hours; stir before serving.
Scrape down mixing bowl with spatula after first mix and repeat 5 sec/speed 4.5 if a finer texture is required.

title: Braised Chicken with Mushroom
ingredients: 600 g chicken, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
20 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
50 g water, plus 2 tbsp for thickening
20 dried shiitake mushrooms, rinsed, soaked to soften, stems removed
1 sprig spring onion, finely chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, oyster sauce and dark soy sauce, marinate for 1-2 hours in refrigerator.
Place garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sesame oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 50 g water and mushrooms, sauté 7 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, cook 12 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, mix cornflour and 2 tbsp water in a small bowl.
Add reserved cornflour mixture, mix 3 min/Varoma//speed . Garnish with spring onion and serve hot.
tips: Patting dry the chicken meat before cutting it in bite-sized pieces will give a thicker gravy.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Macaroni ABC Soup
ingredients: 250 g whole chicken leg (approx. 1 whole chicken leg), with skin, boneless, cut in cubes (1 cm)
150 g potatoes, cut in cubes (1 cm)
50 g carrots, cut in cubes (1 cm)
2 tsp chicken stock powder, adjust to taste
1 pinch white pepper powder, adjust to taste
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place water, onions and tomatoes in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add dried anchovies to it, cook 30 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with spatula.
Add chicken, potatoes and carrots to mixing bowl, cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add macaroni, chicken stock powder and white pepper powder, cook time indicated on packet/100°C//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with spring onion and serve hot.
tips: If you prefer a clearer soup, discard anchovies, onions and tomatoes after step 1.

title: Meatballs in a rich tomato sauce (daoud basha)
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, for greasing
steps: Place minced beef, 1 tsp salt, pepper and cinnamon into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Grease Varoma dish and tray and set aside. With oiled hands shape reserved mince mixture into meatballs (Ø 2 cm) and distribute into Varoma dish and tray. Set Varoma aside.
Place onions, carrots and sunflower oil into mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 4, then remove measuring cup sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add crushed tomatoes, tomato purée, pomegranate molasses, 1 tsp salt and 100 g water, place Varoma into position and cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile mix in a bowl cornflour and remaining 50 g water, stir with a spoon to dissolve.
Remove Varoma and transfer meatballs into mixing bowl with sauce. Add dissolved corn flour and cook 8 min/100°C//speed . Serve immediately.
tips: Serve meatballs with rice or pilaf.

title: Homemade chicken stock powder
ingredients: 300 g chicken, boneless and skinless, sinew free (from approx 500 g whole chicken legs), cut into pieces
200 g mixed white vegetables (e.g. celeriac, onions, garlic, leek), cut into pieces as needed
4 sprigs mixed fresh herbs (e.g. rosemary, thyme, parsley), leaves only
steps: Place chicken into mixing bowl, mince 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place mixed white vegetables and mixed fresh herbs into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add coarse salt, white wine, bay leaf, whole clove, coriander seeds and reserved minced chicken. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid. Cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 2. Mixture will thicken and become fairly dry.
Remove simmering basket and insert measuring cup. Blend 1 min/speed 7. Transfer onto a baking tray. Flatten and spread evenly with spatula. Clean mixing bowl.

Preheat oven to 110°C. Bake in preheated oven (110°C) for 30 minutes or until dried up. Place baked chicken stock into mixing bowl, pulverise 20 sec/speed 8. Transfer into an airtight container and allow to cool for 30 minutes before using or storing in refrigerator.
tips: 1 tbsp stock powder is roughly equivalent to 1 shop-bought chicken stock cube.
To make chicken stock, use 1 tsp per 500 g water.
Stock powder can be stored in the refrigerator for several months.
The salt in this recipe is used as the preservation agent. When mixed with water as described above, the stock does not taste too salty.
If you wish to decrease the salt used in the recipe, we recommend you to store the stock powder in the refrigerator.
Small quantities of sea vegetables, such as dulse, wakame or kombu, can be added to the stock for extra flavour.
You can also use leftover vegetables you have in your refrigerator. Weigh what you have into the mixing bowl to ensure the weight is consistent with the recipe.

title: Ayam Masak Merah (Spicy Tomato Chicken)
ingredients: 1500 g whole chicken, with skin and bone, cut in 16 pieces
15 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
120 g yellow onions, cut in slices
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add ground turmeric and 1 tsp salt then mix. Marinate for 30 minutes. Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 200 g water. Add tamarind paste. Mix, deseed and set aside. Preheat oven to 200°C.
Transfer reserved marinated chicken on a roasting pan with rack. Bake in preheated oven (200°C) for 30 minutes. Set aside.
Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots, lemongrass, ginger, galangal and 20 g water in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 10 min/120°C/speed .
Add reserved tamarind-water mixture, tomato purée, sugar and 1 tsp salt, cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add yellow onions and reserved baked chicken, cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: You can also skip baking chicken in step 2, add marinated chicken in step 5, increase cooking time to 13 minutes.

title: Ginger Sesame Oil Chicken Cubes
