ingredients: 400 g chicken thigh fillets,without skin and bones, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g fresh ginger, peeled and shredded
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, add chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and sugar. Marinate and set aside.
Place ginger and sesame oil in mixing bowl, sauté 2 min 30 sec/120°C//speed .
Add marinated chicken and marinade, cook 6 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer chicken to a serving plate. Serve hot.

title: Sambal Petai Prawns
ingredients: 10 dried chillies, rinsed, soaked and deseeded
100 g onions (approx 1 onion), cut in thin slices
200 g whole prawns, medium-sized, cleaned and shell removed
steps: Place cooking oil, shallots, garlic cloves, candlenuts, belacan and dried chillies in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 6 min/120°C/speed .
Add onions, stink beans, salt and sugar, stir fry 3 min/120°C//speed .
Add prawns, stir fry 1 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Stir Fried Broccoli with Carrot
ingredients: 50 g carrots, cut in thin slices
¼ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec//speed 5. Carefully avoiding to touch the blades, remove garlic skin. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add broccoli florets, carrots and salt, cook 4 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: To achieve softer texture of the broccoli, prolong up to 1 minute cooking time in step 3.
Add 50 g of fresh mushrooms and/or red peppers in step 3 to enhance its colour and nutritional value.

title: Daging Paprik (Stir Fried Beef)
ingredients: 300 g beef tenderloin, cut in slices (1 cm)
150 g yellow onions, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
2 fresh red chillies, cut in slices
2 fresh green chillies, cut in slices
50 g carrots, cut in strips (4 cm)
100 g long beans, cut in pieces (4 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in beef tenderloin. Add ground turmeric and salt then mix. Set aside and marinate for 15 minutes.
Place garlic cloves and cooking oil in mixing bowl, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved marinated beef tenderloin, stir fry 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add yellow onions, red chillies, green chillies, carrots and long beans, stir fry 3 min/120°C//speed . Serve immediately.

title: Oil-free Honey Chicken Wings
ingredients: 20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao) (opcional)
steps: Place a large bowl onto the mixing bowl lid, add chicken wings, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and salt, marinate for 30 mins in a cold place or in refrigerator.
Place lump sugar, shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, mince Turbo/1 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add marinated chicken wings and its sauce, cook 14 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add honey and Chinese rice wine, mix 30 sec/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer chicken wings to a serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: To thicken the sauce, remove the chicken wings (without its sauce) from mixing bowl after step 4, cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 1. Pour the sauce onto chicken wings and serve.

title: Toasted Peanuts
ingredients: 200 g raw unsalted peanuts, with skin
steps: Place cooking oil and peanuts in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Strain peanuts with a fine mesh strainer immediately to stop browning. Let cool completely. Serve as condiment or transfer to airtight jar (200 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ellin Chong.

title: Fish curry
ingredients: 100 g leek, cut into rings (1 cm)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
500 g white fish fillets, skinless (e.g. pollock or cod), cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place onion and carrot in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, leeks and curry powder and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add water, coconut milk, salt and pepper and cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add fish and cook 6 min/90°C//speed . Season to taste and serve hot.
tips: Serve fish curry with basmati rice or chapati (Indian flat bread).

title: Ayam Masak Lemak Cili Api (Braised Chicken with Hot Creamy Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
800 g chicken, with skin and bones, cut in pieces (5 cm)
300 g baby potatoes, cut in quarters  o 300 g Russet potatoes, cut in chunks (3 cm)
steps: Place bird’s eyes chillies, garlic cloves, shallots and turmeric in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 4 sec/speed 8 again. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemongrass, chop 5 sec//speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add coconut milk, water, salt and chicken, cook 10 min/98°C//speed .
Add tamarind piece, potatoes and basil leaves, cook 10 min/98°C//speed . Let stand for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: For a less spicy version, reduce bird’s eye chillies to 6 pieces and add 6 fresh red chillies in step 1.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Tom Yam Mee Hoon
ingredients: 20 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white parts only, cut in slices
1 fresh red chilli, cut in slices
1 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
1 sprig fresh coriander leaves, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in mee hoon. Place large bowl with mee hoon under running tap water until mee hoon is fully covered with water. Soak for 5 minutes (see tips). Drain using Varoma dish and transfer back to large bowl.
Place garlic cloves, shallots, soaked dried shrimp, tomyam paste and lemongrass in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and kaffir lime leaves, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed .
Add fish sauce, sugar, water, carrot, cabbage, red chilli and chicken stock powder, cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add reserved mee hoon (see tips), cook 4 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed . Transfer to serving plates. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot.
tips: Different brand of mee hoon may require slightly different soaking time. Soak the mee hoon approximately 5 minutes or until the texture is loose and thoroughly wet.

The ratio of mee hoon to water is always 100 g more water than the quantity of mee hoon. For example, if you use 400 g mee hoon for this recipe, increase the amount of water to 500 g and double the rest of the ingredients while preparation steps and TM settings remain.
In step 6, mee hoon must be added immediately before the temperature drops below 85°C.

title: Japanese Cheese Tarts
ingredients: 500 g low protein flour, plus extra for dusting  o 500 g cake flour, plus extra for dusting
300 g salted butter, cut in cubes (1 cm)
steps: Place low protein flour, caster sugar, butter and egg in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/speed 6. Remove the dough from mixing bowl, knead the dough gently and form into a flattened ball and wrap with pastry mat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Lightly dust a pastry mat and rolling pin with flour, roll out the dough thinly on left half of pastry mat, about 3-4 mm thick. Align tart tins (Ø 8 cm) face-up at right half of pastry mat, roughly corresponding to the shape of the dough sheet. Transfer dough sheet on top of aligned tart tins by flipping the pastry mat with dough sheet and gently press it down to cut the dough. Carefully separate pastry mat and dough sheet. Gently press the dough into tart tins with finger tips. Use a fork to prick the base of the tart shells. Preheat oven to 200°C.
Bake for 15 minutes (200ºC) until lightly brown. Allow tart shells to cool completely on cooling rack.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream cheese in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/speed 3.
Add milk, caster sugar, whipping cream, rum and cornflour, cook 8 min/100°C/speed 3.

Add lemon juice and vanilla extract, mix 30 sec/speed 3 until it thickens into custard. Remove butterfly whisk. Spoon cheese mixture into baked tart shells. Place cheese tarts in freezer for 20 minutes. Brush tart surface evenly with egg yolk using a pastry brush. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 230°C.
Bake for 10-15 minutes (230°C) until lightly golden yellow. Allow cheese tarts to cool on a cooling rack. Serve warm or cool.
tips: Reduce cornflour to 2½ tsp in step 5 for a runny consistency of the custard.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.

title: Curry Fish
ingredients: 10 dried chillies, soaked and cut in pieces
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, cut in slices
1 stalk torch ginger flower (bunga kantan), bud only, cut in thin slices
500 - 600 g fish tail (1 fish tail), scored
100 g onions, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
1 sprig fresh curry leaves, leaves only
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, dried chillies, ginger, lemongrass, curry powder and cooking oil in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 10 min/120°C/speed .

Add light soy sauce, ginger flower, water and chicken stock powder. Season both sides of fish tail with salt and lemon juice, place in Varoma dish. Set Varoma into position and steam 12 min/Varoma//speed 1. Meanwhile, place ladies’ fingers and tomatoes onto Varoma tray.
Carefully open Varoma lid, Insert prepared Varoma tray into Varoma dish, close Varoma lid and steam 8 min/Varoma//speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add onions, curry leaves, coconut milk and sugar, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed 2. Transfer steamed fish, ladies' fingers and tomatoes to a serving bowl. Pour curry gravy over it and serve immediately.
tips: Replace fish tail with fish fillet slices or fish head.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Kung Po Chicken (Dried Chilli Chicken)
ingredients: 600 g chicken thigh fillets, with skin, cut in pieces (4 cm)
20 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
15 dried chillies, rinsed, deseeded, soaked for 5 minutes and cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, oyster sauce and dark soy sauce. Marinate and set aside in a cool place or refrigerated for 30 minutes.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sesame oil, ginger and dried chillies, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place reserved marinated chicken and marinade, brown sugar and salt in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed . Meanwhile, mix cornflour and water in a small bowl.
Add reserved cornflour mixture, onions and reserved dried chilli mixture, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Sprinkle cashew nuts on top and serve hot.
tips: Patting dry the chicken thigh fillets before cutting it in pieces will give a thicker gravy.
In Step 4, add 1 tsp of black vinegar through the mixing bowl lid hole at the last 1 minute of cooking to make the taste more aromatic.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Guangxi-Style Steamed Whole Chicken with Chives Sauce
ingredients: 1800 - 2000 g kampung chicken (1 whole kampung chicken)
1 tbsp salt, plus ¼ tsp for sauce
40 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
20 g garlic cloves, plus 2-3 cloves extra, smashed for steaming
steps: Rub chicken inside out with rice wine and salt. Place 2-3 smashed garlic cloves and 10 g ginger slices into chicken cavity.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma with chicken into position, steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Transfer steaming liquid to a serving bowl and set aside.
Place 20 g garlic cloves, 30 g ginger slices and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chopped chives and spring onion, sauté 1 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add chopped coriander, light soy sauce, sesame oil, salt and 50 g reserved steaming liquid, mix 30 sec/speed 1. Cut steamed chicken into pieces and transfer to a serving plate. Pour sauce over steamed chicken and serve hot.
tips: You may add vegetables of your choice (cabbage, cabbage, tomatoes, carrot, white radish etc) to the remaining steaming liquid and cook 3 min/100°C// after step 7.
Recipe contributed by Nicole Oh.

title: Fast and Easy Stir Fried Mee Hoon (200 g)
ingredients: 25 g carrots, cut in strips (5 cm)
100 g cabbage, cut in 5 cm length
75 g fish cakes, cut in thin slices  o 75 g skinless chicken breasts, cut in thin slices
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in mee hoon. Place large bowl with mee hoon under running tap water until mee hoon is fully covered with water. Soak for 5 minutes (see tips) for soaking. Drain with Varoma dish and transfer back to large bowl.
Place garlic cloves and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .

Add water, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, white pepper powder and oyster sauce, cook 5 min/100°C//speed . Pour half of boiled sauce into bowl with mee hoon, mix mee hoon with chopsticks until all mee hoon are evenly coated with sauce. Set aside. Place mixing bowl with remaining sauce back in position.
Add carrots and cabbage, cook 1 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed .

Add reserved mee hoon and fish cakes, cook 4 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed . Scrape bottom of mixing bowl with spatula until all mee hoon are evenly coated with sauce. Let mee hoon stand in mixing bowl for 1-2 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Different brand of mee hoon may require slightly different soaking time. Soak the mee hoon approximately 5 minutes until the texture is loose and thoroughly wet.
The setting of temperature at Varoma in step 5 and 6 is to heat up the bowl at maximum as soon as possible, the actual temperature may not reach Varoma.
In step 6, mee hoon must be added immediately before the temperature drops below 85°C.

title: Italian hot chocolate
steps: Place milk, sugar, cocoa powder and wheat starch into mixing bowl. Cook 8 min/80°C/speed 4.
Serve the hot chocolate immediately, with whipped cream to taste.
tips: Vary amount of sugar to taste.Hot chocolate with spice: add preferred ground spice (vanilla, cinnamon, chilli pepper, star anise. . .) at Step 1 and continue as indicated.Chocolate winter punch: when the hot chocolate is done, add ½-1 measuring cup of rum or amaretto liqueur.White chocolate: use skimmed milk instead of whole, and 100 g chopped white chocolate instead of cocoa powder.
Vary amount of sugar to taste.
Hot chocolate with spice: add preferred ground spice (vanilla, cinnamon, chilli pepper, star anise. . .) at Step 1 and continue as indicated.
Chocolate winter punch: when the hot chocolate is done, add ½-1 measuring cup of rum or amaretto liqueur.
White chocolate: use skimmed milk instead of whole, and 100 g chopped white chocolate instead of cocoa powder.

title: Thai burgers
ingredients: 1 stalk lemon grass, fresh, cut into pieces (1 cm )
1 red chilli, dried or fresh, deseeded
200 g fresh button mushrooms, cut into halves
steps: Place lemon grass, chilli and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add spring onion and coriander and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mushrooms and salt and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add pork mince and fish sauce, and use spatula to mix 15 sec/speed 3 with aid of spatula.

Heat oil on in a large nos-stick frying pan. Roll mixture into 4 equally-sized patties (Ø approx. 10 cm). Fry Thai burgers over a medium heat for approx. 4–5 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot.
tips: The lemon grass must be very fresh and not have any woody parts. If necessary, remove the two outer leaves.Retain chilli seeds for more spiciness.Serving suggestion: toast burger buns in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. chilli sauce or ketchup on two roll halves, place Thai burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce or sliced vegetables to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.
The lemon grass must be very fresh and not have any woody parts. If necessary, remove the two outer leaves.
Retain chilli seeds for more spiciness.

Serving suggestion: toast burger buns in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. chilli sauce or ketchup on two roll halves, place Thai burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce or sliced vegetables to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.

title: Nasi Lemak
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemon grass, white part only and sliced
40 - 80 g dried chillies, large and mild heat, deseeded and soaked to soften
steps: Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice, coconut milk, ginger, pandan leaves, lemongrass and salt to it. Stir well with spatula.
Set Varoma dish into position, add eggs to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 18 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Remove Varoma and place eggs in cold water before removing egg shell. Cut into halves and set aside.
Remove simmering basket with spatula. With aid of spatula, transfer cooked rice into a thermal serving bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in tamarind paste and water. Mix, deseed and set aside. Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots and cooking oil into mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add light soy sauce, sugar, salt and tamarind-water mixture, cook 13 min/120°C//speed 2.

Add deep fried anchovies and onions then cook 2 min/120°C/ /speed 2. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. In a serving plate, add a portion of cooked coconut rice, sambal and reserved eggs, garnish with sliced cucumber and roasted peanuts. Serve hot.
tips: Instead of deep fried crispy anchovies, try toasting the anchovies in oven for 15 minutes at 150°C or until light golden brown. The anchovies will become crispy once it is cooled.
Add 1 tbsp of coconut oil in step 4 after rice is cooked to enhance coconut aroma.
Thermal serving bowl is ideal to keep cooked rice warm.

Replace coconut milk with virgin coconut oil for better health benefit. Omit 200 g of coconut milk and add 1300 g of water in step 1. In step 4, add 60 g of virgin coconut oil into the cooked rice and mix well.

title: Nasi Kampung (Kampung-style fried rice)
ingredients: 100 g yardlong beans, diagonally cut into thin slices (3 cm)  o 100 g water spinach, cut into pieces (3 cm)
fried ikan bilis (toasted dried anchovies), to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, red chillies, bird‘s eye chillies, dried anchovies and salt into mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed .
Add long beans, sauté 2 min/120°C/speed .
Insert butterfly whisk, add cooked rice, without measuring cup, stir fry 2 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk, garnish with toasted dried anchovies and serve hot.
tips: The ingredients in step 1 can be replaced with 100 g of green chilli sambal. Skip step 1 and go straight to step 2, reduce sautéing time to 3 minutes.

Cooked rice preparation: Insert simmering basket, place 300 g of long grain white rice (eg. parboiled, basmati or jasmine) and 1200 g of water into mixing bowl, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Cool completely before using in step 3. Do not refrigerate overnight.

title: Japanese Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients: 15 g butter, plus extra for greasing
120 g superfine flour, sifted  o 120 g low protein flour, sifted
400 g large strawberries, hulled, rinsed, cut in slices (0.3 cm), plus extra for decorating
steps: Grease a baking pan (Ø 18 cm) with butter and line with baking paper. Set aside.

Place a heat-resistant bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in milk and butter. Preheat oven to 185°C. Melt milk-butter mixture in preheated oven for 5 minutes (185°C) or until mixture is completely melted. Set aside and allow to cool for 15 minutes.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs and sugar in mixing bowl, without measuring cup, whisk 7 min/40°C/speed 3.
Add superfine flour and baking soda, mix 10 sec/speed 2.

Add vanilla extract and reserved milk-butter mixture, mix 10 sec/speed 2. Remove butterfly whisk. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix until fully combined. Pour the batter into prepared baking pan. Clean and dry mixing bowl, refrigerate mixing bowl for step 7.

Bake for 25-30 minutes (185°C) or until cake is nicely browned and springs back slightly when pressed gently. Allow the cake to cool in pan for 10 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Slice sponge cake horizontally into 2 layers with cake leveler or serrated knife.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream, caster sugar and vanilla extract in dry and chilled mixing bowl, without measuring cup, whip speed 3.5, without setting a time, until desired stiffness is achieved, watching carefully through the hole of mixing bowl lid to avoid over-whipping. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer whipped cream to a bowl and set aside.

Place one sponge cake layer onto a serving platter and spread chantilly cream evenly over the top. Cover with sliced strawberries then place the second sponge cake layer on top. Cover the whole cake with remaining chantilly cream. Decorate with strawberries, dust with icing sugar and serve.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
To replace butter with oil, omit step 2 and add 15 g corn oil along with milk in step 5.

title: Spicy Soy Sauce Chicken
ingredients: 30 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
150 g large red onions, cut in slices
700 g whole chicken legs, (approx. 2 whole chicken legs), with skin and bone, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place ginger slices and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.

Place cooking oil, mustard seeds, white dal, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cloves, cinnamon stick, red onions, shallots, star anise and curry leaves in mixing bowl, without measuring cup, sauté 8 min/Varoma//speed 2.
Add chilli powder, without measuring cup, sauté 2 min/Varoma//speed 2.
Add reserved ginger garlic paste, chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar and water, cook 13 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Rendang Tok with Pulut Kuning (Perak Beef Rendang with Yellow Glutinous Rice)
ingredients: 15 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
1000 g beef chuck, cut in cubes (5 cm)
1 sprig fresh coriander, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl mixing bowl lid, weigh in glutinous rice and water. Add ground turmeric, tamarind pieces, salt and pandan leaves to the bowl. Mix and set aside to soak for at least 1 hour or overnight. Drain through Varoma dish and place pandan leaves on top of soaked glutinous rice, making sure that some holes are remain unobstructed. Close Varoma lid and set aside.

Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 250 g coconut milk. Add 1 tsp salt and sugar to the bowl. Mix and set aside. Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, cloves and star anise in mixing bowl, dry roast without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Let cool for 5 minutes.
Grind 1 min 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dried chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, ginger, turmeric, galangal, lemongrass and water, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add coconut paste, 500 g coconut milk, bay leaves, kaffir lime leaves, 1½ tsp salt and coconut oil, set prepared Varoma into position, cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer steamed rice to the bowl with coconut milk mixture.
Add 500 g coconut milk and beef cubes to mixing bowl, set Varoma dish in position, insert the bowl with rice. Close Varoma lid and cook 45 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.
Cook 10 min/Varoma//speed  until the beef is soft and tender. Let stand for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot with steamed glutinous rice.
tips: To make your own coconut paste, toast 300 g of grated coconut (fresh or frozen) in a preheated oven (160°C) for 30 minutes until golden brown. Scrape every 15 minutes. Transfer to mixing bowl, grind 30 sec/speed 10 to release oil and become moist. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Repeat milling step for 3 times.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Aubergine dip (moutabal/baba ganoush)
ingredients: 1000 g aubergines, peeled, cut into cubes (3-4 cm)
steps: Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position, weigh 700 g aubergines into Varoma dish. Insert Varoma tray and weigh remaining 300 g aubergines in it. Drizzle with 10 g lemon juice, close Varoma lid and cook 50 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside, remove Varoma lid and allow aubergines to cool down for 15 minutes. Empty mixing bowl.
Place remaining 50 g lemon juice, tahini paste, garlic and salt into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 6.

Gently press the aubergines with a spoon to drain excess moisture, add aubergines into mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with olive oil and parsley leaves.
tips: Garnish aubergine dip with paprika and pomegranate kernels.

title: Mee Siam (Spicy Siamese Noodles)
ingredients: 20 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
50 g fresh chives, cut in 3 cm length
1 egg omelette, cut in thin strips, to garnish
1 firm bean curd (tau kwa), pan-fried, cut in cubes, to garnish
1 fresh red chilli, cut in thin slices, to garnish
3 calamansi limes, cut in halves, to garnish
2 tbsp deep fried shallots, to garnish
steps: Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in mee hoon and set aside. Place dried chillies, garlic cloves and shallots into mixing bowl, chop 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dried shrimp, chop 30 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, rinse reserved mee hoon thoroughly. Drain through Varoma dish, set aside.
Add water and light soy sauce, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add reserved mee hoon and soybean paste, stir fry 1 min/100°C//speed .
Add mung bean sprouts and chives, stir fry 3 min/Varoma//speed .

When mixing bowl temperature drops to 90°C, transfer mee hoon to a serving plate. Garnish with omelette strips, bean curd cubes, red chilli slices, calamansi lime halves and fried shallots. Serve immediately.
tips: If you use thick noodles, soak noodles right after sautéing chilli paste in step 3 for 5 minutes and rinse well. If you use thin noodles, wash under running water for 1 minute in step 4.
In step 5, mee hoon must be added immediately. Once temperature drops, mee hoon may be undercooked and break apart.

title: Chicken Korma (Cashew Chicken)
ingredients: 500 - 600 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in bite-sized pieces
steps: Place cashew nuts and water in mixing bowl, purée 30 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, ginger, green chillies and onions in mixing bowl, chop 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add ground cinnamon, ground coriander, ground cumin, ground turmeric and cardamom pods, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed .
Add reserved cashew purée, chicken, yoghurt and salt, stir fry 8 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Best served with naan breads.
Replace chicken breast with 1000 g whole chicken legs, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (4 cm). Increase cooking time to 15 minutes in step 5.

title: Chicken and bacon casserole
ingredients: 150 g cheese, medium-hard (e.g. Edam), cut into pieces
800 g chicken breast fillet, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
200 g bacon slices, cut into pieces
steps: Place bread and parsley in mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place olive oil and garlic in mixing bowl, chop 2 sec/speed 8 and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken, salt, honey and mustard and cook 10 min/120°C//speed .
Then shred 4 sec//speed 4 (see tip). Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C.
Place milk, plain flour, butter, lemon juice, paprika, salt, pepper and mustard in mixing bowl and cook 9 min/90°C/speed 4.

Arrange chicken on bottom of a casserole dish (approx. 30 cm x 20 cm x 5 cm), cover with bacon, cheese and finish with sauce. Cover with breadcrumbs and bake in oven at 180°C for about 20 minutes. Serve hot.
tips: Serve chicken and bacon casserole with rice.
For a chunkier texture, reduce chopping time in step 5 or do not chop at all.

title: Green beans with tomato and parsley
ingredients: 1 bunch parsley, leaves washed and dried
400 g chopped tomatoes, canned, or fresh
steps: Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set side.
Place garlic, onion and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomato, water and salt. Arrange green beans into Varoma dish and put Varoma into position. Cook 35 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Set Varoma aside, place beans into the mixing bowl with the sauce, add parsley and pepper and stir 30 sec//speed . Leave beans in the mixing bowl for 5 minutes, then serve hot or warm.
tips: For those who prefer raw onion, chop some at the start of preparation and add at the end with the parsley.
Instead of water, use cider vinegar or tomato vinegar.

title: Sausage and pea risotto
ingredients: 100 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
200 g chorizo sausage, cut into slices, or other type of dried paprika sausage
320 g risotto rice (e.g. Arborio or Carnaroli)
1 tbsp chicken stock paste  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 7 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place olive oil, onion and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add sausage, bacon and purée and sauté 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add wine, rice, stock and water, stir with the aid of spatula and cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Add peas and cook 6 min/100°C//speed .
Add sweetcorn and reserved cheese, mix with aid of spatula. Serve hot.

title: Golden Pillow (Big Bun With Nyonya Curry Chicken Filling)
ingredients: 40 g butter, softened at room temperature
1200 g whole chicken legs (approx. 3 legs, with skin and bone, cut into pieces (3 cm)
150 g Nyonya spice paste, homemade or store bought
steps: Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add high protein flour, milk powder, egg, butter and salt to mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Knead Dough /5 min. Transfer to a pastry mat. Shape into a smooth ball and wrap with pastry mat. Allow to proof until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Clean mixing bowl.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, Nyonya spice paste and meat curry powder. Add salt and mix. Set aside for 15 minutes.
Grease a sheet of baking paper (approx. 50 cm x 50 cm, layered by 2 pieces of 30 cm x 30 cm) with oil. Line a large bowl with greased baking paper.

Place marinated chicken and coconut milk in mixing bowl, cook 15 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to prepared bowl, carefully wrap into a parcel and twist the knot tightly. Bend the knot to form a round shape parcel and set aside.

Line a baking tray with a second sheet of greased baking paper. Flatten risen bread dough with a rolling pin, roll into a big flat round shape of ½ cm thickness (Ø 40 cm). Place curry chicken parcel on baking tray, then cover with flattened bread dough and carefully tuck the dough under the chicken parcel. Set aside to proof for another 45 minutes or until dough doubled in size. During the last 10 minutes of proofing, preheat oven to 170⁰C.
Brush bun with lightly beaten egg. Bake for 20-25 minutes (170°C) or until golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Replace Nyonya curry chicken with your favourite curry recipe.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Stir Fried Pork Belly Slices with Kimchi
ingredients: 3 fresh shiitake mushrooms, cut in slices
1 fresh green chilli, cut in slices
100 g pork belly, skinless, cut in thin slices (0.3 cm)
1 tbsp spring onions, white part only, chopped
1 tsp white sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish
steps: Place 20 g cooking oil, onions, mushrooms, green chilli, salt and white pepper powder in mixing bowl, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and ginger to mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 30 g cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pork belly, kimchi, rice wine and gochujang, stir fry 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved onion mushroom mixture, chopped spring onion and sesame oil, stir fry 1 min/120°C//speed . Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork belly and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C/ /speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.
Partially freeze pork belly before cutting for perfect thin slices.

title: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: 250 g potatoes, peeled, cut in chunks (2 cm)
½ tsp rock salt, adjust to taste
150 g tomatoes (approx. 1 tomato), cut in cubes (1 cm)
1 tbsp fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place potatoes, green chilli, cumin seeds, ground coriander seed, ground turmeric, red chilli powder, water and rock salt in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/Varoma//speed .
Add cauliflower florets and tomatoes, cook 8 min/Varoma//speed . Add cold pressed sesame oil to mixing bowl and mix well with spatula. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Limau Kasturi Asam Boi (Sour Plum Calamansi Drink)
steps: Place rock sugar and sour plums in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/2 sec/2 times.
Add calamansi and water, blend Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place with spatula and strain calamansi drink into a jug. Serve cold.
tips: Replace calamansi with 2 lemons, cut into quarters.

title: Chocolate Lava Cakes
ingredients: 150 g unsalted butter, cut in cubes (2 cm), plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease 8 ramekins (8 cm, 125 ml) with a little melted butter. Divide cocoa powder between each ramekin (½ tsp each) and rotate to coat bottom and sides evenly. Set ramekins aside.
Place dark chocolate in mixing bowl, grate 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, sugar and salt, melt 4 min/60°C/speed 2.
Mix 2 min/speed 4, slowly adding eggs and egg yolks through hole of mixing bowl lid one at a time until combined.
Add vanilla bean paste and plain flour, mix 20 sec/speed 3.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 5 sec/speed 4. Divide mixture between prepared ramekins, leaving a 5 mm space at the top. Place into refrigerator to cool for 20 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Place ramekins onto a baking tray and bake for 12 minutes (200°C), or until top is smooth and crusty and springs back when pressed gently. Allow lava cakes to cool for a few minutes. Meanwhile, whip cream.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream in mixing bowl, whisk 45 sec/speed 3, or until soft peaks form, watching carefully through hole in mixing bowl lid to avoid overwhipping. Remove butterfly whisk.
Turn out lava cakes onto serving plates and serve with whipped cream and raspberries.
tips: These chocolate lava cakes, so called because they spill with chocolate 'lava' when broken, are based on a classic French recipe that may (or may not) have been invented by Michel Bras. He tried to patent the recipe in 1981, but it's been copied and developed by countless famous chefs over the years, including Jean-George Vongerichten (who also claims it as his own), Raymond Blanc and Gordon Ramsay. This recipe borrows from the classic, with a little Nigella inspiration too.
Filled, uncooked ramekins can be stored in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 2 days or even frozen for up to 2 weeks. Place into the refrigerator to defrost and bake as per recipe.
Original recipe developed by Dani Valent, Australia.

title: Turmeric Chicken
ingredients: 800 g chicken, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add salt, sugar and light soy sauce to the bowl and mix. Set aside to marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or refrigerator.
Place shallots, ginger and turmeric in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5 or until a fine paste is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemongrass and oil, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed 0.5.
Add marinated chicken and onions, stir fry 14 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.

title: Pineapple Tarts
ingredients: 1500 g fresh pineapple (approx. 2 pineapples), peeled, eyes and core removed, cut in cubes (2 cm)
250 g unsalted butter, cold, cut in cubes (1 cm)
steps: Place pineapple in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Drain blended pineapple using Varoma dish to discard excessive liquid.
Place blended pineapples pulp, sugar and cinnamon stick in mixing bowl, cook 40 min/120°C/speed 1 or until it thickens. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of pineapple jam (approx. 8 g) and roll into a small ball. Repeat this step until all jam is used.
Place plain flour, milk powder, caster sugar and salt in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/2 sec/1 time.
Add butter, mix 5 sec/speed 5.

Add egg yolks, mix Dough /20 sec. Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Shape the dough into a long log and cut into small pieces (approx. 10 g). Flatten a dough piece, place a reserved jam ball in the centre of each and wrap into a ball. Cut dough surface with clipper to create a pineapple look and place on a baking tray. Repeat the steps with remaining dough balls and jam. Preheat oven to 170°C.

Using a pastry brush, brush pastry surface with lightly beaten egg. Bake for 20 minutes (170°C) until lightly brown. Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an airtight container.

title: Sweet potato muffins with walnuts
ingredients: 270 g sweet potatoes, peeled, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
280 g flour, plus extra for flouring
100 g brown sugar, plus extra for sprinkling
steps: Place walnuts in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in sweet potatoes then steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Empty mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a 12-hole muffin tray and set aside.
Place reserved steamed sweet potatoes in mixing bowl and mash 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add flour, sugar, brown sugar, milk, oil, eggs, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, 50 g reserved chopped walnuts and cinnamon then mix 20 sec/speed 5.
Divide mixture evenly between holes in prepared muffin tray and sprinkle with remaining chopped walnuts and brown sugar.
Bake for 30 minutes (180°C) or until a wooden skewer placed in the centre of a muffin comes out clean. Allow to cool, then serve.

title: Broccoli burgers with radish salsa
ingredients: 1 red onion (approx. 60 g), cut into halves
30 g soy flour, full fat, as egg replacement
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place radishes, onion, mustard, vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 4.5.
Add capers and stir 5 sec//speed 2. Transfer salsa to a bowl and allow to steep in fridge. Rinse mixing bowl.

Add 400 g water to mixing bowl, place Varoma into position, weigh broccoli, close Varoma and cook 16 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside. Remove Varoma lid and allow broccoli to cool for approx. 20 minutes. Empty and dry mixing bowl.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 8.
Place soy flour in a bowl and mix to a smooth paste with 60 g water
Add half of broccoli florets, soy flour, breadcrumbs, oat flakes, salt and pepper to mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5 with aid of spatula.

Add remaining broccoli florets and use spatula to stir 5 sec//speed 3.5. Shape 8 round patties (Ø approx. 7 cm) from broccoli mixture. Heat a little oil in a frying pan and fry patties on either side until golden brown. Allow to drain on a paper towel. Serve the broccoli burgers warm with radish salsa.
tips: Serve with mashed potatoes, quinoa or buckwheat.Soy flour is available in health food shops. A vegan egg replacement can alternatively be used.
Serve with mashed potatoes, quinoa or buckwheat.
Soy flour is available in health food shops. A vegan egg replacement can alternatively be used.

title: Agar-Agar Gula Melaka (Palm Sugar Agar-Agar Jelly)
ingredients: 200 g coconut milk, fresh or packaged
200 g palm sugar, cut in chunks
2 - 2 ½ tsp agar-agar powder  o 10 g agar-agar strips, cut in 7 cm length, rinsed
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in coconut milk. Add egg and salt then mix. Set aside. Place palm sugar, agar agar powder, water, sugar and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, boil 10 min/120°C/speed 2.

Cook 2 min 30 sec/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, add reserved coconut-egg mixture through hole of mixing bowl lid. Remove pandan leaves. Transfer to a baking tin (20 cm x 20 cm). Allow to cool completely and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Cut in desired shapes before serving.
tips: Replace baking tin with small cup moulds.
If your coconut milk is too thick, reduce to 50 g and dilute it with 150 g water before step 1.

title: Soy Sauce Chicken
ingredients: 1 whole chicken (approx.1.3-1.5 kg), feet and neck removed
6 sprigs spring onions, white part only
30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place ginger slices and spring onions inside chicken cavity. Place chicken bottom down on mixing knife blade.
Add garlic cloves, honey, Chinese rice wine, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, sesame oil and water, cook 40 min/100°C//speed . Let chicken rest in mixing bowl for another 10 minutes. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Smooth fennel and carrot soup
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
350 g fennel, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
250 g carrots, peeled and cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
40 g leek, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for serving
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place fennel, carrots and leek into mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add water and vegetable stock cube, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add a pinch of salt if necessary, blend 1 min/speed 5-9, increasing speed gradually.
Transfer to soup bowls, add a dash of olive oil, sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Serve hot or warm.
tips: If preferred, decorate the soup with a pinch of paprika and some sprigs of fennel leaves.

title: Lentil and spinach soup
ingredients: 50 g carrots, peeled and cut into slices (0.5 cm)
50 g celery leaves, washed and dried
200 g fresh spinach leaves, washed and dried
steps: Place onion, carrot and celery into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lentils, bay leaves, stock cube and water and cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing.
Add olive oil, spinach, rice and season if necessary, cook 16 min/100°C//speed 1, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup. Check if rice is cooked and prolong cooking time if necessary.
Transfer to a soup tureen or large serving bowl and serve hot.

title: Spicy Black Pepper Chicken
ingredients: 600 g chicken wings (approx. 6-8 chicken wings), halved at joint
2 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
60 g yellow onions, cut in slices
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken wings, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and sesame oil. Marinate and set aside for at least 30 minutes in a cool place or refrigerated.
Place black peppercorns and rock sugar in clean and dry mixing bowl, grind Turbo/2 sec/4 times.
Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, cook 12 min/Varoma//speed 1. Meanwhile, mix Chinese rice wine and cornflour in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add sliced onions and rice wine mixture, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.
Patting dry the chicken meat before cutting it in bite-sized pieces will give a thicker gravy.
If you want to rinse the black peppercorns, place them in the oven (140°C) after rinsing and toast for 5 minutes or until completely dried.

title: Garlic dip (toum)
steps: Place oil and lemon juice into mixing bowl and emulsify 1 min/speed 4. Transfer into a jug and set aside.
Place garlic cloves, salt and 50 g oil lemon emulsion and mix 3 min/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and bottom all around the knife with spatula and blend 1 min/speed 6. If a paste-like consistency is not achived, blend again 1 min/speed 6.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and bottom all around the knife with spatula and mix /speed 3.5 (approx. 4 minutes), while very slowly pouring reserved oil-lemon emulsion onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer into a jar and refrigerate until needed.
tips: Serve with meat or chicken.
Serve with meat or chicken.

title: Beetroot hummus
ingredients: 50 g tahini (see tip)  o 50 g toasted sesame seeds
200 g beetroot, cooked and cut into very thin slices
steps: Place garlic, chickpeas, beetroot, lemon juice, tahini (or sesame seeds), salt, olive oil, curry and cumin into mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.
Place 1 slice of beetroot on each endive leaf, top with 1 tbsp hummus and another slice of beetroot coiled like a cone. Sprinkle with olive oil, pepper and toasted sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
tips: Nutritional comments: This is a very healthy starter thanks to its richness in complex carbohydrates.
Tahini is a paste made from toasted ground sesame seeds. It is used as a condiment or on its own in Middle Eastern cuisine.
You can also serve hummus on slices of toast.
One serving consists of 2 stuffed endive leaves.

title: Oat porridge with dates and cardamom
ingredients: 30 - 40 g pistachio nuts, unsalted, or other type of nuts (e.g. walnuts, almonds etc.)
steps: Place pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place dates into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place milk, sugar, cardamom and oat flakes into mixing bowl and cook 9 min/90°C//speed 2.
Add reserved chopped dates and cook 2 min/90°C//speed 2.
Add blossom water and mix 20 sec//speed 3. Transfer the mixture into a large bowl or into individual bowls, sprinkle with chopped pistachio nuts and serve warm.
tips: The porridge will keep thickening as it rests, if it is not served immediately adjust the quantity of milk in step 3.
Replace the milk with 1 tin sweetened condensed milk (400 g) and 450 g water. Omit sugar or adjust it to taste.

Single portion: reduce the amount of ingredients to 30 g dates, 40 g large oat flakes, 210 g milk, a pinch of ground cardamom and 1 tsp blossom water. Follow the same procedure as described in the preparation and in step 3 cook 6 mins/90°C//speed 2.

title: Sambal Tumis Udang (Prawn Sambal)
ingredients: 500 g medium-sized prawns, whiskers removed, cleaned and deveined, patted dry with paper towel
30 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place prawns and 20 g cooking oil in mixing bowl, cook 6 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place dried chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, shrimp paste and water, chop 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 80 g cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add palm sugar, salt, tamarind extract and reserved prawns, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed . Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Egg Tarts
ingredients: 200 g unsalted butter, cold, cut in cubes (1 cm)
370 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place icing sugar, butter, plain flour, egg, salt and vanilla extract in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 4.

Transfer mixture onto a lightly floured pastry mat. Fold the pastry mat to cover pastry. Flatten with a rolling pin until pastry is ½ cm thick. Unfold pastry mat with pastry placed on right half of pastry mat.

Line 12 tart tins (Ø 6.5 cm) on left side of pastry mat. Flip right half of pastry mat so that pastry covers tart tins. Gently roll over it with a rolling pin so that pastry cuts into tins. Carefully separate pastry mat and remove excess pastry. Lightly press pastry into tart tins.
Repeat steps for remaining pastry. Place on a baking tray and bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes (180°C). Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack.
Preheat oven to 170°C. Place icing sugar and water in mixing bowl, heat 4 min/37°C/speed 1.

Add evaporated milk and eggs, mix 20 sec/speed 3. Strain egg mixture twice through a fine mesh strainer. Pour egg mixture into baked tart pastry and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes (170°C) or until custard sets. Serve warm.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustment on the time and temperature to suit your oven.

title: Nasi Arab (Arabian Rice)
ingredients: 1 tsp paprika powder, adjust to taste
1 ½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
½ tsp orange food colouring  o 1 pinch saffron
4 - 5 whole chicken legs, with skin, fats removed, not scored (see tips)
1 tomato, seeds removed, coarsely chopped (see tips)
2 tbsp lemon juice, adjust to taste
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
½ tsp sugar, adjust to taste
1 ½ tbsp salt, adjust to taste
1 tomato, large sized, cut in quarters
¼ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black peppercorns, cardamoms, dried bay leaves, cinnamon stick and cloves in mixing bowl, dry roast 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Let temperature drop to 95°C (approx. 5 minutes), mill 1 min/speed 4-10 gradually. Transfer to a jar (see tips).
Place 1 ½ tablespoon reserved Arabian spice mix, paprika powder, olive oil, lemon juice, salt and orange food colouring in a large bowl and mix well. Add chicken to it, mix well and set aside.
Arrange chicken in Varoma dish and tray. Place water in mixing bowl and set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, mix chopped cucumber, tomato, onions, coriander leaves, olives, lemon juice, salt and sugar and refrigerate till ready to serve (see tips).
Place rice, salt, 1 tablespoon reserved Arabian spice mix, cardamoms and cinnamon stick in simmering basket and mix well with spatula. Add green chilies on top of the rice.

Place simmering basket in mixing bowl. Set Varoma with chicken back into position, steam 22 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer cooked rice to a serving dish and arrange cooked chicken on top of rice (see tips). Transfer soup to a serving bowl and garnish with coriander leaves. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place red chilies, bird’s eye chili, garlic, tomato, coriander leaves, lemon juice, salt and sugar in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl. Serve immediately with rice, chicken, soup and salad.
tips: Skip step 1 if you are using store-bought or pre-made spice mix. The Arabian spice mix in this recipe is enough to prepare this recipe twice.
Cut whole chicken legs into 2 or 3 pieces for easier serving.
To ensure the cucumber stay crunchy, mix with 1 tsp of salt to remove excess water for 10 minutes after chopping.
If jasmine rice is used for this recipe, change settings to 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.5 in step 7.
Recipe contributed by Afiza Halin.

title: Hong Kong Bakery Butter Cookies
ingredients: 225 g unsalted butter, softened at room temperature
225 g low protein flour (top flour/cake flour), sieved
steps: Place butter in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add icing sugar, mix 2 min/speed 3.5 until creamy. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add low protein flour, cornflour and salt, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer into a piping bag with star-shaped tip (13 mm).

Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Hold piping bag vertically above parchment paper and squeeze out batter approximately 3 cm in diameter. Rotate tip in alternating motion to form ruffles and repeat this motion 3 to 4 times. Upon reaching desired height (approximately 2 cm), pull piping tip sharply up. Leave at least 3 cm space between each cookie. Repeat this step for the remaining cookie batter. Store piped cookies in refrigerator for 20-30 minutes. Preheat oven to 150°C.

Bake on middle rack for 40 minutes (150°C) until slightly golden brown. Adjust oven temperature to 180°C, continue to bake for 3 minutes (180°C) until golden brown. Let cool completely on tray before serving or storing in airtight container.
tips: Recipe contributed by Cynthia Wong.

title: Shallot Oil
steps: Place cooking oil and shallot slices in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Let cool completely. Serve as condiment or transfer to airtight jar (200 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ellin Chong.

title: Coffee dessert
ingredients: 400 g ice cubes, left at room temperature for several minutes
steps: Place sugar and instant coffee into mixing bowl and pulverise 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ice cubes and milk and beat 5 min/speed 5, until dessert is beaten thoroughly. Transfer to glasses and serve immediately.

title: Chicken skewers with peanut satay sauce
ingredients: 1 piece fresh ginger, 3 cm, thinly sliced  o 2 tsp ground ginger
2 tsp lemon grass, freeze-dried or ground
50 g light sesame oil, from unroasted sesame
20 g Thai green curry paste  o 20 g Thai yellow curry paste
1 tbsp light sesame oil, from unroasted sesame
1 tbsp lime juice  o 1 tbsp lemon juice
steps: Cut chicken breast fillets lengthwards into thin strips (approx. 1.5 cm wide), press flat with hand or a wide knife blade and place in bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in cold water.
Place onions, garlic and ginger in mixing bowl and chop, 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add coriander, cumin, lemongrass and oil and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add soy sauce and sambal oelek and puree 10 sec/speed 8.
Spread marinade over meat, stir and leave to marinate for at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare peanut satay sauce.
Rinse mixing bowl.
Place peanuts in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 8 scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add curry paste and oil and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1 dünsten.
Add lime juice, coconut milk, sugar, salt and ground peanuts and cook 4 min/100°C/speed 2.
Weave marinated meat onto 30 skewers and fry in non-stcik pan on both sides until golden. Serve chicken skewers with peanut satay sauce
tips: Soak wooden skewers first so meat comes off more easily after frying.
The chicken skewers can alternatively be cooked in the Varoma (place 500 g water in mixing bowl and steam approx. 12 min/Varoma/speed 1). They will then be particularly tender.
The chicken skewers can also be grilled in the oven at 200°C until golden brown.
The skewers and satay sauce can be served hot or cold.
Spicy peanut satay sauce: Add ½ tsp cayenne pepper during the final step.
Try using pork or turkey instead of chicken.

title: Bucatini amatriciana
ingredients: 40 g Pecorino Romano, in chunks (3 cm)
400 g peeled tomatoes, canned  o 300 g crushed tomatoes, canned
steps: Place Pecorino Romano into mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Add red chilli into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and pancetta, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add tomatoes, salt, pepper and continue cooking: 15 min/100°C//speed 1. Meanwhile cook the bucatini “al dente” in a pot with plenty of boiling salted water (cook for the length of time shown on the packaging). Drain the pasta through Varoma dish, place in a serving bowl and dress with the sauce prepared in advance. Sprinkle with the grated Pecorino Romano. Serve immediately.
tips: This condiment may be prepared in advance and stored for later use. Store in clean, dry jars with airtight lids. Place the jars in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and leave to simmer for 20 minutes. Leave to cool in the saucepan and then store in a dark cupboard. The jars of sauce have a shelf life of 2-3 months.
Use the type of pasta preferred: bucatini, spaghetti, macaroni.
The most traditional recipe uses diced (2 cm) guanciale instead of pancetta.

title: Chicken Porridge With Century Egg
ingredients: 200 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
200 g long grain white rice, rinsed and drained
2 salted eggs, cooked, shell removed and cut in cubes
2 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
2 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, finely chopped, to garnish
2 sprigs spring onions, finely chopped, to garnish
steps: Place chicken, light soy sauce and sesame oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place rice and water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add eggs to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 16 min/100°C/speed 3. Remove Varoma and place eggs in cold water before removing egg shell, cut eggs into cubes (0.5 cm).

Add reserved minced chicken, reserved century eggs, salted eggs, chicken stock paste, salt, white pepper powder and ginger, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and spring onions before serving.
tips: Replace chicken with fish or meat of your choice.
Warm century eggs with shell, especially if you are using duck eggs, it eases cutting into cubes without egg yolk sticking on the knife.

title: Magdalenas
ingredients: 1 piece lemon zest, (approx. 5 cm x 1 cm)
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180°C. Place 12 paper muffin cases in a muffin tray.
Place sugar and lemon zest into mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10.
Add eggs. Mix 2 min/37°C/speed 5.
Add milk and sunflower oil into mixing bowl. Mix 10 sec/speed 5.
Add flour and baking powder. Mix 10 sec/speed 3.
Fill ¾ of each of the paper muffin cases with the mixture.

Sprinkle with sugar and bake 20 minutes (180°C). Remove magdalenas from the muffin tray. Place another 12 paper muffin cases in the tray, fill them with the rest of the mixture and bake 20 minutes (180°C). Allow to cool before serving or place in an air-tight container to avoid drying.
tips: If you don’t have a muffin tin, use 3 paper muffin cases as a mould for each magdalena and place them on a baking tray. To ensure they bake uniformly, make sure the magdalenas are not touching while in the oven.

If you don’t have a muffin tin, use 3 paper muffin cases as a mould for each magdalena and place them on a baking tray. To ensure they bake uniformly, make sure the magdalenas are not touching while in the oven.

title: Leek and potato soup with crispy smoked ham
ingredients: 25 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for serving
380 g potatoes, peeled and cut into small pieces
10 g dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and squeezed
1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
1 slice smoked dry-cured ham (speck), cut into thin strips  o 1 slice prosciutto cut into thin strips
steps: Place olive oil and leek into the mixing bowl, sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add potato, porcini mushrooms, water, vegetable stock cube and cook 25 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, in a non-stick frying pan, lightly fry the ham until it is crispy and then transfer to a plate.
Check the potatoes and if necessary, prolong cooking time. Then blend 1 min/speed 8. Transfer soup into soup plates.
Garnish with the crispy ham, sprinkle with chives and add a dash of olive oil. Serve hot
tips: Serve the soup with toasted bread.
The ham in this recipe is a lean, lightly smoked and dry cured ham from South Tyrol in northern Italy. It may be substituted with prosciutto.

title: Chicken with couscous and saffron
ingredients: 1500 g chicken pieces (thighs, drumsticks and breast cut into quarters), skinless and boneless
100 g raisins  o 100 g dried apricots, cut into pieces
600 g red onions, cut into slices (5 mm)
240 g dried chickpeas, soaked in 800 g water the day before, rinsed and drained
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in couscous and set aside.
Place ginger and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a large bowl.

Place large bowl with ginger-garlic mixture onto mixing bowl lid and add chicken pieces, olive oil, and raisins into it and season with 1 tsp cumin, cinnamon, turmeric, raisins,1 tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper. Mix well with spatula to coat all chicken pieces and set aside.

Place water, saffron, ½ tsp cumin, 1 tsp salt, 1 pinch pepper, 200 g sliced onions and drained and rinsed chickpeas into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position, distribute 200 g sliced onions in Varoma dish, place marinated chicken pieces on top and cover with 200 g sliced onions, steam 20 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Carefully open Varoma and stir chicken to ensure even cooking, close Varoma again and steam a further 20 min/Varoma//speed 1.

Remove Varoma and set aside. Insert simmering basket and strain some of the liquid from mixing bowl over the reserved couscous (enough to cover the couscous plus 1½ cm on top). Mix gently with a fork and allow to rest for 15 minutes.

Remove simmering basket, set Varoma back in position, stir chicken again, cover Varoma and steam a further 15 min/Varoma//speed 1. Empty couscous onto a wide, deep platter, make a hole in the middle and fill with chicken. Pour over the whole content of mixing bowl (chickpeas and stock). Serve hot.
tips: For a more intense flavour, marinate the chicken prepared in step 2 overnight in the refrigerator. Continue the next day with the preparation from step 3.
When using canned chickpeas, rinse and drain them well and add them to the mixing bowl at the end of step 5.

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Tiramisu
ingredients: 2 ½ tbsp rum  o 2 ½ tbsp Irish cream liqueur
steps: Place chocolate chips and coffee in mixing bowl, heat 2 min/60°C/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl, add ½ tbsp rum and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place mascarpone cheese, icing sugar, whipping cream and vanilla extract in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add peanut butter and 2 tbsp rum, mix 20 sec/speed 2. Dip each of the ladyfingers into the chocolate mixture until soaked but not soggy, about 3-4 seconds. Arrange in a single layer on the bottom of 4 glass jars (200 g). Top with a large dollop of the peanut butter cream and spread evenly. Top with another layer of ladyfingers and another layer of cream. Refrigerate until ready to serve, at least 4 hours. Dust with cocoa powder. Serve chilled.

title: Indian Pilaf Rice
steps: Place shallots, ginger, garlic cloves and coconut oil in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cinnamon sticks, star anise and cardamom seeds, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed 2.
Add tomato ketchup, sugar, salt, ground turmeric, chilli powder, ground black pepper and water, cook 5 min/100°C//speed .

Add rice, start Rice Cooker . Let cooked rice stand for 10 minutes in mixing bowl. Add black currants and cashew nuts. Lightly stir with spatula to mix well. Transfer cooked rice to serving bowl. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Chicken Nuggets
ingredients: 400 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in cubes (3 cm), partially frozen
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place plain flour, rice flour, 1 tsp salt and ground black pepper in mixing bowl, mix 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a plate and set aside. Place breadcrumbs to another plate and place egg to a bowl.
Place chicken in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cooking oil, ½ tsp salt, steak spice and water, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer into a bowl. Take a spoonful of chicken mixture and coat it with reserved flour mixture, followed by egg, and lastly breadcrumbs. Roll into a ball and lightly press to flatten it. Place onto lined baking tray. Repeat the steps with the remaining chicken mixture.
Pour oil to a frying pan, heat up with medium fire, place nuggets and fry until golden brown. Transfer to a kitchen paper towel to absorb excess oil. Serve hot.
tips: For a less oily version, you can bake the chicken nuggets in a preheated oven (200°C) for 12 minutes, flip them over halfway through.
Serve chicken nuggets with dipping sauce of your choice.
Avoid high heat frying as breadcrumbs get burnt easily.

title: Gula Melaka Huat Kuih (Palm Sugar Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: 130 g palm sugar (gula Melaka), cut into cubes (2 cm)
steps: Place palm sugar, 110 g water and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Strain palm sugar mixture through simmering basket into a bowl and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Clean mixing bowl. Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases.

Place reserved cooled palm sugar mixture, coconut milk, self-raising flour, vegetable oil, egg and baking powder in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 5. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, boil 9 min 30 sec/Varoma/speed 1.
Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Nyonya Spice Paste
ingredients: 20 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
6 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
30 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
20 g fresh ginger, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
1 torch lily, bud only, cut in quarters (opcional)
steps: Place soaked dried chillies, red chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, lemongrass, galangal, ginger, torch lily, shrimp paste and cooking oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Start Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add sugar and salt, sauté 15 min/90°C/speed 2. Use as a base for curries (see tip) or transfer to 2 airtight jars (400 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Use as a base for a tasty curry: combine Nyonya spice paste with curry  powder, coconut milk and tamarind juice and add chicken, seafood, meat or vegetables as preferred.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Moong Dhall (Green Peas Dhall)
ingredients: 2 cm fresh ginger, cut in cubes
150 g mung beans (dhall), soaked overnight and drained
100 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
80 g onions (approx. 1 onion), cut in slices
2 heaped tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place garlic cloves, green chillies and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add ground coriander, ground cumin, ground fennel, ground turmeric and garam masala, sauté 4 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add mung beans, tomatoes, water, carrots and onions, cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add coconut milk and salt, cook 8 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve as a side dish to eat with steamed rice or as a dipping sauce for chapatis.
You can also soak the mung beans in hot water for an hour until they double in size.

title: Pau Sambal (Malaysia Burger)
ingredients: 20 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
50 g dried anchovies (ikan bilis), trimmed, rinsed
100 g yellow onions, cut into thin slices
1 cucumber (approx. 250 g), cut into thin slices
steps: Place water, sugar, yeast powder, butter and egg in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add plain flour and salt, knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough onto a pastry mat and shape into a ball. Wrap dough ball with pastry mat like a parcel and let rest for 10 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Divide dough into 20 portions (35 g each), shape into balls and let rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat and carefully fry dough balls in batches until golden brown. Drain on paper kitchen towels to absorb excess oil.
Place dried chillies, shallots and 20 g dried anchovies in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and onions, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 30 g dried anchovies, sugar, salt, tamarind paste and water, cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
To serve, halve burger buns horizontally with a serrated knife. Spread reserved sambal on bottom bun, top with cucumber slices and cover with top bun as a sandwich. Serve immediately.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Spiced Vegan Pumpkin Cauliflower Soup
ingredients: 55 g virgin olive oil, plus 2 tbsp extra for drizzling
350 g pumpkin flesh, cut in cubes (3 cm)
150 g white onions, cut in quarters
400 g vegetable stock  o 400 g water
80 g coconut milk, plus extra for drizzling
½ tsp sea salt, adjust to taste
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
5 - 6 stalks fresh chives, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place olive oil, curry powder, garam masala and chilli powder in mixing bowl, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add cauliflower, pumpkin, onions and garlic cloves, stir fry 8 min/Varoma/speed 1 until vegetables are slightly softened.
Add vegetable stock, coconut milk, honey, salt and black pepper, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and coconut milk. Garnish with chopped chives. Serve warm.

title: Authentic Meat Floss
ingredients: 300 g pork loin, cut in pieces (3 cm)
20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Preheat oven to 120°C. Place pork loin, cooking oil and light soy sauce in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add sugar, rice wine and water, cook 30 min/Varoma//speed , then mix 5 sec/speed 4. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl with spatula.
Without measuring cup, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1 until dries up. Transfer to a baking tray.
Bake for 25 minutes (120-130°C) until the mixture is dried. Let cool completely to room temperature and store in an airtight jar. Use as needed.
tips: Use as sandwich topping, filling for buns or serve as a snack.

title: White Radish Pork Rib Soup
ingredients: 400 g pork ribs (soup bone, neck bone or spiral bone), cut in pieces (4 cm)
500 g white radish, cut into slices (2 cm)
100 g yellow onions, cut into wedges
1 piece dried cuttlefish, cut into strips (2 cm)
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 pinch white pepper powder, adjust to taste
steps: Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add pork ribs to it and blanch 12 min/60°C/speed 3.5. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Rinse pork ribs under running water and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 1000 g water and reserved blanched pork ribs in mixing bowl, cook 12 min/100°C//speed .
Start Slow Cook /18 min/98°C.
Add white radish, onions, dried cuttlefish and rice wine, start Slow Cook /2 h/98°C.
Add wolfberries, salt and white pepper powder. Let stand until mixing bowl temperature drops to 70°C. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Red lentil soup with cumin
steps: Place lentils, water, salt, cumin, onions and rice into mixing bowl and cook 40 min/100°C/speed 1, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Place measuring cup back in position and cook 10 min/80°C/speed 4.
Add butter and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer into a serving bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place sunflower oil and paprika into mixing bowl and sauté 1 min/120°C/speed 1. Garnish soup with paprika flavoured oil and serve immediately.
tips: For a smoother texture, mix 5 sec/speed 6 in step 3.

title: Teochew Yam Paste with Gingko (Onee)
ingredients: 80 g gingko nuts, peeled and rinsed
600 g yam (taro roots), peeled and cut in chunks
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add gingko nuts into it, steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with spatula and set gingko nuts aside.
Add yam chunks to mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add sugar and cooking oil, blend Blend /1 min until the paste is smooth and creamy. Transfer cooked yam paste to serving bowls, garnish with reserved gingko nuts and serve hot.
tips: To deshell gingko nuts: Knock the nut shell with hammer or nut cracker until it cracks. Break open the shell,peel the thin layer of brownish skin (easier to peel after soaking in water). Use toothpick to remove the tiny green stems from the hearts of the gingko nuts to remove bitter taste.
Replace cooking oil with shallot oil and pork lard for authentic flavour.
For quicker version, purchase ready-peeled gingko nuts from retailer.

If you prefer your yam paste to be creamy, add 200 g of coconut milk into cooled yam paste and blend 10 sec/speed 3 until smooth in step 2. As coconut milk will dilute the sweetness, add sugar if needed.
You can also place yam paste into a gutted pumpkin and top with gingko nuts, steam for 30 min/Varoma/speed 2 or until the pumpkin is cooked.

title: Cornflake Crunch
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Distribute 24 small paper cups onto a baking tray out of the oven.
Place butter, honey, brown sugar and salt in mixing bowl, melt 4 min/60°C/speed 2.
Add cornflakes, almond flakes, white sesame seeds, raisins and cranberries, mix 1 min//speed . Mix evenly with aid of spatula. Scoop cornflake mixture with a spoon into paper cups.
Bake for 5 minutes (160°C). Allow to cool before serving or storing in airtight jars.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustment on the temperature to suit your oven.

title: Pork Belly Cabbage Rice
ingredients: 300 g pork belly, skinless, cut in slices (2-3 mm)
200 g cabbage, cut in chunks (4 cm)
10 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place 4 garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 2 min 30 sec/120°C/speed .
Add pork belly, stir fry 7 min 30 sec/120°C//speed 1.

Add Basmati rice, water, cabbage, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice wine, white pepper powder and 2 garlic cloves, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 15 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with chopped spring onions and serve warm.
tips: Serve with hard boiled eggs.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Baked kibbeh (kibbeh bil sanieh)
ingredients: 400 g lamb meat, finely minced  o 400 g beef, finely minced
500 g lamb fillet sinew free, cut into cubes (3 cm)  o 500 g beef tenderloin, cut into cubes (3 cm)
300 g fine bulgur wheat, rinsed with cold water and strained well (see tip)
10 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place onions and sunflower oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pine nuts, minced lamb and sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add salt, pepper and ground cinnamon and mix with spatula. Transfer into a deep bowl and set aside.
Place lamb cubes and 2 ice cubes into mixing bowl and chop 3 min/speed 6. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onions, 2 ice cubes and bulgur into mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved minced lamb, salt, ground cinnamon and mix 20 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula.
Insert measuring cup and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer into a bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a round baking dish (Ø 28 cm) and set aside.

Spread half of kibbeh mixture in prepared baking dish and lightly press with wet hands. Form a smooth and flat surface. Layer on top with reserved mince filling and cover with remaining kibbeh mixture. Score with a sharp knife for decoration and brush with remaining 10 g sunflower oil. Sprinkle with pepper and spice mix (optional).
Bake for 55 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Do not let rinsed bulgur rest for more than 30 minutes, as it will soak too much.
Serve with Yoghurt and cucumber salad.

title: Potato Gratin
ingredients: 30 g salted butter, softened at room temperature
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
1000 g Russet potatoes, cut in thin slices (3 mm)
100 g mozzarella cheese, plus extra for sprinkling
1 sprig fresh parsley, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, melt 2 min 30 sec/50°C/speed .
Add whipping cream, chicken stock, ground black pepper and salt, mix 20 sec/speed 3.

Preheat oven to 180°C. Arrange two layers of potato slices in a baking dish (30 cm x 30 cm x 5 cm), pour over half portion of cream mixture. Repeat with remaining potato slices and cream mixture. Sprinkle a handful of mozzarella cheese on top. Cover with aluminium foil.

Bake in middle rack for 1 hour 15 minutes (180 °C) or until potatoes are softened. Remove aluminium foil and sprinkle with remaining mozzarella cheese. Bake for another 10 to 15 minutes until golden and bubbly. Garnish with crushed bacon strips and parsley. Cut in portions and serve hot.

title: Beef Stew with Cauliflower Mash
ingredients: 800 g cauliflower, cut in florets (2-3 cm)
½ tsp rock salt, adjust to taste
1 tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
200 g yellow onions, cut in quarters
700 g beef chuck, cut in pieces (3 cm x 3 cm)
200 g beef stock  o vegetable stock
200 g red wine  o cranberry juice, no sugar
250 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
1 - 2 tsp rock salt, adjust to taste
2 tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
150 g button mushrooms, cut in quarters
200 g potatoes, cut in cubes (3 cm x 3 cm)
6 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, chopped (opcional)
steps: Place cauliflower and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 15 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add milk, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add salt, ground black pepper, butter and grated parmesan, blend 30 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onion and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add beef, cook 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
