Add beef stock, red wine, carrots, thyme leaves, tomato paste, bay leaves, salt, ground black pepper and flour, cook 45 min/80°C//speed . Cook again 20 min/Varoma//speed .
Add button mushrooms and potatoes, cook 20 min/Varoma//speed . Let rest for 15 minutes in mixing bowl.
Carefully remove bay leaves. Transfer stew to serving bowls and garnish with chopped parsley. Serve together with cauliflower mash.

title: Salted Fish Pork Belly
ingredients: 350 g pork belly, skinless, cut in thin slices, patted dry with kitchen towels
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
20 g salted fish, flesh only, cut in pieces
2 sprigs spring onions, cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6. Sieve through fine mesh strainer. Reserve ginger juice and pomace.
Place garlic cloves and shallots into mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and dried chillies, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pork slices and ginger juice, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. .
Add ginger pomace, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, rice wine, white pepper powder, salted fish, onions and spring onions, cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.

title: Pork Ball Soup With Cabbage
ingredients: 200 g pork shoulder loin, cut in strips (1 cm), partially frozen
400 g Chinese cabbage, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place pork strips in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cornflour, sesame oil, egg white, light soy sauce, salt and white pepper powder, knead Dough /3 min. Wet your hands, put a scoop of minced pork on your palm to roll it into a ball. Repeat this step until all pork is used and set pork balls aside.
Place cabbage, hot water, preserved vegetables, chicken stock powder, ginger and white pepper powder in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C//speed .

Without measuring cup, cook 10 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, add pork balls through the hole in the mixing bowl lid. Transfer pork balls, soup and cabbage into a soup bowl. Season with salt. Garnish with spring onion and serve hot.
tips: It is best to use pork shoulder loin with 30% fat and 70% lean meat.
You can replace Chinese cabbage with 400 g of angled luffa in step 3.
Dried mushroom cuttlefish pork balls: Place 2 dried Chinese mushrooms (soaked to soften, cut in cubes) and 10 g shredded dried cuttlefish in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 8. Continue from step 1.
Fried pork balls: Add 20 g carrots in step 1 and some chopped spring onions in step 2. Shape pork balls and place on a greased plate. Heat up a frying pan, fry over medium heat until golden brown.

title: Chwee Kuih (steamed rice cake)
ingredients: 200 g preserved radish (sweetened), rinsed and squeezed
steps: Place preserved radish and garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 80 g vegetable oil, sesame oil, dark soy sauce and sugar, sauté 15 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Grease approximately 20 heat-resistant steaming moulds and set aside.
Place rice flour, tapioca starch, 250 g water and salt into mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 4.
Add 600 g water and 20 g vegetable oil, cook 4 min/80°C/speed 4.
Transfer the mixture into individual greased moulds and distribute into Varoma dish and Varoma tray. Set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 1000 g water into mixing bowl, boil 10 min/Varoma/speed 3. Place Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma and set it aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer steamed rice cakes onto a serving plate and top with cooked preserved radish. Let it cool before serving.
tips: Best served with dried shrimp sambal.
To speed up the unmoulding process, put the hot moulds in a tray of cold water bath for about 2 minutes. To unmould, use a butter knife which is brushed with some oil to run around the inner mould.
For more intense flavour, add 4 bird’s eye chillies (chilli padi) and/or 10 g of dried shrimps in step 1.

title: Sichuan spaghetti
ingredients: 15 g fresh ginger root, sliced (2 mm)
50 g celery stalk, cut in pieces
200 g beef mince  o 200 g pork mince
½ - ¾ tsp chicken stock paste
20 - 25 g Chinese chilli oil, with fried chilli, plus extra for drizzling
spring onions, sliced (1 mm), for garnishing
steps: Place onion, ginger, garlic, carrots and celery in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add oil and sauté 4 min 10 sec/120°C/speed 0.5.
Add beef, fermented soy beans and Sichuan pepper and sauté 4 min 30 sec/120°C//speed .
Add soy sauce and rice wine and sauté without measuring cup 2 min/120°C//speed 1.

Add tomatoes, stock paste, chilli oil, sugar, tahini, salt and pepper and cook 26 min/100°C//speed 0.5. Meanwhile, towards the end of cooking time, cook spaghetti pasta in plenty of water with ½ tsp baking soda on stove, as per packet instructions. Drain cooked spaghetti through Varoma dish and transfer to a serving bowl. Pour sauce over spaghetti, garnish with peanuts and spring onions and drizzle with chilli oil and sesame oil. Serve immediately.

title: Chili non Carne
ingredients: 20 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids (vegan), broken into pieces
255 g canned kidney beans, drained (weight after draining)
steps: Place garlic and onion in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Roughly crumble tofu into mixing bowl and add oil and soy sauce and sauté 4 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place potatoes, water, tomatoes, tomato puree, salt, paprika powder, oregano, sugar, cumin and cayenne pepper to mixing bowl and cook 23 min/100°C//speed .
Add diced peppers and cook 9 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add chocolate and kidney beans, use spatula to mix carefully and cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Season to taste, transfer to 4 soup bowls or mugs, sprinkle with tofu-onion mixture, stir gently and serve with vegan bread or baguette.
tips: If the chilli is too mild, season with more cayenne pepper during step 5 to taste.

title: Strawberry White Chocolate Cheesecake
ingredients: 200 g white chocolate (pieces, callets or coins)
250 g strawberries, diced (0.5 cm x 0.5 cm), patted dry with kitchen towel, plus a few slices extra for decoration
steps: Line base of a springform cake tin (Ø 20 cm) with baking paper
Place butter and 25 g caster sugar in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add digestive biscuits, grind 10 sec/speed 10. Spread mixture into prepared cake tin. Use a spoon to press mixture down firmly to make a compact layer. Leave to chill in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place salt, heavy cream, white chocolate, gelatine powder and 100 g caster sugar in mixing bowl, melt 7 min/70°C/speed 2.
Add vanilla extract, lemon juice and cream cheese, mix 30 sec/speed 4.

Add strawberries and gently stir in with spatula. Pour cheese mixture into cake tin over biscuit base. Cover with cling film and chill in refrigerator for at least 6 hours or overnight until set. Arrange sliced strawberries on top of cheesecake to decorate as preferred. Cut in pieces and serve chilled.

title: Gai Dan Gou (Chinese Steamed Egg Sponge Cupcakes)
ingredients: 25 g vegetable oil (sunflower, corn, soybean or canola)
steps: Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases. Place caster sugar in mixing bowl, pulverise 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add eggs, mix 1 min/speed 4.
Add milk, vegetable oil, cake flour and baking powder, mix 10 sec/speed 5. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 6 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, check cupcakes with a cake tester skewer if it comes out clean when it is inserted into the centre of the cakes. Prolong steaming time by 3-5 minutes if necessary. Transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Steamed egg cakes can be stored in the freezer and reheated upon serving by gently steaming them in the Varoma for a few minutes. The steamed cakes will become soft and spongy again.
Recipe contributed by Mavis Ong.

title: Potato Buns
ingredients: 200 g Russet potatoes, cut in cubes (1 cm)
40 g butter, softened, plus extra for greasing  o 40 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place potatoes and water in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Blend 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place milk, dried yeast, sugar and egg in mixing bowl, mix 1 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2.

Add high protein flour, butter, reserved potatoes and salt, knead Dough /4 min. Transfer dough to a large bowl, cover with a damp kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Grease 2 baking trays (20 cm x 20 cm) with butter. Set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place milk, butter, vanilla extract, plain flour, cornflour, sugar, egg yolks and custard powder in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/90°C/speed 2 until thickened. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside.

Divide dough into 24 pieces, form each into a ball and place them on prepared baking tray (1.5 cm apart). Cover with damp kitchen towel and let rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). During last 10 minutes of proofing, preheat oven to 170°C. Brush dough with lightly beaten egg using pastry brush. Transfer reserved custard cream to a piping bag and pipe custard cream on dough surface in a cross pattern.
Bake for 20-25 minutes (170°C) or until golden brown colour. Remove buns from tray and allow to cool completely on a cooling rack before serving.
tips: To avoid the dough sticking to your kitchen towel while rising, you can use cling film, plastic wrap or a pastry mat instead.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
If local potatoes are used, reduce fresh milk to 100 g as they contain more water compared to Russet potatoes.
Serve remaining custard with ice cream, fruit crumble, apple strudel or use it as filling for cream puffs or pie.

title: Red Velvet Cookies
ingredients: 1 tsp white vinegar  o lemon juice
150 g white chocolate chips, plus extra 50 g for topping
steps: Place flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl, mix 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer flour mixture to a bowl and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk, place butter, caster sugar and brown sugar, whisk 1 min/speed 4. Add egg, egg yolk, food colouring, vanilla essence and vinegar, mix 1 min/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk.

Add flour mixture and white chocolate chips in mixing bowl, knead with aid of spatula Dough /30 sec. Mix well with spatula to make sure the dough is well combined if necessary. Transfer dough into a bowl and place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours until dough is firm.

Preheat oven to 175°C. Meanwhile, line a baking tray with parchment paper or silicon mat. Scoop cookie dough and shape into balls (approximately 30 g each) and place them 4 cm apart on prepared baking tray.

Gently flatten cookies to half their height. Bake cookies in preheated oven for 14 minutes (175°C). Carefully remove cookies from oven, immediately press some white chocolate chips into top of cookies. Carefully transfer cookies to a wire rack and allow to cool. Once cool, serve or store in an airtight container.

title: Vegetable paella
ingredients: 200 g mixed peppers, cut in pieces (2 cm)
200 g mixed beans, frozen (e.g. flat green beans, lima beans, navy beans)
100 g courgettes, cut in pieces (2 cm)
100 g green asparagus, cut in pieces (3 cm)
½ tsp yellow food colouring powder (paella colorant) (opcional)
1 lemon, cut in wedges, for serving
steps: Place garlic, onion and oil in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5.
Add peppers, mixed beans, courgettes, asparagus, carrots, tomatoes, salt and rosemary and sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .
Add paprika, saffron, food colouring, cayenne pepper and vegetable broth and cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Add rice, artichokes and mushrooms and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .

Transfer contents of mixing bowl to a large shallow frying pan (paella pan, Ø 35 cm). Cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes and then over low heat for a further 5 minutes. Serve immediately garnished with lemon wedges.
tips: Instead of cooking on the stove, the rice can be cooked in a preheated oven (200°C) for 10-15 minutes, covering with foil if beginning to brown too much.

title: Chicken breast with mushroom sauce and potatoes
ingredients: 300 g potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
2 chicken breast fillets, skinned (150-200 g each), cut into strips (1 cm)
½ lemon, preferably organic, grated zest and juice only
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
steps: Place water and 1 teaspoon salt in the mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position and arrange the potatoes inside. Insert tray and cover with a sheet of baking paper. Make sure that you do not cover the front slots. Arrange the slices of chicken inside.

Season the chicken fillets with lemon juice, ½ teaspoon of salt and pepper, close the Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully remove Varoma lid and check that the chicken fillets and potatoes are cooked. If necessary, close the Varoma and extend the cooking time 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Carefully remove Varoma lid, turn upside-down and place Varoma dish on top. Set aside the chicken fillets and potatoes and keep warm. Empty and dry the mixing bowl.
Place shallot into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 75 g mushrooms, white wine, soy cream and with the simmering basket in place of the measuring cup cook 5 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add remaining mushrooms, 1 heaped teaspoon grated lemon zest, nutmeg, ½ teaspoon of salt and pepper to taste and cook: 5 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Arrange the potatoes and chicken on a serving platter, add the mushroom sauce and serve.

title: Chicken with tomato sauce
ingredients: 600 g chicken meat, skinless and boneless, cut into cubes (4 cm)
200 g fresh mushrooms, cut into slices (e.g. button mushrooms) (opcional)
steps: Place onions and sunflower oil into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5, then sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken pieces, 1 pinch pepper and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed . Transfer chicken in a bowl and set aside.
Place tomato passata and tomato puree into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 5
Add vinegar, salt, cinnamon, 1 pinch pepper and mushrooms and cook 25 min/100°C//speed .
Add chicken and cook 8 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Accompany with rice or pasta.

title: Candied Almond
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar and water in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .
Add almond nuts, mix 35 sec//speed . Transfer to a serving plate.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse mixing bowl.
Cool completely before serving.

title: Stewed Pork Belly With Rose Wine
ingredients: 1000 g pork belly, with skin, cut in strips (3 cm width)
4 stalks spring onions, white part only, cut in 5 cm length
40 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
60 g Chinese rose essence wine (mei gui lu)
steps: Place pork belly and water in mixing bowl, blanch 12 min/100°C//speed . Discard water, rinse and cut pork belly in cubes (3 cm). In a bowl, place blanched pork belly, light soy sauce, first draw soy sauce, oyster sauce and mix. Marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in refrigerator. Before cooking, separate marinated pork and marinade, set aside.
Place spring onions, garlic cloves, ginger, shallots and reserved marinated pork in mixing bowl, stir fry 15 min/Varoma//speed .
Add reserved pork marinade, lump sugar and rose wine, stir fry 35 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: For softer pork belly, transfer cooked pork belly to a thermal serving bowl after step 3 and let it rest for 30 minutes before serving.
For a spicy version, add 5 dried chillies in step 3.
This dish is unique with addition of Chinese rose essence wine. The aromatic lard from the dish can be served with steamed rice, dried noodles.

title: Teochew Seafood Porridge
ingredients: 120 g long grain white rice, rinsed
150 g fish fillets, cut in slices (1 cm)
1 pinch white pepper powder, adjust to taste
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice. Add sesame oil and salt to the bowl. Mix and set aside. Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in fish fillets, squid and prawns. Add fish sauce and white pepper powder to the bowl and mix. Place seasoned fish fillets and squid on Varoma tray. Place seasoned prawns and fish balls in Varoma dish.
Place pickled cabbage, reserved rice mixture and water in mixing bowl, cook 20 min/100°C/speed .

Set Varoma into position, steam 10 min/Varoma/speed . Remove Varoma. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer steamed seafood into mixing bowl and let it stand for 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves before serving.
tips: Replace fish fillets, squid and prawns with other seafood such as clams, crabs or scallops for this recipe.

title: Nutty Passionfruit Pork Ribs
ingredients: 500 g pork spare ribs, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
5 tbsp roasted cashew nuts, coarsely crushed
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork spare ribs and sugar. Add light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, chicken stock powder, baking soda and five-spice powder and mix. Marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Place water and passionfruit pulp in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/Varoma/speed . Transfer to a fine mesh strainer and extract passionfruit juice and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 140 g reserved passionfruit mixture, reserved marinated pork spare ribs and marinade in mixing bowl, cook 25 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, mix remaining reserved passionfruit juice, cooking oil, cornflour, white rice vinegar and 3 tbsp cashew nuts in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add reserved passionfruit-vinegar mixture, stir fry 3 min/120°C//speed .
Add 2 tbsp cashew nuts and stir well with spatula. Serve hot.
tips: If you can’t find passionfruit pulp, use concentrated passionfruit or frozen passionfruit purée. Adjust the amount of sugar to taste.
To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork spare ribs and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C//speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.

title: Tikka paste
ingredients: 50 g fresh coriander, leaves and stalks
100 g fresh ginger, peeled, cut into slices (2 mm)
steps: Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds and dried red chillies into mixing bowl and toast 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Grind 1 min/speed 8.
Add fresh coriander, garlic, ginger and olive oil then blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, lemon juice, salt, dried onions, tomato purée and turmeric then cook 45 min/80°C/speed 2.
Transfer to sterilized jars, adding a little olive oil to cover the paste. Seal jars with sterilized lids and store in refrigerator until needed.
tips: Top up with a little more oil after each use so the paste stays submerged; this helps to preserve it.
To make a smaller quantity, halve the ingredients and cook for 25 minutes in step 3.

title: Aioli
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid to weigh the sunflower oil. Set aside.
Place lemon juice, 50 g of extra virgin olive oil, garlic and salt into mixing bowl and blend 3 min/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. If garlic is not totally blended, mix a further 1 min/speed 7 until the mixture has the consistency of a paste.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place mixing bowl lid and insert measuring cup. Blend 4 min/speed 3 and gradually pour the set aside oil onto mixing bowl lid without removing measuring cup. The oil will drip slowly into mixing bowl.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10 sec/speed 2.5. Pour into a sauceboat and serve immediately or refrigerate in an air-tight jar.
tips: Traditionally served with boiled or roast potatoes, arroz al caldero and fideuá. Can also be served as an accompaniment to meat, fish and/or vegetable dishes.
Traditionally served with boiled or roast potatoes, arroz al caldero and fideuá. Can also be served as an accompaniment to meat, fish and/or vegetable dishes.

title: Pumpkin, cauliflower and romanesco soup
ingredients: 30 g celery stalks, cut into pieces
30 g carrot, peeled and cut into pieces (2 cm)
2 leaves fresh sage, washed and dried  o 1 tsp dried sage leaves
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for serving
250 g pumpkin flesh, cut into pieces (1 cm)
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
100 g dried soup pasta, e.g. risoni pasta
steps: Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place celery, onion and carrots into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sage and olive oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pumpkin, cauliflower, Romanesco, water and vegetable stock, cook: 20 min/100°C//speed .
Add pasta and cook for time indicated on packet/100°C//speed .
Transfer soup to a tureen or large serving bowl, season if necessary, sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley. Add a dash of olive oil and serve immediately.

title: Kacang Botol Goreng Bercili (Stir Fried Four Angled Bean With Chilli)
ingredients: 2 fresh red chillies, deseeded, cut in 3 parts
300 g four angled beans, cut in slices (2.5 cm)
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, red chillies and dried shrimp in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add four angled beans and salt, stir fry 3 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.

title: Red Date Longan Peach Gum Dessert
ingredients: 50 g peach gum, soaked overnight, cleaned
steps: Place water, pandan leaves, dried longan and red dates in mixing bowl, cook 6 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add peach gum and lump sugar, cook 45 min/90°C/speed . Add goji berries to mixing bowl and let stand for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Nyonya Steamed Fish
ingredients: 3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
2 stalks torch ginger flowers (bunga kantan), buds only
800 g pomfret fish (1 whole fish), gutted and descaled, scored (see tips)
50 g ladies' fingers (okra) (approx 5 ladies‘ fingers), cut in pieces (2 cm)
100 g brown onions, cut in wedges
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place red chillies, tomatoes, shallots, garlic cloves, lemongrass, ginger flowers, bird's eye chillies and cooking oil in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add kesum leaves, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, mix tamarind paste and water in a small bowl. Deseed and set aside.
Add tamarind-water mixture, sugar, shrimp paste, salt and lime juice, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert a steaming tray (Ø 20 cm), weigh in fish, ladies‘ finger, onions and tomatoes. Drizzle with reserved Nyonya sauce. Close Varoma lid and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 2. Check if fish is cooked evenly, prolong cooking time if needed. Remove Varoma. Carefully open Varoma lid, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: When selecting the tray to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); ensure the size of tray is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
Scoring the thickest part of the fish with 3 bone-deep cuts, allows more of the flavour to be absorbed by the flesh and reduces steaming time.
To check whether the fish is cooked, its eye should pop out. The flesh should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks.

title: Wajik (Palm Sugar Glutinous Rice)
ingredients: 4 pandan leaves, cut in 10 cm length
500 g Thai glutinous rice, soaked for 2 hours, rinsed
350 g palm sugar, cut in chunks
steps: Place 1500 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, line with pandan leaves, weigh in glutinous rice. Drizzle 100 g water on it, close Varoma lid and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 3.5 or until translucent. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place coconut milk, palm sugar, sugar and salt in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile, line a baking tray (18 cm x 18 cm) with baking paper.

Add steamed glutinous rice, cook 7 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer cooked rice into prepared baking tray. Flatten with the back of spoon. Allow to cool completely before cutting into diamond shape. Serve immediately.
tips: There are two types of glutinous rice in the market.-: local glutinous rice requires longer cooking time. Thai glutinous rice is best for this recipe as it cooks faster with shorter soaking time.
Traditionally wajik is served by scooping a portion out using a spoon instead of cutting.

title: Chilli Stuffed Fish
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
2 torch lilies (bunga kantan), buds only, cut in halves
10 g fresh turmeric  o 10 g ground turmeric
2 tsp salt, plus extra for rubbing
6 hardtail scads (ikan cencaru), slit on back along both sides of spine
steps: Place dried chillies, red chillies, bird’s eye chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, lemongrass, onions, shrimp paste, torch lilies, galangal, turmeric and ginger in mixing bowl, blend 15 sec/speed 8-10 increasing speed gradually to speed 10 or until a thick paste is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, sauté 20 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add salt, sugar and kaffir lime leaves, stir fry 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Pat fish dry with kitchen towel and rub salt all over the fish skin. Preheat oven to 220°C. Divide chilli paste into 6 equal portions and stuff chilli paste into fish stomach and side pockets. Line a baking tray with aluminium foil, place a roasting rack on it and arrange stuffed fish on roasting rack. Bake for 15 minutes (220°C) , turn the fish over and bake for a further 5-10 minutes. Serve hot.
tips: You can also pan-fry the stuffed fish over high heat until golden brown.
For a smoother spice paste, increase blending time to 30 seconds in step 1.

title: Sesame Crème
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C.
Add white sesame seeds, black sesame seeds, cooked rice, cashew nuts and sugar, start Blend /1 min. Serve hot.

title: Dried Shrimp Sambal
ingredients: 100 g dried chillies, deseeded and soaked to soften
steps: Place cooking oil, dried shrimp, garlic cloves, shallots, dried chillies, salt and sugar in mixing bowl, grind 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Cook 45 min/120°C/ /speed 1. Serve as a condiment or pour to a jar for storage in refrigerator.
tips: For smoother and finer dried shrimp sambal, blend sambal for 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually after cooking in step 2.
Serve with steamed rice.
This sambal can be used in dishes like stir fried sambal kangkong, four-angled beans, long beans, ladies' finger etc.

title: Stewed vegetables
ingredients: 300 g courgette, with skin, cut into slices (2cm)
steps: Place red pepper, green pepper and onion into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 4. Transfer into simmering basket and set aside.
Place courgette into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4.
Add extra virgin olive oil and set aside vegetables and heat 15 min/120°C//speed .
Add crushed tomatoes, salt and pepper and heat 20 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve with white rice and accompanied by fried and scrambled eggs.
If you prefer pisto less watery, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid in step 4 to allow more evaporation and avoid any spattering.

title: Courgette side dish
ingredients: 850 g courgette, not peeled and diced (3 cm x 3 cm)
steps: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 6 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, add olive oil and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk, add courgette, salt and pepper and sauté 20 min/120°C//speed 1. Serve hot as an accompaniment for meat and fish dishes.
tips: The cooking time may vary depending on the size of the pieces of courgette.
This dish can also be used as a pasta sauce.

title: Balsamic salmon and courgette noodles
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for greasing
4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (150 g each)
steps: Grease Varoma dish with olive oil and set aside.
Place balsamic vinegar, white wine, honey, Dijon mustard, rosemary and garlic clove in mixing bowl and blend 8 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Set prepared Varoma dish in position, add salmon fillets to it and season with salt and ground pepper. Insert Varoma tray and line with baking paper. Cut courgette ends off and run through a vegetable spiralizer or use a mandolin or vegetable peeler to cut the courgettes into long thin strips like noodles. Place courgette noodles in Varoma tray and season with olive oil and lemon juice.
Cover Varoma and steam 13-15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, transfer courgette noodles to a serving dish, place salmon on top, drizzle with sauce and serve immediately.
tips: This is a very tasty way to cook vegetables. Try preparing carrots, winter radish or leeks in this way.Subsitute 4 portions of skinless chicken breast for the salmon for a tasty alternative.
This is a very tasty way to cook vegetables. Try preparing carrots, winter radish or leeks in this way.
Subsitute 4 portions of skinless chicken breast for the salmon for a tasty alternative.

title: Asparagus salad with tomatoes and goat's cheese
ingredients: 250 g green asparagus (thin stalks), ends trimmed, cut in pieces diagonally (3 cm)
50 g dried tomatoes in oil, drained (approx. 5-6 pieces)
80 g fresh goat's cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place oil, asparagus, garlic and pine nuts in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Meanwhile, cut cherry tomatoes in half.
Add sugar to mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Transfer to a serving dish and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place sundried tomatoes in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with asparagus. Add cherry tomatoes, rocket leaves and goat’s cheese and mix together. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
tips: Replace goat’s cheese with Parmesan shavings.

title: Milk pudding (mouhallabieh)
steps: Place pistachio nuts in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place mastic gum grains and sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Insert butterfly whisk, add milk, cornflour and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add rose water and blossom water and mix 5 sec/speed 3.
Pour hot mixture into individual bowls, allow to cool and refrigerate until serving. Just before serving, unmold milk puddings onto dessert plates and sprinkle with reserved chopped pistachio nuts.
tips: For extra flavour wet the serving bowls with some rose water. This procedure also prevents milk puddings from sticking to the serving bowls.
For a richer alternative, before serving pour syrup flavoured with blossom water on top of the milk puddings and then add chopped pistachio nuts.

title: Chocolate Batik Cookies
ingredients: 200 g chocolate malt powder (eg. Milo®, Ovaltine® or Vico®)
250 g biscuits (eg. Marie® biscuits), roughly crushed
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper. Set aside.
Place butter in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/60°C/speed 2.
Add chocolate malt powder and condensed milk, mix 2 min/60°C/speed 2.
Without measuring cup, mix 2 min//speed , meanwhile, add biscuits through hole in mixing bowl lid, mixing with aid of spatula.

Transfer cookies batter into prepared baking tray. Wear plastic gloves or use the back of a spoon to flatten the batter by pressing it lightly. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before cutting into pieces to serve.
tips: For stronger chocolate aroma, add ¼ tsp of instant coffee powder in step 3.

title: Dodol (Palm Sugar Glutinous Rice Sweet)
ingredients: 227 g palm sugar (gula Melaka), cut in chunks (3 cm)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place gula Melaka in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5.
Add caster sugar, 120 g water and pandan leaves, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages . Remove pandan leaves.
Add glutinous rice flour, white rice flour, coconut milk, 100 g water and salt, mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Without measuring cup, cook 60 min/120°C/speed 3.
Without measuring cup, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Without measuring cup, cook 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Without measuring cup, cook 5 min/120°C/speed 0.5.
Without measuring cup, cook 5 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, grease a baking tray (10 cm x 10 cm) with a layer of oil. Transfer to prepared baking tray and let cool completely to set.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse mixing bowl.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Cut in squares (2 cm) and serve.
tips: To get a really nice dark brown colour for your dodol, choose good quality gula Melaka which is darker in colour.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Honey Butter Biscuits
ingredients: 165 g unsalted butter, cold, cut in cubes (1 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 230ºC. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in milk. Add vinegar to it. Mix well with spatula and set aside. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Place flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 3.
Add 115 g butter, mix 15 sec/speed 3.5.
Add reserved milk mixture, knead Dough /25 sec. Place dollops of dough on prepared baking tray using an ice cream scoop or spoon. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place 50 g butter in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/60°C/speed 3. Brush dough surface with melted butter using a pastry brush. Bake on middle rack for 12 minutes (230ºC) or until lightly golden.
Add honey to mixing bowl, mix 6 min/Varoma/speed 1. When biscuits are done, remove from oven and brush immediately with honey butter glaze. Serve warm or cool.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Best served warm. If kept overnight (do not refrigerate), reheat in oven before serving.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Pulled pork with steamed buns
ingredients: 3 tsp dried instant yeast  o 30 g fresh yeast, crumbled
120 g red onion (approx.1 onion), cut into halves
110 g carrot (approx. 1 carrot), cut into quarters
80 g celery stalks (approx. 2 stalks), cut into quarters
80 g fennel bulb (approx. 1/2 bulb), trimmed and thinly sliced
2 tart apples (e.g. Granny Smith), core removed and cut into eighths
2 tsp ground smoked paprika  o 2 tsp ground sweet paprika
50 g molasses  o 50 g golden syrup
1 tbsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
salad leaves to taste, to serve
steps: Grease a large bowl, Varoma dish and Varoma tray with oil and set aside. Place water and yeast into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add flour and salt and knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Transfer dough into large oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and leave to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).

Transfer proved dough onto lightly floured work surface. Divide dough into 12 equal-sized portions, roll into balls and place into greased Varoma dish and onto Varoma tray. Set Varoma aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Cut the shoulder meat into cubes (6-7 cm), then transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place garlic and red onion into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7.
Add carrot and celery and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add fennel, apple and 40 g olive oil sauté 10 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add reserved pork shoulder meat and sauté 2 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add paprika, mustard, chilli flakes, brown sugar, vinegar, molasses, stock paste and tomato purée, then place Varoma with buns into position and steam 30 min/Varoma//speed 1.

Set Varoma with buns aside, then place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and continue to cook 40 min/80°C//speed . Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C. Transfer steamed buns onto prepared baking tray (30 x 40 cm), then brush with milk and bake for 5-10 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Transfer buns onto a wire rack and set aside.
Remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup and shred 3 sec//speed 5. Transfer pork into a large bowl and cover to keep warm.
Fill buns with shredded pork and serve warm with salad leaves on the side.
tips: Substitute the salad greens for Coleslaw in your pulled pork buns.
Serve leftover pulled pork over rice, with corn tortillas or in sandwiches the next day.
Cooked pulled pork can easily be frozen and reheated later.

title: Chicken with rice
ingredients: 400 g Egyptian rice  o 400 g short-grain rice
1000 g chicken breasts, cut into strips
50 g olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in rice. Transfer to a sieve, rinse under running water and set aside to drain.
Place into a bowl 1 tbsp Arabian spice mix, ½ tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp salt, 1 pinch pepper, mix and set aside.
Distribute chicken strips on Varoma dish and tray, coat with the reserved spice mix, drizzle with some olive oil and set aside.
Place onions and 50 g olive oil into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5 and then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add minced beef and sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer drained rice into simmering basket, add sautéed minced beef and mix with spatula.

Place water, 1 tbsp Arabic spice mix, ½ tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp salt, 1 pinch pepper, nutmeg and bay leaves into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, set Varoma into positon and steam 20-25 min/Varoma/speed 4.
Remove Varoma and set aside, mix chicken strips with spatula. Remove simmering basket and set aside. Place Varoma back into position and steam 20-25 min/Varoma/speed 4.
Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove bay leaves, add butter and flour into mixing bowl and cook 7 min/90°C/speed 4.
Transfer rice-beef mince mixture into a deep serving bowl, add chicken strips on top, pour some sauce and garnish with almonds, pine nuts and pistachio nuts. Serve remaining sauce separately.

title: Homemade Fish Ball Soup
ingredients: 500 g mackerel fish fillets, cut in pieces
2 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
2 sprigs coriander leaves, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place fish fillets in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add 1 tsp salt, white pepper powder, tapioca starch, ice cubes and 1 tsp chicken stock powder, knead Dough /5 min until the paste texture is smooth and fine. While kneading, prepare a bowl of ice water.

To make fish balls, wet your hand, put a handful of fish paste in your palm. Make a fist and squeeze the paste upward towards your thumb. Use a spoon to scoop out the paste and form a ball. Transfer it to a bowl of cold water. Repeat the step with remaining fish paste until finished and set aside the fish balls. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, add 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp chicken stock powder, boil 8 min/100°C/speed 2
Add prepared fish balls, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer fish balls to serving bowls and pour soup over it, garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.
tips: Fish balls are best made from fresh fish bought from the market on the same day.
Use only homemade ice cubes for this recipe.
The fish paste can be sticky to handle. Wet your hand when shaping the fish paste into a ball.
Use fish paste to make Yong Tau Foo, fish cake etc.
Add vegetable of your choice in the soup like tomatoes, green leaf vegetables etc.
You can also transfer the fish paste mixture into an icing bag and pipe balls or noodles for steamboats.

title: Garlic, Olive Oil and Chilli Spaghetti
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh parsley, leaves washed and dried (opcional)
steps: Place parsley in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and chilli in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g olive oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water and salt, boil 7 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add spaghetti through hole in the mixing bowl lid when the water boils. Cook time indicated on packet/100°C//speed  until “al dente”. Pour into a serving bowl, dress with the remaining olive oil, add chopped parsley and stir. Serve hot.
tips: When done, if the water has not been completely absorbed, leave in the mixing bowl for a few minutes until sauce is fully absorbed.
To make the garlic easier to digest, remove the central shoot if present.

title: Green Chillies With Pork Belly
ingredients: 250 g pork belly, skinless, cut in slices
6 fresh green chillies, deseeded, cut in slices
2 dried chillies, soaked to soften, cut in pieces
steps: Place cooking oil and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pork slices, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. .
Add fermented soy bean paste, green chillies, sugar, light soy sauce and dried chillies, stir fry 5 min/120°C/speed . Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Raw Walnut Brownies
ingredients: 150 - 180 g raw walnuts, plus extra to garnish
25 g unsweetened cocoa powder, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place walnuts in mixing bowl, crush 3 sec//speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 120 g reserved crushed walnuts, Medjool dates, black mission figs, cocoa powder and rock salt in mixing bowl, blend 15 sec/speed 10 until mixture is evenly mixed.

Add 30-60 g reserved crushed walnuts, mix 5 sec//speed 2. Transfer to a spring form pan (Ø 10 cm). Using the back of spoon, press firmly to compress the mixture until the surface is smooth. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Dust with cocoa powder and garnish with remaining walnuts. Cut in pieces. Serve cold.
tips: To improve the bioavailability of walnuts, soak walnuts overnight and dehydrate at 40°C for 24 hours in a dehydrator before step 1.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Oil Free Honey Soy Chicken Cubes
ingredients: 400 g chicken thigh fillets, cut in cubes (3-4 cm)
20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao) (opcional)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and oyster sauce. Add salt to the bowl. Mix and set aside.
Place lump sugar, shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/1 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add marinated chicken and marinade, cook 6 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add honey and rice wine, mix 30 sec/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer chicken to a serving plate. Garnish with chopped spring onion and sesame seeds. Serve hot.
tips: To thicken the sauce, remove the chicken thighs (without its sauce) from mixing bowl after step 4, cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 1. Pour the sauce onto chicken thighs and serve.

title: Yam Rice
ingredients: 150 g pork belly, skinless, cut in pieces
200 g yam (taro roots), peeled and cut in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm)
½ tsp Chinese five spice powder (opcional)
1 sprig fresh coriander, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, dried shrimp, pork belly, yam, salt and white pepper powder, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .

Add Basmati rice, water, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, salt and five spice powder. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing, start Rice Cooker . Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Crispy Roast Pork Belly
ingredients: 1200 g pork belly, with skin (13 cm x 15 cm), skin pierced with a sharp knife
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Rub pork belly except skin with 1 tbsp salt, sugar, rice wine and five-spice powder, set aside in refrigerator for at least 3 hours or overnight. Place pork belly in Varoma dish.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, preheat oven with grill function to 160°C. Remove Varoma and set aside. While pork belly is still hot, using a knife, lightly score skin in a criss-cross pattern. Using a pastry brush, brush the skin with white vinegar.

Place pork belly on aluminium foil and fold the sides up on to the meat, making sure skin is remains completely uncovered. Place pork belly with aluminium foil onto a baking dish. If necessary, place a metal spoon under pork belly to ensure the whole slab is same height. Cover the skin with remaining 2 tablespoons salt to form a layer.

Bake on middle rack for 30 minutes (160°C). Remove from oven and remove salt layer from skin. Increase temperature to 220°C. Remove pork belly from aluminium foil and place on to a cooling rack to roast. Place leftover foil or another tray underneath to catch oil drippings.

Return pork belly to oven onto, the highest rack to broil. Cook for another 15 minutes (220°C) or until skin has puffed up and become crispy. Remove pork belly from oven and let rest for at least 10 minutes before cutting into bite-sized pieces to serve.
tips: To make the cutting easier, start from the meat side and cut down to the skin.
Best served with yellow mustard and/or chilli sauce.
Chili sauce: Place 15 red chillies, 50 g garlic cloves, 50 g ginger, juice of 5 key limes and 1 tbsp sesame oil in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 8. Mix with 4 tbsp sugar and 1 tbsp salt.

title: Salted caramel slice
ingredients: 120 g unsalted butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
150 g dark chocolate, broken into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a cake tin (30 x 20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 2 min/50°C/speed 1, or until butter has melted.
Add flour, sugar and coconut and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat mixing 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer into prepared tin and press down to form a base.
Bake for 10 minutes (180°C). Set base aside to cool in tin (approx. 1 hour).
Place condensed milk, butter and golden syrup into mixing bowl and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 3, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Pour caramel filling mixture over cooled base in tin, then bake for a further 10 minutes (180°C) then set aside.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and melt 2 min 30 sec/50°C/speed 2, or until butter has melted.
Pour chocolate mixture over caramel filling, then sprinkle with salt and set aside until chocolate sets (approx. 30 minutes). Once chocolate has set, cut into slices and serve.
tips: If you are making this for children, omit the coarse salt at the end.
If you are making this for children, omit the coarse salt at the end.

title: Za'atar flat bread (mankouche)
ingredients: 500 g bread flour, plus extra for dusting
50 - 80 g za'atar or za'atar mix substitute
steps: Place water, dried yeast, sugar and olive oil into mixing bowl and mix 1 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 3.
Add bread flour, salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4 and then knead 2 min/. Transfer to a bowl and cover with cling film. Set aside to rise for 1 hour or until it doubles in size.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Divide reserved dough into 8 equal pieces. Using a rolling pin roll-out each piece on a floured surface into a circle (Ø 18 cm), pinch the edges between your fingers creating a ridged pattern all around and place on prepared baking tray.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in dried za’atar and olive oil, mix well with a spoon. Divide mixture evenly and spread it on the flat breads. Bake for 7-8 minutes (200°C) or until lightly golden. Serve warm.
tips: Top mankouche additionally with black olives, cherry tomatoes or mint leaves.

Cheese Mankouche: substitute topping with cheese topping. In step 4 place into mixing bowl 200 g Akkawi cheese and 200 g Gruyère and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Roll-out the flat breads, spread 50 g chopped cheese on each and spread evenly. Proceed as described in the recipe.

title: Wholemeal bread with green olives and za'atar
ingredients: 250 g white flour, plus extra for dusting
3 tsp za'atar, plus extra for sprinkling
60 g green olives, pitted, coarsley chopped (approx. 20 olives)
steps: Place water, oil, honey and yeast into bowl and mix 1 min/37°C/speed 3.
Add wholemeal flour, white flour, 2 eggs and salt and knead 2 min/.
Add za’atar and olives and knead 1 min/. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and divide into 3 pieces and roll each piece into a rope (approx. 40 cm x 4 cm). Join the 3 ropes at one end, plait keeping the braid tight, and join again at the other end. Place plait onto prepared baking tray, tuck pinched ends at both sides of the bread under the loaf to keep them secured, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 h). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.

Brush plait with an egg whisked with 1 tbsp water, sprinkle with za’atar and bake for 40-45 minutes (180°C) or until brown and bread sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing and serve.
tips: Make two smaller loaves by dividing the dough into two and then follow the directions in step 5. For individual bread rolls divide the dough into 10-12 pieces. Bake the two smaller breads for 30-35 minutes and bake the rolls for 15-20 minutes.

title: Coffee Candy
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.

Place 50 g water, instant coffee powder, glucose syrup, sugar, butter and salt in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages . Pour the coffee syrup onto a heat-resistant pastry mat and immediately scrape the syrup off rim of mixing bowl with spatula so that mixing bowl lid can be securely closed for the subsequent cleaning step.

Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Meanwhile, make sure the coffee mixture is still hot to avoid overcooling, cut the mixture into small cubes with a dough scraper while it is still warm. Cool and serve.

title: Chapatis
ingredients: 250 g chapati (atta) flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Grease a bowl and set aside.
Place water, olive oil, chapati flour and salt in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 3, then knead 1 min/.
Knead 1 min/, meanwhile add 3 tbsp water through hole of mixing bowl lid.

Transfer the dough on lightly floured surface, form it into a ball and place into a prepared greased bowl, cover with a damp kitchen towel and let it rest for 30 minutes. Divide the dough into 15 small balls, on a lightly floured surface, flatten and roll into round shape (Ø 20 cm) with a rolling pin, dust frequently with flour to to prevent dough from sticking to the work surface.

Heat a non-stick flat pan over medium fire, flap one chapati between your hands to remove excess flour and place in heated pan, cook until small bubbles start to form. Flip over and cook until it starts to puff up. When both sides are cooked, remove and place in a thermal serving bowl to keep warm. Serve hot.
tips: Chapatis are best served immediately after cooking with chicken kurma or dhall.
Dust your hands with flour, then flatten and roll the dough into chapati shape.
Stack and wrap remaining chapatis in aluminium foil to keep them fresh in the refrigerator. To reheat, warm wrapped chapatis together with aluminium foil 5 to 10 minutes in a hot oven at 200°C.
Use as thin crust pizza. You may chill the dough before use, add your favourite toppings before baking in preheated oven (200°C) for 20 minutes.

title: Kuih Ko Sui (Steamed Palm Sugar Rice Cake)
ingredients: 150 g palm sugar (gula Melaka), chopped in chunks (2 cm)
steps: Lightly grease 16 heat-resistant small cup moulds. Set aside.

Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert a heat-resistant bowl (max Ø 14 cm, 10 cm height - see tips), add grated fresh coconut and salt to it. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma and set the bowl aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place palm sugar, dark brown sugar, pandan leaves and 230 g water in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Remove pandan leaves.
Add rice flour, tapioca starch, alkaline water and 320 g water, cook 6 min/75°C/speed 2. Pour into greased cup moulds and distribute moulds into Varoma dish and Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, boil 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Place Varoma into position, steam 10-15 min/Varoma/speed 3 until the colour changes or until a skewer comes out clean when it is inserted in the centre. Remove Varoma and set it aside. Leave it to cool completely and remove Kuih Ko Sui from cup moulds with a skewer or toothpick. Top with reserved steamed coconut and serve.
tips: When selecting the bowl and moulds to be used in the Varoma, consider to: choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); make sure the dish size is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Ayam Goreng Kunyit (Stir Fried Chicken with Turmeric)
ingredients: 350 g whole chicken legs, boneless, cut in pieces (4 cm)
50 g carrot, cut in thin strips
100 g long beans, cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add salt and ground turmeric, mix and set aside.
Place cooking oil, garlic slices, red chilli slices and green chilli slices in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved marinated chicken, stir fry 3 min/Varoma//speed .
Add cauliflower florets, carrot and long beans, stir fry 4 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Strawberry mojito
steps: Place ice cubes into mixing bowl and crush 8 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a jug and set aside.
Place strawberries and mint leaves into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to jug with crushed ice and mix with aid of spatula.
Place limes, sugar, water and rum into mixing bowl and blend 1 sec/speed 9. Divide strawberry and crushed ice mixture evenly into 4 glasses. Add rum mixture and serve immediately.

title: Blueberry cheesecake ice cream
ingredients: 250 g cream cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl then grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolks, milk, vanilla seeds and salt then start Thicken /80°C.

Add cream and cream cheese and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.

Place blueberries, sugar and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl, allow to cool and refrigerate until needed.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of frozen ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a container.

Place remaining pieces of ice cream in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and smooth surface with spatula. Using a spoon, add 1 tbsp of blueberry sauce and carefully mix into ice cream. Repeat with remaining blueberry sauce. Freeze for approx. 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved and serve.

title: Quick coffee sorbet
steps: Place condensed milk, soluble coffee and ice cubes into mixing bowl. Grind 2 min/speed 10 while moving spatula from side to side through hole in the mixing bowl lid to ensure the ice is uniformly ground. Serve immediately.
tips: Add 50-100 g of brandy or cognac and garnish with dried nuts.
Add 50-100 g of brandy or cognac and garnish with dried nuts.

title: Oat slice
ingredients: 150 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease and line a square baking dish (21 cm) with baking paper, allowing a 2 cm overhang at each end. Set dish aside.
Place flour, oats, sugar and coconut into mixing bowl and combine 10 sec//speed 3. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place butter and golden syrup into mixing bowl and melt 2 min/60°C/speed 1, or until butter has melted.
Add baking soda and boiling water and mix 5 sec/speed 3.
Add reserved oats mixture and combine 5 sec//speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat combining 5 sec//speed 4. Transfer mixture into prepared baking dish.
Using the back of a spoon, press mixture evenly into dish, then bake for 15-30 minutes (160°C) (see tip).
Allow to cool in dish before cutting into squares and serving.
tips: The baking time in step 6 will determine the end result. For a soft and chewy slice, bake for 15 minutes; for a firmer slice bake for 20-25 minutes and; for a very firm slice bake for 30 minutes.
The baking time in step 6 will determine the end result. For a soft and chewy slice, bake for 15 minutes; for a firmer slice bake for 20-25 minutes and; for a very firm slice bake for 30 minutes.

title: Kek Sarang Semut (Honeycomb Cake)
ingredients: 100 g salted butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place butter in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/60°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, grease a square baking tray (20 cm x 20 cm) with butter and line with baking paper. Set aside.
Add liquid caramel, condensed mik, eggs, plain flour and baking soda, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer batter into prepared baking tray, cover with cling film and set aside for 40 minutes. Preheat oven to 180°C.

Bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C) or until a cake tester skewer comes out clean when it is inserted into the centre of the cake. Allow the cake to cool in tray then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Cut and serve.
tips: To make your own liquid caramel, melt 300 g caster sugar with 2 tbsp water in a medium-sized, very clean saucepan over medium-high heat. Do not stir, but occasionally swirl the saucepan, until sugar becomes fairly light golden. At this point, very carefully pour in approx 230 g hot water (it will bubble up and spatter). Stir over medium heat until all caramel is dissolved and syrup thickens slightly. Pour the syrup into a sealed jar and can be kept refrigerated for weeks.
Cool liquid caramel completely before using.
Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Replace liquid caramel with maple syrup.

title: Teochew Yam paste with gingko (Onee)
ingredients: 600 g taro (yam), peeled and cut in chunks
80 g gingko nuts, peeled and rinsed (see tips)
steps: Place yam chunks and water into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, weigh in gingko nuts, close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside.

Add sugar and cooking oil, purée 1 min/speed 6-10, increasing speed gradually until the paste is smooth and creamy. Transfer cooked yam paste into serving bowls, garnish with reserved gingko nuts and serve hot.
tips: To deshell gingko nuts: Knock the nut shell with hammer or nut cracker until it cracks. Break open the shell, peel the thin layer of brownish skin (easier to peel after soaking in water). Use toothpick to remove the tiny green stems from the hearts of the gingko nuts to remove bitter taste.
Replace cooking oil with shallot oil and pork lard for authentic flavour.
For quicker version, purchase ready-peeled gingko nuts from retailer.

If you prefer your yam paste to be creamy, add 200 g of coconut milk into cooled yam paste and blend 10 sec/speed 3 until smooth in step 2. As coconut milk will dilute the sweetness, add sugar if needed.
You can also place yam paste into a gutted pumpkin and top with gingko nuts, steam for 30 min/Varoma/speed 2 or until the pumpkin is cooked.

title: Steamed Chicken with Chilli Sauce
ingredients: 500 g whole chicken legs (approx 2 whole chicken legs), with skin, boneless
1 spring onion, cut in 4 cm length
2 dried chillies, deseeded, cut in 1 cm length
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
1 pinch white sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert a steaming dish (Ø 20 cm). Weigh in chicken, season thoroughly with salt. Top with ginger and spring onion, close Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Check if chicken is cooked, prolong cooking time if needed. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl and reserve 3 tbsp of the steaming liquid, set aside.

Place 3 tbsp reserved steaming liquid, garlic cloves, chilli oil, light soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, dried chillies, rice wine and sesame oil in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 10 until a fine smooth paste forms. Cut reserved chicken in slices (1 cm) and transfer onto a serving plate. Drizzle with blended chilli sauce and garnish with coriander leaves and sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
tips: Check doneness of the meat after steaming in step 1. Meat should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks.
For a faster version, replace homemade chilli oil with store-bought chilli oil.

When selecting the dish to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); ensure the size of dish is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Biskut Arab (Arab Shortbread Cookies)
ingredients: 50 g butter, softened at room temperature
steps: Place plain flour and icing sugar in mixing bowl, mix Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee and butter, knead Dough /1 min. Transfer dough to a bowl.

Preheat oven to 150°C. Line 4 baking trays with parchment paper. Pinch together 1 teaspoon of dough and roll into a small ball (Ø 2 cm). Place on prepared trays with a gap of 2.5 cm apart. Repeat with remaining dough and bake on middle rack for 20 minutes (150 °C) until light golden. Let cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight jar.
tips: To get light and fluffy biscuits, bake plain flour in oven for 10 minutes (160°C). Let cool completely before step 1.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Korean Egg Bread
ingredients: 80 g cheddar cheese, shredded  o 80 g mozzarella cheese, shredded
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease 2 baking tins (12.5 cm x 7.5 cm).
Place low protein flour and baking powder in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/1 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter in mixing bowl, melt 2 min/70°C/speed 1.
Add milk, 1 egg, sugar and salt, mix 30 sec/speed 3.

Add reserved flour mixture and vanilla extract, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix well. Divide batter into prepared tins. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top, crack an egg on each baking tin.
Bake for 20 minutes (200°C). Serve warm.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustment on the time and temperature to suit your oven.

title: Pineapple Chicken
ingredients: 400 g whole chicken legs, deboned and cut in bite-sized pieces
10 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
200 g fresh pineapples, cut in chunks (3 cm)
10 g fresh red chillies, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add sugar, light soy sauce, chilli sauce and dark soy sauce and mix. Marinate and set aside for at least 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and ginger, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed .
Add pineapples, reserved marinated chicken and marinade, without measuring cup, stir fry 10 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, mix cornflour and water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add red chillies and reserved cornflour mixture, without measuring cup, stir fry 1 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Adjust the amount of sugar and salt as the ripeness of pineapple may affect the flavour of the dish.
Patting dry the chicken before marinating helps to make the dish less watery.

title: Chickpea and carrot dip
ingredients: 250 g carrots, cut in pieces (2 cm)
20 g agave syrup  o 20 g honey
½ tsp freshly ground pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place oil, carrots, onions, agave syrup, cumin and coriander in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .
Insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add chickpeas, tahini, salt, pepper and lemon juice and Blend /15 sec. Season to taste and serve warm or cold.
tips: Recipes for tahini can be found on Cookidoo®.
Serve with pita, flat bread or Turkish bread.

title: Lamb stew
ingredients: 150 g onions, cut into halves (1 onion)
70 g bacon rashers, cut into pieces (3 cm)
750 g lamb meat for stew, boneless, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
¼ tsp fine salt, to taste
½ tsp black pepper, freshly ground, plus extra to taste
2 celery stalks, cut into slices (1-2 cm)
2 tbsp stock paste (meat or vegetable)  o 2 stock cubes (each for 0.5 l) (meat or vegetable)
steps: Place rosemary, thyme and sage into mixing bowl and chop 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat chopping 20 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and bacon and sauté 6 min/Varoma/speed 1, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Season lamb with salt and pepper, then add lamb to mixing bowl and cook 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add carrot and celery and cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add all remaining ingredients, including reserved chopped herbs, and cook 60 min/100°C//speed 1.
Mix contents of bowl with spatula, then cook for a further 25 min/100°C//speed 1. Serve hot (see tip).
tips: This lamb stew is best served with a side of creamy polenta and steamed vegetables.

title: Spinach turnovers (fatayer)
ingredients: 400 g fresh spinach leaves, washed and dried
steps: Place water, olive oil, salt and flour into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4, then knead 1 min/. Transfer into a bowl and cover with cling film. Set aside for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile prepare the filling.
Place 200 g spinach leaves into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer into Varoma dish and set aside.
Place remaining 200 g spinach leaves into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer into Varoma dish with reserved chopped spinach and strain well by pressing with the back of a spoon.
Place onions, salt, sumac and lemon juice into mixing bowl and chop 20 sec/speed 6. Transfer mixture to Varoma dish with spinach and mix with spatula. Set aside to drain well before assembling.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.

Divide reserved dough into 4 equal pieces and, on a lightly floured surface, shape each piece into a log. Cut each log into 8 equal pieces. With a rolling pin roll-out each piece of dough into a circle (Ø 10 cm).

Place 1 heaped tsp spinach filling in the centre of each circle. Think of each circle as having 3 sides. Lift two sides and pinch together, then lift the third side and pinch it to the loose edge to form a triangle. Pinch the edges to close the filling in. Transfer to prepared baking trays and bake for 30 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Transfer on a cooling rack and serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Rice Wine Chicken
ingredients: 1200 g kampung chicken, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
20 g dried black fungi, soaked to soften, shredded
steps: Place sesame oil and ginger in mixing bowl, sauté 8 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add chicken and black fungi, stir fry 8 min/120°C//speed .
Add rice wine, salt and lump sugar, cook 6 min/100°C//speed .
Add wolfberries, cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.

title: Steamed Pork Patty With Rice
ingredients: 1 pinch white pepper powder, for seasoning
20 g pickled cabbages (tung choy), soaked for 5 minutes
steps: Place minced pork, sugar, white pepper powder, pickled cabbages, sesame oil and water in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Divide into 4 equal portions and transfer to 4 steaming bowls. Carefully crack eggs on each bowl, season with salt and white pepper powder. Place the bowls in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice to it, set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.

Carefully open Varoma lid, insert Varoma tray, add French beans to it. Close Varoma lid and steam 3 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Scoop steamed rice onto 4 serving plates, top with steamed pork patty and French beans. Serve hot.
tips: Replace French beans with broccoli or cauliflower florets.

title: Acar (Nyonya Pickled Vegetables)
ingredients: 1000 g mixed vegetables, (e.g.. carrots, long beans, cucumbers, cabbage, pineapple, turnips), cut in strips
40 g fresh red chillies, deseeded, cut in thin slices
40 g fresh green chillies, deseeded, cut in thin slices
5 - 8 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
100 g unsalted roasted peanuts, coarsely ground, to garnish
2 tbsp sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in mixed vegetables, red chillies and green chillies. Season with 2 tsp salt and set aside for 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Place dried chillies, lemongrass, candlenuts, garlic cloves, shallots, turmeric, shrimp paste and cooking oil in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, rinse reserved vegetables and drain through Varoma dish. Transfer to a muslin cloth and squeeze out excess water. Set aside.
Add 1 tsp salt, sugar, vinegar and reserved vegetables, stir fry 4 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with roasted peanuts and sesame seeds. Serve hot or cold.

title: Cekodok Pisang (Fried Banana Balls)
steps: Place bananas in mixing bowl, mash 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add plain flour, white rice flour, brown sugar, white sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract and salt, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Preheat cooking oil in a deep fryer to 190°C (see tip).

Scoop 1 tbsp batter and drop slowly into hot oil. Fry banana balls in batches of 4-5 for 3-5 minutes until golden brown, gently stirring to prevent balls from sticking together or to the fryer. Repeat with remaining batter until finished. Serve warm.
tips: If a deep fryer is not available, heat oil in a deep saucepan, using a food thermometer to check the temperature reaches 190°C.
Recipe contributed by Ezrin.

title: Sayur Lodeh (Indonesian Vegetable Stew in Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 50 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white parts only
50 g carrot, cut in thin strips (0.5 cm x 4 cm)
100 g jicama (sengkuang), cut in thin strips (0.5 cm x 4 cm)
100 g long beans, cut in 4 cm length
50 g glass noodles, soaked to soften and drained
100 g dried bean curd sticks (fuchuk), soaked to soften
200 g firm tofu, cut in cubes (2 cm)
2 fresh red chillies, cut in slices
2 fresh green chillies, cut in slices
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, yellow onion, cumin seeds and dried shrimp, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 5 sec/speed 5 again. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemongrass, chop 4 sec//speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, carrot strips, jicama strips and salt, boil 10 min/100°C//speed .

Add coconut milk, long beans, glass noodles, bean curd sticks, tempeh, tofu cubes, red chillies, green chillies, tamarind piece and ground turmeric, cook 10 min/95°C//speed . Let stand in mixing bowl for 5 minutes before serving.
tips: You may pan-fry tempeh and firm tofu before adding in step 6.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Teochew Steamed Pomfret With Mee Hoon
ingredients: 1 - 2 pomfrets (total 500-600 g), gutted and descaled, scored at both sides (see tips)
50 g fresh ginger, cut in thin strips
1 fresh red chilli, cut in pieces (1 cm)
100 g silky tofu, cut in cubes (1 cm)
100 g salted vegetable (hum choi), cut in thin strips (0.5 cm)
3 dried Chinese mushrooms, soaked to soften, cut in thin slices (0.5 cm)
2 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped, to garnish
steps: Rub both sides of fish with salt and white pepper powder. Set aside. Arrange tomatoes in Varoma dish, place fish on top of tomatoes, add 25 g ginger, red chilli and tofu on top of the fish. Set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, without measuring cup, sauté 10 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a small bowl. Set aside.

Place mixing bowl back to position. Place water, salted vegetable, 25 g ginger, sour plums, fish sauce, mushrooms and sugar into mixing bowl, set prepared Varoma dish into position, drizzle with rice wine, close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, soak mee hoon for 10 minutes. Carefully open Varoma lid, check whether the fish is cooked (see tips). Remove Varoma and set aside.

Add reserved soaked mee hoon to mixing bowl, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer mee hoon into a serving dish, carefully place steamed fish onto mee hoon and pour in soup. Garnish with reserved garlic, spring onion and coriander. Serve hot.
tips: Scoring the thickest part of the flesh allows more of the flavour to season the fish and reduce steaming time.

Check whether the fish is cooked after steaming in step 4. Fish should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks. If it is not cooked, set Varoma dish back into position and continue steaming in step 5.

title: Pea and ginger soup, Lemon salmon with broccoli
ingredients: 1 lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (150-180 g each)
100 g leek, white part only, cut in pieces
100 g celery stalks, cut in pieces
50 - 100 g single cream, approx. 18% fat, to taste
steps: Place 30 g olive oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon zest from half the lemon and 25 g lemon juice in mixing bowl. Mix 20 sec/speed 5. Place salmon fillets in a deep dish and pour marinade from mixing bowl over the salmon. Refrigerate for 10 minutes and continue with recipe.
Place shallots, garlic clove, leek, ginger and 50 g olive oil in mixing bowl. Chop 4 sec/speed 4, then sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with baking paper.

Add celery stalks, green peas, water and 1 tsp salt to mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position, add broccoli florets to it and season them with ½ tsp salt. Insert prepared Varoma tray, arrange salmon fillets on the tray, season with ½ tsp salt and ground black pepper and drizzle with marinade. Close Varoma and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm.
Add cream to mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve soup for starter (see tip), then salmon fillets and broccoli for main course.
tips: A quick, healthy meal with bright flavours and colours, starting with a vibrant green pea soup with zingy ginger, followed by lemon-marinated salmon with steamed broccoli: this recipe can turn a weeknight dinner into a special treat.
If the celery stalks have leaves, place a few leaves on top of salmon fillets before steaming to add extra flavour.
For a milder taste omit drizzling salmon with marinade in step 3.
After serving the soup, set mixing bowl and covered Varoma back in position so the main course keeps warm while the soup is enjoyed.

title: Gluten-free focaccia bread
ingredients: 20 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing and drizzling
110 g gluten-free plain white flour mix
steps: Grease a large rectangular baking tray with olive oil and set aside.
Place almonds in mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 10.

Add cornflour, plain white flour, yeast, sugar, xantham gum, salt, water and olive oil then mix 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to prepared baking tray and spread out to the edges of tray with an oiled spatula, cover loosely with oiled cling film and leave to rise for 20 minutes in a warm place. Meanwhile preheat oven to 200°C.
Use oiled fingertips to make dimple impressions all over the dough, sprinkle with rosemary needles and coarse salt, then drizzle with olive oil.
Bake 20-30 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Leave on tray to cool then tear or slice to serve.
tips: For sticky doughs like this one where you may have a lot of dough stuck to the mixing blades after pouring it out, place mixing bowl back into position and mix 2 sec/speed 10. The remaining dough should now be easy to remove using the spatula.To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products carefully to ensure traces of wheat or gluten have not been used as part of the production process.

For sticky doughs like this one where you may have a lot of dough stuck to the mixing blades after pouring it out, place mixing bowl back into position and mix 2 sec/speed 10. The remaining dough should now be easy to remove using the spatula.
