To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products carefully to ensure traces of wheat or gluten have not been used as part of the production process.

title: Chicken casserole with saffron and orange
ingredients: 1 orange, preferably organic, zest and juice only
650 g chicken (1 whole chicken, see tip)
200 g chicken stock  o 200 g water + 1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade
steps: Place orange zest, coriander, pepper and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add orange juice and emulsify 5 sec/speed 6.
Place the chicken in a container and baste with the prepared marinade. Leave in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Turn once.
Arrange the courgettes in the Varoma tray and season with salt. Set Varoma aside.
Place onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add the olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.

Tie chicken tightly with kitchen string. Place tied chicken above the mixing knife, add any remaining marinade, white wine, saffron dissolved in a little stock, salt and chicken stock. Cook 20 min/Varoma/speed .
Turn the chicken. Place the Varoma into position with the courgettes and continue to cook 15 min/Varoma/speed .
Set Varoma aside and keep warm. Remove the meat from the mixing bowl and keep warm (see tip). Reduce the sauce 10 min/Varoma/speed 1 without measuring cup.
Cut the meat into portions and serve with steamed courgettes and the sauce.
tips: The recipe is suitable for a chicken or cockerel of 650-800 g. It is also possible to cook chicken pieces in the mixing bowl instead of a whole chicken.

If preferred, cook other vegetables in the Varoma dish and tray while the chicken is cooking (potatoes, pumpkin, broccoli etc.). To add a Middle-Eastern touch, garnish with dried fruit (pine nuts, pistachios and almonds). Serve with basmati or pilaf rice.
For a crispy version of the chicken, broil in a hot oven under the grill while you finish cooking the sauce.

title: Cabbage soup
ingredients: 40 g olive oil, plus extra for serving
400 g white cabbage, cut into strips
200 g potato, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
steps: Place garlic, onion and fennel seeds into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add the olive oil and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add water and salt, place Varoma dish into position and arrange the cabbage inside, insert tray and place the potatoes on top, close with the lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully remove Varoma lid, turn upside-down and place Varoma dish on top.
Place steamed cabbage and potatoes into mixing bowl, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add beans and cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer into a soup tureen or large serving bowl.
Serve hot sprinkled with black pepper and a dash of olive oil.

title: Japanese Adzuki Bean Mochi Buns
ingredients: 230 g fresh milk, icy cold (see tips)
100 g Thai glutinous rice, soaked for 4 hours
100 g Japanese adzuki bean paste, homemade (see tips) or store-bought
steps: Place 20 g high protein flour and 100 g icy cold milk in mixing bowl, cook 3 min/80°C/speed 3. Let stand for 10-15 minutes.
Add 130 g milk, egg yolk, sugar, salt, milk powder, 290 g high protein flour and yeast, knead Dough /4 min.

Add butter, knead Dough /1 min. Transfer dough onto pastry mat. Shape into a ball, flatten it and fold to wrap dough ball loosely into an envelope shape. Let proof in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Clean mixing bowl.
Grease a steaming plate (ø 14 cm) with oil. Place glutinous rice, caster sugar and 50 g water in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 10.
Add 35 g water, blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 10. Transfer to greased steaming plate and place in Varoma tray. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma with steaming plate into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, discard steaming liquid on mochi surface and let cool for 10 minutes. Divide mochi into 8 equal portions, cover with cling film.
Divide proofed dough ball into 8 equal portions and let rest for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 180°C.

Flatten 1 dough ball with rolling pin. Place 1 portion of mochi filling and top with 1-2 tbsp adzuki bean paste. Wrap the filling with the dough into a round shape and pinch the edges firmly to seal the bun. Place on a baking tray with seam side down. Repeat with remaining ingredients until finished. Cover with cling film and let proof until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes).
Spray buns with cold water and bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C) until golden brown. Transfer to a cooling rack and allow to cool completely before serving.
tips: Before step 1, place the milk in the freezer for 20 minutes.
To make your own adzuki bean paste, find the recipe on Cookidoo®.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Ghee Roasted Chicken
ingredients: 500 g chicken thighs, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm)
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken thighs and set aside. Place dried chillies, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black peppercorns and fennel seeds in mixing bowl, dry roast 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add garlic, ginger, tamarind paste and water, blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Blend again 1 min 30 sec/speed 9 or until smooth. Add ground turmeric, yoghurt, lemon juice and salt, mix well with spatula. Transfer the spice mixture to the bowl with reserved chicken thighs. Mix well and set aside to marinate for 30 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onion in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved chicken, cook without measuring cup 10 min/Varoma//speed .
Add curry leaves and jaggery, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl, serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Menaha Devi Perumal.

title: Coconut Jelly
ingredients: 2 pandan leaves, tied into a knot
steps: Separate coconut water and coconut flesh.
Place coconut water in mixing bowl, top up with water to 1500 g.
Add agar-agar powder, sugar and pandan leaves, cook 10 min/98°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, cut reserved coconut flesh in thin strips. Arrange coconut strips in 12 glass jars (120 g each).
Discard pandan leaves. Transfer contents of mixing bowl to prepared glass jars and let cool completely. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until set. Serve chilled.
tips: The texture of coconut jelly should be soft and wobbly.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Snowflake Crisp Nougat
ingredients: 60 g unsalted butter, cut in cubes (1 cm)
50 g milk powder, plus extra for dusting
150 g salted crackers (e.g. Ritz®), broken in pieces
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pistachios, almond nuts and cranberries. Set aside.
Place butter and marshmallow in mixing bowl, heat 10 min/100°C/speed 2 until completely melted. Meanwhile, line a baking tray (30 cm x 30 cm x 5 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Add milk powder, mix 20 sec/speed 3 until all combined. Immediately transfer nougat mixture into prepared bowl. Mix well with spatula. Add in half of cracker pieces, using spatula quickly fold in until combined. Add remaining cracker pieces and continue to fold in until combined.
Transfer nougat to prepared baking tray. Cover with another layer of baking paper and press down to approximately 2 cm thickness until firm and surface is flattened. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Unmould nougat from baking tray. Remove baking papers. Dust surface with milk powder evenly. Cut into squares (2 cm) and store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
tips: Replace dried cranberries with other dried fruit (raisin, cherry, blueberry, raspberry, strawberries etc.) and pistachio-almond mixed nuts with other nut varieties according to personal preference.
You can also use hand gloves to press the nougat mixture in step 4.

title: Frappé Coffee
ingredients: 90 g caster sugar, adjust to taste
300 g full cream milk, to taste
steps: Place sugar and granulated coffee in mixing bowl, mill 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ice and milk, blend 15 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 15 sec/speed 6. Serve immediately with whipped cream (optional) and shaved chocolate (optional).
tips: Espresso coffee: instead of granulated coffee use 2 shots of brewed espresso coffee (approx. 60 g) and add in step 2 with the milk and ice. Proceed as per recipe.

title: Steamed Chicken with Dang Gui
ingredients: 40 - 50 g fresh ginger, cut into thin slices
500 g chicken, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a small fine sieve and squeeze out juice, reserving it. Rinse mixing bowl.

Set Varoma dish into position and insert a steaming dish (Ø 20 cm). Weigh in chicken, Chinese rice wine, light soy sauce and oyster sauce. Add wolfberries, dang gui, reserved ginger juice, sesame oil, salt and red dates to the dish and mix. Remove Varoma, set aside and marinate for 1-2 hours in refrigerator.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma with chicken into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1, Carefully open Varoma lid, check if chicken is cooked evenly, prolong cooking time if needed. Serve hot.
tips: Serve hot with steamed rice.

When selecting the dish to be used in the Varoma, consider to: choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); make sure the dish size is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Tom Yum Paste
ingredients: 15 fresh red chillies, cut into halves, deseeded
50 g fresh ginger, cut into slices (0.5 cm)
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
15 dried chillies, deseeded (see tips), soaked to soften
steps: Place red chillies, garlic cloves, kaffir lime leaves, ginger, galangal, lemongrass, shallots, raw sugar, shrimp paste, coriander and torch lilies in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10.
Add dried chillies, blend 1 min/speed 10 with aid of spatula. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add cooking oil, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Add fish sauce and lime juice, cook 3 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk. Use as condiment for tom yum soup or transfer to 3 airtght jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: To peel off garlic skin, place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec//speed 5. Remove garlic skin.
To deseed the chillies, cut dried chillies in halves, place in clean and dry mixing bowl and chop 10 sec//speed 5.

To easily peel the shallots, cut the tops off the shallots. Place them in mixing bowl, fill with water to cover shallots and stir 20 sec//speed 2. Then stir again 30 sec//speed 3.5. Drain shallots and remove the skins.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Meatballs in Spanish sauce
ingredients: 500 g mixed minced meat, (250 g of beef and 250 g of pork)
20 g olive oil (to grease the tray)
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180°C.
Place carrots, garlic, parsley and breadcrumbs into mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 7.
Add eggs, milk, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 3.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add minced meat and mix 10 sec/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and add pine nuts. Finish by mixing with spatula.
Grease a baking tray. Put some olive oil on your hands, roll the meatballs into shape, dip them in the flour and place them on the baking tray.
Bake 10 minutes (180ºC) on one side and 5 minutes on the other. Remove from oven and place the meatballs into a casserole dish.
Place onion, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomato purée and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add white wine and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, salt, nutmeg, pepper, beef extract, clove and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help evaporation and avoid spattering.
Pour over the meatballs and bake 10 minutes (180°C). Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.
tips: If you prefer the sauce thinner, blend 20 sec/speed 5 at the end of step 8.
Serve with diced fried potatoes.

title: Chicken noodle soup
ingredients: 1 whole chicken (1.2-1.4 kg, fitting in Varoma dish)
150 g spring onions, trimmed and cut into pieces (approx. 3 spring onions)
150 g onion (approx. 1 onion), cut into halves
1 - 2 long red chillies, deseeded if preferred
3 - 4 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked and sliced
400 g udon noodles, rinsed and separated (see tip)
120 g carrot (approx. 1-2 carrots), cut into halves lengthways and cut into slices (1 cm)
100 - 150 g canned baby sweetcorn, drained and cut into halves
150 - 200 g broccoli, trimmed and cut into small florets
1 - 2 spring onions, trimmed and cut into thin slices, to garnish
2 - 3 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, torn, to garnish
1 tbsp ready-made fried onions, to garnish (optional) (see tip)
1 seaweed sheet (nori sheet), cut into thin strips, to garnish (optional) (see tip)
steps: Reverse Varoma lid and place Varoma dish onto it. Place chicken into Varoma dish and fill chicken cavity with lemon and onion.
Place garlic, ginger, spring onions/shallots and coriander into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add miso paste, soy sauce and mirin and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Rub garlic ginger marinade all over chicken and set Varoma aside.
Place onion and chilli into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer into simmering basket and set aside.
Place mushrooms, oil, stock paste and water into mixing bowl and insert simmering basket with onion and chilli. Place Varoma with chicken into position and steam 45 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Add eggs to Varoma dish, arranging them around the chicken, then secure Varoma lid and steam 10-15 min/Varoma/speed 1, or until chicken and eggs are cooked. Set Varoma aside and allow chicken and eggs to cool. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and discard contents.
Re-insert simmering basket, then weigh udon noodles into it and cook 1 min 30 sec/100°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, drain noodles, then divide between 4 serving bowls.

Re-insert simmering basket, then weigh carrot, corn and broccolini into it and cook 5-8 min/100°C//speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, drain vegetables, then divide between the serving bowls placing over noodles. Season broth to taste with salt, then set aside to keep warm.
Shred reserved cooled chicken meat and discard carcass. Divide shredded chicken evenly between the serving bowls.

Peel reserved cooled eggs, cut each egg into halves and add 2 halves to each serving bowl. Pour broth into serving bowls, then garnish with spring onions, coriander leaves, fried onions and nori strips (optional). Serve immediately.
tips: Miso paste is a staple of Japanese cuisine, made of fermented soybeans. It is a savory paste commonly used to give depth and flavor to soups and may also be used to make sauces and marinades. It can be found in Asian grocery stores or in the international section of general supermarkets. If you can't find miso paste, use 2 teaspoons chicken or vegetable stock paste instead.Mirin is a type of Japanese rice wine similar to sake, but with a lower alcohol content and higher sugar content. If you can’t find mirin, use 1 tablespoon dry sherry plus ½ teaspoon sugar instead.Udon noodles are a type of thick wheat flour noodles of Japanese cuisine, soft and chewy in texture. Udon can be found in Asian grocery stores or in the international section of general supermarkets. If you're cant find udon noodles, use rice or chinese noodles instead, adapting cooking time in step 7 according to the packet.Fried onions (bawang goreng in Indonesian) are most often added as a garnish to soups, noodle dishes and congee in Southeast Asian cooking. They can be found in Asian grocery stores.Seaweed sheets or nori sheets are paper-like crisp sheets of edible seaweed usually used to wrap sushi.You can find packages of it at any Asian grocery stores and regular supermarkets.

Miso paste is a staple of Japanese cuisine, made of fermented soybeans. It is a savory paste commonly used to give depth and flavor to soups and may also be used to make sauces and marinades. It can be found in Asian grocery stores or in the international section of general supermarkets. If you can't find miso paste, use 2 teaspoons chicken or vegetable stock paste instead.
Mirin is a type of Japanese rice wine similar to sake, but with a lower alcohol content and higher sugar content. If you can’t find mirin, use 1 tablespoon dry sherry plus ½ teaspoon sugar instead.

Udon noodles are a type of thick wheat flour noodles of Japanese cuisine, soft and chewy in texture. Udon can be found in Asian grocery stores or in the international section of general supermarkets. If you're cant find udon noodles, use rice or chinese noodles instead, adapting cooking time in step 7 according to the packet.
Fried onions (bawang goreng in Indonesian) are most often added as a garnish to soups, noodle dishes and congee in Southeast Asian cooking. They can be found in Asian grocery stores.
Seaweed sheets or nori sheets are paper-like crisp sheets of edible seaweed usually used to wrap sushi.You can find packages of it at any Asian grocery stores and regular supermarkets.

title: Lentil loaf
ingredients: 150 g red pepper, cut into pieces
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place rice and linseed in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, weigh lentils into simmering basket and bring to boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Cook 10 min/90°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a loaf tin (approx. 30 x 12 x 10 cm).
Add carrot, paprika and onion to mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5 with aid of spatula. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 5 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add cooked lentils, rice and linseed mixture, salt, pepper, paprika powder, curry powder, mustard and ketchup and stir 30 sec/speed 3 with aid of spatula.Transfer to the baking tin and bake 55–60 minutes (180°C). Cut into slices and serve warm or cold.
tips: Serve the lentil roast with roast potatoes and ketchup as a main meal, or alternatively on bread.

title: Beans with beef in tomato sauce (fasouliah)
ingredients: 300 g beef shoulder meat, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Soak overnight dried white beans in 700 g water with 1 tsp baking soda.
Place onions and oil into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk, add beef, salt and pepper and sauté 10 min/120°C/speed .
Remove butterfly whisk, add water and heat 10 min/100°C/speed .

Add drained and washed pre-soaked beans and tomato puree, cook 50-70 min/100°C//speed , prolong time if white beans are not soft enough (see tip). Transfer into a serving bowl and season to taste before serving.
tips: Cooking time of beans in step 6 varies depending on the quality of the beans.

title: Yoghurt and cucumber salad
ingredients: 350 g cucumbers, peeled and deseeded, cut into pieces
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
steps: Place cucumber and salt into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer cucumber into simmering basket and let drain (approx. 10 min). Press to squeeze as much water as possible and set aside.
Place garlic and salt to taste into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add reserved chopped cucumbers, Greek yoghurt and mix 20 sec//speed 2.5. Adjust seasoning to taste. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate before serving.

title: Bubur Jagung (Sweet Corn Porridge)
steps: Place 200 g sweet corn kernels in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/1 sec/1 time.
Add 50 g sweet corn kernels, cane sugar, palm sugar, coconut cream, water, sagos, salt and pandan leaves, cook 20 min/90°C/speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: You can also add 1 tbsp of rinsed small sago and 100 g water in step 2.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Foochow Nourishing Chicken Soup
ingredients: 8 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, squeezed
750 g kampung chicken, cut in chunks (5 cm)
55 g Foochow glutinous red wine, plus 1 tbsp for cooking
steps: Place sesame oil, ginger and mushrooms in mixing bowl, sauté 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add kampung chicken, water, honey date, red dates and 15 g glutinous red wine, start Slow Cook /45 min/95°C.
Add remaining 40 g glutinous red wine, wolfberries and salt. Let it stand until mixing bowl temperature drops to 70°C. Serve warm.
tips: For lighter version, remove chicken skin and trim all fat before step 1.
Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Japanese toasted sesame salad dressing
steps: Place white sesame seeds and roasted peanuts into mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, stir fry 3 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add light soy sauce, icing sugar, sesame oil, water, garlic cloves, black vinegar and rice vinegar, blend 20 sec/speed 6-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve immediately or pour into a jar for storage in refrigerator.
tips: Prolong 10 seconds in step 3 for smoother texture.
Can be served as a condiment or as a sauce for Japanese cold noodles.
If you can’t find black vinegar, replace with balsamic vinegar, adjusting amount to taste.

title: Spring onion pork ribs
ingredients: 600 g pork spare ribs, cut into 10 cm pieces (approx. 12 pcs)
1000 g spring onions, cut into pieces (5 cm)
spring onion, cut in thin strips, for garnishing
steps: Place brown slab sugar into mixing bowl, grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add oil, heat 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add pork spare ribs, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and water, cook 5 min/Varoma/speed .
Add 330g spring onions, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed .
Add 330g spring onions, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed .
Add remaining spring onions, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed . Transfer into a bowl and garnish with reserved spring onions. Serve immediately.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, before cooking place pork spare ribs and 600 g water into mixing bowl, blanch 30 min/45°C//speed . This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.

title: Chai Buey
ingredients: 10 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
350 g fresh tomatoes, cut in quarters
750 g Chinese mustard greens (head mustard), trimmed
20 g chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
400 g roasted pork, cut in cubes (2 cm)
steps: Place garlic cloves, ginger, tomatoes, dried chillies, tamarind pieces, cooking oil and 500 g mustard green in mixing bowl, sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .
Add water, remaining 250 g mustard greens, chicken stock powder, sugar and roasted pork, start Slow Cook /1 h 30 min/95°C. Serve hot.
tips: Replace roasted pork with roasted duck.
Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Kuih Ketayap (Crêpes With Sweet Coconut Filling)
ingredients: 6 pandan leaves, cut in strips (2.5 cm)
steps: Place water and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10.
Add plain flour, cornflour, salt, coconut oil and egg, mix 30 sec/speed 4.

Grease and heat a non-stick flat pan over medium fire. Once pan is hot, pour ¾ measuring cup batter onto the pan, swirl to completely cover the bottom of the pan. When the crêpe is cooked, transfer to a plate. Divide sweet coconut filling into 10 equal portions. Place 1 portion sweet coconut filling onto centre of crêpe, form it into a log shape. Pull the bottom (the part closest to you) of the crêpe up and over the filling, tucking it under a little bit to pull the filling closer together. Gently pull the left side of the wrapper over the middle, and then the right, to close up the ends of the roll. Continue rolling until you reached the end. Repeat with remaining batter and filling. Serve immediately.

title: Teriyaki Chicken Rice Balls
ingredients: 200 g skinless chicken thigh fillets, cut in cubes (1 cm)
1 pinch white pepper powder, adjust to taste
steps: Set Varoma dish into position, insert a steaming rack. Top with a steaming plate (Ø 14 cm), weigh in chicken. Add teriyaki marinade, light soy sauce and cornflour to the plate and mix. Remove Varoma dish and set aside for 10 minutes.

Line Varoma tray with parchment paper that is enough to cover 2 cm of the sides of the tray. Grease with oil. Mix eggs, salt and white pepper powder in a small bowl. Insert Varoma tray and pour egg mixture onto prepared Varoma tray.

Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice to it, set Varoma into position, steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer cooked rice to a thermal serving bowl, add vinegar and mix with spatula. Peel off parchment paper and cut steamed egg in small pieces. Add furikake, prawn roe, chicken cubes and egg pieces into rice and mix well.

Place 2 tbsp rice mixture on cling film (15 cm x 15 cm) and lift up the edges, twist and form into a ball shape. Unwrap and place the rice ball on a serving plate. Repeat the steps for the remaining rice mixture. Garnish with prawn roe and serve.
tips: Replace furikake with 2 tbsp of toasted seaweed and 2 tbsp of toasted sesame seeds.

title: Sous-Vide Salmon
ingredients: 2 fresh salmon fillets, boneless and skinless (approx. 150 g each, 3 cm thickness)
½ tsp ground black pepper, to season
30 g lemon juice (approx. ½ lemon)  o 1 level tsp ascorbic acid powder
1 sprig spring onion, trimmed and cut in thin slices, for garnishing
steps: Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towel. Season each salmon fillet with ½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper and top each fillet wtih 1 bay leaf and 1 slice of lemon. Place salmon fillets into 2 Sous-Vide bag (18 cm x 16.5 cm (see tips)). Seal using a vacuum sealer as per manufacturer’s instructions (see tips).

Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket. Place sealed bags into simmering basket. Add more water if necessary to fully submerge bags (not higher than 2L maximum fill level). Remove bags from simmering basket and set aside. Add lemon juice to mixing bowl and warm up Sous-vide /15 min/55°C.

Place sealed bags, side by side, in mixing bowl ensuring bags are completely covered with water, then start Sous-vide /40 min/55°C. Carefully remove bags using tongs. Remove salmon from bags and discard bay leaves and lemon slices. Garnish with spring onion and serve warm.
tips: Fish for Sous-Vide recipes must be of sashimi quality i.e. suitable for eating raw, or must have been frozen at a minimum of –20 °C for at least 24 hours. We recommend buying frozen fish for Sous-Vide cooking.
We recommend using high-quality zipper-lock bags. Look for bags made without BPA (Bisphenol A). They are widely available from major retailers. Polythene bags are not suitable for cooking food.

To avoid the possibility of oxidation on the mixing knife, the juice of half a squeezed lemon or a level teaspoon of vitamin C/ascorbic acid must be added to the water. The amount of water depends on the volume of the bag. Add more water if necessary to fully submerge the bag, and not higher than the maximum fill level.

title: Pancake muffins with banana and chocolate
ingredients: 40 g butter, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
130 g flour, plus extra for flouring
40 g banana, cut in small pieces
steps: Grease and flour 4 heat-resistant glass jars (Ø 7 cm, height 4-5 cm). Distribute chocolate chips and banana evenly between jars and set aside.

Place eggs, sugar, butter, milk, vanilla extract, flour and baking powder in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Using spatula, scrape down and stir in any remaining flour on sides of mixing bowl. Divide batter between prepared glass jars and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish in position and place heat-resistant glass jars inside, close Varoma and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, dust muffins with icing sugar and serve warm.
tips: Replace banana with berries of your choice.
Top pancake muffins with fresh fruit of your choice.

title: Miso carbonara udon
ingredients: 40 g pecorino cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)  o 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
30 g spring onions, white and green part, cut in pieces, plus extra to garnish
150 g bacon cubes (2 cm)  o 150 g guanciale, cut in pieces (2 cm)
steps: Place pecorino cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and spring onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add bacon and oil and sauté 4 min/120°C//speed 0.5. Transfer to a serving bowl and set aside.

Place grated cheese, egg, egg yolks, miso paste, milk and pepper in mixing bowl and heat 15 min/65°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, cook udon noodles as per instructions on packet and transfer to serving bowl. Add miso carbonara sauce to serving bowl and mix well. Garnish with sesame seeds, spring onions and chilli flakes. Serve immediately.

title: Moroccan harira and chicken soup
ingredients: 10 stalks fresh coriander, cut in pieces
1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
1 ½ - 2 tsp ground coriander, to taste
2 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 2 chicken stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
4 chicken thighs, skinless, boneless (approx. 400 g), cut in pieces (2 cm)  o 400 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in pieces (2 cm)
steps: Place coriander in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and remove 1 tsp chopped coriander and set aside for garnish.
Place leeks, celery and carrots in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 3.
Add olive oil, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, ground turmeric and harissa paste and sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .

Add water, chopped tomatoes, green lentils, chicken stock paste, caster sugar and reserved chopped coriander, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add lemon juice and chicken, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 15 min/100°C//speed 0.5. Meanwhile, toast bread slices. Serve Moroccan harira hot drizzled with olive oil and garnished with reserved chopped coriander and plain yoghurt, with toasted white bread.
tips: Green lentils vary in cooking times, the lentils used here have 35 minutes cooking time, but the lentils that you use may have a shorter cooking time.
Serve the soup with humus.
Omit the chicken for a vegetarian option.

title: Apricot amaretti
ingredients: 100 g mixed nuts, whole (e.g. pistachios, almonds and hazelnuts)
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and pulverise 30 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place almonds in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 7.
Add apricots, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Rinse mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg white, salt and honey in mixing bowl and whisk until stiff 2 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk
Add almond and apricot mixture, nuts and 150 g icing sugar and stir 20 sec/speed 2.

With wet hands, shape 24 little balls (Ø approx. 3 cm), roll in remaining icing sugar and place on baking tray approx. 1 cm apart. Let the amaretti rest for 10-15 minutes to let the surface dry. Bake for 6-10 minutes (190°C), allow to cool and store cool and dry in jars.

title: Avocado mayonnaise
ingredients: 240 g avocado, ripe, flesh only (approx. 1 avocado)
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid, weigh sunflower oil into jug and set aside.

Place avocado, egg, lime zest, lime juice, mustard, salt and pepper into mixing bowl, emulsify 2 min 30 sec/speed 4 while slowly pouring reserved sunflower oil onto the mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion.
Season avocado mayonnaise to taste, transfer to a bowl and chill until served.
tips: For best results, all ingredients and the mixing bowl should be at room temperature.Only use ripe, soft avocados to avoid lumpy mayonnaise.To fix mayonnaise that will not thicken or is too runny: transfer mayonnaise to a bowl. Add 1 further egg to mixing bowl, emulsify again 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 by slowly pouring the liquid mayonnaise onto the mixing bowl lid and allowing it to drizzle down onto the rotating blades.
For best results, all ingredients and the mixing bowl should be at room temperature.
Only use ripe, soft avocados to avoid lumpy mayonnaise.

To fix mayonnaise that will not thicken or is too runny: transfer mayonnaise to a bowl. Add 1 further egg to mixing bowl, emulsify again 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 by slowly pouring the liquid mayonnaise onto the mixing bowl lid and allowing it to drizzle down onto the rotating blades.

title: Vegan bean burger
ingredients: 6 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
265 g canned kidney beans, drained (weight after draining)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place parsley and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add onion and oat flakes and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula again.
Add beans, sambal oelek, mustard, salt and pepper and chop coarsely 5 sec//speed 4 so beans split open, transfer to a bowl and leave to steep for 1 hour.
Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan. Shape bean mixture into 4 equally-sized patties (Ø approx. 10 cm). Fry bean burgers for approx. 3–4 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot (see tip).
tips: Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. ketchup or mustard on two roll halves, place bean burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, sliced gherkin and beetroot to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.

Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. ketchup or mustard on two roll halves, place bean burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, sliced gherkin and beetroot to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.

title: Lentil puree (moujadarra)
ingredients: 40 g sunflower oil, plus extra for frying
50 g Egyptian rice, rinsed  o 50 g short-grain rice, rinsed
steps: Place 200 g onions and 40 g sunflower oil into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5, then sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place lentils, 1500 g water, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and cook 40 min/Varoma/speed 1.5.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add remaining 100 g water, rice, olive oil, and reserved sautéed onions and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.5.

Adjust seasoning to taste and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.5, meanwhile heat oil in a frying pan, slice 200 g onions lengthwise and fry them until golden brown. Drain the onion on paper towels. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer lentil puree into a serving bowl and garnish with fried onions before serving.
tips: Serve Lentil puree with a salad and bread on the side.

title: Crêpes with herbs
ingredients: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
10 sprigs fresh mint, leaves only, washed and dried
10 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves only, washed and dried
10 g spring onions, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place mint leaves, parsley leaves and spring onions into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add ground Parmesan, eggs, olive oil, milk, flour, salt and black pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 5. The batter should have the consistency of liquid cream. If it seems too thick, add a little milk and combine using spatula. Refrigerate and allow batter to rest for at least 20 minutes before using.

Lightly grease a non-stick frying pan with sunflower oil and heat on medium heat. Pour in a ladle of batter, twirling the pan as you pour to cover base of pan completely. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until edges of crêpe are light golden. Turn crêpe over and cook for a further 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve warm.
tips: Crêpes can be served with various fillings (e.g. butter, yogurt and a sprinkle of sumac or sour cream and salmon).

Crêpes can be frozen for later use. Place a piece of baking paper or cling film between each crêpe before freezing so they can be easily defrosted. After defrosting, wrap crêpes in aluminium foil and warm in a preheated oven (150ºC) for 5-10 minutes.

title: Aligot (Cheesy Mashed Potato)
ingredients: 500 g Russet potatoes, cut in chunks (3 cm)
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place potatoes and milk in mixing bowl, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to avoid splashing and cook 20 min/98°C/speed 1.
Remove butterfly whisk. Add butter, salt, ground black pepper, Emmental cheese, Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese, mash 1 min/100°C/speed 3. Serve hot.
tips: Aligot is a dish made from cheese blended into mashed potatoes that is made in central region in France. The dish is known for its smooth and elastic texture. Today, it is enjoyed for village gatherings and celebrations.

title: Tom Ga Khai (Thai Coconut Milk Chicken), Steamed Clams With Garlic And Thai Curry Fish Custard
ingredients: 1 banana leaf (20 cm x 30 cm), blanched
200 g fish fillets, cut in thin slices (3 mm)
150 g fresh prawn flesh, cut in 1 cm pieces
10 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
20 kaffir lime leaves, shredded, plus extra for garnishing
½ torch lily (bunga kantan), bud only
50 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in slices
3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, bruised
400 g skinless chicken thigh fillets, cut in cubes (2 cm)
200 g fresh oyster mushrooms, tear in bite-sized pieces
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
1 fresh red chilli, cut in thin strips, , to garnish (refer to step 6)
kaffir lime leaves, shredded, to garnish
steps: Line a square baking tray (15 cm x 15 cm) with banana leaf and 10 betel leaves (shiny-side down). Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in fish fillets, prawn flesh and squid rings. Add white pepper powder to the bowl and mix. Transfer to lined baking tray.

Place red chillies, dried chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, galangal, lemongrass, shrimp paste, candlenuts and coconut milk in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add eggs, kaffir lime leaves, ground turmeric, rice flour, tapioca starch, fish sauce and sugar, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to lined baking tray. Insert in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.

Place an oval-shaped steaming dish (Ø 20 cm) onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cabbage and clams. Place lemon juice, torch lily, bird’s eye chillies, red chilli, garlic cloves, coriander leaves, sugar, fish sauce, salt and water into mixing bowl, blend 6 sec/speed 8. Transfer to prepare steaming dish and place on Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water, galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves and bird’s eye chillies in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, cook 18 min/Varoma/speed . Carefully open Varoma lid, check if fish custard and clams are cooked evenly, discard any clam that haven’t opened, prolong cooking time if needed. Remove Varoma and set aside to serve.

Add chicken, fish sauce, sugar, coconut milk, oyster mushrooms, tomatoes and lemon juice to mixing bowl, cook 10 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer tom ga khai to a serving bowl. Garnish with coriander leaves. Garnish fish custard with chilli strips and shredded kaffir lime leaves. Serve hot.
tips: You can also prepare fish custard into individual parcel. Take a banana leaf (cut into 20 cm x 23 cm). Put some fish slices, squid rings and prawns on it. Spoon 2 tbsp spice mixture on it. Then fold into a packet and secure with staple pins.

Check whether the clams are cooked after steaming in step 5. Clams should be enough to open up their shells. If they are not opened, set Varoma dish back into position and continue steaming in step 6.

title: Caribbean stew and Steamed rice cups
ingredients: 800 g lamb shoulder meat, boneless (see variation), cut in pieces (3-4 cm),  o 800 g boneless stewing lamb, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g orange juice, freshly squeezed (1 orange)
20 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed (½ lemon)
180 g celery stalks, cut in pieces
2 fresh bay leaves  o 1 dried bay leaf
20 g raw cane sugar  o 20 g brown sugar
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh lamb, orange juice, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce into it and set aside. Place garlic cloves, onions, celery, coriander, oregano, bay leaves and cayenne pepper in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with meat and stir to coat meat, then cover and allow to marinate 8-24 hours in refrigerator.
After marinating lamb, place oil and raw cane sugar in mixing bowl and cook 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomato purée and cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1, then add reserved meat and marinade, salt and water. Set Varoma dish in position.

Arrange 4 heat-resistant tea cups or small mugs (Ø 8 cm, height 9 cm) in Varoma dish. Place in each cup 40 g rice, 100 g water, 1 pinch salt and 1 tsp oil. Close Varoma and cook 35 min/Varoma//speed . To serve, invert one rice cup on each plate, giving a firm shake downwards to unmould the rice, and serve hot with the Caribbean stew.
tips: The rich flavours of this lamb stew are enhanced by the overnight marinade with citrus juices, spices and herbs. Steaming rice in cups above the stew allows you to save time and also to present the rice in an elegant moulded shape. The original Caribbean recipe, a classic from the Dominican Republic, is traditionally made with goat meat - try ordering goat at your butcher’s for a slightly more gamey flavour in the stew.
For a more traditional, richer flavour, use bone-in meat, increasing the amount of meat to 1000 g.

Caribbean goat meat stew: replace lamb meat with 1000 g bone-in goat shoulder, cut in 5-6 cm pieces. In step 4, cook the stew 90 min/95°C//speed  before setting the covered Varoma with rice cups on mixing bowl lid – then cook a further 30 min/Varoma//speed .

title: Chicken with almonds and raisins
ingredients: 300 g plum tomatoes, peeled (see tip)  o 300 g canned whole tomatoes, drained
1 whole chicken (approx. 750 g), cut in bite-size pieces
½ tsp yellow food colouring powder (paella colorant) (opcional)
2 tsp mixed spices (cumin, paprika, coriander, nutmeg, ginger, cinnamon)
steps: Place oil and raisins in mixing bowl and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed .
Add the almonds and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed . Transfer almonds and raisins to a sieve placed over a bowl to drain the oil and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, tomatoes and reserved oil in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 4, then sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken, food colouring, mixed spices, salt and pepper and cook 10 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved almonds and raisins, stir using spatula to combine and transfer to a bowl. Keep warm.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh couscous into it. Set aside.
Place water, oil and salt in mixing bowl and heat 7 min/100°C/speed 1. Pour over reserved couscous and stir using spatula. Leave to stand for 5 minutes and serve warm with chicken.
tips: This Moroccan-inspired dish is popular in Melilla, a Spanish autonomous city located on the northwest coast of Africa, sharing a border with Morocco.

To peel tomatoes: boil a pot of water and cut an "X" on the bottom of each tomato. Use a slotted spoon to plunge tomatoes into boiling water for 30-60 seconds. Remove tomatoes and immediately place in ice water. Once cool, use a paring knife to pull off skins starting at the "X".
Instead of a whole chicken, use only chicken breasts or thighs (the upper part of the chicken leg), and reduce cooking time to 6 minutes in step 4.

title: Potato gnocchi
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, in chunks (3 cm)
800 g floury potatoes, peeled and sliced
250 - 300 g flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set side.
Pour water into the mixing bowl and place Varoma in position. Arrange the sliced potatoes into Varoma dish, close Varoma lid and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and keep hot.
Remove water from the mixing bowl, add 50 g of flour and potatoes. Blend 20 sec/speed 5.
Add the rest of the flour, egg, grated Parmesan and salt. Knead 20 sec/speed 3.
Tip the mixture onto a floured pastry board, dust hands with flour, and shape the mixture into a ball.

Take small pieces of the mixture and roll on the pastry board to make rolls of pasta with a diameter of 2 cm. Cut pieces of 1.5 cm, which will become the gnocchi. Roll the gnocchi quickly off the prongs of a fork, one by one, to dent the centre and create their famous ribbed decoration.
Cook the gnocchi in salted water, until they rise to surface, then drain with a slotted spoon, and place into Varoma dish. Serve hot with preferred condiment.
tips: Floury potatoes like King Edwards are best for gnocchi, and the amount of flour needed will vary depending on the type of potatoes used.Dress in a serving dish with tomato sauce or butter melted with sage and grated Parmesan, or with another favourite condiment.
Floury potatoes like King Edwards are best for gnocchi, and the amount of flour needed will vary depending on the type of potatoes used.
Dress in a serving dish with tomato sauce or butter melted with sage and grated Parmesan, or with another favourite condiment.

Green gnocchi: use only 600 g of potatoes and add 200 g of spinach or cooked, well-drained greens. After step 1, blend the spinach for 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and continue as described in step 2, increasing the amount of flour to 400 g.Pumpkin gnocchi: use only 500 g of potatoes and add 300 g of baked or steamed pumpkin. After step 1, blend the pumpkin for 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and continue as described in step 2, increasing the amount of flour to 400 g.

Green gnocchi: use only 600 g of potatoes and add 200 g of spinach or cooked, well-drained greens. After step 1, blend the spinach for 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and continue as described in step 2, increasing the amount of flour to 400 g.

Pumpkin gnocchi: use only 500 g of potatoes and add 300 g of baked or steamed pumpkin. After step 1, blend the pumpkin for 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and continue as described in step 2, increasing the amount of flour to 400 g.

title: Koshari stew
ingredients: 1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
½ tsp dried chilli flakes, adjust to taste
80 g short dried pasta (e.g. elbow macaroni)
50 g cooked chickpeas, rinsed (weight after draining) (opcional)  o 50 g canned chickpeas, rinsed (weight after draining) (opcional)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice, lentils, 300 g water and set aside to soak.
Place onions, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add crushed tomatoes, remaining 800 g water, vinegar, stock paste, cumin, chili flakes, salt, pepper and mix with spatula.
Drain rice and lentils through simmering basket and insert simmering basket carefully to avoid spilling tomato sauce. Mix well with spatula and cook 16 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Add pasta and chick peas to simmering basket. Mix with spatula and cook 13 min/Varoma/speed 4. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and transfer rice mixture into a deep serving bowl, pour over some tomato sauce and mix gently with a fork.
Pour remaining tomato sauce into a jug and serve with Koshari stew. Serve hot.
tips: If sauce needs thickening, at the end of step 6 reduce by steaming further 5 min/Varoma/speed 2 without measuring cup and place simmering basket onto the mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing.
Serve Koshari stew with finely sliced deep fried onions on top.

title: Kaya Kok (Kaya Puffs)
ingredients: 125 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
80 g butter, cold  o 80 g margarine, cold
175 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
40 g butter, cold  o 40 g margarine, cold
220 g kaya, homemade or store-bought, chilled
steps: Place plain flour and butter in mixing bowl, knead Dough /1 min. Transfer to lightly floured surface. Divide into 12 equal portions. Cover with cling film and set aside.
Place plain flour, salt, icing sugar, butter and 85 g water in mixing bowl, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer to lightly floured surface. Divide into 12 equal portions.

Using a rolling pin, flatten 1 portion of water dough to 2 mm thickness, top with 1 portion of oil dough, wrap the oil dough with water dough and shape into a ball. Repeat for remaining dough balls until finished.
Roll out a dough ball into oblong shape, then roll it up to form a log shape. Repeat for remaining dough balls. Cover the rolled dough logs with cling film, and set aside to rest for 10 minutes.

Flatten dough logs into oblong shape with rolling pin to 2 mm thickness, place 1 tablespoon of kaya in the centre and fold dough in half to form a crescent, pleat the edges to seal. Repeat for remaining dough logs and kaya until finished. Preheat oven to 200°C.
Line a baking tray with baking paper. Arrange kaya kok on baking tray. Whisk together egg yolk and 10 g water in a small bowl. Using a pastry brush, lightly brush dough surface with egg mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes (200°C) until golden brown. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
tips: Cold kaya is more solid and easier to work with.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Prawn Paste Stuffed Soft Tofu
ingredients: 60 g fresh prawn flesh, pat-dried with kitchen towel
2 pieces water chestnuts, cut in cubes
steps: Cut the tofu into 6 slices (2 cm each) and set aside.
Place prawns in mixing bowl, chop 7 sec/speed 4.
Add minced pork, salt and water chestnut cubes, mix 10 sec//speed 2.
Add egg whites and tapioca starch, mix 20 sec//speed 2.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Using a spoon, scoop out some tofu from each tofu piece and fill with prawn paste. Place in a steaming bowl. Repeat this step until all ingredients are used. Place steaming bowl with tofu in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma//speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.

Place cooking oil, cornflour, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, dark soy sauce and chicken broth in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/100°C//speed 1 until the sauce has thickened. Drizzle over steamed tofu, serve immediately.

title: Quick Steamed Buns (Mantao)
ingredients: 20 g vegetable oil (corn oil or sunflower oil)  o 20 g cooking oil
250 g medium protein flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place 130 g water, sugar, dried yeast and oil in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add flour and salt, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to lightly floured surface, flatten with a rolling pin into thin sheet and roll up with hands. Divide dough into 10 pieces with spatula and form each dough into mantao shape. Place mantao shape dough onto lightly greased Varoma dish and tray, cover with Varoma lid and allow them to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes or until dough doubles its original size.
Place 600 g water in mixing bowl, place closed Varoma into position and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve warm.
tips: For best result, use specific dumpling flour (eg. Bluekey® Pau flour)
Avoid adding sugar onto blades and drizzle olive oil over knife blades to help kneading.
Wholemeal steamed buns: Replace 250 g of medium protein flour with 200 g of medium protein flour and 50 g of wholemeal flour in step 2.
Fruity steamed buns: Add 100 g of dried fruit, for example, raisins, cranberries or wolfberries, in step 2.

title: Malabar Prawn Curry
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawn flesh. Add chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, turmeric powder and ½ tsp salt to it. Mix well and let it marinate for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Place coconut oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add curry leaves and green chillies, sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved prawns, coconut milk and ½ tsp salt, cook 6 min/98°C//speed . Serve hot with white rice.
tips: Refer to Cookidoo®  to make your own ginger garlic paste.
Recipe contributed by Hemy Nadarajah.

title: Swedish carrot slice
ingredients: 250 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease baking tray.
Place walnuts into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5 and transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Place carrots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5 and transfer to bowl with walnuts.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place brown and white sugar, eggs and oil into mixing bowl and whisk 2 min/speed 3 until creamy. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add chopped nuts and carrots and stir 20 sec/speed 4.

Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon and mix well 40 sec/speed 5 with aid of spatula. Transfer mixture onto baking tray and bake 35-40 minutes (180°C). Allow cake to cool for at least 1 hour and cut into slices. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add cream cheese and lemon juice and mix 15 sec/speed 3. Apply icing to cake, spreading smoothly and serve.
tips: This cake is very moist; it tastes best when well infused.
This cake is very moist; it tastes best when well infused.

title: Gochujang seafood risotto
ingredients: 300 g mussels, fresh, cleaned, in shells
150 g fish fillets, boneless, skinless, cut in pieces (3 cm x 3 cm)
150 g fresh shiitake mushrooms, sliced (5 mm)
320 g risotto rice, e.g. Baldo, Carnaroli, Arborio
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in 10 g gochujang paste and sesame oil. Stir well and set aside.
Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 20 g olive oil, mascarpone and 20 g gochujang paste then blend 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer cheese and gochujang mixture to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place 600 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position and weigh in mussels. Insert Varoma tray and weigh in shrimps, fish fillets and shiitake mushrooms. Using a pastry brush, spread gochujang sesame mixture over shrimps, fish fillets and shiitake mushrooms. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully remove Varoma, set aside and keep warm. Empty mixing bowl.
Place shallot in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 30 g olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add rice and sauté without measuring cup 3 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add white wine and cook without measuring cup 1 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add 750 g water and vegetable stock paste. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl thoroughly using spatula to loosen rice. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 14 min/100°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, remove mussels from their shells, reserving 8 mussels in shells for garnishing.

Once risotto is cooked, transfer to a large bowl, add reserved cheese and gochujang mixture, mussels, half of steamed shrimps, steamed fish and mushrooms. Fold gently using spatula and combine well. Divide risotto between 4 serving bowls, top with reserved mussels in shells and remaining steamed shrimp. Sprinkle with toasted black sesame seeds and serve immediately.
tips: Gochujang paste is a savoury, sweet, and spicy fermented condiment popular in Korean cooking.
Gochujang paste, sesame oil and toasted sesame seeds can be found in Asian grocery stores or online.
Replace 300 g mussels with shell, 150 g shrimps and 150 g fish fillets with 350 g mixed seafood.
Replace shiitake mushrooms button mushrooms.

title: Vegetable tortilla with chorizo
ingredients: 50 g red peppers, cut in thin strips
200 g potatoes, cut in quarters and then in slices (0.5 cm)
100 g broccoli, cut in small florets
100 g fresh green beans, cut in pieces (1 cm)
4 slices medium-hard cheese (e.g. Havarti, Gouda or young Cheddar)
steps: Place chorizo in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add pepper and oil and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add potato, broccoli, green beans and salt, sauté 16 min/120°C//speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk and pour into simmering basket placed over a bowl to drain oil. Transfer drained potatoes and vegetables to a large bowl.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Brush a ring mould (approx. Ø 22 cm x 7-8 cm high) with some of the drained cooking oil. Cut a ring of baking paper and line base of ring mould.
Place eggs and baking powder in mixing bowl and whisk 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer beaten eggs to bowl with potatoes and vegetables and mix using spatula.
Transfer half of potato and egg mixture into ring mould. Top with chorizo and cheese slices and cover with remaining potato and egg mixture.
Bake tortilla for 15 minutes (200°C). Remove from oven and, using spatula, gently loosen outer and inner edges of tortilla. Flip over onto a flat plate to unmold, cut in slices and serve hot.
tips: Serve with a mixed salad for a main course.

title: Tuna empanada
ingredients: 150 g red peppers, cut in pieces
150 g green peppers, cut in pieces
200 g canned pickled tuna ("bonito en escabeche"), drained (see tip)
25 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 3 tsp dried yeast
steps: Place onion, red and green pepper, crushed tomatoes, olive oil, sugar and salt in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer to a large bowl and add tuna and eggs. Mix together using spatula and leave to cool.
Place water, olive oil, white wine and lard in mixing bowl and warm 1 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add egg and yeast and mix 5 sec/speed 4.

Add flour and salt, mix 15 sec/speed 6 and then knead Dough /2 min. Remove dough from mixing bowl, form into a ball and leave to rest in a bowl covered with cling film for at least 30 minutes or until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Divide dough into 2 parts. Using a rolling pin, roll out one part of dough between 2 sheets of cling film or on a lightly floured work surface.

Place dough on prepared baking tray. Spread filling on top of dough, leaving a 2 cm border. Roll out second half of dough. Brush edges of empanada base with water and cover filling with second sheet of dough. Trim and seal edges and decorate surface with dough trimmings. Make a hole or cut in the middle for steam to escape. Brush with beaten egg and bake for approx. 30 minutes (200°C). Serve hot or cold.
tips: Replace pickled tuna with tuna in oil or tuna in brine or water.
Roll out each piece of dough between two sheets of cling film. This avoids having to add flour, the dough will be wetter and it will dry out less once it has been rolled out.
For an even better result and to make the dough more digestive, prolong the resting time in step 5 by 2 to 3 hours.
If using dried yeast, it should be added together with the flour in step 5.

title: Pizza rolls
ingredients: 100 g cheese (e.g. Emmental, Gouda, Cheddar), cut in pieces
400 g bread flour, plus extra for dusting
1 tsp citric acid  o 30 g lemon juice
steps: Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until needed.

Place 220 g water, sugar, fresh yeast, flour, olive oil and salt in mixing bowl, then knead Dough /2 min. Meanwhile, line Varoma dish with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish and set aside.
Place remaining 250 g water and citric acid in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /1 h/40°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer dough to a floured work surface and, using a rolling pin, roll out into a rectangle (approx. 30 cm x 40 cm). Spread tomato sauce over dough, place ham on top and sprinkle with reserved grated cheese.

Carefully roll dough into a log, starting with longer side of the rectangle. Cut in 10 slices (approx. 3 cm) using a sharp knife, place flat on prepared baking tray and season with dried herbs. Cover with cling film or a tea towel and leave to rise for 20 minutes. Towards the end of rising time, preheat oven to 180°C.
Bake pizza rolls for 30 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve hot or cold.
tips: Prepare pizza rolls in advance for a picnic or a party and store in refrigerator.
Replace tomato sauce, ham and grated cheese with spinach and feta cheese.

title: Chocolate dragée cookies
ingredients: 200 g butter, unsalted, in pieces (1-2 cm)
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.
Place hazelnuts into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, sugar, egg and vanilla and mix 1 min/speed 3.
Add flour, yeast and salt and knead 40 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl.

Use a teaspoon to form small balls of dough about the size of a walnut and arrange them on 2 baking trays leaving a gap of about 5 cm. Stick 4-5 coloured chocolate dragées to the surface of each ball.
Place one tray in the oven at a time and bake for 10-12 minutes (180°C) or until the biscuits are golden. Remove from the oven and leave the biscuits to cool completely on a cooling rack.
Serve immediately or store in an airtight container.
tips: You can make the cookies together with children and let them make the dough balls and decorate the biscuits with the chocolate dragées.
You can make the cookies together with children and let them make the dough balls and decorate the biscuits with the chocolate dragées.

title: Chicken breasts with courgette topping
ingredients: 100 g carrots, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
400 g chicken breast fillets, sliced horizontally
steps: Place onion, carrots and 200 g courgettes into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 5 min/100°C/speed 1, then 5 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Place chicken breast slices and remaining courgettes into Varoma dish and tray. Top each piece of chicken with courgette purée.
Place water into mixing bowl, insert the Varoma and cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Serve chicken fillets hot with courgette slices.
tips: Turkey breast fillets can be used instead of chicken breasts.

title: Energy bars with cereals and dried fruit
ingredients: 40 g dried fruit (e. g. raisins, blueberries etc.)
70 g dark chocolate, in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place walnuts and dried fruit into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Place into a bowl and set aside.
Place muesli into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 3. Transfer to bowl with chopped nuts and dried fruit.
Place dark chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with muesli and dried fruit.
Place almonds and 10 g water into mixing bowl and chop 2 min/speed 6 until it achieves a consistency similar to almond paste.
Add honey, and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 3. Combine in the bowl with the other ingredients and mix well (see Tip).
Lay out a sheet of baking paper on the work surface, pour on the mixture and smooth out with aid of spatula to a height of approx. 1 cm. Place in refrigerator for 2 hours.
Cut into bars of the required size and serve or store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator.
tips: To best mix the mixture, it is advisable to wear disposable latex gloves and knead the mixture with the hands to achieve an even consistency.
To best mix the mixture, it is advisable to wear disposable latex gloves and knead the mixture with the hands to achieve an even consistency.

title: Turkey burgers
ingredients: 450 g turkey breast fillet, skinless, sinews removed, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place turkey in a freezer bag or on a chopping board and place in freezer for 1 hour.
Place coriander in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8.
Add partially frozen turkey, onion, salt, cumin, ginger and cayenne pepper and chop 10-12 sec/speed 6.
Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Shape mixture into 4 equally-sized patties (Ø approx. 10 cm). Fry turkey burgers for approx. 3–4 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot.
tips: Ensure all sinews have been removed, else the turkey burgers will be fibrous.Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread apricot yoghurt dip or a dip of your choice on two roll halves, place turkey burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, sliced vegetables or cheese to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.
Ensure all sinews have been removed, else the turkey burgers will be fibrous.

Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread apricot yoghurt dip or a dip of your choice on two roll halves, place turkey burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, sliced vegetables or cheese to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.

title: Stir-fried noodles with vegetables
ingredients: 200 g courgettes, unpeeled, cut into thin sticks (5 cm long)
150 g carrot, cut into thin sticks (5 cm long)
200 g fresh mushrooms (seasonal), cut into slices
steps: Place garlic, olive oil, all vegetables and salt in mixing bowl. Sauté 12 min/120°C//speed . Add soy sauce, transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Pour water and coarse salt into mixing bowl and heat 10 min/100°C/speed 1 to bring to a boil.
Add chinese vermicelli and cook 3 min/100°C//speed . Strain noodles in simmering basket, rinse with cold water and drain well.
Sauté noodles with reserved vegetables in a non-stick frying pan over high heat for a few minutes. Top with bean sprouts and serve hot.
tips: Nutritional comments: This is a very nutritionally balanced and light recipe that can be combined with a light starter.
For extra flavour, add some grated ginger and more soy sauce.
You can also use rice noodles. In this case, add these to the mixing bowl instead of soy noodles and let stand for 3 minutes.

title: Semolina cake (namoura)
ingredients: 50 g butter, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
steps: Grease a baking dish (32 cm x 22 cm x 4-6 cm) and set aside.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 9.
Add yoghurt and mix 20 sec/speed 4.
Add medium semolina and fine semolina and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and baking powder and mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer into prepared baking dish, spread evenly, cover with a tea towel and set aside for 1 hour. Meanwhile prepare syrup.
Place water, sugar, blossom water, rose water (if using) and lemon juice into mixing bowl and cook 10 min/115°C/speed 2. Transfer into a heat-resistant bowl and set aside to cool.
Preheat oven to 180°C.

Score cake into 12 pieces (squares or diamonds) and place a blanched almond in the centre of each piece. Bake for 25 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Pour cooled syrup onto hot cake, place back into oven and bake another 2 minutes. Set aside to cool before serving.

title: Iraqi cheese pies (cheese chureck)
ingredients: 170 g butter, cut into pieces , plus extra for greasing
650 g flour, plus extra for dusting
150 g feta cheese, cut into cubes (1 cm)
220 g Halloumi cheese, cut into cubes (1 cm)
180 g mozzarella, cut into cubes (1 cm)
steps: Place water, butter, milk, sugar and yeast into mixing bowl and mix 2 min/37°C/speed 3.
Remove measuring cup and mix 30 sec/speed 3 while adding 2 eggs one by one through opening of mixing bowl lid.

Add flour and salt and knead 3 min/. Meanwhile lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Place dough into prepared bowl and form into a ball. Cover bowl with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow to rest in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer reserved dough to a lightly floured surface and knead briefly with the hands and divide into 3 equal pieces. Divide again each piece of dough into 4 equal pieces (approx. 90 g each) and set aside keeping them covered during next operations.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in feta cheese, halloumi cheese, and mozzarella cheese. Mix well and set aside.

Roll each piece of dough into a rectangle (approx. 30 cm x 10 cm) and place approx. 1/12 of cheese mixture along the bottom end of the long side. Brush the opposite side of the rectangle with a little water and roll the dough over the filling, press lightly the edge to seal. Form roll into a circle and transfer it on the prepared baking tray with the seam at the bottom. Repeat the process with the other pieces of dough and cheese filling.

Brush the cheese pies with an egg lightly beaten with 1 tbsp water. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and bake for approx. 20 minutes (180°C) or until golden. Transfer the pies on a cooling rack or serve hot accompanying with fresh mint leaves on side.

title: Vegetable harrira soup
ingredients: ¼ tsp ground cayenne pepper, adjust to taste
100 g dried green lentils, soaked for approx. 15 min, drained
150 g canned chickpeas, drained, weight after draining  o 150 g cooked chickpeas, drained, weight after draining
2 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 2 chicken stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
steps: Place coriander and parsley into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 2 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onions, olive oil, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, paprika and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add carrots and celery and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add canned tomatoes, salt, lentils, water, chickpeas and chicken stock paste and cook 30 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add lemon juice, lemon zest, reserved chopped parsley and coriander, mix 5 sec//speed 3 with aid of spatula, taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve warm.
tips: Serve with pitta bread or any other type of bread of your choice for a hearty meal.

title: Chicken with yoghurt tahini sauce (fattet d'jaj)
ingredients: 1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
1000 g chicken pieces (thighs, drumsticks, breasts, wings)
steps: Place a glass onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in 50 g cold water. Set aside.
Place garlic and lemon juice into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tahini paste and blend 15 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 30 sec/speed 4 while slowly pouring reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Add yoghurt and salt and mix gently with spatula. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate.

Place garlic, olive oil, lemon zest, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl. Use garlic-lemon zest mixture to rub chicken pieces all over, then distribute them in Varoma dish and tray.
Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Carefully open Varoma lid and mix chicken pieces to ensure even steaming, then continue steaming 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, prepare pitta croutons. Cut pitta bread into bite-size square pieces and fry in batches in hot oil until they become crispy and golden. Drain on paper towels, sprinkle with salt to taste and set aside.
Remove Varoma and let cool down. Remove all skin and bones and cut chicken into pieces (approx. 2-3 cm) and transfer into a bowl. Mix with lemon juice, adjust seasoning to taste and refrigerate.

To assemble, place pitta croutons in a serving dish (Ø 25 cm, 5 cm height), top with chicken pieces and cover with yoghurt sauce. Garnish with toasted pine nuts and finely chopped fresh coriander before serving.
tips: Oven toasted pitta bread croutons: instead of frying pitta bread in step 7, brush the whole pitta breads with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and grill in the oven until crispy and golden. Then break it into small pieces.
Save the liquid in the mixing bowl after the chicken is cooked (chicken stock) and use it to make a soup or other preparation which requires stock.
For a faster result, replace the chicken pieces with 800 g chicken breasts, cut in 4 pieces each and in step 7 use only 500 g water. In step 8  steam 10 mins/Varoma/speed 1.

title: Pumpkin Chicken Brown Rice
ingredients: 4 dried scallops, rinsed, soaked to soften and patted dry with paper towels
30 g yellow onions, cut in wedges
200 g brown rice, rinsed and soaked for 1 hour, drained
200 g chicken fillets, cut in pieces (3 cm)
100 g Japanese pumpkin (Kabocha), cut in cubes (1.5 cm x 1.5 cm)
50 g dried shrimp, toasted, to garnish (opcional)
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place scallops in mixing bowl, shred 20 sec//speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place yellow onions, shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 7 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved shredded scallops and cooking oil, sauté without measuring cup 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add water, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add brown rice, chicken fillets, pumpkin, reserved scallops, light soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper powder and salt, start Rice Cooker . Transfer to a serving bowl, gently stir with spoon. Let stand for 10 minutes. Garnish with toasted dried shrimp, crispy fried garlic and chopped spring onions. Serve warm.
tips: The resting period is important to ensure all excess liquid is being reabsorbed into the rice to finish cooking it. Use a fork or chopsticks to stir through the rice to avoid crushing the grains.
Adjust seasonings accordingly in step 5 if your soy sauce is extremely salty.
Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Berry Nice Gelato
ingredients: 500 g frozen mixed berries (e.g. blackberries, raspberries and strawberries)
steps: Place frozen mixed berries and soy milk powder in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 10 with aid of spatula until creamy. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve immediately.
tips: For the best texture, the gelato should be served immediately. Otherwise, the gelato may be kept in the refrigerator (4°C) up to 4 hours or in the freezer for longer storage.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Pineapple Pork Ribs
ingredients: 500 g pork spare ribs, cut in pieces (4 cm), patted dry with kitchen towels
150 g Morris pineapple, flesh only, cut in cubes (2 cm)
10 g plum sauce, homemade or store-bought
3 - 4 fresh strawberries, stems removed, cut in halves, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork ribs, light soy sauce. Add dark soy sauce and salt to the bowl. Mix and aside in refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Place cooking oil and marinated pork ribs in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add pineapple, tomato ketchup, sugar, plum sauce and oyster sauce, cook 30 min/100°C//speed . Then toss 5 sec//speed 2. Transfer to a serving plate, garnish with strawberry halves. Serve hot.
tips: To thicken the sauce, remove the pork ribs and pineapple (without its sauce) from mixing bowl, and cook a further 5 min/Varoma/speed 1 until thickened. Pour the sauce onto pork ribs and serve.

title: Braised Chicken Wings With Mushrooms
ingredients: 40 g dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed
10 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken wings. Add light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and white pepper in the bowl and. Set aside in refrigerator to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Place garlic cloves, ginger and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and mushrooms, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add marinated chicken and marinade, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add clove, star anise, water and rice wine, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Rasam
ingredients: 7 garlic cloves, with skin, lightly smashed
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in tamarind pulp and water. Mix and deseed, set aside. Place cumin seeds, black mustard seeds, white dhal, dried chilies, shallots, curry leaves and cooking oil in mixing bowl, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved tamarind water, garlic cloves, tomatoes, rasam powder and salt, cook 10 min/98°C//speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Savoury Vegetarian Rice
ingredients: 100 g carrots, cut in 2 cm strips
300 g tomatoes, cut in cubes (5 cm)
200 g fresh shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and cut in slices
1 sprig fresh coriander, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, ginger and coriander roots in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomato puree, carrots, tomato cubes, mushrooms, chicken stock powder, salt, ground black pepper and water, cook 10 min/100°C/speed .
Add parboiled basmati rice, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 15 minutes. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Nyonya Fish Maw Soup
ingredients: 1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
10 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed
300 g cabbage, cut into 4 cm squares
50 g fried fish maws, soaked to soften, cut into 5 cm length (see tip)
steps: Place minced pork, prawn flesh and water chestnuts in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salt, white pepper powder, sesame oil and cornflour, mix 5 sec/speed 4. Divide prawn mixture into 12 equal portions, roll into balls and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water, chicken stock powder, salt, white pepper powder and rice wine in mixing bowl and start Kettle /100°C.
Add mushrooms, cabbage and fish maws and start Slow Cook /40 min/95°C.
Add reserved prawn meatballs and cook 5 min/100°C//speed . Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: Soak fried fish maw with hot water, squeeze out the oil, wash with tap water and soak againwith water. Repeat twice until the fish maw turns soft and is not greasy anymore.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.
Replace prawn meatballs with 3 whole chicken legs (cut into 4 cm pieces) and add in step 4.

title: Sup Sayur Campur (Mixed Vegetable Soup)
ingredients: 100 g red onions, cut in halves
100 g carrots, cut in thin slices
50 g radish, cut in cubes (1 cm)
steps: Place red onions, garlic cloves, ground blackpepper, ground cumin and cooking oil in mixing bowl, chop 15 sec/speed 7.
Add water and anchovy stock powder, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add broccoli florets, carrots, radish, celery and salt, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Quinny.

title: Kuih Bingka Ubi (Baked Tapioca Cake)
ingredients: 100 g butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
1000 g tapioca, peeled and cut in chunks (2.5 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease a square baking tray (17 cm x 17 cm) and set aside.
Place tapioca and water in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer blended tapioca into a fine mesh strainer and drain off excessive liquid. Reserve tapioca pulp and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
