Place reserved tapioca pulp, brown sugar, eggs, egg yolk, coconut milk, grated coconut, 45 g butter and salt in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 2.

Pour the batter into prepared baking tray. Bake for 60-70 minutes (170°C). After 20 minutes or when cake surface forms a crust, take out baking tray and brush 55 g butter on cake surface with pastry brush. Continue to bake until surface is golden brown or until a cake tester skewer comes out clean when it is inserted in the centre of the cake. Let it cool completely before slicing and serve.
tips: For best flavour and results, choose tapioca roots with a white flesh as they are starchier.

title: Gnocchi tricolore
ingredients: 100 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
2 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
steps: Place parmesan and basil in mixing bowl and chop 25 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Add onion and garlic to mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add tomatoes, sugar, stock cube, water and Italian herbs and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Place Varoma into position, weigh in 400 g gnocchi, making sure a few holes remain unobstructed.

Insert Varoma tray, weigh in 600 g gnocchi. Distribute gnocchi evenly, making sure a few holes remain unobstructed. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside, transfer gnocchi to serving bowl and keep warm.
Blend tomato sauce 5 sec/speed 8, increasing speed gradually. Pour over gnocchi and garnish with basil and parmesan mixture. Serve immediately.
tips: Serve gnocchi tricolore with a green salad on the side.

title: Courgette omelette
ingredients: 20 g stale white bread, cut into pieces
60 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
steps: Line Varoma tray with baking paper, leaving some of the steaming holes uncovered then place in Varoma dish. Set aside.
Place bread, Parmesan and parsley in mixing bowl then chop 15 sec/speed 7.
Add eggs and salt then mix 15 sec/speed 4.
Add courgettes and spring onions then chop 4 sec/speed 4. Pour mixture onto baking paper in Varoma tray.
Place water in mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position then cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Carefully, using the baking paper, remove omelette and transfer to a plate. Cut into pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) before serving warm or cold.
tips: Can be served as a starter or as a side dish with potatoes and salad.
For a different flavour, the parsley can be substituted with another herb (e.g. wild garlic, dill, chives or a mix of herbs).

title: Lentil and chorizo stew
ingredients: 50 g red peppers, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g green peppers, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g carrots, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
50 g spring onions, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)  o 50 g onions, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh lentils into it. Add enough water to cover lentils and set aside to soak for at least 3 hours. Remove lentils from soaking water, rinse and drain them.
Place drained lentils, red peppers, green peppers, carrots, spring onions, olive oil, salt, paprika, stock cube, chorizo, ham and water in mixing bowl and cook 40 min/100°C//speed .
Check that lentils are cooked. If not, cook a further 5-6 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Replace peppers and carrots with vegetables of your choice such as potato, pumpkin, etc.
Replace 50 g lentils with 50 g rice.

title: Apricot tahini bliss balls
steps: Place sesame seeds into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add almonds, apple and apricots and chop 10 sec/speed 8.
Add honey, tahini paste and blossom water and mix 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in desiccated coconut, set aside. With wet hands shape reserved apricot-tahini mixture in small balls (Ø 2-3 cm). Roll them in desiccated coconut to coat and refrigerate in an airtight container before serving.
tips: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
Serve with coffee or as finger dessert.
Replace sesame seeds with linseed.

title: Za'atar bread rolls
ingredients: 100 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing and brushing
550 g flour, plus extra for dusting
100 g fresh za’atar leaves, washed and dried
steps: Place water, olive oil, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and heat 2 min/37°C/speed 3. Meanwhile grease a bowl with olive oil.
Add flour, semolina and salt and mix 15 sec/speed 6, then knead 2 min/.

Add za’atar leaves and knead 1 min 30 sec/. Transfer dough into prepared bowl, cover with cling film or a tea towel and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 h). Meanwhile preheat oven to 200ºC, line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
On a lightly floured surface roll out reserved dough into a square (2 cm thick) and cut out circles with a cookie cutter (Ø 5 cm).
Place bread rolls onto prepared baking tray, sprinkle with flour and cover with a towel. Allow to rise for approximately 20 minutes in a warm place.
Brush bread rolls with olive oil and bake for 20 minutes (200°C) or until lightly golden. Serve warm.
tips: If za’atar leaves are not available, replace with a combination of fresh oregano, marjoram and thyme leaves.
Serve with labneh, halloumi, feta cheese or with soup.

title: Middle eastern stuffed chicken
ingredients: 1 whole chicken (max. 1.3 kg), washed and patted dry, wings clipped
100 g Egyptian rice  o 100 g short-grain rice
1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
5 apricots, fresh or dried, pitted and cut into halves
steps: Place Arabian spice mix, cumin seeds, cardamom seeds, fennel seeds and coriander seeds into mixing bowl and dry roast 3 min/120°C/speed 4.
Allow spices to cool down for a few minutes and then grind 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add olive oil and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and use spice mix to rub generously all over skin and inside of chicken. Season with 1 tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper. Allow to marinate for at least half an hour out of refrigerator. Meanwhile, prepare the stuffing.
Place a heat-resistant bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh rice into it and set aside.

Place 200 g water and vegetable stock paste into mixing bowl, heat 4 min/100°C/speed 1, transfer to prepared bowl with rice, mix with spatula and allow to rest for 20 minutes. Meanwhile continue with recipe and clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place toasted bread, parsley and coriander into mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer herbs-bread mixture to the bowl with rice and mix with spatula.
Place onions, garlic, dried apricots and dates into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7.

Add raisins, pine nuts, sumac, 1 tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper and mix 5 sec//speed 2.5. Transfer to bowl with rice and mix with spatula until all ingredients are combined. Stuff chicken with reserved rice mixture, use toothpicks to secure skin around stuffing.

Place 1700 g water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish into position and, to ensure steam circulates evenly, lay butterfly whisk flat in the bottom of Varoma dish, place chicken on top, close Varoma and steam 60 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma, turn chicken upside down, place Varoma again in position and steam for another 30 min/Varoma/speed 1, prolong time if needed. Remove Varoma, transfer to a serving platter and serve.
tips: Place the chicken for a few minutes under a hot grill if you prefer crispy skin.

title: Sambal Belacan
steps: Place red chillies, bird's eye chillies and shrimp paste in mixing bowl and chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Serve as condiment for noodles and rice or transfer to 1 airtight jar (100 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Drizzle with freshly squeezed Calamansi lime juice upon serving.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Pumpkin Risotto
ingredients: 120 g Parmesan cheese, rind removed, cut in pieces (3 cm)
60 g butter, room temperature, cut in small pieces
1 piece fresh black truffle, cut in thin slices, to garnish
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl, grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place pumpkin flesh, water and 1 tsp salt in a mixing bowl, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1. Then blend 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to another bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place extra virgin olive oil and rice in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.

Add 1 tsp salt, vegetable broth, reserved pumpkin purée, butter, freshly ground black pepper and grated Parmesan cheese, mix well with spatula, cook 15 min/100°C//speed 1. Let stand for 1 minute. Garnish with black truffle slices and serve immediately.
tips: You can easily make your own vegetable stock. Place 100 g onion, 100 g carrots, 100 g celery and 100 g shallots in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Add 800 g water, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1. Strain the broth using a fine mesh strainer.

title: Stir Fried Whole Fish
ingredients: 500 g fresh yellowtail fish (2 small sized fishes, approx. 18-20 cm length), gutted and descaled, cleaned and patted dry with kitchen towel
100 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)  o 100 g mirin
steps: Rub both fish skin and inside with salt and 30 g rice wine. Set aside to marinate.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, 70 g rice wine and sugar. Set aside. Place sesame oil and ginger slices in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed .

Insert butterfly whisk. Arrange both fishes around sides of mixing bowl on both sides of butterfly whisk with stomach facing up. Ensure that fish are on top of blades. Pour reserved sauce mixture over both fish evenly. Cook 7 min/Varoma//speed . Check if fish is cooked, prolong cooking time if necessary (see tip). Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: To check doneness of fish, insert a clean fork into the thickest part of the fish at a 45 degree angle and gently twist the fork. Meat of the cooked fish should be flaky and opaque. Cook for extra 2-3 minutes if necessary.

title: Pandan Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: 6 - 7 fresh pandan leaves, cut to 3 cm length
steps: Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases. Place plain flour and baking powder in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place coconut milk and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Strain through a small fine sieve into another bowl. Discard pandan pulp. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place caster sugar and egg in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 3. Meanwhile, add reserved pandan milk through hole of mixing bowl lid.

Add salt, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Then whisk 3 min/speed 3. Meanwhile, add reserved flour mixture and vegetable oil through hole of mixing bowl lid. Remove butterfly whisk. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and fill until 90% full. Arrange 6 cupcakes in Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma into position, steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove the steamed huat kuih and arrange remaining 6 cupcakes in Varoma tray. Close Varoma lid and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Replace pandan leaves with 2½ tsp pandan paste.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Prawn Biryani
ingredients: 20 g raisins, plus extra for garnishing
20 g cashew nuts, toasted, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns, chilli powder, lemon juice, palm sugar and water. Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, fennel powder, coriander powder, curry powder, garam masala, salt and ground black pepper. Mix well and set aside to marinate for 20 minutes in refrigerator.

Place ghee, cooking oil, onions, ginger garlic paste, cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, bay leaves, green chilli slices and garam masala in mixing bowl, sauté without measuring cup, 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved prawns and marinade, tomato cubes and Greek yogurt, stir fry 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add coriander leaves, mint leaves and raisins, mix 2 min/120°C//speed  . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water and salt in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, weigh in 200 g Basmati rice. Add reserved prawn masala on top of the rice and add remaining 50 g rice on top of prawn layer.

Add coconut milk, set Varoma into position, cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Transfer rice to a serving dish. Garnish with cashew nuts and raisins. Serve hot.
tips: Refer to Cookidoo®  to make your own ginger garlic paste and garam masala.
For dairy free substitute, you may replace ghee with vegan butter and replace yogurt with almond cashew paste. Refer to Cookidoo®  to make your own almond cashew paste.
Best served hot with condiments such as pickled pineapple, boiled egg, yogurt, raita or kurma curry.
Recipe contributed by Sakuntala Khalaiselvan.

title: Fish and Potatoes with Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 800 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
6 hake steak (120-200 g each)  o 6 white fish fillets (any type of white fish, 120-200 g each)
30 g cold pressed olive oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place potatoes in Varoma dish and set aside. Lightly grease Varoma tray, place hake steaks on it and season with salt to taste. Set aside.
Place onions, garlic clove, carrots, olive oil, white wine, tomatoes, black pepper, 1 tsp salt and water in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Place Varoma without Varoma tray into position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish, close lid and steam a further 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Season potatoes with salt to taste. Serve hake and potatoes with tomato sauce.
tips: For a smooth sauce, mix sauce 15 sec/speed 5 before serving.

title: Vinegar Pork Knuckle
ingredients: 1000 g pork knuckle, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
120 g old ginger, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
120 g young ginger, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place pork knuckle and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch 12 min/100°C//speed . Discard water. Transfer to a bowl.
Place old ginger, young ginger and sesame oil in mixing bowl, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, place eggs in Varoma dish.
Add 300 g water, black vinegar and sweet vinegar. Set Varoma with eggs in position and cook 15 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add palm sugar and reserved pork knuckle to mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /2 h/98°C. Meanwhile, carefully open Varoma lid, place eggs in cold water before peeling.
Transfer steamed eggs back to mixing bowl and let stand for 30 minutes to soften the meat. Serve warm.
tips: You can ask your butcher to remove pig hair thoroughly upon purchase.
Scrape steamed eggs with a knife before step 5 so that the eggs can absorb flavour easily.
Let the steamed eggs fully soak in gravy for even colouring in step 5.
You can also transfer cooked pork knuckle and steamed eggs to a thermal serving bowl or pot in step 5 to soften and colour the eggs with gravy.
Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: French Raw Chocolate
ingredients: 20 g unsalted butter, cut in pieces
1 tbsp cocoa powder, to dust  o 1 tbsp Japanese green tea powder, to dust
steps: Place whipping cream, butter and honey in mixing bowl, heat 4 min/100°C/speed 2
Add chopped chocolate, let sit for 2 minutes.
Mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a square cake frame (17 cm x 17 cm). Let cool and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, cut into pieces and dust with cocoa powder. Serve chilled.

title: Salted Chicken
ingredients: 30 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
4 sprigs spring onions, cut in 5 cm length
50 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 tsp sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish
steps: Rub chicken inside out with salt and sand ginger powder. Marinate and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Insert dang gui, chuan xiong, 5 g ginger slices and 2 sprigs spring onions into chicken cavity.

Place 25 g ginger, 2 sprigs spring onions and shallots in mixing bowl, sit the chicken bottom down on the knife blade, add sesame oil and rice wine, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 25 min/120°C//speed .

Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 15 min/100°C//speed . Place cooked chicken onto aluminium foil, wrap tightly and let it rest for at least 30 minutes. Transfer chicken gravy to a bowl and set aside. Tear chicken into smaller parts, then shred chicken skin and meat, garnish with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
tips: The leftover chicken, gravy and bones can be used in the abalone chicken porridge recipe.
Use the reserved chicken gravy from step 3 as a dipping sauce.
Place leftover chicken bones and 1200 g water in mixing bowl, cook 30 min/100°C/speed. Strain and use as chicken broth for other recipes.

title: Tabouleh with quinoa and tuna
ingredients: ½ tsp fine salt, plus 1 pinch extra to taste
½ lemon, preferably organic (grated zest and juice only)
20 g spring onions, cut into pieces (opcional)
3 - 4 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves washed and dried  o 3 - 4 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves washed and dried
2 - 3 sprigs fresh mint, leaves washed and dried
100 g tomatoes, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g canned tuna, in brine or water, drained well
steps: Place water and ½ teaspoon salt into mixing bowl and bring to the boil: 8 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add quinoa and cook 12 min/100°C//speed . Strain quinoa using simmering basket and transfer to a large bowl. Dry mixing bowl.
Combine the grated zest and juice of the lemon with the quinoa and mix.
If used, place garlic clove, spring onions, coriander and mint into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, 1 pinch of salt to taste, tomatoes and chilli and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add cucumber, tuna and chop 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer mixture into bowl with quinoa and mix with aid of spatula.
Serve tabouleh warm or cold.
tips:
A diet for fitness requires a good portion of lysine and iodine to maintain an excellent psychophysical balance and guarantee optimum athletic performance.
In addition to these elements, tuna and quinoa are also excellent sources of potassium, iron, calcium and B vitamins, which are essential for various biological functions, for example, muscular contraction, the transmission of nerve impulses within the body and the transport of oxygen to the tissue.

title: Honey lime chicken supremes with Mango chutney
ingredients: ½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 lime, preferably organic, zest (cut in 1 cm pieces) and juice
3 - 6 limes, preferably organic, zest (cut in 1 cm pieces) and juice
75 g red peppers, cut in pieces
500 g ripe mango, flesh only, cut in small pieces (1-2 cm)
steps: Place honey, black pepper, salt, sweet paprika, garlic clove, lime zest and 20 g lime juice in mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 8.

Place chicken in a bowl and drizzle the blended marinade over it, stir to coat then allow to marinate for 30 minutes in refrigerator. Meanwhile line Varoma tray with baking paper with enough to go 2 cm up the sides. Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish. Clean and dry mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Place coriander and approx. 50 g lime zest in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Reserve 1-2 tsp coriander-lime zest mixture in a small bowl.
Add garlic cloves, onions, red peppers and jalapeño chillies to mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.

Add mango, salt, sugar, 70 g lime juice and water. Arrange marinated chicken on lined Varoma tray, set Varoma in position and cook 28 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm. Transfer part of the mango chutney to fill a 450 g sterilised jar, cover with a sterilised lid and set aside for another use (see tip). Transfer remaining mango chutney to a wide serving dish and allow to cool for a few minutes until lukewarm. Slice the chicken supremes diagonally and arrange them over the mango chutney in the serving dish, then sprinkle with reserved chopped coriander-lime zest mixture. Serve warm or refrigerate and serve chilled.
tips: For a complete meal, in step 5 steam in Varoma dish 400-600 g vegetables (e.g. carrots, potatoes, green beans, courgettes, broccoli), cut in bite-size pieces.
For a complete meal, in step 5 steam in Varoma dish 400-600 g vegetables (e.g. carrots, potatoes, green beans, courgettes, broccoli), cut in bite-size pieces.

What is wonderful with this recipe is the perfect cooking point of the chicken, moist and tender, and the surprising and moreish combination with mango chutney. The recipe produces a bonus - an additional jar of mango chutney that you can enjoy another time with steamed meat or fish, your favourite cheese, or a curry.

What is wonderful with this recipe is the perfect cooking point of the chicken, moist and tender, and the surprising and moreish combination with mango chutney. The recipe produces a bonus - an additional jar of mango chutney that you can enjoy another time with steamed meat or fish, your favourite cheese, or a curry.

A chicken supreme is a half breast of chicken with the upper part of the wing still attached.For a stronger flavour, marinate the chicken in step 2 for a few hours or overnight.Once it has cooled completely, the mango chutney in the jar can be kept in the refrigerator for up to two weeks or stored in freezable containers in the freezer for up to 6 months.
A chicken supreme is a half breast of chicken with the upper part of the wing still attached.
For a stronger flavour, marinate the chicken in step 2 for a few hours or overnight.
Once it has cooled completely, the mango chutney in the jar can be kept in the refrigerator for up to two weeks or stored in freezable containers in the freezer for up to 6 months.

title: Cannelloni
ingredients: 150 g chopped tomatoes, canned or fresh
200 g pork meat, lean, sinew free, diced
steps: Place olive oil, onion and garlic in the mixing bowl and sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken breasts, beef, pork, salt, pepper, bay leaf and cognac and cook 28 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add flour and blend 1 min/100°C/speed 2.
Remove bay leaf and chop 8 sec/speed 5.
Add milk and blend 5 min/100°C/speed 2.

Pour the contents into a piping bag – to fill the cannelloni tubes more easily – and let the mixture cool. Boil dried cannelloni in a pot. Drain the tubes well, place them on a tea towel and set aside. Once cold, fill the tubes with the mixture, place the tubes into a gratin dish and set aside.
Pre-heat oven/grill to 220ºC.
Place butter into mixing bowl and heat 4 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add flour and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 3.
Add milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg and blend 8 min/90°C/speed 4.
Pour the béchamel over the cannelloni tubes, sprinkle with grated cheese and grill 5 minutes (220ºC) or until golden brown. Serve hot.

title: Liquorice ice cream
ingredients: 120 g liquorice sweets, e. g. swirls or salinos
steps: Place licorice in mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 10.
Add milk and sugar, soften 4 min/95°C/speed 1, blend 1 min/speed 9 and allow to cool for 5 minutes.

Add cream, eggs and egg yolks and whisk 6 min/75°C/speed 3. Transfer mixture up to 4 cm high, to shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium or silicone) and cover with cling film and allow to freeze for at least 8 hours.

Remove ice cream from freezer, allow to thaw for 5–10 minutes, turn out of the dish onto a wooden board and use knife to cut into cubes (2–3 cm). Place ice cream cubes in mixing bowl and crush 30 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Stir until creamy 40 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. If necessary, allow ice cream to harden for a further ½ hours in freezer or serve immediately.
tips: Depending on the type of licorice used (hard, soft, salty etc.), the licorice taste may vary. Select a type of licorice to your taste.

title: Stuffed pancakes (katayef with kashta cream)
ingredients: 150 g white bread, crust removed, cut into pieces
steps: Place milk into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add bread and cornflour and cook 4 min/90°C/speed 2.

Add blossom water and rose water and mix 1 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Transfer into a shallow bowl, cover with cling film and set aside to cool for 40 minutes. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare and cook pancakes.
Place water, dried yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and mix 2 min/37°C/speed 2.5.
Add flour and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a bowl, cover with cling film and allow to rise for 1 hour.

Just before frying, add baking soda and lemon juice to the bowl with the pancake batter and mix with spatula. To cook pancakes heat 1 tsp sunflower oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. For each pancake (Ø 7-8 cm), using a small ladle or a half full Arabic coffee/espresso cup, pour batter into pan and cook until bubbles start bursting on pancake surface. Do not turn pancake over. Remove from stove when pores form on the surface of each pancake. Place the pancakes on baking paper and set aside to cool. Repeat with remaining batter.
Place sugar, water, lemon juice and blossom water into mixing bowl and heat 10 min/115°C/speed 2. Empty into a heat-resistant bowl and set aside to cool down.

Fill each pancake with 1 full tsp of kashta cream. Pinch two edges together in one side leaving other half side open like a horn. Sprinkle or cover cream on open side with chopped pistachios. Serve stuffed pancakes with syrup.

title: Cheese pies
ingredients: 200 g Gruyère cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
180 g feta cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place orange juice, sunflower oil, flour and baking powder into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4, then knead 1 min/. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside for at least 30 minutes.
Place Gruyère cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 6.
Add feta cheese, egg and mint and mix 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer reserved dough onto a lightly floured surface and roll-out dough to shape into a log. Divide into 2 equal pieces and with a rolling pin, roll-out each piece into a rectangle (45 x 30 cm). Using a round cookie cutter (Ø 7-8 cm), cut circles and fill each one with 1 tsp of cheese filling. Join two opposite sides over the cheese filling and pinch them together. Prick each side with a fork for steam to escape and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 20-30 minutes (200°C) or until golden. Place on a cooling rack to cool down and serve warm.
tips: For a golden colour, brush with milk or orange juice.
Cheese pies can also be shaped in crescents.
Olive pies: replace cheese filling in step 3 with olive filling. Olive filling: mix in a bowl 100 g chopped onion, 200 g deseeded chopped black olives and 20 sprigs finely chopped coriander.

title: Arabian spice mix
steps: Place black peppercorns, paprika, cumin, coriander seeds, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon and cardamom into mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 9. Transfer into a jar and store in a dry place.
tips: This is a traditional spice mix used with slight variations in the Middle East and North Africa. In Lebanon it is known as seven-spice mix, in the United Arab Emirates and Gulf countries as b’zhar. Other ingredients like dried ground ginger, ground turmeric and dried ground galangal are often added or used as a substitute. Create your own spice mix with your favourite spices.

title: Mutton Peratal
ingredients: 1500 g mutton, boneless leg, cut in cubes (3 cm x 3 cm)
350 g potatoes, cut in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm)
steps: Place mustard seeds, cumin seeds, white dhal, fennel seeds, cloves, star anise, cardamom seeds, cinnamon stick, cooking oil, onion slices and curry leaves in mixing bowl, sauté 12 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add mutton, coconut milk, water, ginger garlic paste, chilli powder, meat curry powder, 1 tsp fennel powder and 1 tsp cumin powder, cook 40 min/100°C//speed .
Add 1 tsp fennel powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, sugar and salt, cook 10 min/100°C//speed , prolong cooking time if needed.
Add potato cubes, cook 10 min/Varoma//speed .
Add coriander, cook 2 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.
tips: Refer to Cookidoo®  to make your own ginger garlic paste.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Steamed Chicken With Green Ginger Sauce
ingredients: 1000 g chicken, (half chicken), with skin and bone
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
30 g spring onions, cut in pieces (4 cm)
1 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
1 sprig spring onion, thinly sliced, to garnish
1 fresh red chilli, thinly sliced, to garnish
steps: Place a steaming tray (Ø 20 cm) onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add salt and rice wine. Rub and marinate chicken inside out. Bend and fold spring onion and place under chicken. Arrange steaming tray with chicken in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Prolong cooking time if necessary. Remove Varoma and discard spring onion, then set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place ginger, spring onions and cooking oil in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chicken stock powder, salt and sugar, stir fry 7 min/120°C/speed 2.
Transfer ginger sauce to a serving bowl. Cut chicken into pieces (3 cm), arrange on a serving plate. Garnish with spring onion slices and red chilli slices. Serve warm with ginger sauce on the side.
tips: Check doneness of the meat after steaming. Meat should be tender enough to be pierced through easily by a fork or chopsticks.
Use Bentong ginger for more aromatic and spicy taste profile.

title: Hakka Yam Abacus
ingredients: 500 g yam (taro roots), peeled, cut in cubes (2 cm)
15 g dried shrimp, soaked in hot water for 30 minutes
10 g dried shredded squid, soak in hot water for 30 minutes
4 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed, cut in thin slices
3 dried black fungus, soaked to soften, cut in thin strips
steps: Place 800 g water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position, add yam cubes to it, steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place cooked yam and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl, mash 1 min/speed 6.
Add 100 g tapioca flour, knead Dough /1 min. Meanwhile, dust 50 g tapioca flour on a pastry mat.

Transfer dough onto lightly dusted pastry mat and knead dough together. Roll into a log shape (Ø 1 cm) and cut into 1 cm cubes. Roll the pieces in between your palms and roll round into balls. Use the ball-shaped end of butterfly whisk top to make an indentation in the middle.
Insert simmering basket. Place 1800 g water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C.

Add 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp of salt and carefully place reserved yam abacus beads into simmering basket, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 2 until yam abacus beads float up. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Place yam abacus beads in a bowl with cold water to stop cooking process. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, shallots and dried shrimp in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 30 g cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed  until fragrant.
Add shredded squid, shiitake slices, black fungus and minced pork, cook 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add yam abacus beads, oyster sauce, sesame oil, dark soy sauce, white pepper powder, 1 tsp salt and 100 g water, cook 1 min/Varoma//speed . Garnish with red chili and spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: Different yam varieties contain different starch levels, please adjust water and flour accordingly.
Chill yam dough overnight for easier shaping and to avoid that yam abacus beads stick together after cooking.

title: Prawn Arrabbiata
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
250 g penne pasta (or other short dried pasta)
2 tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl, grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and chillies in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tomatoes, olive oil and salt, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add water and pasta, cook 8 min/98°C//speed 0.5.
Add prawn and ground black pepper, cook 5 min/120°C//speed 0.5. Stir in half of the grated Parmesan to season. Sprinkle with remaining grated Parmesan and serve hot.

title: Menu with Pea Ginger Soup, Lemon Salmon with Broccoli and Potato
ingredients: 4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (150-180 g each)  o 4 white fish fillets, skinless (150-180 g each)
5 - 10 g fresh ginger, peeled and sliced (opcional)
100 g leek, white part only, cut in pieces  o 100 g onions, cut in halves
100 g English celery stalks, cut in pieces
350 g frozen green peas  o 350 g carrots, cut in pieces (see tip)
250 g potatoes, cut in pieces (1 cm)
400 g broccoli florets  o 400 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, courgettes, mushrooms), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
50 - 100 g single cream (approx. 18 % fat), to taste
steps: Place 30 g olive oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon zest from half the lemon and 25 g lemon juice in mixing bowl, emulsify 20 sec/speed 5. Place salmon fillets in a deep dish and pour marinade from mixing bowl over the salmon. Refrigerate for 10 minutes and continue with recipe.
Place ginger, garlic clove, shallots, leek and remaining 50 g olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with baking paper.
Add celery stalks and green peas to mixing bowl, chop 8 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add water and 1 tsp salt to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and add potatoes to it. Set Varoma dish in position, add broccoli florets to it and season them with ½ tsp salt. Insert prepared Varoma tray, arrange salmon fillets on the tray, season with ½ tsp salt and black pepper and drizzle with marinade. Close Varoma and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm. Remove simmering basket using spatula, set aside on a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm.

Add cream to mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve soup for starter (see tip), then salmon fillets, potatoes and broccoli for the main course.
tips: A quick, healthy meal with bright flavours and colours, starting with a vibrant green pea soup with zingy ginger, followed by lemon-marinated salmon with steamed potatoes and broccoli: this recipe can turn a weeknight dinner into a special treat.
If making a carrot soup instead of a pea soup, make sure carrots are cut in small pieces.
If the celery stalks have leaves, place a few leaves on top of salmon fillets before steaming to add extra flavour.
For a milder taste omit drizzling salmon with marinade in step 3.
After serving the soup, set mixing bowl and covered Varoma back in position so the main course keeps warm while the soup is enjoyed.

title: Thai Massaman Curry Paste
ingredients: 1 cinnamon stick (5 cm length), cut into 3
15 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place black peppercorns, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick and dried chillies in mixing bowl and cook without measuring cup 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh water into it and set aside. Place garlic cloves, shallots, galangal, lemongrass and shrimp paste in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved spice mixture, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Meanwhile, pour reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Add cooking oil and rock salt and sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Use as a base for Thai Massaman curry or transfer to 1 airtight jar (200 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Red Thai Curry Paste
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in water and set aside. Place dried chillies, white peppercorns, cumin seeds and coriander seeds in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Grind 1 min/speed 10.
Add garlic cloves, shallots, coriander roots, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime zest, shrimp paste and salt, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 30 sec/speed 10. Meanwhile, pour reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Add cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Use as a base for red Thai curry or transfer to 1 airght jar (500 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Persimmon Pudding
ingredients: 600 g persimmons, (approx 4 persimmons), peeled, deseeded, cut in quarters
400 g cashew nuts, soaked for 30 minutes
2 tbsp maple syrup  o 2 tbsp agave syrup
some fresh peppermint, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place persimmons in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a dome mould (Ø 15 cm) immediately and refrigerate overnight. Clean mixing bowl.
Place cashew nuts, water and maple syrup in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10 until creamy. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
To serve, unmould persimmon pudding. Put a spoonful of reserved cashew cream on persimmon pudding. Garnish with blueberries and peppermint leaves. Serve chilled.
tips: This recipe is the culmination of two years of dedicated culinary experimentation and the commitment to avoiding additive binding agents to create an all-natural raw vegan pudding.
Persimmons need to be transferred into mould immediately after blending, or it will start to condense in mixing bowl, and won’t set properly in the mould.
Select almost ripe persimmon as they contain high amounts of pectin, which helps it to set naturally. Unripe persimmon have a bitter taste, whereas overripe persimmons will not set nicely.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Kuih Semprit (Custard Cookies)
ingredients: 1 tsp rose essence  o 1 tsp vanilla extract
3 - 4 drops red food colouring, adjust to personal preference
steps: Place caster sugar in mixing bowl, pulverise 10 sec/speed 10.
Add margarine, mix 1 min/speed 3.
Add egg yolks and rose essence, mix 40 sec/speed 3.

Add custard powder, cornflour and plain flour, mix 40 sec/speed 3. Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Using a spoon, mix one portion with red food colouring. Cover with damp kitchen towel for 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 160°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Transfer both doughs (red and plain) at the same time into a semprit pump. Use your thumb to press 5 cm long strips of dough onto prepared baking tray.
Bake for 15-20 minutes (160°C). Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an airtight container.
tips: If butter is used, leave gap of about 2.5 cm in-between pressed cookie dough as it will spread during baking.
Semprit pumps can be found in any supermarket or baking supply shop. Use a cookie press gun instead if you can’t find a semprit pump.

title: Chilli Vinegar Pork Trotter Stew
ingredients: 1000 g pork trotter, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)
10 dried chillies, rinsed, soaked and deseeded
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork trotter, garlic cloves, shallots, rice vinegar and sugar. Add dried chillies, bird’s eye chillies, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce and salt and mix. Set aside and marinate for 1 hour in refrigerator.
Place reserved marinated pork trotter and marinade in mixing bowl, cook 60 min/100°C//speed .
Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 15 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork trotter and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C//speed . This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.

title: Sambhar (Vegetable Dhall)
ingredients: 5 dried chillies, soaked and deseeded, cut in 4 cm length
180 g toor dal, soaked for 6 hours, drained
330 g tomatoes (approx 3 tomatoes), cut in wedges
50 g carrots, cut in thin slices
150 g potatoes, cut in cubes (1 cm)
130 g brinjals, cut in thick strips
steps: Place garlic cloves and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dried chillies and cooking oil, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed 0.5.

Add sambhar powder, ground coriander, garam masala, mustard seeds, ground cumin and curry leaves, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 0.5. Meanwhile, mix 2 tsp tamarind paste and 2 tbsp water in a small bowl. Deseed and set aside.
Add asafoetida powder, toor dal, tomatoes, reserved tamarind-water mixture and 350 g water, cook 15 min/120°C//speed .
Add carrots and potatoes, cook 7 min/120°C//speed .
Add brinjals, cauliflower florets and salt, cook 7 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: Avoid adding spices onto the mixing knife blades.

Replace the carrots, potatoes, brinjals and cauliflower florets with any vegetables of your choice, cut in bite-sized pieces as needed. Add the longer-cooking vegetables (e.g. radishes, sweet potatoes, squash) in step 5, and faster-cooking vegetables (e.g. broccoli, ladies‘ fingers, green beans, snow peas, cherry tomatoes) in step 6.

title: Golden Sand Prawns (Salted Egg Prawns)
ingredients: 500 g prawns (approx. 10 prawns), whiskers removed, deveined, cleaned and patted dry with kitchen towels
50 g butter, softened at room temperature
3 - 5 red bird's eye chillies (chilli padi), sliced
10 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 250 g prawns, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 250 g prawns in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salted egg yolks and butter, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add curry leaves, chilli padi and rice wine, cook 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add sautéed prawns, salt and pepper, cook 30 sec/120°C/speed 1. Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Summer seafood soup
ingredients: 500 g winter melon, peeled, cut into pieces (3 cm)
150 g scallops, fresh, cut into cubes (1 cm)
150 g raw prawns, peeled, cut into cubes (1 cm)
10 g celery stalks, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place winter melon into mixing bowl, cook 12 min/100°C/speed 1.
Purée 30 sec/speed 5.
Add water and chicken stock powder, cook 13 min/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, mix cornflour and 2 tbsp water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add reserved cornflour mixture, cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add scallops, salt and white pepper powder, cook 2 min/100°C//speed .
Add prawns and beaten egg whites then cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Garnish with chopped celery and serve hot.

title: Stir Fried Prawns with Soy Sauce
ingredients: 10 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
2 sprigs spring onion, cut in 3 cm pieces
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place cooking oil, ginger slices and spring onions in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add prawns, salt, light soy sauce, rice wine and sugar, stir fry 10 min/Varoma//speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Traditionally, stir fried prawns are deep-fried with high heat. After cooking, the prawns are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. This recipe is cooked with less oil and low temperature, which is unique and healthier!

title: Thousand island dressing
steps: Place pickled cucumber, parsley leaves and eggs into mixing bowl, mix 6 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mayonnaise, mustard, pickled cucumber liquid, tomato ketchup, white pepper, salt, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco and mix 10 sec//speed 3. Use as desired.

title: Ikan Bilis Seasoning Powder
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in dried anchovies. Transfer on a baking tray. Bake in preheated oven (180°C) for 10 minutes until golden brown and crispy, set aside and cool for 20 minutes.
Place reserved dried anchovies in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10. Serve as seasoning powder or pour to airtight jars for storage up to 1 month.
tips: Use as umami seasoning powder for all savoury dishes.

title: Easy apple pie
ingredients: 400 g apples (e.g. Reinette), peeled, cored and cut into quarters
icing sugar to taste, for sprinkling
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a pie tray with removable bottom (Ø 24 cm approx.) with butter. Line with 4 overlapping sheets of filo pastry or one sheet of puff pastry.
Place milk, egg yolks, sugar and cornflour in mixing bowl and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl, let cool and pour over pastry. Sprinkle with cinnamon and set aside.
Place apples, lemon zest and lemon juice in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4. Remove, pour over cream and bake at 180°C for about 25 minutes or until golden. Serve warm sprinkled with icing sugar.
tips: Serve apple pie accompanied with a scoop of ice cream of your choice.
Serve apple pie accompanied with a scoop of ice cream of your choice.

title: Fish fingers with tomato sauce
ingredients: 500 g cod fillets, skinless and boneless, cut into sticks (2 x 6 cm) (see tip)
steps: Place beer, flour, garlic, parsley, yeast and ½ teaspoon of salt into mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer batter to a bowl and add cod fillets. Cover well with batter and let rest for 10 minutes. Clean the mixing bowl.

Place olive oil, tomato, salt, sugar and bicarbonate of soda into mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to facilitate evaporation and cook 15 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, heat oil in a non-stick pan and fry the fish fingers on each side until golden. Drain fish fingers on kitchen paper. Serve immediately with the tomato sauce.
tips: The batter can also be used to make fried onion rings: cut an onion into rings (5 mm), cover well in the mixture and fry in hot oil until golden.
The batter can also be used to make fried onion rings: cut an onion into rings (5 mm), cover well in the mixture and fry in hot oil until golden.
Instead of cod, any other type of white fish can be used to prepare fish fingers.
Instead of cod, any other type of white fish can be used to prepare fish fingers.

title: Soy bolognese
ingredients: ½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 ½ tsp basil, dried or fresh, finely chopped
steps: Place onion, garlic and carrot in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.

Add tomatoes, soy mince, water, tomato puree, salt, paprika, pepper, sugar, marjoram, basil and cinnamon, stir once with spatula. Place simmering basket on mixing bowl lid instead of measuring cupand cook 17 min/100°C//speed 2 garen. Season to taste and serve with pasta.

title: Penne pasta with tuna
ingredients: 1 oz olive oil, plus extra to cook pasta
450 g dried penne pasta or other short dried pasta
15 g fresh parsley (approx. 20 sprigs)  o 15 g fresh coriander (approx. 40 sprigs)
steps: Place water, 1 tsp salt and a splash of olive oil into mixing bowl and cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add pasta and cook with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, for time indicated on package/100°C//speed 1. Strain pasta through Varoma dish and set aside.
Place olive oil, onions, parsley and ½ tsp salt into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Sauté 7 min/Varoma/speed 1. Place dressing in a large serving bowl with reserved pasta.
Place undrained tuna in serving bowl with pasta and dressing and mix together with spatula. Serve immediately.

title: Chicken with Peppers
ingredients: 100 g onions, cut in halves, sliced (5 mm)
500 g chicken breast, cut in pieces (2 cm)
400 g mixed peppers, cut in pieces (2 cm)
200 g water, plus extra for cooking rice
1 tsp salt, plus extra for cooking rice
1 tsp chicken stock paste  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
20 g Turkish red pepper paste, mild (Biber salçası)  o 20 g tomato purée
steps: Place 20 g oil and onions in mixing bowl and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add 300 g chicken, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Meanwhile, place simmering basket in a large bowl.
Transfer chicken to simmering basket and drain meat juices into bowl.
Place 20 g oil and peppers in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .

Add water, tomatoes, remaining 200 g chicken, reserved meat juices, hot and sweet paprika, basil, oregano, salt pepper, stock paste and pepper paste, stir using spatula and cook 15 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, cook rice on the stove in a large pan of boiling, salted water as indicated on packet then, in a small bowl, mix cornstarch with 1-2 tbsp water until dissolved.
Add cornflour mixture and reserved browned chicken to mixing bowl and cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Season to taste and serve with the rice.

title: Pork Rib Soup With Dried Shiitake Mushroom And Bean Curd
ingredients: 60 g dried bean curd sticks, rinsed
500 g pork spare ribs, cut in pieces (4 cm)
1800 g water, plus some extra for soaking mushrooms
30 g Chinese red dates, pitted, rinsed
15 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Cover dried shiitake mushrooms and dried bean curd sticks with some water and soak to soften for at least 1 hour. Cut soaked bean curd sticks into long strips (approx. 15 cm) and set aside. Squeeze and cut soaked shiitake mushrooms into quarters. Reserve soaking water.
Place pork ribs and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch 5 min/100°C//speed . Empty mixing bowl and rinse pork ribs.
Place 1200 g water (including soaking water), blanched pork ribs, reserved shiitake mushrooms, red dates, longan and rice wine in mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /1 h 45 min/98°C.
Add reserved bean curd sticks and salt, cook 15 min/98°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Check packaging label or ask your retailer to make sure the dried bean curd sticks will not melt during cooking.
Replace pork ribs with boneless pork ribs for a lighter version of this soup.
Recipe contributed by Mavis Ong.

title: Thosai (Rice and Lentil Pancakes)
ingredients: 150 g urad dhall, soaked for 8 hours, drained (see tips)
300 g parboiled rice (idli or basmati), soaked for 8 hours, drained
steps: Place urad dhall, rice, cooked rice, fenugreek seeds, salt and water in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 10. Transfer to a thermal serving bowl. Leave at a warm place for 8 hours or overnight until the batter ferments and bubbles are forming (see tips).

Lightly grease a non-stick flat pan with ghee and heat over medium fire. Scoop batter with a small ladle into pan, twirl pan as you pour to cover base of pan completely. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until edges of thosai are light golden. Flip thosai over and cook for a further 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve warm.
tips: Serve warm with yoghurt, sambhar or chutney.
Soak urad dhall and rice in water 5 cm above the level of the dhall and rice for 8 hours or overnight.
Keep the container loosely closed while the batter is fermenting.

title: Orange Sorbet
ingredients: 200 g oranges (approx. 2 oranges), without skin or pips, cut in pieces
steps: Place caster sugar in mixing bowl, grind 5 sec/speed 10.
Add ice cubes, crush 30 sec/speed 10 while stirring with spatula, moving clockwise and anticlockwise.
Add oranges, mix 30 sec/speed 6 while stirring with spatula, moving closewise and anticlockwise. Serve immediately.

title: One Pot Chicken Rice
ingredients: 800 g whole chicken leg, cut in 5 pieces
steps: Place garlic, ginger, shallots and coriander roots in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, salt and chicken, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add water, cook 8 min/100°C//speed .

Transfer to a large bowl. Place half-cooked chicken and 600 g reserved chicken soup (see tips) back in mixing bowl. Add rice, start Rice Cooker . Let sit in mixing bowl for 5 minutes. Serve with remaining reserved chicken soup, salad, sliced tomato, sliced cucumber and chilli sauce (see tips).
tips: Chilli sauce: Place 5 bird’s eye chilies, 5 garlic gloves, 10 g ginger, 5 tbsp reserved chicken soup, 1 tbsp light soy sauce and 4 limau kasturi (juice only) in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10.
If jasmine rice is used for this recipe, place 500 g reserved chicken soup back in mixing bowl in step 4.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Sesame salmon and pea soup
ingredients: 20 g fresh ginger root, sliced (3 mm)
600 g fresh salmon fillets, skinless, cut in pieces (approx. 3 cm x 5 cm x 2 cm)  o 600 g frozen salmon fillets, skinless, thawed, cut in pieces (approx. 3 cm x 5 cm x 2 cm)
50 g microgreens  o 50 g lettuce, thinly sliced (5 mm)
steps: Place 10 g ginger and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add honey, sesame oil and soy sauce and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a large bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in salmon fillets, then stir well using spatula to combine. Set aside to marinate for 15 minutes.
Place Varoma lid upside down on work surface and place Varoma dish on it. Place marinated salmon in Varoma dish and on Varoma tray. Reserve marinade. Insert Varoma tray, close Varoma and set aside.
Place reserved marinade in mixing bowl, then reduce without measuring cup 5 min/115°C/speed 2. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add vegetable oil and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add frozen peas, water, coconut milk, vegetable stock paste, remaining 10 g ginger, salt and pepper. Set Varoma in position and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.
Insert measuring cup and blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Divide between 4 serving bowls and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.

Place microgreens on a serving plate. Place approx. 5-10 steamed salmon cubes in large bowl with honey mixture and slightly cover salmon with mixture. Place salmon on microgreens, repeat with remaining salmon. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and serve immediately with pea soup.

title: Tuna stew with potatoes
ingredients: 500 g albacore belly (skin and bones removed), cut in chunks  o 500 g tuna belly, cut in chunks
180 g green peppers, cut in pieces
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in albacore pieces. Remove and set aside.
Place garlic cloves, cumin and salt in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6.
Add fish stock and mix 30 sec/speed 8. Transfer to bowl with fish pieces.
Place oil, peppers and onion in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 4, then sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add tomatoes and sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add potatoes and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed .

Add 200 g reserved marinade. Line Varoma tray with baking paper and place fish pieces and remaining marinade on it. Close and set Varoma in position and steam 18 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma. Transfer stew to a deep serving dish and add fish pieces and cooking liquid. Mix and serve immediately.
tips: This recipe is typical of the city of Ceuta, where usually frigate mackerel is used instead of albacore (bonito).

title: Garlic chickpea breads (Panisses)
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for cooking
steps: Place garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and sauté without the measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water and heat 5 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add chickpea flour, 1 tbsp olive oil, salt and ground pepper and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula and mix the chickpea flour, if necessary.

Cook 8 min/110°C/speed 2.5, until the mixture thickens. Meanwhile line a baking tray with baking paper. Transfer mixture to prepared baking tray. Spread in an even layer (2 cm thick), cover with cling film and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Heat a frying pan with olive oil, cut the dough into 8 cm x 2 cm strips and brown them on all sides. Serve hot, with yoghurt sauce or a pepper compote.
tips: Panisses are a Provencal speciality. They are very versatile, and can be eaten as a snack, as an accompaniment to salad or soup, or as an appetizer before a meal. Serve Panisses with a dip such as aioli, or tapenade for an appetizer. They can be eaten on the go, as an accompaniment to a salad, or as an appetizer to a meal.
Place 60g fresh goat’s cheese, 125g plain yoghurt, 6 chopped fresh chives, salt and ground pepper in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Adjust seasoning to taste.

title: Beef chili with lemon feta
ingredients: 200 g Danish feta cheese, cut into pieces (2 cm)  o 200 g feta cheese, cut into pieces (2 cm)
½ - 1 red chilli, seeds removed, if preferred
1 - 1 ½ tsp fine salt, to taste
1000 - 1200 g beef sirloin, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
425 g canned kidney beans, rinsed and drained (weight is pre-draining)
2 - 3 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place lemon zest and black pepper into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and repeat grinding 10 sec/speed 9.

Add Danish feta, lemon juice and olive oil and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic, onion and chili into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, cumin, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, cinammon and coriander and sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add salt, tomato purée, tomatoes, tomato passata, sugar and beef and cook 15 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add kidney beans and cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Serve beef chili with lemon feta topping and garnish with coriander leaves.
tips: Serve beef chili with corn bread, crusty bread, rice or couscous and salad.

Danish feta is a smoother and creamier variety of the original Greek feta cheese, made from cow's milk. If Danish feta is unavailable, any type of feta can be used. The topping will have a crumbly texture, however.
Replace sirloin with 1000-1200 g beef mince, adding in batches of 200-300 g at a time.

title: Piña colada sorbet
ingredients: 500 g fresh pineapple, cut in into pieces (2 cm) (approx. 1 pineapple), frozen individually
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.

Add 500 g frozen pineapple flesh, cold coconut milk, lemon juice and rum and crush 20 sec/speed 6. Then mix 20 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula until creamy. If necessary, freeze for a further 20 minutes, divide into portions and serve immediately.
tips: Select a ripe, sweet pineapple for a particularly aromatic sorbet.Ready frozen pineapple pieces are available in well-stocked supermarkets.
Select a ripe, sweet pineapple for a particularly aromatic sorbet.
Ready frozen pineapple pieces are available in well-stocked supermarkets.

title: Cocktail Tropical with rum and passion fruit
ingredients: 200 g pineapple, cut in pieces, plus extra cut in slices (1 cm) to garnish
40 g passion fruit pulp, fresh (of 1 passion fruit)
steps: Place pineapple and ice cubes in mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 10.
Add rum, ginger ale and passion fruit pulp and blend 20 sec//speed 3.5. Divide ice cubes between 2 cocktail glasses, add cocktail mixture and serve immediately, garnished with pineapple slices.

title: Bean stew with meatballs
ingredients: 1 tbsp beef stock paste, homemade  o 1 beef stock cube (for 0.5 l)
500 g green beans, fresh or frozen (defrosted)
250 g sausage meat, ready seasoned (see tip)
250 g canned butter beans, drained (weight after draining)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place carrot, leek and celery in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add butter and sauté 2 min/120°C//speed .

Add potato, water, stock paste and savory. Place Varoma into position, weigh green beans into Varoma dish, close Varoma and steam 22 min/Varoma//speed . Meanwhile, roll sausage meat into little meatballs (Ø approx. 2 cm) and set aside.
Add meatballs and white beans to mixing bowl, place Varoma back into position and steam 5 min/Varoma//speed . Set Varoma aside.
Transfer green beans from Varoma to mixing bowl, add salt, pepper and parsley and mix 10 sec//speed 2 with aid of spatula. Season to taste, arrange on 4 plates and serve immediately.
tips: Instead of ready seasoned sausage meat use 250 g minced pork seasoned with 30 g finely chopped onion, 1 tsp fine salt, 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper and 1 pinch dried marjoram.

title: Arabian ice cream
ingredients: 3 mastic gum grains  o 1 sachet mastic gum powder
steps: Place sugar, salep powder and mastic gum kernels into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add milk and cook 15 min/90°C/speed 2.5.
Pour mixture into ice cubes tray or into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and allow to cool completely. Cover with cling film and freeze for at least 10 hours.

Place half of ice cream cubes (or if frozen in containers cut into pieces of 4 x 4 cm) into mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream into a bowl.
Place remaining ice-cream cubes into mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer into reserved bowl with ice cream and serve immediately.
tips: For a firmer consistency, place ice cream back in freezer for 15 minutes before serving.
Garnish with chopped green pistachios.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate or fruit sauce.

title: Carrot coriander soup and tikka salmon with steamed vegetables
ingredients: 450 g carrots, 150 g cut into slices (approx. |5 mm) and 300 g cut into chunks
½ - 1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
50 g butter, cut in pieces  o 50 g olive oil
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
2 sprigs fresh coriander, plus some extra leaves to garnish
steps: Weigh 150 g carrots slices and broccoli florets in Varoma dish.

Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish, line Varoma tray with baking paper and arrange salmon fillets on Varoma tray. Season with 1 pinch salt and ground pepper, spread 1 tsp tikka paste on top of each salmon fillet and set Varoma aside.
Place lentils, lemon zest and ginger into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 10.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Chop again 10 sec/speed 10.
Add 300 g carrots chunks, onions, garlic, and butter, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, stock paste, ½-1 tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper, place Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm.

Add coriander and milk and blend soup 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve the soup hot, garnished with some coriander leaves and a swirl of cream. Garnish the salmon tikka with remaining coriander leaves, finely cut, and serve with steamed vegetables on side.
tips: Replace vegetables with any other vegetables of your choice that cook in the same time. Replace salmon with other fish fillets of your choice.

title: Okra and meat stew (bamia)
ingredients: 1000 g fresh okra, stem ends removed
300 g beef, cut into cubes (3 cm)
steps: Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in okra, drizzle with vinegar and set aside.
Place garlic, onions, coriander and olive oil into mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5, then sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add beef, salt, pepper and sauté 10 min/120°C/speed .
Add chopped tomatoes and tomato puree. Place Varoma into position and steam 30 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma.
Add steamed okra into mixing bowl, gently mix with spatula and cook 2 min/Varoma/speed . Transfer into a deep serving dish and serve hot.
tips: Traditionally okra without meat is served cold while okra with meat is served hot.
Serve with rice or pilaf.
If frozen okra is used, steaming time in step 4 may be reduced.
Vegetarian okra stew: avoid meat and skip step 3, adding salt and pepper at step 4.

title: Lamb meatballs in spicy tomato sauce (lamb kofta)
ingredients: 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
2 fresh green chillies, cut into halves and deseeded
900 g ripe tomatoes, cut into quarters
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Grease Varoma dish and tray.
Place garlic, onions, parsley, mint and coriander into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add Arabian spice mix, sumac, salt, pepper and lamb mince and mix 30 sec//speed 3. Transfer to a bowl, with oiled hands, shape small meatballs (Ø 3 cm) and place them into prepared Varoma dish and tray. Set aside.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in rice. Transfer to a sieve and rinse under running water. Transfer rice back to bowl with enough water to cover the rice and set aside to soak. Meanwhile continue with recipe.
Place coriander seeds into clean and dry mixing bowl and dry roast 3 min/120°C/speed 1, then grind 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onions and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved ground coriander seeds and cook 1 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add chillies, tomatoes, vegetable stock paste, oregano, salt and pepper and chop 30 sec/speed 6.

Insert simmering basket with soaked rice, add water and mix with aid of spatula. Place Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 4. Set Varoma aside, remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, transfer rice into a bowl and moisture the rice by adding 200 g of cooking liquid from the mixing bowl. Mix gently with a fork and set aside.
Place closed Varoma back into position and steam 7 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside.

Add cornflour into mixing bowl and reduce sauce 3 min/Varoma/speed 2, without measuring cup. Transfer meatballs to a serving dish, pour remaining sauce on top and garnish with finely chopped fresh coriander. Serve warm with reserved rice.

title: Pulut Inti (Glutinous Rice With Sweet Coconut)
ingredients: 400 g Thai glutinous rice, soaked for 2 hours, rinsed
1 banana leaf, cut in 12 pieces (each 14 cm x 16 cm)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, insert a baking tin (Ø 15 cm), weigh in glutinous rice. Add pandan leaves, close Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3.5.

Carefully open Varoma lid, weigh in coconut milk, add salt then mix with spatula, close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.5 or until translucent. Remove Varoma and set aside. Divide sweet coconut filling into 12 equal portions.

Carefully open Varoma lid, divide steamed glutinous rice into 12 equal portions. Place 1 portion glutinous rice onto a banana leaf and shape it slightly like a cone. Place 1 portion sweet coconut filling onto rice and wrap into parcel. Repeat the steps for remaining rice and filling until finished. Unwrap parcel before serving.
tips: Steamed glutinous rice can be firmly pressed into small teacups. Unmould upon serving and garnish with sweet coconut filling.

title: Pork Belly In Shrimp Paste
ingredients: 300 g pork belly, with skin, patted dry with kitchen towels, cut in pieces (2 cm x 1 cm)
20 g shredded dried cuttlefish, approx. 5 cm long
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place 10 g cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pork pieces, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 20 g cooking oil, ginger, cuttlefish and chilli, sauté without measuring cup 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add rice wine, shrimp paste and reserved pork, cook 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add water, cook without measuring cup 30 min/110°C//speed , then cook without measuring cup 5 min/Varoma//speed  . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Ginger Tea Paste
steps: Place old ginger in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add molasses sugar, cook 30 min/100°C/speed 2. Pour ginger paste into jars. Mix 100 g ginger paste to 1000 g hot water or beverage of your choice to form ginger tea. Serve hot.
tips: Longan red date ginger tea preparation: place 300 g of old ginger, 150 g of dried longans and 150 g of dried red dates in step 1 to chop. Add 300 g of molasses sugar in step 2.

title: Christmas Berry Trifle
steps: Place 100 g ladyfingers in mixing bowl, crush 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining ladyfingers in mixing bowl, crush 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with crushed sponge fingers and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place milk, egg yolk, sugar, salt, vanilla essence and corn flour in mixing bowl, cook 7 min/90°C//speed 3. Transfer custard to a bowl and leave to cool for at least 30 minutes.
Place strawberries, raspberries and lemon juice in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sugar, water and agar-agar powder, cook 7 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl then place in refrigerator for approx. 3 hours (see tip). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place sugar in mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert butterfly whisk, add cream, whip 50 sec/speed 4, until medium peaks form, watching carefully to avoid overwhipping.
Add mascarpone cheese and reserved vanilla custard, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer mascarpone mixture to a piping bag and set aside.

Place 1 heaped tbsp crushed ladyfingers in a glass, then top with 1 tbsp berry coulis. Use piping bag to pipe a layer of mascarpone cream. Place another heaped tbsp crushed sponge fingers, then another 1 tbsp berry coulis. Pipe a mascarpone cream swirl, then top with crushed cream crackers and some mint leaves to decorate. Place in refrigerator until ready to serve.
tips: Berry sauce in steps 4 and 5 can be made up to 2 days in advance and stored in refrigerator until ready to use.
For the best flavour and texture, make sure you scoop out a spoonful of each layer's filling and serve.

title: Three-in-One Meal (Rice, Steamed Egg and Dang Gui Chicken)
ingredients: 500 g boneless chicken leg (approx. 1 leg), cut to 2 cm strips
10 g dried black fungus, soaked to soften
5 jujube red dates, pitted, cut in halves
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)  o 1 tbsp mirin
1 tsp light soy sauce, to drizzle
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken pieces, black fungus and ginger slices. Add garlic slices, goji berries, red dates, dang gui slices, light soy sauce, salt, sesame oil and rice wine to it. Mix and marinate for 1 hour in refrigerator. Transfer marinated chicken into a steaming dish (Ø 15 cm). Arrange in Varoma dish. Set aside.
Place a jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh in water and set aside. Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs and salt in mixing bowl, beat 10 sec/speed 3.

Beat without measuring cup 10 sec/speed 3. Meanwhile, add water through hole of mixing bowl lid. Arrange another steaming dish on Varoma tray. Pour egg mixture into it and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Insert simmering basket, weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket and rinse rice with running water. Let rice drain in simmering basket and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with rice, set prepared Varoma dish and Varoma tray into position. Close Varoma lid, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 4. Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with spatula, transfer steamed rice to a thermal serving bowl to keep warm. Carefully open Varoma lid, drizzle light soy sauce on each steamed egg. Sprinkle chopped coriander on steamed dang gui chicken to garnish. Serve hot.

title: Lemongrass Tempeh
ingredients: 250 g tempeh (approx 2 pieces tempeh), cut in chunks (2-3 cm)
60 g fresh lemongrass, white part only, cut in thin slices (0.5 cm)
½ fresh red chilli, chopped, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in tempeh and 50 g lemongrass. Add soy sauce, mirin and sesame oil to the bowl. Mix well and marinate for 1 hour at room temperature.
Place water and 10 g lemongrass in mixing bowl, boil 2 min/Varoma/speed .

Add reserved tempeh and marinade, without measuring cup, stir fry 5 min/Varoma//speed . Add cold pressed sesame oil to mixing bowl and mix well with spatula. Garnish with chopped chilli and serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Bamia (Okra Lamb Stew)
ingredients: 200 g yellow onions, cut in quarters
3 sprigs fresh coriander, roots and leaves separated, chopped
450 g tomatoes (approx. 4 tomatoes), cut in cubes (1 cm)
600 g lamb shoulder, cut in cubes (5 cm)
300 g baby okra, frozen  o 300 g ladies' fingers, stems trimmed off
steps: Place black peppercorns, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cinnamon stick and cloves in clean and dry mixing bowl, dry roast without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Let cool for 5 minutes.
Grind 2 min/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place yellow onions, garlic cloves and coriander roots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tomatoes and cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add lamb shoulder cubes, tomato purée, hot water and reserved spice mixture, start Slow Cook /1 h/98°C.
Add salt, lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves, cook 8 min/Varoma//speed .
Add baby okra, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Serunding Udang Kering (Dried Shrimp Floss)
ingredients: 50 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
7 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place grated coconut, dried shrimp, dried chillies, lemongrass, shallots, garlic cloves, ground coriander, ground cumin and ground fennel in mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, preheat oven to 150°C.

Transfer mixture to a baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes (150°C) until it becomes dry. Toss the mixture for an even colour and dried texture if necessary. Use as filling or transfer to a jar and store in refrigerator.

title: Daging Kicap Meletup (Spicy Soy Beef)
ingredients: 20 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
1000 g beef, cut in 0.5-1 cm thickness
steps: Place dried chillies, garlic, shallots, ginger, tomatoes and lemongrass in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and ghee, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add coconut milk, light soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, dark soy sauce, tomato sauce and chilli sauce, simmer 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add sliced beef, cook 20 min/Varoma//speed 
Add ground black pepper, onions and bird's eye chillies, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed . Serve immediately.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Hot and Sour Pineapple Rice
ingredients: 250 g medium-sized prawns, cleaned and deveined, patted dry
3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, bruised
100 g fresh pineapples, cut in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm)
4 tbsp nam prik pao (Thai chilli paste)
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns. Add 1 tbsp fish sauce, mix and set aside.

Place 30 g cooking oil and marinated prawns in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Transfer cooked prawns to serving bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and yellow onions in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add green capsicum and red capsicum, chop 3 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemongrass and 30 g cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add basmati rice, pineapple cubes, water, Thai chilli paste, 1 tbsp fish sauce, sugar, salt and chilli powder, start Rice Cooker .
Add reserved prawns to mixing bowl, mix well with spatula. Let stand for 15 minutes. Transfer to serving bowl. Squeeze lime juice all over cooked rice and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Cynthia Wong.

title: One Pot Noodles
ingredients: 4 bird's eye chillies, adjust to taste
100 g carrots (cut in 1 cm x 5 cm lengthwise)
300 - 340 g flat rice stick noodles (mee lidi)
150 g fish cakes, cut in small pieces
steps: Place garlic and bird's eye chillies in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sesame oil and sliced beef, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce and white pepper powder, simmer 6 min/70°C/speed 1.
Add carrots and noodles through hole in mixing bowl lid, cook without measuring cup 8 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add choy sum and fish cakes, cook 2 min 30 sec/Varoma//speed 1. Let rest in mixing bowl for 2 minutes before serving. Serve warm.
tips: Saltiness may vary slightly depending on the type of soy sauce used.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Cantonese Steamed Fish
ingredients: 1 pomfret fish (approx 600 g), descaled and gutted, scored
2 sprigs spring onions, tied into knots, plus extra thinly sliced for garnishing
1 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao) (opcional)
1 fresh red chilli, deseeded, thinly sliced, to garnish
steps: Place soy sauce, 70 g water, sugar and coriander roots in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/110°C//speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Arrange fish on a steaming tray (Ø 20 cm). Stuff fish with spring onions and ginger slices. Drizzle with rice wine. Insert steaming tray with fish in Varoma dish.
Place 700 g water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/100°C/speed 1.

Set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Prolong cooking time if necessary. Carefully open Varoma lid, discard steaming juice. Drizzle reserved soy sauce over steamed fish. Garnish with coriander leaves, spring onion slices, shallot oil and chilli slices. Serve hot.
tips: When selecting the tray to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); ensure the size of tray is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
To check whether the fish is cooked, its eye should pop out. The flesh should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks.

title: Ngo Hiang (Five Spice Meat Rolls)
steps: Place water chestnuts in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 3.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place prawn flesh in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
