Add reserved water chestnuts, minced pork, egg, plain flour, light soy sauce, chopped spring onions, white pepper powder, five spice powder and sesame oil, knead Dough /40 sec.

Using a clean damp cloth, wipe both sides of bean curd skins. Cut bean curd skins into squares (18 cm x 18 cm). Divide meat mixture into 10 equal portions. Place a portion of meat mixture on the lower center of bean curd skin. Leave about 1.5 cm on both sides and roll it up. Seal both ends with some water. Repeat with remaining meat mixture and bean curd skins until finished and place in Varoma dish and Varoma tray. Close Varoma lid and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer bean curd rolls to a serving plate. Let cool completely.
Preheat cooking oil in a deep fryer to 190°C (see tips). Place bean curd rolls carefully into hot oil. Fry bean curd rolls in batches of 2-3 for 3-5 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.
tips: If a deep fryer is not available, heat oil in a frying pan, using a food thermometer to check the temperature reaches 190°C.
Recipe contributed by Jenny Chan.

title: Garlic soup
ingredients: 1 tbsp paprika  o 1 tbsp smoked paprika
steps: Place garlic and oil in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7.
Add ham and sauté without measuring cup 8 min/120°C/speed .
Add paprika and sauté 30 sec/120°C/speed .
Add water and stock cubes and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1. Add eggs through hole in mixing bowl lid and mix 5 sec/speed 2.
Add bread and mix 2 sec//speed 4. Let stand for a few minutes in mixing bowl, then serve hot.
tips: Garlic soup, "sopa de ajo" or "sopa castellana" in Spanish, is a traditional winter soup that comes in many regional variations. Only a few simple ingredients are used to prepare this hearty and rustic soup.

title: Potato and pork rib stew (patatas guisadas con costillas adobadas)
ingredients: 100 g green peppers, cut in pieces (4 cm)
100 g red peppers, cut in pieces (4 cm)
900 g pork ribs, seasoned with paprika, cut in 5 cm pieces (see tip)
1000 g potatoes, peeled and cut in pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place garlic, onion, green and red pepper and oil in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5, then sauté 10 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add pork ribs and sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .

Add paprika, 150 g potatoes, bay leaf, salt, nutmeg and cumin and fill with water up to the 2 litre fill level mark. Place Varoma in position and weigh in remaining 850 g potatoes. Close Varoma and steam 35 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and transfer potatoes to a soup tureen. Add stewed pork ribs and mix well with spatula. Serve hot.
tips: "Costillas adobadas" are pre-marinated pork ribs readily available in supermarkets and butcher shops throughout Spain. You can easily make your own marinade with a mixture of paprika, oregano, garlic power, olive oil and a splash of red wine. Allow ribs to marinate for a few hours. Alternatively, use any type of marinated pork ribs.
Ask your butcher to cut pork ribs in smaller pieces for you.

title: Gruyerè and black olive breads (Olivettes)
ingredients: 150 g Gruyère cheese, cut in pieces
15 g fresh yeast  o 1 ½ tsp dried instant yeast
350 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
1 egg, beaten with a little salt
steps: Place Gruyère cheese in mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water, olive oil and yeast in mixing bowl and mix 3 sec/speed 5.
Add plain flour and salt and knead 2 min/. Meanwhile dust a bowl with flour.
Add 50 g reserved grated Gruyère and olives and knead 30 sec/. Transfer to prepared bowl. Cover with cling film and allow to rise in a warm place for approx. 30 minutes or until double in size.
Preheat oven to 210°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper.

When the dough has doubled in size, transfer to a lightly floured work surface. Knock it back firmly with the hands to let the gas escape. Divide the dough into 6 equal pieces. Shape into long loaf shapes, approx. 25 cm in length. Arrange on the prepared baking trays and cover with a tea towel. Allow to rise for approx. 30 minutes.
Brush the olivettes with beaten egg-salt mixture and sprinkle with the rest of the reserved grated Gruyère. Bake for 15 minutes (210°C). Serve the olivettes warm or at room temperature.
tips: Olivettes are very nice with a simple Provencal olive oil as an appetiser
The olivettes can be stored in an airtight container for up to one week
Sprinkle with 25g pumpkin seeds before baking

title: Asian vegetable soup with tofu
ingredients: 15 g fresh coriander leaves  o 15 g fresh parsley leaves
100 g tofu, plain, drained and diced (2 cm)
100 g daikon radish, cut into pieces
30 g fresh ginger root, thinly sliced
2 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade, vegan (see tip)  o 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l), vegan
100 g spring onions, cut into diagonal rings
100 g snow peas, cut in half
100 g thin wheat noodles, broken into pieces  o 100 g rice noodles, broken into pieces
steps: Place coriander in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 7 and transfer to a bowl.
Mix coriander in bowl with 2 tbsp soy sauce and 10 g sesame oil. Add tofu and allow to marinate for at least 1 hour.
Place carrots and daikon into mixing bowl, chop 8 sec/speed 4.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 20 g sesame oil and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, stock paste, carrot and daikon mixture and spring onions, and cook 15 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add snow peas and noodles and cook for time indicated on packet/100°C//speed 1.
Season soup to taste with remaining 3 tbsp soy sauce, vinegar, agave syrup, salt and pepper. Transfer to 6 soup bowls, garnish with marinated tofu and serve.
tips: Prepare the vegetable stock paste featured in The Basic Cook Book without parmesan and with vegan wine for a vegan variation of this paste.
Use rice vinegar to create a particularly exotic dish.

title: 'Qamar el-din' juice
ingredients: 300 g qamar el-din cut into small pieces (see tip)
pine nuts, soaked in water for garnish (opcional)
steps: Place ice cubes, qamar el-din, sugar, rose water and blossom water into mixing bowl and blend 2 min/speed 4-8, increasing speed gradually.
Add water and blend 1 min/speed 9 (see tip). Pour into glasses and garnish with pine nuts (optional).
tips: Qamar el-din is sun-dried apricot paste sold widely in Middle Eastern supermarkets. This juice is traditionally used to break the fast during the month of Ramadan. Qamar el-din can be replaced by dried apricots.
For a thinner consistency, before serving, add 500 g water and mix 10 sec/speed 4.

Dried apricot juice: place 300 g dried apricots in mixing bowl with 700 g water and heat 7 min/100°C/speed 2 then blend 1 min/speed 10.  Add ice cubes, sugar, rose water, blossom water and mix 1 min/speed 9. Serve.

title: Biscuits with date, pistachio and cardamom filling
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid, weigh water into it and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 1.
Add flour, baking powder, salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again 4 sec/speed 4. The mixture should look like bread crumbs.

Mix speed 3 while slowly pouring reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to obtain a soft buttery dough. Transfer dough onto a piece of cling film and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place pistachio nuts into clean and dry mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 7.
Add butter, dates, cardamom and mix 8 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a work surface, divide filling into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a thin string (approx. 20 cm long) and set aside.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Divide dough into 4 equal pieces and using a rolling pin, roll out each piece on a lightly floured surface or silicon mat, shaping dough into a rectangle (20 cm x 7 cm and ½ cm thick). Place date paste string in the middle and roll the dough around it to enclose. Transfer the rolls to prepared baking tray keeping the seam at the bottom, brush with an egg beaten with water and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 10-15 minutes (200°C) or until lightly golden.
Allow date rolls to cool down and then cut gently diagonally with a bread knife into pieces (approx. 1.5 cm). Serve as desired.
tips: Serve with coffee or tea.
The filling can also be used to fill maamoul.

title: Spiced rice pudding (meghli)
ingredients: 200 g Egyptian rice  o 200 g short-grain rice
1300 g water or meghli water (see tip)
unsalted pistachio nuts, chopped, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place rice into mixing bowl and grind 2 min/speed 10.
Insert butterfly whisk, add cinnamon, caraway, water, mix 10 sec/speed 2.5, and then cook 30 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add sugar and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1. While the mixture is still hot, pour into small individual bowls and set aside to cool down. Sprinkle with 1 tbsp desiccated coconut and garnish with mixed nuts, almonds and pistachio nuts before serving.
tips: For extra flavour, replace water with Meghli water: place 2000 g water, 5 cinnamon sticks, 2 whole nutmeg seeds, 2 pieces of fresh ginger and 10 cloves into mixing bowl and cook 60 min/100ºC/speed 1. Add 1 tbsp aniseed, 1 tbsp ground cinnamon, 1 tbsp ground caraway, stir with spatula and leave it to infuse. When cooled down, strain it. Omit the extra tablespoon ground cinnamon in the main recipe if using meghli water.

title: Cheese sambousek
ingredients: 110 g akkawi cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)  o 110 g mozzarella, cut into pieces (3 cm)
110 g Gruyère cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place flour, butter, oil, water and salt into mixing bowl and knead 1 min 30 sec/. Transfer into a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside for at least 1 hour.
Place Akkawi cheese and Gruyère cheese into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6.
Add eggs, parsley, pepper and nutmeg and mix 15 sec/speed 5.

Divide reserved dough into 4 equal pieces. On a lightly floured surface, with the aid of a rolling pin, roll-out each piece of dough (2 mm thick). With a cookie cutter (Ø 7-8 cm) cut dough into circles. Place in the centre of each circle ½ tsp filling and fold one side over the filling to shape crescents. Seal the edges by twisting them or pressing with a fork.

Pour sunflower oil into a non-stick pan for deep frying and heat. Deep fry sambousek in small batches until golden and transfer into Varoma tray lined with paper towel to absorb excess oil. Serve hot.

title: Daging Goreng Berempah (Stir Fried Spicy Beef)
ingredients: 350 g beef tenderloin, cut in thin slices
2 garlic cloves, cut in thin slices
150 g yellow onion, cut in thin slices
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in beef. Add salt and ground turmeric to the bowl. Mix and set aside.
Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds and fennel seeds in clean and dry mixing bowl, dry roast without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Let cool for 3 minutes.
Grind 1 min/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, garlic slices and reserved beef, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add onion, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Crispy Garlic Slices and Garlic Oil
steps: Place cooking oil and garlic slices in mixing bowl, making sure that they are evenly distributed in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start High Temp. . Strain fried garlic slices with a fine mesh strainer immediately to stop browning. Let cool completely. Serve as condiment or transfer to airtight jar (250 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ellin Chong.

title: Traditional Chinese Peanut Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in peanuts. Spread peanuts in single layer on baking tray, bake on middle rack for 20-22 minutes (170°C) or until golden brown. Set aside to cool completely (approx. 20 minutes).
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in peanut oil and set aside. Place cooled roasted peanuts in mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add plain flour, icing sugar and salt, mix without measuring cup 30 sec/speed 4. Meanwhile, add reserved peanut oil through hole of mixing bowl lid. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Take 1 spoonful of dough, press until firm and shape gently into a ball. Place dough balls slightly apart on prepared baking tray.

Lightly press dough balls with the narrow end of a funnel to create small circles. Mix water and egg yolk in a small bowl, then strain through a small sieve. Using a pastry brush, glaze dough balls with egg yolk mixture.
Bake on middle rack for 20 minutes (170°C) until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container.
tips: Recipe contributed by Cecilia Lim.

title: Salted Vegetables Duck Soup
ingredients: 800 g duck, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
50 g salted vegetables (hum choi), rinsed, soaked for 30 minutes, cut in pieces (2 cm)
3 sour plums in brine, drained, pits removed
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place duck, fresh ginger, salted vegetables, tomatoes, sour plums and water in mixing bowl, cook Slow Cook /2 h/98°C. Add salt to season. Serve hot.

title: Ginger Pork
ingredients: 300 g pork tenderloins, cut in thin slices
20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place shredded ginger and sesame oil in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, cook 10 min/120°C/speed .
Add pork slices, dark soy sauce, sugar and salt, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed .
Add rice wine, cook 1 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Tiger Shaped Pineapple Tarts
ingredients: 1500 g fresh pineapples (Josaphine and Morris), peeled, eyes and core removed, cut in cubes (3 cm)
300 g unsalted butter, cold, cut in cubes (1 cm)
9 - 10 drops food colouring paste, pink, red, yellow, green and black
steps: Place pineapples in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Drain pineapples with Varoma dish to discard excess liquid.

Place pineapple pulp, sugar and cinnamon stick in mixing bowl, placing Varoma dish without lid instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 30 min/120°C/speed 2. Then cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2, prolong cooking time if necessary until desired texture achieved. Transfer to a bowl and let cool completely. Divide pineapple jam into small balls (16 g each). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place lump sugar in mixing bowl, pulverise 10 sec/speed 10.
Add plain flour, low protein flour, milk powder and cornflour, mix Turbo/1 sec/2 times.
Add butter, egg yolks, vanilla extract and salt, mix 20 sec/speed 6 until soft dough formed.

Mix 20 g dough with 1 drop of pink food colouring, 20 g with 1 drop of yellow food colouring, 20 g with 1-2 drops of red food colouring, 10 g with 1 drop of green food colouring and 5 g with 1 drop of black food colouring respectively. Set aside 30 g plain dough as white dough, mix remaining dough with 3-4 drops of orange food colouring to create orange-coloured dough.

Line a baking tray with baking paper. To form tigers, roll orange dough into small balls (20 g each), flatten into round discs and fill center with reserved pineapple jam balls. Wrap into egg shapes. Use orange dough to form legs, pink dough to form ears, white dough to form nose pads and bellies, red dough to form tongues and red paper. Yellow dough to form pineapples and gold ingots, green dough to form leaves. Arrange tiger-shaped cookies on baking tray. Repeat steps for remaining dough and pineapple jam balls until finished. Preheat oven to 150°C.

Baked on middle rack for 20 minutes (150°C). Transfer to a cooling rack and let cool completely. Using an edible food pen, draw face features, tiger stripes and blessed work signs on each cookie before serving.
tips: Recipe contributed by Nicole Oh.

title: Dwaejibukgogi (Korean BBQ Marinade)
ingredients: 125 g Asian pear (singo pear), core removed, cut into quarters
3 g fresh ginger, cut into slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place pear in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place onions, garlic cloves, ginger, chopped spring onion, light soy sauce, brown sugar, ground black pepper, sesame oil and gochujang, start Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved chopped pear, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Use as BBQ marinade for grilled or pan-fried meat or transfer to 1 airtight jar (250 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.
tips: This recipe can be used to marinate 500 g meat (chicken, pork or beef) or vegetables (e.g. mushrooms, brinjals, squash etc).

title: Roti Sarang Lebah (Honeycomb Buns)
ingredients: 50 g virgin coconut oil, plus extra for greasing
100 g whipping cream  o 80 g fresh milk
steps: Place water, yeast, sugar and coconut oil in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add plain flour and plain yoghurt, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Then knead 4 min/. Grease round baking tray (Ø 20 cm) with coconut oil and set aside. Transfer dough to a large bowl, cover with damp kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes).

Divide dough into 16 equal balls (approx. 30 g each), place them on prepared greased baking tray. Cover with damp kitchen towel and let rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (45 minutes to 1 hour). Preheat oven to 180°C.
Bake for 25 minutes (180°) or until golden brown. Allow to cool on a cooling rack.
Place brown sugar, butter and whipping cream in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Drizzle sauce over baked buns and serve immediately.

title: White Chocolate Cheesecake Stuffed Strawberries
steps: Pat dry strawberries with kitchen paper towels. Cut the top (leaves) off of each strawberry. Use a piping bag nozzle (Ø 3 cm) to carefully hollow out centre of strawberries.
Slice off a bit of the tip of each strawberry so it can stand up, stand to dry on a paper towel.
Place white chocolate chips in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Then melt 2 min/50°C/speed .

Add cream cheese, whipping cream, lemon juice and vanilla extract, mix 2 min/speed 4. Transfer to a piping bag with nozzle (ø 3 cm). Fill each strawberry with cheesecake mixture. Place finished strawberries on a serving tray. Serve immediately.

title: Bee Hive Cake
ingredients: 100 g gula Melaka, shaved  o 100 g gula apong
50 g butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place low protein flour and baking soda in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/1 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place gula Melaka, caster sugar and 80 g water in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages .
Add hot water and butter, cook 3 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to another bowl and set aside let it completely cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs in mixing bowl, whisk 20 sec/speed 3. Meanwhile, grease a round cake tin (Ø 17 cm).
Add condensed milk, reserved flour mixture and cooled sugar syrup, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Mix 10 sec/speed 3. Let rest in mixing bowl for 90 minutes. Pour batter in prepared round cake tin and wrap with aluminium foil to prevent steaming water drip into the cake. Place in Varoma dish. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 1400 g water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C. Set closed Varoma into position, steam 50 min/Varoma/speed 3. Let cool completely on a cooling rack before slicing and serving.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Pumpkin Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: 200 g fresh pumpkin flesh, cut into cubes (2 cm)
steps: Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases. Place 300 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add pumpkin cubes to it, steam 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Check if pumpkin is soft, prolong steaming time by 10-15 minutes if necessary. Remove simmering basket with spatula and set aside to cool completely (approx. 20 minutes). Empty mixing bowl.
Place 50 g caster sugar, 50 g rice flour, 60 g water and dried yeast powder in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 3. Let mixing bowl stand for 10 minutes.
Add 150 g caster sugar and 180 g water, mix 30 sec/speed 5.

Add 200 g rice flour, 100 g plain flour, baking powder and reserved steamed pumpkin, mix 30 sec/speed 5. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and arrange in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, boil 6 min/Varoma/speed 3. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Sichuan Chilli Oil
steps: Place dried bird’s eye chillies and dried chillies in clean and dry mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/2 sec/4 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place canola oil, star anise, cinnamon sticks, cao guo and bay leaves in mixing bowl, cook 20 min/120°C/speed 0.5. Carefully discard spices.
Add reserved chillies, cook 15 min/120°C/speed .
Add sesame seeds, cook 5 min/120°C/speed . Serve as condiment or dipping sauce or pour into a jar and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Replace dried bird’s eye chillies and dried chillies with store-bought chilli powder, adjust spiciness according to your preference.
Add some sesame oil and chopped coriander to the chilli oil before serving.

title: Provençal tart
ingredients: 250 g wheat flour, plus extra for dusting
125 g butter, salted, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
½ tsp herbes de Provence, dried
steps: Place flour, butter, water, salt, egg, herbes de Provence and Espelette pepper in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a surface and shape it into a flattened ball. Cover with cling film and refrigerate for 10 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a loose-based tart tin (Ø 25 cm).

Roll out the pastry on a floured work surface and line the prepared tin with the shortcrust pastry. Prick the pastry with a fork, cover with baking paper and place baking beans or dried beans on top. Bake 10 minutes (180°C). Meanwhile continue with the recipe.
Cut aubergines, courgettes, carrots and red pepper in thin strips (approx. 3-4 mm thick and 3 cm long), using a mandoline or a sharp knife.
Place mustard, green olives, egg, milk, cream, salt and ground pepper in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to pre-cooked tart base.

Arrange on the tart the strips of aubergine and courgette (skin side uppermost) and carrot in circles, starting at the edge and working inwards. Intersperse these with the strips of pepper until all are used up. Bake for 35 minutes (180°C). Serve hot or cold.
tips: Aubergines are widely used in Provence, and cooked in many ways, this is one of the most innovative
This tart makes a really attractive centrepiece on a buffet
Replace the mustard with 80 g of wholegrain mustard.

title: Yellow rice with chicken
ingredients: 500 g chicken thigh, skinless, boneless, diced.
170 g green pepper, cut into strips (approx. 2 x 3 cm)
170 g red pepper, cut into strips (approx. 2 x 3 cm)
½ tsp food colouring, yellow (see tip)
steps: Place olive oil and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add green and red pepper and sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add chicken broth, paprika, yellow colouring and salt and cook 9 min/Varoma//speed .
Add rice and cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add peas through hole in the mixing bowl lid and heat 3 min/100°C//speed 1.
Pour into a serving dish, leave to stand for 3 minutes and serve immediately.
tips: You can use 1/2 tsp of Kurkuma instead of food colouring.

title: Salmon and coleslaw filling for sandwiches
ingredients: 250 g Chinese cabbage, cut into pieces
300 g smoked salmon, cut into strips
steps: Place a jug onto the mixing bowl lid, weigh oil into jug and set aside.

Place egg, salt, pepper, mustard, ketchup, lemon juice and chilli powder into mixing bowl. Mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 while very slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer mayonaise to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place coriander and cabbage into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Place carrots and radish in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with cabbage, mix with 180 g mayonnaise and salmon. Fill baguettes with salmon filling and sprinkle with hazelnuts (optional). Cut baguette into pieces and serve fresh.
tips: Use left over mayonnaise for salads or dips.
Use left over mayonnaise for salads or dips.

title: Demo Recipe - Isaac
ingredients: 400 - 500 g mixed frozen red berries or other frozen fruit of your choice, in pieces (3-4 cm)
120 g milk, plus extra for brushing
50 g mixed whole nuts, chopped  o 50 g chorizo, sliced
½ fresh chilli, finely chopped (1 mm)
400 g feta cheese, in pieces (4 cm)
50 g olive oil, plus extra for sprinkling
40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)
320 g risotto rice (e.g. Carnaroli, Arborio), 14-15 minutes cooking time (see tip)
1 stock cube (for 0.5 l), meat or vegetable  o 1 heaped tsp stock paste, homemade
½ - 1 tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl then start Blend /10 sec.

Add lemons and water then, holding measuring cup in place, crush Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place using spatula then strain lemonade into a jug. Serve immediately. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place sugar in mixing bowl then start Blend /10 sec.
Add mixed frozen red berries and lemon juice, then start Blend /45 sec.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add egg whites then whisk 1 min/speed 4.
Add milk and whisk 30 sec/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Divide between the 4 glasses and serve immediately. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place milk, yeast, oil, egg and sugar in mixing bowl then start Warm Up /37°C/speed 2.
Add flour and salt then start Dough /30 sec. Meanwhile, line a baking sheet with baking paper and set aside.
Add nuts and start Dough /30 sec. Tip out dough onto work surface then shape into a ball and set aside.

Put water and a small drop of washing-up liquid in mixing bowl then start Pre-clean /Quick. Meanwhile, press dough with open hands, rolling it onto the work surface into a log approx. 20-22 cm long, and exerting more pressure on the extremities. Brush surface with milk using a pastry brush then place on prepared tray.
Place tray in cold oven then set thermostat to 180ºC and bake for 30-35 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack before slicing and serving.
Place garlic and chilli in mixing bowl then chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add feta cheese and paprika then mix 3 sec/speed 5.

Add yoghurt, lemon juice and olive oil then mix 3 sec//speed 5. Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and sprinkle with olive oil and freshly ground pepper. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 3 days. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place shallot in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 20 g butter and extra virgin olive oil then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add risotto rice and sauté without measuring cup 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add dry white wine and cook without measuring cup 1 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add water, stock cube and salt then scrape bottom of mixing bowl thoroughly with spatula to loosen rice. Place simmering basket on mixing bowl lid and cook 12-13 min/100°C//speed 1. Allow risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 1 minute before transferring to a serving bowl. Using spatula, combine with remaining 20 g butter and grated Parmesan cheese then serve immediately.
tips: The lemonade: choose small lemons with a smooth shiny peel, as these are juicier and have less white pith. For a sweeter or tarter lemonade, adjust the quantity of sugar to taste.

The bread: use this basic dough to prepare different variations as you wish. - For a sweet version: mix 2 tbsp sugar with 1 tsp water, then sprinkle the surface of the bread with this wash.- Instead of rolling the dough into a log, roll it out into a rectangle (approx. 30 cm x 40 cm), spread with the filling of your choice and sprinkle with  ingredients of your choice (e.g. cream cheese and diced ham, chocolate cream and nuts...). Roll up lengthways. - For a donut: half the log lengthways, leaving one extremity uncut. Plait so that the cut is facing upwards then join both extremities to form the donut.
The dip: the cheese sauce goes well also with grilled meats and potatoes.

The risotto: risotto is best served immediately. Should you need to reheat it, you can do so in a pan, add a little water to it before reheating. Adjust cooking time according to the time indicated on rice packet. Liquid absorption may vary according to the type of rice. If risotto seems dry before it is cooked through, add more liquid.Rule of thumb for creating your own risotto recipe: for every 100 g risotto rice you will need 275 g liquids (water and wine) combined with stock paste. The maximum quantity of rice that can be cooked at any one time for this basic recipe is 500 g. Bear in mind adding other ingredients (e.g. mushrooms, sausage) will increase the volume of the overall dish. Please adjust the quantity of rice accordingly.

title: Spanish cheesecake (quesada pasiega)
ingredients: 8 - 10 pieces lemon zest (1 cm x 4 cm), yellow part only
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a round earthenware or glass baking dish (Ø 22 cm).
Place lemon zest and sugar in mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add fresh cheese, egg, flour, butter, salt and cinnamon and mix 30 sec/speed 6. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake for 40 minutes (200°C). Remove from oven, allow to cool and serve.
tips: Quesada pasiega is a traditional dessert typical of the region of Cantabria in the north of Spain.

title: Veal stew (Blanquette de veau)
ingredients: 600 g veal meat, cut in pieces (approx 2cm x 3cm)
300 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
200 g leeks, cut in slices (1 cm)
300 g fresh white button mushrooms, cut in quarters
steps: Place water, thyme, bay leaves and parsley in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and add veal to it. Set Varoma dish in position and add carrots and leeks in it and steam 35 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile, place mushrooms on Varoma tray and set aside.

Remove Varoma, insert Varoma tray, close and set Varoma back in position and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside and remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Transfer meat and vegetables to a serving dish and set aside to keep warm. Drain cooking liquid through simmering basket and set aside. Clean simmering basket.
Place butter in mixing bowl and melt 1 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add flour and heat 1 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Add 300 g of the reserved cooking liquid, salt and ground pepper and heat 3 min/90°C/speed 4. Adjust seasoning if necessary. Pour the sauce over the meat and vegetables, and serve immediately.
tips: Use the fillet veal cut, if available, for the pieces of veal
Thicken the sauce with an egg yolk, as an alternative to the flour in step 4.
Serve with a red wine from the Loire region, such as an Anjou.

title: Conchiglie pasta with fresh tomato sauce and goat's cheese
ingredients: 80 g goat's cheese, medium hard, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)  o 80 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
300 g ripe tomatoes, seeds removed and cut into cubes (0.5-1 cm)  o 300 g canned cherry tomatoes, cut into cubes (0.5-1 cm)
1 sprig fresh basil, leaves washed and dried
350 g pasta, dried, type conchiglie or other short type dried pasta
steps: Place goat's cheese into mixing bowl and roughly grate: 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry the mixing bowl.
Place olive oil into mixing bowl. Add garlic clove and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes, ½ tsp salt and basil, cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add water, 1 tsp salt and bring to the boil 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add pasta through the hole in the mixing bowl lid and cook without the measuring jug for time indicated on packet/100°C//speed  or until al dente.
Transfer pasta into a large bowl and dress with the reserved goat's cheese.
Leave to rest for 1 minute and serve.
tips: While cooking the pasta, check the pasta through the hole in the mixing bowl lid. Depending on the type and quality of the pasta, it may be necessary to add 20-30 g of hot water during the cooking time to achieve the creamy result typical of this type of pasta.
If you are using canned cherry tomatoes, strain them first using the simmering basket.

title: Greek style pork stew
ingredients: 200 g red peppers, cut into quarters, seeds removed
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
700 g pork tenderloin, cut into strips (1 x 1,5 cm)
steps: Place water and ½ tsp salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, weigh in white basmati rice, remove simmering basket and rinse rice under cold running water until water runs clear. Place simmering basket back into mixing bowl and cook 16 min/100°C/speed 4. Transfer rice into a serving bowl and keep warm.
Place onions, red peppers and oil into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes, paprika, 1 tsp salt and the pepper into mixing bowl and cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add pork, stir with spatula and cook 4-6 min/100°C//speed 1 until pork is cooked and still tender. Serve hot with rice.
tips: To save time, cook rice on your stove top while Greek style pork stew is cooking in mixing bowl or serve with fresh crispy bread.
Serve with vegetables of choice.

title: Champagne lemon slush
steps: Place lemons and champagne in mixing bowl, hold measuring cup in position and press Turbo/0.5 sec/6-8 times. Insert simmering basket, hold in place in mixing bowl with spatula and drain liquid into a jug. Remove simmering basket, empty mixing bowl and rinse with water.
Place ice cubes, sugar and sieved liquid into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to 8 glasses and serve immediately.
tips: Decorate the glasses with slices of lemon or twists of lemon peel.Serve with a straw if desired.
Decorate the glasses with slices of lemon or twists of lemon peel.
Serve with a straw if desired.
For a non-alcoholic alternative, replace the champagne with water.Instead of lemons, 300 g other fruit can be added to mixing bowl (e.g. peaches or strawberries).
For a non-alcoholic alternative, replace the champagne with water.
Instead of lemons, 300 g other fruit can be added to mixing bowl (e.g. peaches or strawberries).

title: Pineapple and ginger jam
ingredients: 25 g fresh ginger root, peeled and thinly sliced
750 g pineapple, fresh, cut into pieces
25 g lime juice  o 25 g lemon juice
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8 Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pineapple and chop 4 sec/speed 5.

Add lime/lemon juice and jam sugar and cook 14 min/100°C/speed 2. Test for a set (see tip), transfer to 2 prepared jam jars with twist-off lids (à 500 g) – see tip – and close immediately. Turn upside down and allow to stand on lid for 5 minutes, then turn back upright and allow to cool. Store in a cool, dry place.
tips: Testing for a set: Place a small plate in freezer (5–10 minutes) before you begin making jam. Place a spoonful of jam on the cold plate, allow to cool and press lightly with your finger. If the jam wrinkles, it is ready. If not, allow to cook for a further 2 minutes and repeat test.
To ensure the jam keeps for as long as possible, wash the jars thoroughly and dry in a warm oven or wash in the dishwasher. Transfer the jam to the jars while they are still warm.
The pineapple and ginger jam keeps for up to 6 months when unopened and stored in a cool, dry place.

title: Wholegrain hamburger buns
ingredients: 250 g waxy potatoes, diced (1 cm) (see tip)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl and insert simmering basket. Weigh potatoes in simmering basket and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, transfer potatoes to a flat dish and allow to cool for approx. 30 minutes. Meanwhile, empty and dry mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Place 20 g wheat grains in mixing bowl, crush 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 230 g wheat grains in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.
Place cooled potatoes and milk in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add yeast, 2 eggs, flour, salt, butter and ground wheat and knead 2 min/ kneten. Transfer dough to a large bowl, cover with cling film or a damp kitchen towel and leave in a warm place for 30 minutes to rise until doubled in size.

Line a baking tray with baking paper. With floured hands, shape 6 equally-sized balls from the dough and place on baking tray. Cover bread rolls with cling film or a damp kitchen towel and leave in a warm place for approx. 45 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C.
Whisk 1 egg and glaze the rolls, sprinkle with shredded wheat and bake in oven for 18–20 minutes (200°C) until golden. Allow to cool for 10 minutes and serve as desired.
tips: In step 5, 250 g cooked potatoes from the previous day, cut into pieces, can alternatively be used. The cooking and cooling described in step 1 is then no longer necessary.If the dough is very sticky after step 5, add 30 g flour and knead another 15 sec/.These bread rolls make ideal burger buns but are also perfect for breakfast or as a savoury snack.
In step 5, 250 g cooked potatoes from the previous day, cut into pieces, can alternatively be used. The cooking and cooling described in step 1 is then no longer necessary.
If the dough is very sticky after step 5, add 30 g flour and knead another 15 sec/.
These bread rolls make ideal burger buns but are also perfect for breakfast or as a savoury snack.

title: Potato goulash
ingredients: 100 g spring onions, cut into rings
100 g peppers, red and green, in bite-sized pieces
500 g pork shoulder, boneless, cut into pieces (approx. 2,5 x 2 cm)
¼ tsp black pepper, freshly ground
4 tbsp crème fraîche  o 4 tbsp sour cream
steps: Place onion, garlic, and carrot in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add spring onions, paprika and pork goulash and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed , placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing.

Add potato, water, lemon zest, tarragon, marjoram, paprika, salt and pepper and cook 30 min/100°C//speed 1. Check if meat is done and prolong cooking time if necessary. Transfer to 4 soup bowls and serve with 1 tbsp crème fraîche on each.
tips: Serve goulash with crispy bread on the side.
If you can't find crème fraîche or sour cream, instead serve with Greek yoghurt to which a splash of lemon juice has been added.

title: Stuffed semolina cookies (ma'amoul)
ingredients: 550 g pistachio nuts, shelled, unsalted  o 550 g walnuts, shelled
steps: Place 300 g butter and 10 g dried yeast into mixing bowl and melt 4 min/60°C/speed 2. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 500 g medium semolina and 250 g fine semolina. Add melted butter, mix with spatula, cover and set aside for 3 hours.
Place remaining 300 g butter and remaining 10 g dried yeast into mixing bowl and melt 4 min/60°C/speed 2. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place another bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in remaining 500 g medium semolina and remaining 250 g fine semolina flour. Add melted butter, mix with spatula, cover and set aside for 3 hours.
Place 50 g sugar, 3 mastic gum grains and 7 mahleb seeds into clean and dry mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add first semolina mixture, 75 g rose water, 35 g blossom water and mix 20 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula.
Add 100 g water, mix 10 sec/speed 6, then knead 1 min/. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 50 g sugar, remaining 3 mastic gum grains and remaining 7 mahleb seeds into clean and dry mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add second semolina mixture, remaining 75 g rose water, remaining 35 g blossom water and mix 20 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula.
Add 100 g water, mix 10 sec/speed 6, then knead 1 min/. Transfer into bowl with other dough and set aside for 30 minutes.
Place pistachio nuts and sugar into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5.
Add blossom water and rose water and mix 10 sec/speed 3 with aid of spatula.
Preheat oven to 200ºC. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.
Divide dough into 6 equal pieces and roll into a log. Divide each log into 8 equal pieces and roll into a ball (approx. 3 cm).

Flatten each ball between the bottom part of your palms and shape into a flat circle (Ø 9-10 cm). Form a small cup of dough and stuff with 1 heaped teaspoon of pistachio mixture and close carefully, rolling smooth. Shape into a semi-sphere (Ø 4 cm).

Place the semi-sphere in the ma’amoul mould, press gently but firmly. Place a tea towel on the border of the table then invert the mould, tapping the end of the mould on the tea towel so that formed cookie will fall out. Transfer formed cookies on prepared baking trays and bake for 12-15 minutes (200ºC) until slightly golden. Transfer to a cooling rack, sprinkle with icing sugar and allow to cool before serving.
tips: Replace pistachio or walnut filling with date filling (see Biscuits with date, pistachio and cardamom filling recipe).
Instead of shaping the semolina cookies with a ma’amoul mould, it is possible to realize the characteristic decoration pinching the dough with a pastry crimper or a fork.

title: Tahini dip (tarator)
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
100 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed, plus extra to taste
steps: Place tahini paste, salt, garlic, water and lemon juice into mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 6. Add salt or lemon according to taste, transfer to a bowl and garnish with parsley leaves before serving.
tips: Adjust the amount of water according to the thickness of the tahini paste.
Serve with falafel or fish.

title: Harissa sauce
ingredients: 250 g fresh red chillies, cut into halves lengthwise, seeds removed
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
2 tsp smoked paprika powder  o 2 tsp sweet paprika powder
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place caraway and cumin seeds into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10 and then dry-roast 3 min/120°C/speed 2.5, without measuring cup.
Add chillies and chop 7 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salt, garlic cloves, tomato puree, vinegar, smoked paprika, extra virgin olive oil, black pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 6.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a jar with twist off lid, cover with a layer of olive oil, store in refrigerator and use as needed.

title: Couscous with lamb and vegetables
ingredients: 500 g lamb shoulder meat, cut into pieces (4 cm)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place coriander and parsley into mixing bowl and chop 7 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.

Add pieces of lamb meat, 2 tsp salt, pepper and 40 g olive oil and cook 10 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, cut carrots, turnips and courgettes into chunks (approx. 4 cm) and set aside. Place couscous, 1 tsp salt and 20 g olive oil in a bowl. Rub couscous in a circular motion between your hands to moisten grains evenly and remove any lumps that may form, cover with 350 g water and stir using spatula to moisten couscous evenly. Cover bowl and set aside.

Add reserved vegetables, chopped coriander and parsley, cinnamon, ginger and 500 g water to mixing bowl. Gently fluff the couscous with a fork to separate grains and transfer to Varoma tray. Place Varoma dish and tray into position and cook 15 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add raisins, chick peas and saffron, cook again 15 min/100°C//speed . Transfer lamb and vegetables to deep plates. Cover with sauce and serve with couscous.

title: Pumpkin Kaya
ingredients: 600 g pumpkin, flesh only, cut in cubes (3 cm)
100 g raw cashew nuts, soaked for 30 minutes
1 pandan leaf, lower part only (10 cm) (see tips)
½ tsp bamboo salt  o ½ tsp rock salt
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, weigh in pumpkin and steam 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, check if pumpkin is cooked and soft, prolong steaming time if needed. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Empty mixing bowl.
Place cashew nuts, pandan leaf and steamed pumpkin into mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually until a fine paste is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 15 min/120°C/speed 3.5.
Add molasses powder and bamboo salt, stir 15 sec/speed 5. Prolong time if necessary until desired consistency achieved. Pour into airtight jars and store in refrigerator until needed.
tips: Best served with steamed wholemeal bread and a cup of aromatic coffee or tea.
The indicated weight of cashew nuts is wet weight after soaking. Dry weight is approximately 75 g.
If you can’t find long pandan leaves, replace with 2 short pandan leaves, lower part only (5 cm each).
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Olive Vegetable Rice
ingredients: 8 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed
200 g pork belly, skinless, cut in thin slices
20 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften, drained
200 g pickled olive vegetables (gan lan cai), oil drained
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, dried shiitake mushrooms in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, pork belly and dried shrimp, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add pickled olive vegetables, chicken stock powder and water, boil 10 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add carrots and rice, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 15 minutes. Transfer to serving bowl. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: 1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
600 g firm tofu (momen tofu), cut in pieces (approx 1.5 cm)
2 tbsp chilli bean paste (eg: Sichuan chilli bean paste)
2 sprigs spring onions, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in minced meat. Add light soy sauce, white pepper powder and Chinese rice wine. Mix well and set aside to marinate for 15 minutes.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and reserved marinated minced pork, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add tofu, oyster sauce, chilii bean paste, salt and sesame oil, stir fry 5 min/100°C/speed . Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a plate and garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.

title: Drunken Herbal Prawns
ingredients: 800 g medium-sized prawns, deveined and patted dry with paper towels
350 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
3 cm fresh ginger, cut in thin strips
10 Chinese red dates, rinsed and pitted
10 g dang gui (Chinese angelica root), cut in slices
1 sprig fresh coriander, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns and 50 g rice wine. Add ½ tsp salt and ½ tsp sugar to bowl. Mix and set aside in refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
Arrange marinated prawns in Varoma dish and place ginger strips on top of prawns. Cover with Varoma lid and set aside.

Place 300 g rice wine, water, black vinegar, red dates, dang gui, wolfberries, chicken stock powder and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl. Set Varoma with prawns into position, steam 8 min/Varoma/speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.
Cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1. Using a fine mesh strainer, strain herbal broth to a bowl and let cool.
Transfer steamed prawns and ginger to herbal broth. Cover bowl with cling film and allow to infuse for 4 hours or overnight in refrigerator. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve chilled.
tips: If you prefer the Drunken Herbal Prawns to be warm, after step 4, transfer steamed prawns and ginger directly to hot herbal broth after straining. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve warm.

title: Braised Duck With Sour Plum Sauce
ingredients: 800 g duck, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (4 cm)
30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
250 g sour plum sauce, homemade or store-bought
steps: Place duck, ginger juice, rice wine, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, sour plum sauce and sugar in mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /2 h 30 min/98°C. Transfer to a serving dish and serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Green Tea Pudding
ingredients: 820 g unsweetened soya milk, room temperature
110 g raw sugar, adjust to taste
2 heaped tsp kudzu powder (Japanese arrowroot powder)
3 heaped tsp green tea powder, plus extra for garnishing
steps: Place water, soy milk, raw sugar, kanten powder, kudzu powder and green tea powder in mixing bowl, heat 12 min/90°C/speed 3.

Distribute the mixture evenly into 5 ramekins (200 ml each) through a fine mesh strainer. Allow to cool completely before refrigerating for 2 hours. Dust with green tea powder to garnish. Serve chilled.
tips: Ensure soy milk is at room temperature for kanten powder to dissolve completely in step 1.
You can replace unsweetened soy milk with sweetened soy milk and omit sugar in step 1, or adjust to taste.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Cordyceps Flower Chicken Soup
ingredients: 600 g kampung chicken, preferably drumsticks, with skin and bone
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add salt to the bowl. Mix well and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add reserved chicken drumsticks, cordyceps flower, Chinese yam, wolfberries and scallops, start Slow Cook /2 h/98°C. Serve hot.
tips: For healthier version, remove chicken skin and trim all fat before marinating in step 1.

title: Hakka Rice Wine Chicken
ingredients: 1200 g boneless chicken drumsticks (approx. 4 pieces), with skin, cut in pieces (4 cm)
15 g toasted sesame oil, plus 1 tbsp extra
20 g old ginger, cut in thin slices
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, light soy sauce and molasses sugar. Add salt, 1 tbsp sesame oil and 2 tbsp rice wine. Mix and marinate, set aside in refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Place 15 g sesame oil and ginger in mixing bowl, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, cook 14 min/Varoma//speed . Drizzle with 2 tbsp rice wine. Serve hot.
tips: Replace boneless chicken thigh with 1200 g chicken breast, cut in 2 cm thick strips. Reduce cooking time to 7 minutes in step 3.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Curry Mee
ingredients: 1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
500 g chicken thigh, boneless and skinless, cut in small pieces
70 g fried tofu, cut in halves
150 g fish cakes, cut in small pieces
300 g long beans, cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place shallots, garlic, ginger in mixing bowl, blend 15 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemongrass, meat curry powder and oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add water, coconut milk, chicken thigh, fried tofu, fish cakes and salt. Place Varoma dish in position and weigh in yellow noodles (see tips). Insert Varoma tray and weigh in long beans. Close Varoma lid and steam 17 min/Varoma//speed .
To serve, place a portion of yellow noodles in a serving bowl. Pour over 2-3 scoops of curry. Top with steamed long beans, cockles, hard-boiled egg, chilli slices and fried shallots. Serve hot.
tips: Arrange yellow noodles properly and do not cover the entire holes in Varoma dish to let the steam to escape.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Sup Tauhu Kulit (Beancurd Skin Soup)
ingredients: ½ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
80 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
150 g broccoli, cut in small pieces
60 g tauhu kulit (fu chok), cut in 5 cm length, soaked to soften
50 g dried glass noodles (soh hoon), soaked to soften
steps: Place garlic and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water, salt, ground black pepper and mushroom seasoning, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add carrots, broccoli, soaked tauhu kulit and soaked dried glass noodles, cook 5 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.

title: Tonkatsu with coleslaw, wasabi and dill dressing, potato wedges
ingredients: 300 g white cabbage, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)
2 - 3 pinches salt, plus ½ tsp and extra for seasoning
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in potatoes. Add honey, oil, garlic, sugar, salt and pepper then mix well with spatula. Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes (200°C) or until crispy and golden brown. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place white cabbage, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame seeds, salt and sugar in mixing bowl then chop 3-4 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place dill in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add wasabi, rice vinegar, yoghurt, mayonnaise, sugar and 2-3 pinches salt then mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place egg, water, cornflour, ½ tsp salt and pepper in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a deep plate and set aside.

Prepare 2 plates. Place plain flour on one plate and panko breadcrumbs on second plate. Using a meat mallet, flatten out each pork loin steak (approx. 2 cm thick) and season with salt on both sides. Dip each piece in flour and dust off excess. Dip in prepared egg wash, then in panko crumbs, gently patting each side to coat. Repeat with remaining pork chops.

On a stove, heat oil (approx. 2-3 cm) over medium heat in a saucepan or a deep frying pan. Line a plate with paper towels and set aside. Fry one pork chop at a time on both sides until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Drizzle with wasabi dressing and serve immediately with potatoes and salad on side.
tips: Tonkatsu is a Japanese breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet. Instead of the usual Japanese tonkatsu sauce (a type of thick brown sauce), we serve ours with a zingy wasabi dill dressing.

title: Sushi donuts
ingredients: 1200 g water, plus extra for rinsing
10 g sesame oil  o 10 g coconut oil
100 g vegetables and fruit, mixed, (radish, carrot, cucumber, pickled ginger, mango, radicchio), to garnish
100 g salmon fillet, skinless, sushi quality, or mixed with tuna and prawns, to garnish
1 tbsp sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish (optional)
steps: Insert simmering basket in mixing bowl and weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket using spatula and rinse under cold running water until it runs clear.

Insert simmering basket, pour water and 1 tsp salt over rice in mixing bowl then cook 22 min/100°C/speed 4. Remove simmering basket using spatula, transfer to a bowl, cover with a tea towel and leave to cool completely. Empty mixing bowl.
Place avocado, lemon juice, ½ tsp salt and ground pepper in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer mixture to a piping bag and set aside.
Grease an 8-hole doughnut tray with sesame oil using a pastry brush.

Add rice vinegar to cooled sushi rice and mix well with spatula. Transfer sushi rice to doughnut tray, making sure holes are only filled half way up with rice. Moisten your fingers with water to avoid rice sticking to your hands. Press rice firmly into holes so doughnuts keep their shape.
Pipe prepared avocado cream (or see tip) on top of rice. Spread remaining sushi rice on top of avocado cream and press down firmly.

To turn out doughnuts, place a serving plate onto tray, flip both over and carefully lift off plate. Doughnuts will fall out of the holes. If they do not release immediately, gently tap tray onto working surface.
Garnish sushi doughnuts with thinly sliced vegetables and fruit as desired. Add salmon, tuna or prawns and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with soy sauce.
tips: Waiting time can be used to prepare the vegetables and fruit garnish. Use any leftovers if available.
Fill rice doughnuts with olive, tomato or tuna paté instead of avocado cream.

title: Asturian rice pudding
ingredients: 250 g white short-grain rice, for rice pudding
4 - 6 pieces lemon zest (1 cm x 4 cm), yellow part only
steps: Place milk, cream, rice, 100 g sugar, anise liqueur, lemon zest and cinnamon in mixing bowl and cook 35 min/95°C//speed 1. Transfer rice to a baking dish, remove lemon zest and cinnamon and leave to cool for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 50 g sugar and caramelise gently using a kitchen blowtorch. Serve warm or cold.

title: Sweet monkey bread
ingredients: 150 g butter, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
50 g sugar  o 50 g brown sugar
1 tsp citric acid  o 30 g lemon juice
steps: Place pecan nuts in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place milk, 80 g water, fresh yeast, 30 g butter and sugar in mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add flour and salt and knead Dough /5 min. Meanwhile, line Varoma dish with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish and set aside.
Place remaining 250 g water and citric acid in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /1 h/40°C. Set Varoma aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place remaining 120 g butter, brown sugar and cinnamon in mixing bowl and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 2.

Grease a bundt cake tin (Ø 24-26 cm) with butter and set aside. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough into a rectangle (50 cm x 30 cm) and cut into 7 strips. Cut each strip into 6 equal pieces and form each piece into a ball. Dip each ball in melted cinnamon butter and transfer to prepared bundt cake tin. Arrange 1 layer of balls on the bottom of the tin then sprinkle with 1 tbsp reserved chopped pecan nuts. Repeat with remaining dough, cinnamon butter and chopped pecan nuts. Cover with cling film and leave to rise for 1 hour. Towards the end of rising time, preheat oven to 180°C.
Bake for 30-35 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes in tin before inverting onto a serving plate. Serve warm or cold.
tips: Serve with a fresh fruit salad.
Replace pecan nuts with any other type of nuts (e.g. walnuts, hazelnuts etc.).

title: Jamaican carrot juice
ingredients: 20 g fresh ginger root, cut in slices (1 mm)
200 g ice cubes, plus extra to serve
steps: Place sugar, carrots and ginger in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add ice cubes, coconut milk, water, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla then blend 30 sec/speed 10. Transfer to 4 glasses. Garnish with shredded coconut, add ice cubes and serve immediately.
tips: Adjust the amount of sugar according to personal preferences.
For best results, use fresh and sweet carrots.
Replace sugar with honey.

title: Chickpea stew with vegetables and chorizo
ingredients: 750 g broth  o 750 g water, with 2 stock cubes
200 g potatoes, cut into small cubes
800 g chickpeas, cooked, canned, washed and drained
steps: Place leek, carrots and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4.
Add chorizo and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add broth, potatoes and bay leaf and cook 22 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add chickpeas and cook 12 min/100°C//speed . Transfer into a serving bowl, wait a few minutes and serve hot.

title: Strawberry pudding
ingredients: 3 gelatine leaves (approx. 6 g), soaked and squeezed
steps: Place water and strawberries into mixing bowl, blend 15 sec/speed 7. Strain mixture into a bowl using a fine colander.
Place strained mixture and cream into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/90°C/speed 1.
Add gelatine leaves, previously soaked in cold water and squeezed, and mix 20 sec/speed 4.
Add cheese and sugar, mix 20 sec/speed 5. Pour into 6 short glasses and chill in the refrigerator (at least 2 hours) until serving.

title: Lemon chicken
ingredients: 200 g onions, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
600 - 700 g chicken in pieces (drumsticks, thighs, breast cut into pieces of 4-5 cm)
4 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves washed and dried, plus extra for garnish
steps: Place garlic and onions into mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken drumsticks and thighs, lemon zest and juice, parsley, water, cumin, saffron, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon, salt and pepper and cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Add chicken breast and cook 10 min/90°C//speed .
Add olives, cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Decorate with parsley leaves and serve.
tips: Serve lemon chicken with couscous, basmati rice or pilaf rice.

title: Chicken parcels with vegetable stuffing and potatoes
ingredients: 1 pinch fine salt, plus extra to taste
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
steps: Place 100 g courgettes and 100 g red pepper, cut into pieces, into the mixing bowl and chop coarsely 6 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mozzarella, salt, pepper and basil and mix 5 sec/speed 3.Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Butterfly each chicken breast, open it and beat with a meat tenderiser. Stuff each escalope with some of the vegetable and mozzarella mixture and close the parcel with a toothpick. Season with vegetable salt and extra salt and pepper to taste. Arrange the parcels in the Varoma dish. Insert the Varoma tray. Cut the remaining peppers and courgettes into slices and arrange in the Varoma tray.

Place water into mixing bowl, place the simmering basket in position and place the potatoes inside. Insert the Varoma and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket with spatula and set aside. Keep potatoes warm until ready to serve. Retain the cooking liquid in the mixing bowl.
Place stock paste, flour and cream into the mixing bowl and cook 3 min/100°C/speed 3. Then mix 15 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.
Remove the toothpicks from the chicken parcels and arrange the chicken parcels on a serving plate.
Serve hot with the potatoes, vegetables and sauce.
tips: Variation for sauce: You can also serve the chicken parcels with a cold tomato sauce. At the end of step 4, empty the mixing bowl. Place 100 g onion and 1 clove of garlic into mixing bowl, chop: 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add 400 g tomatoes (quartered), one tablespoon olive oil, ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, ½ teaspoon herb salt or any type of flavoured salt, ½ teaspoon dried basil, ½ teaspoon pepper and 1 pinch sugar, mix: 12 sec/speed 5.
You can enjoy this dish with any type of vegetable. You can also serve it cold, cut into slices and used as a garnish for fresh salads.

title: Arabian chicken with couscous
ingredients: 1 piece fresh ginger (3 cm), peeled and thinly sliced
1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
200 g red peppers, cut into bite-sized pieces
100 g aubergines, cut into bite-sized pieces
100 g dried apricots, cut into quarters
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
500 g chicken breast fillet, cut into pieces (2 cm)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh couscous into it. Add 350 g water, 40 g oil and 1 tbsp salt. Stir and leave to soak for 10-15 minutes.
Place onion, carrot and ginger in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 30 g olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1 without measuring cup.

Add 450 g water, stock cube, potato, red pepper, aubergine, apricots, 1 tbsp salt, pepper, cumin, paprika powder and ground coriander. Place Varoma dish into position and add chicken, making sure some holes remain unobstructed. Insert Varoma tray and add couscous, spreading evenly. Secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma. Transfer mixing bowl contents to a serving dish, stir in diced chicken and sprinkle with mint leaves. Serve with the steamed couscous.
tips: Use floury potatoes for a creamier sauce or add a little starch to thicken, as desired.
Prepare remaining ingredients according to recipe while couscous is soaking.

title: Sweet cheese pastry (knafeh)
ingredients: 200 g butter, plus extra for greasing
500 g white bread, crust removed and cut into pieces
150 g white bread, crust removed and cut into pieces
250 g akkawi cheese, desalted (see tip) and cut into cubes
steps: Place sugar, water, lemon juice and blossom water into mixing bowl and heat 10 min/115°C/speed 2. Transfer into a heat-resistant bowl and set aside to cool down.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a cake tin (Ø 32 cm), cover the base with baking paper and set aside.
Place bread into mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 9 with aid of spatula.
Add softened butter and mix 10 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead Dough /1 min. Transfer into prepared tin, spread evenly and press down well with a flat plate or a slightly smaller tin. Set tin with pastry aside.
Place milk into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add bread and cornflour and heat 4 min/90°C/speed 2.
Add blossom water and rose water and mix 1 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Transfer onto pastry layer in baking tin and set aside.

Place Akkawi cheese and mozzarella into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6. Sprinkle evenly on top of kashta cream layer and bake for 35 minutes (200°C) or until edges are golden brown. When still hot, reverse onto a large serving plate and drizzle with reserved syrup. Serve immediately.
tips: To desalt Akkawi cheese, soak it for 12 hours or overnight in abundant water, changing the water every half hour in the first hours. Drain an pat dry before use.

title: Date and pistachio truffles (bethith)
steps: Place pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and grind 4 sec/speed 7. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place flour into mixing bowl and dry roast 10 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add butter and melt 10 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add dates, cardamom and cook 1 min/90°C/speed 6.

Add 60 g reserved pistachio nuts and cook 1 min/90°C/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. With wet hands form truffles (approx. Ø 4 cm) and roll them in the remaining ground pistachios; repeat until the mixture is used up. Serve at room temperature.
tips: Date and pistachio truffles (bethith) are served with Arabic coffee on special occasions.
The mixture is quite sticky. To clean the mixing bowl more easily, place 500 g hot water, add a drop of washing up liquid and mix 3 min/speed 7 to loosen the sticky paste.
Cover the truffles in desiccated coconut or chopped walnuts instead of pistachio nuts.

title: Yoghurt soup with meat dumplings (Shish barak)
ingredients: 300 g flour, plus extra for dusting
3 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves only  o 3 sprigs fresh mint, leaves only
10 sprigs fresh coriander, roughly cut  o 20 sprigs fresh mint, leaves only
steps: Place flour, milk, oil and 1 pinch salt into mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Transfer dough into a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside for 30 minutes.
Place parsley and onion into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, add minced meat, Arabic spice mix, cinnamon, nutmeg, pepper, 1 pinch salt, pine nuts and mix 10 sec/speed 2. Transfer filling into a bowl and refrigerate. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Divide reserved dough into 4 equal pieces. On a lightly floured surface, with aid of a rolling pin, rollout each piece of dough (1 mm thick).

Cut dough with a round cookie cutter (Ø 5-6 cm) and place ¼ tsp filling in the centre of each circle. Fold one end over filling to shape crescents, wrap the ends of the crescents around your finger and join into tortellini shaped dumplings. Transfer onto prepared baking tray.
Bake in preheated oven (180°C) for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Transfer into a plate and set aside.
Place oil, coriander and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8, then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place yoghurt, corn flour and salt into mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 5.
Insert butterfly whisk and heat 25 min/80°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk.
Transfer soup into a tureen, add dumplings and garnish with sautéed coriander and garlic. Serve immediately.

title: Buddha's Delight
ingredients: 8 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed, squeezed
1 cm fresh ginger, cut in slices
500 g Chinese cabbage, cut in chunks (5 cm)
120 g carrots, cut in thin slices
10 g dried black fungus, soaked to soften, stems removed, cut in pieces
1 tbsp oyster sauce  o 1 tbsp abalone sauce
40 g red fermented bean curd (nam yee), with gravy
50 g dried bean curd sheet, soaked to soften  o 100 g wet bean curd sheets (dau ken)
1 pinch dried black moss, soaked to soften, drained (opcional)
30 g mung bean vermicelli (dongfen), soaked to soften, drained
steps: Mix shiitake mushrooms, 1 tsp sugar, ½ tsp salt and cornflour in a small bowl. Set aside.
Place cooking oil and ginger slices in mixing bowl, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add cabbage and carrots, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Add red dates, black fungus, reserved shiitake mushrooms, tofu puffs, oyster sauce, light soy sauce, red fermented bean curd and 3 tsp sugar, cook 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add sweet peas, mung bean vermicelli, dried moss, bean curd sheets and ½ tsp salt, cook 2 min/120°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: You can add any colourful vegetables such as lotus root, baby corn, celery etc in step 5.

title: ABC Nut Butter
steps: Place almonds, Brazil nuts and cashews in mixing bowl, grind 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again 3 min/speed 5.5. Serve immediately or store in an airtight jar in the refrigerator.
tips: ABC Nut Butter can be stored in the refrigerator in an airtight jar for up to one month.

Pre-soaking of nuts will enhance their digestibility. Prior to making recipe: place nuts in a non reactive bowl, covering with warm water and 1 tbsp salt. Soak for 7-24 hours. Drain and rinse nuts and place on a large baking sheet. Dehydrate in a low oven on proof mode or 65°C for 12-24 hours, turning once or twice. They are done when the nuts are crisp.
Replace with other types of nuts or a variety of nuts to find your favorite flavor combination.
Use roasted nuts for a stronger flavor.

title: Pulut Tai Tai (Steamed Blue Glutinous Rice)
ingredients: 20 blue clitoria flowers (bunga telang), fresh or dried, lightly rinsed
300 g glutinous rice, soaked for 2 hours and drained
3 pandan leaves, cut in 5 cm length
steps: Place a small bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in hot water and soak blue clitoria flowers. Stir and press to extract the juice. Set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert a heat-resistant square baking pan (14 cm x 14 cm, 10 cm height - see tips), weigh in salt, coconut milk and glutinous rice. Place pandan leaves on top of the baking pan. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 3 prolong time if necessary until rice is evenly cooked. Remove Varoma and set it aside.

Carefully open Varoma lid, remove pandan leaves and add reserved blue flower juice to the rice in the baking pan, mix well with ⅓ of cooked glutinous rice, mix blue tinted rice lightly with chopsticks to fluff up the rice.
Use measuring cup to press down cooked glutinous rice until compact and firm. Allow it to cool in the pan before cutting into squares (approx. 3 cm x 3 cm) to serve.
tips: To intensify the coconut aroma, replace 50 g hot water with 50 g coconut milk. Heat coconut milk to 100°C and soak blue clitoria flowers. Stir and press before straining to extract more colouring.
Best served with kaya.

When selecting the pan to be used in the Varoma, consider to: choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); make sure the dish size is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
There are two types of glutinous rice in the market. Thai glutinous rice is best for this recipe as it cooks faster with shorter soaking time.
If using local glutinous rice, soak for 5 hours and prolong steaming time to 50 minutes in step 2 or until evenly cooked.
Grease your knife with a little oil before cutting for neat slices.

title: Steamed Chicken With Herbal Liqueur
ingredients: 400 g kampung chicken (free-range chicken), skinless, with bone, cut in pieces (3 cm)
steps: Break chicken bones using a meat mallet. Arrange chicken pieces in a steaming bowl (Ø 15 cm).
Place steaming bowl with chicken on mixing bowl lid, weigh in hot water. Add dang gui slices. Cover with aluminium foil. Arrange in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma with steaming bowl into position, steam 70 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove aluminium foil.
Add herbal liqueur to steaming bowl. Close Varoma lid, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Let stand for 15 minutes. Serve warm.
tips: Best served before bedtime.
Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Traditional Black Sugar Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
steps: Place black sugar, 160 g water and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 150 g water, dried yeast powder and 200 g plain flour in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2. Then start Fermentation /1 h/37°C.
Add reserved cooled black sugar syrup, 250 g plain flour, egg and baking powder, mix 1 min/speed 6. Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases.
Mix well with spatula. Pour batter into prepared cupcake cases. Arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C.
Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Nyonya Blue Pea Flower Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: 20 blue clitoria flowers (bunga telang), fresh or dried, lightly rinsed
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/1 sec/1 time.
Add coconut water, white rice flour and dried yeast powder, mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add blue clitoria flowers, mix well with spatula. Start Fermentation /4 h/37°C. Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases.
Add coconut milk and baking powder, mix well with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, arrange empty greased cupcake moulds in Varoma dish and tray. Close Varoma lid and preheat moulds 10 min/Varoma/speed 3. Meanwhile, strain the batter through a fine sieve into a bowl and set aside.
Carefully open Varoma lid, pour sifted batter into hot cupcake moulds. Close Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 4. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: The greased cupcake moulds are heated to ensure that huat kuih (steamed muffins) crack open like a blooming flower.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Steamed Pepper Chicken
ingredients: 60 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
2 whole chicken legs (approx. 600 g), preferably free-range chicken, rinsed, patted dry with kitchen paper
1 ½ tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place white peppercorns in clean and dry mixing bowl, heat 6 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place ginger in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Transfer to a muslin cloth and extract ginger juice. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Cut 2 diagonal slashes on each chicken leg, arrange on a steaming plate (Ø 15 cm). Drizzle reserved ginger juice over chicken and set aside.

Place reserved white peppercorns in mixing bowl, crush Turbo/2 sec/3 times. Transfer to chicken legs, add salt, sesame oil and rice wine. Rub all over the chicken legs thoroughly. Cover with heat-resistant cling film, set aside in refrigerator for 45 minutes.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, insert steaming plate with chicken. Close Varoma lid and steam 45 min/Varoma/speed 2. Check if chicken is cooked, prolong steaming time if necessary. Remove cling film and serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Braised Soft Bone Ribs With Pig Tendon
ingredients: 2 stalks spring onions, cut in halves
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
400 g soft bone pork ribs, cut in pieces (3 cm)
30 g dark soy sauce  o 30 g date caramel
5 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, cut into halves
steps: Rinse soaked tendons and squeeze out water, set aside.
Place 1500 g water, ginger, spring onion and 1 tsp rice wine in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C.

Insert simmering basket, add soaked tendons to it and blanch 10 min/95°C/speed 2.5. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Rinse tendons, trim off hard ends and cut into 6 cm length. Empty mixing bowl.
Place cooking oil, shallots, garlic cloves, star anise and cloves, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add soft bone ribs, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, lump sugar, mushrooms and 700 g water, start Slow Cook /1 h/95°C.
Add reserved blanched tendons and salt, cook 15 min/95°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: For a thicker gravy, remove pork ribs and tendons after step 6, without measuring cup, cook *10 min/Varoma/speed 1. *
Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Mistletoe Matcha Bread
steps: Place butter, cream cheese, sugar and milk in mixing bowl, mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 5 sec/speed 5 again. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour and matcha powder, mix 5 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 5 sec/speed 4 again. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water, sugar and yeast powder in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add high protein flour, milk powder, 1 egg, butter and salt, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Then knead Dough /5 min. Transfer onto a lightly floured surface. Shape dough into a smooth round ball and cover with cling film. Leave in a warm place to proof again until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Clean mixing bowl.
Using a rolling pin, flatten bread dough and roll into an oblong shape. Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Roll dough portions into smooth round balls and rest for 15 minutes.
Using a rolling pin, flatten each dough ball into a rectangular thin sheet (15 cm x 20 cm), spread reserved matcha filling evenly. Gently roll up each sheet into a log shape.
