Continue roll each log shaped dough into approximately 35 cm - 40 cm length. Cut in middle along the dough stripe, lay one on top of another across. Plait dough by alternating two strands. Make dough into a circle, pinch off one end, lay pinched end on one strand and tie it over, place seam down. Line baking tray with a layer of baking paper. Arrange on prepared baking tray. Leave in a warm place to proof again until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). During the last 10 minutes of proofing, preheat oven to 170⁰C.
Crack 1 egg in a bowl and beat lightly. Using a pastry brush, brush dough with egg and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Bake in middle rack (170⁰C) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

title: Bitter Gourd Salted Vege Soup
ingredients: 400 g pork neck bones, cut in pieces (4 cm)
250 g salted vegetables (hum choi), rinsed, soaked for 30 minutes, cut in pieces (3 cm)
250 g bitter gourd, cut in strips (1 cm), core removed
80 g yellow onions, cut in wedges
steps: Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add neck bones to it and blanch 13 min/60°C/speed 3.5. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Rinse pork ribs under running water. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place reserved blanched neck bones and 1000 g water in mixing bowl, boil 9 min/100°C//speed .
Start Slow Cook /18 min/98°C.
Add salted vegetables, carrots, bitter gourd, salted plum, onions and ginger slices, start Slow Cook /18 min/98°C.
Add wolfberries, salt and white pepper powder. Let stand until mixing bowl temperature drops to 70°C. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Wholemeal Mantou
ingredients: 20 g cooking oil (sunflower oil, corn oil or soybean oil)
steps: Place 130 g water, caster sugar, dried yeast and cooking oil in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add pau flour, wholemeal flour and salt, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough onto pastry mat, flatten with a rolling pin into thin sheet and roll up with hands, starting from the longest edge. Divide log into 10 pieces with spatula and form each piece into mantao shape. Place mantao in lightly greased Varoma dish and tray, cover with Varoma lid and allow to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes or until doubled in size.
Place 600 g water in mixing bowl, set closed Varoma into position, steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve warm.
tips: For best results, use a specific dumpling flour (e.g. Bluekey® Pau flour)
Avoid sprinkling sugar onto mixing knife and instead drizzle cooking oil over the blades to help kneading.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Idli
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in urad dhall and 200 g water, then add in fenugreek. Set aside and leave to soak for minimum 4 hours.
Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice and 500 g water. Set aside and leave to soak for minimum 4 hours. Drain the ingredients in both bowls through simmering basket and discard water.
Place reserved urad dhall and fenugreek and 100 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g water, blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place soaked rice and 150 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 150 g water, blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add urad dhall mixture, blend Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time.
Start Fermentation /10 h/40°C (see tips).
Add salt to mixing bowl (see tips), mix 20 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 1500 g water in mixing bowl, boil Kettle /100°C.

Grease idli mould with gingelly oil. Scoop 1 ladle of batter into idli mould. Place mould in Varoma dish and close Varoma lid. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove idli from mould.

Grease idli mould with gingelly oil. Scoop 1 ladle of batter into idli mould. Place mould in Varoma dish and close Varoma lid. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove idli from mould.

Grease idli mould with gingelly oil. Scoop 1 ladle of batter into idli mould. Place mould in Varoma dish and close Varoma lid. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove idli from mould.

Grease idli mould with gingelly oil. Scoop 1 ladle of batter into idli mould. Place mould in Varoma dish and close Varoma lid. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove idli from mould. Serve immediately with side dishes of choice.
tips: Continue with step 9 after 10 hours of fermentation without much delay. If the fermented batter after step 8 is not used immediately, transfer to a food container with lid and keep in refrigerator up to 3 days to stop the fermentation process. Before use, place the batter into mixing bowl and continue from step 9 onwards.
Idli can be served with sambar, chutney and curry.
Recipe contributed by Kumudhini Selva Kumaran.

title: Nian Gao (Sweet Sticky Rice Cake)
ingredients: 500 g glutinous rice, soaked for 30 minutes, drained
50 g palm sugar (gula Melaka), cut in chunks
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place glutinous rice and 400 g water in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 3 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl. Clean mixing bowl.
Place gula Melaka, sugar and 100 g water in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages .

Immediately add 50 g hot water through hole in mixing bowl lid and mix 2 min/speed 2. Let cool to 45°C. Meanwhile, line bottom and sides of 3 round stainless steel cans (Ø 10 cm) with banana leaves, making sure banana leaves cover the cans on all sides. Grease banana leaves with cooking oil
Add reserved glutinous mixture, mix 1 min/speed 5. Then cook 5 min/100°C/speed 3.5. Pour the batter into the cans until 70% full. Cover with aluminium foil. Clean mixing bowl.

Place hot water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, arrange cans to it. Close Varoma lid and steam 90 min/Varoma/speed 2. Cool completely. Unmould nian gao and trim off excess leaves using scissors.
tips: Keep nian gao refrigerated for storage. Freshly cooked nian gao is very sticky and difficult to cut, refrigerate it for 2-3 days will make it harder and easy to cut. (Reminder: If storing at room temperature, put nian gao on wire rack and place at well ventilated place for up to 2 weeks. After 2 weeks, transfer nian gao to freezer for continue storage. Thaw frozen nian gao at room temperature before serving.)
To soften banana leaves, you can blanch them with hot water or wilt the leaf pieces over open flame for a few seconds before lining the cans.
Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Oriental beef stew with pearl couscous
ingredients: 150 g onion (1 onion), cut into halves
2 pinches saffron powder  o ½ tsp saffron threads
¼ tsp smoked paprika powder  o ¼ tsp sweet paprika powder
800 g beef topside steak, trimmed and cut into cubes (3 cm)  o 800 g beef rump steak, trimmed and cut into cubes (3 cm)
1 - 2 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade, to taste  o 1 - 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
½ tsp black pepper, freshly ground
300 g pearl couscous  o 300 g couscous, medium grain
180 g carrots, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
220 g turnip, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
250 g courgette, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
240 g canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained (weight after draining)
steps: Place coriander and parsley into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onion and 20 g of the oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then sauté 1 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add cinnamon, ground ginger, saffron, paprika and nutmeg and sauté 1 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add beef, stock paste, flour, salt and pepper and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .

Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh couscous and remaining olive oil into it. Using your hands, rub couscous to remove the starch. Place large bowl back onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh 500 g of the water into it. Set couscous aside to soak.
Add carrots, turnip, zucchini, reserved coriander and parsley and remaining 400 g of the water and cook 15 min/Varoma//speed .
Drain couscous through Varoma dish. Place Varoma dish with couscous into position, then weigh raisins into it. Add chickpeas, then close Varoma lid and steam 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Stir couscous in Varoma dish with spatula to ensure even cooking, then secure Varoma lid and steam for a futher 5 min/Varoma//speed .
Serve beef stew warm with couscous on the side.
tips: Pearl couscous, also called Israeli couscous, is a type of toasted pasta shaped like little balls made from wheat flour. It is similar to regular couscous. Pearl couscous can be found in the kosher or specialty section of supermarkets.

title: Salmon with mango sauce, flat green beans and carrots
ingredients: 4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (150-180 g each, 4 cm thick)
200 g carrots, cut in pieces (approx. 2 mm)
250 g flat green beans, cut in halves
250 g mango, flesh only, cut in pieces (approx. 3 cm)
1 sprig fresh parsley, leaves only, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Stir cayenne pepper, salt, nutmeg and white pepper in a small bowl. Place salmon fillets on a large sheet of baking paper, rub them all over with cayenne pepper mixture and fold baking paper into a sealed parcel, twisting the ends tightly. Place butterfly whisk flat in Varoma dish and position parcel on top of it to ensure some holes in the Varoma dish remain unobstructed. Insert Varoma tray, add carrots and flat green beans and set aside.
Place mango, brandy, curry powder and water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm.
Add cream and cook 5 min/90°C/speed 1.
Add yoghurt, salt and white pepper and blend 30 sec/speed 10. Remove salmon from parcel, transfer to a serving dish, sprinkle salmon with parsley and serve hot, with sauce and vegetables on the side.
tips: Here’s a fast and easy meal that is original and flavourful. The spice rub gives the tender salmon a kick, which is tempered by the slightly sweet curried mango sauce and fresh vegetables. As always, adjust spices and vegetables to your liking.

Here’s a fast and easy meal that is original and flavourful. The spice rub gives the tender salmon a kick, which is tempered by the slightly sweet curried mango sauce and fresh vegetables. As always, adjust spices and vegetables to your liking.

title: Egg salad in crispy Easter nests
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
250 g flour, plus extra for flouring
steps: Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool completely, then peel, cut in halves and set aside.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and grease (if needed) a 12-hole muffin tray. Set aside.

Place flour, oil, water and salt in mixing bowl then knead Dough /1 min. Transfer dough to a floured work surface and roll out into a square (40 cm x 40 cm) using a rolling pin. Using a knife, cut dough into 12 squares (9 cm x 9 cm) and line each hole of prepared muffin tray with 1 dough square. With the help of a glass press dough into muffin hole (see Tip). Bake for 12 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Meanwhile, bring together remaining dough, roll it out (approx. 2 mm thick) and cut out 24 bunny ear shaped pieces using a tablespoon. Place on prepared baking tray and bake for 10 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool completely.
Place parsley and shallots in mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add reserved boiled eggs, sour cream, mustard, mayonnaise, vinegar, black pepper and salt then mix 15 sec/speed 3. Divide egg salad among baked Easter nests, place two prepared biscuits as ears on top and garnish with chives (if using). Serve immediately or chill in refrigerator until needed.
tips: Prick the bottom of the dough in muffin tray with a fork to ensure even baking.

title: Salted chocolate and date caramels
ingredients: 1 pinch sea salt flakes, plus extra for sprinkling
1 tsp natural vanilla extract or scraped seeds of ½ vanilla pod
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place a heat-resistant deep bowl on the top of mixing bowl lid and weigh in dates. Add boiling water and allow to soak for 10 minutes. Discard as much water as possible from dates.
Place drained dates, coconut oil, 1 pinch salt flakes and vanilla extract into mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a bowl and freeze for 30 minutes.
With wet hands roll one tablespoonful of reserved date mixture into a ball (approx. Ø 2-3 cm). Place ball on prepared baking tray. Repeat with remaining mixture and refrigerate.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 3. Transfer into a heatproof glass and set aside.

Coat each date caramel by dipping it into the ganache. Place balls back on the tray, sprinkle with salt flakes sparingly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Transfer into an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to serve.

title: Boeuf bourguignon
ingredients: 10 g vegetable oil, plus extra for frying
100 g smoked bacon, cut in cubes (2-3 cm)
450 g braising steak, cut in cubes (3 cm)
150 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
150 g fresh white button mushrooms, cut in quarters
steps: Place onions and garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add vegetable oil and bacon and cook 4 min/120°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, heat a frying pan over high heat with vegetable oil and brown the steak for 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle the meat with flour and mix, brown again for 1 minute on each side. Cook in batches if necessary.
Add browned meat to mixing bowl, scraping the bottom of frying pan to collect meat juices. Add carrots, wine, bouquet garni, salt and ground pepper and cook 40 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add mushrooms and cook without measuring cup 30 min/100°C//speed 1. Adjust seasoning if necessary and remove bouquet garni. Serve immediately.
tips: Boeuf Bourguignon is from the Burgundy area of France, and a red burgundy is the wine traditionally used
This dish freezes very well. Allow to cool to room temperature, and transfer to a freezer container
Garnish with 100g quartered mushrooms and 10g chopped flat leaf parsley, for a fresh finish
A red burgindy wine complements this dish very well

title: Mushroom pastry
ingredients: 200 g puff pastry, rolled out (1-2 mm)
400 g fresh mushrooms, cut into quarters
100 g cheese, in slices (e.g. Gruyère, Gouda etc.)
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a pie tray with removable bottom (21 x 31 cm approx.) with baking paper. Line prepared pie tray with pastry.
Place mozzarella cheese in mixing bowl and grate 2 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place parsley in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7.
Add olive oil and garlic, chop 2 sec/speed 8 and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Place 200 g mushrooms in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 4.
Add 200g mushrooms, salt and wine and cook 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add cheese and cook 1 min/100°C/speed . Spread over pastry, sprinkle with grated reserved mozzarella and bake at 200°C for about 25 minutes. Serve immediately.

title: Pasta salad with tuna and basil vinaigrette
ingredients: 30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus some extra to cook pasta
400 g dried penne pasta (or other short type pasta)
350 g canned tuna, in brine or water, drained
150 - 250 g cherry tomatoes, cut in halves
steps: Place water, salt and a little olive oil in mixing bowl and heat 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add pasta and cook for time indicated on packet/100°C/speed 1. Drain pasta through Varoma dish. Transfer to a salad bowl and set aside.
Place olive oil and garlic in mixing bowl, chop 2 sec/speed 8 sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tuna and mix 2 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove, mix with pasta and tomato. Leave to cool.
Place basil, olive oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and honey in mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 7. Mix with pasta and serve immediately.

title: Courgette and cod lasagne
ingredients: 600 g courgettes, cut lengthwise into slices (approx. 0,5 cm)
500 g cod fillet, skinless, cut into pieces (3 cm)
150 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 pinch black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
steps: Place courgette in Varoma dish leaving some holes uncovered for steam to circulate. Place cod on Varoma tray. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish and set aside.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 5 and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add peeled shrimp and sauté 2 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Empty mixing bowl. Place milk, flour, salt, pepper and nutmeg into mixing bowl and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 4.
Preheat oven to 200° C.
Transfer cooked cod fillets to a plate and flake with aid of two forks.

In a heat-resistant casserole dish greased with olive oil, arrange a layer of courgette slices, cover with some cod and shrimp, sprinkle with a little grated cheese and cover with a layer of sauce. Continue forming layers until all ingredients are used up, the last layers being courgette, sauce and grated cheese. Bake for 15 minutes (200°C) until golden brown.
tips: Serve Courgette and cod lasagne accompanied with a salad.

title: Cauliflower and sweet potato salad with nuts
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut into cubes (3 cm) (opcional)
120 g mixed nuts, e.g. pistachios, pine nuts and almonds
700 g cauliflower, broken into florets (3 cm)
4 spring onions, trimmed and cut into quarters
8 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
200 g fresh mushrooms, cut into slices
300 g sweet potato, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
80 g fresh baby spinach, roughly chopped
12 dried apricots, cut into thin strips
½ tsp fine salt, to taste
½ tsp black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
steps: Place Parmesan cheese (optional) into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place mixed nuts, cinnamon, cumin, ginger, coriander and turmeric into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 6. Without measuring cup, dry roast 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place cauliflower florets into mixing bowl and chop 2-3 sec//speed 5. Mix cauliflower with aid of spatula and repeat chopping, if necessary until an evenly chopped consistency is achieved. Transfer chopped cauliflower into Varoma dish and set aside on Varoma lid turned upside down.
Place garlic, spring onions/shallots, 4 sprigs of the parsley and 4 sprigs of the coriander into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mushrooms and wine and combine 10 sec//speed 1. Pour mushroom mixture over cauliflower in Varoma.
Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, then weigh sweet potato into it.

Place Varoma into position, then steam 15-18 min/Varoma/speed 2, or until sweet potato is cooked. Remove Varoma, then remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set vegetables aside to cool and drain for 5 minutes.
Place a large serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh currants and baby spinach into it.

Add dried apricots, reserved spice-nut mixture, cooled cauliflower-mushroom mixture and cooled sweet potato to serving bowl. Season to taste, then stir through remaining parsley and coriander leaves and extra virgin olive oil (optional) with spatula.
Serve immediately topped with reserved Parmesan cheese (optional) or cover and place in refrigerator until use.
tips: Serve cauliflower and sweetpotato salad as a main course by itself or as a side dish. It makes a great salad to take to your next barbecue party or picnic.
Serve cauliflower and sweetpotato salad as a main course by itself or as a side dish. It makes a great salad to take to your next barbecue party or picnic.

title: Cheesecake ice cream
steps: Place vanilla pod and sugar in mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add cream and beat until stiff speed 3, without setting a time.
Add sour cream, cream cheese and lemon juice, stir 6 sec/speed 3. Transfer to ice cube trays. Allow to cool for at least 3 hours until fully frozen. Remove butterfly whisk.
Place half of ice cream cubes in mixing bowl, crush 5 sec/speed 8. Stir until creamy 5 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining ice cream cubes in mixing bowl, crush 5 sec/speed 8. Stir also until creamy 5 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula and transfer to bowl. Serve immediately.
tips: You will need 3-4 ice cube trays for these quantities.
You will need 3-4 ice cube trays for these quantities.

title: Salmon burgers
ingredients: 250 g frozen salmon fillet, thawed and cut into pieces (3-4 cm) (see tip)
50 g white bread, cut into pieces
steps: Place dill and onion in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salmon, bread roll, egg, lemon zest, salt and pepper and chop 10 sec/speed 5.

Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan. Roll mixture into 4 equally-sized patties (Ø approx. 10 cm). Fry salmon burgers over a medium heat for approx. 3–4 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot (see tip).
tips: The salmon fillets will take approx. 1 h 30 min to defrost at room temperature. They should then still be solid, but no longer entirely frozen.If using fresh salmon, cut the fillets into pieces (3-4 cm), lay them flat on a board or in a freezer bag, and allow to freeze.If you do not have any fresh dill, use 1½ tsp frozen or dried dill.Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. mayonnaise or any dip of your choice on two roll halves, place salmon burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, coleslaw or sliced vegetables to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.
The salmon fillets will take approx. 1 h 30 min to defrost at room temperature. They should then still be solid, but no longer entirely frozen.
If using fresh salmon, cut the fillets into pieces (3-4 cm), lay them flat on a board or in a freezer bag, and allow to freeze.
If you do not have any fresh dill, use 1½ tsp frozen or dried dill.

Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. mayonnaise or any dip of your choice on two roll halves, place salmon burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, coleslaw or sliced vegetables to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.

title: Beef burgers with cheese filling
ingredients: 20 g oil, plus extra for frying
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
150 g Cheddar cheese or any other medium-hard cheese, cut into 8 pieces (3 x 3 cm, 5 mm thick)
steps: Soften the roll in water and squeeze out well.
Place parsley in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add squeezed bread roll, egg, beef mince, mustard, salt, pepper, paprika powder and chopped parsley and mix 30 sec//speed 4 with aid of spatula.

Press ⅛ mince mixture flat in your hand, place a piece of cheddar at the centre, closing mince around it. Press down firmly so that the cheese cannot leak out during frying and carefully shape into a flat burger patty (Ø approx. 10 cm). Repeat for 7 other burgers.
Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Fry beef burgers for approx. 3–4 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot.
tips: Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. ketchup or a dip of your choice on two roll halves, place beef burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, coleslaw or pickled gherkin to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.
Replace the cheddar cheese with feta cheese.

title: Caramel ice cream
steps: Place fudge in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10.
Add milk, sugar and salt and heat 6 min/90°C/speed 3 to dissolve.

Add cream and egg yolk and whisk until thick 6 min/80°C/speed 3. Transfer mixture, up to 4 cm high, into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and cover with cling film. Allow to freeze for at least 8 hours.

Remove ice cream from freezer, allow to thaw for 5–10 minutes, turn onto a board and cut into cubes (2–3 cm). Place ice cream cubes in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 7. Then mix until creamy 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. If desired, freeze for a further ½–1 hour, transfer to dessert dishes and serve immediately..
tips: If you would like your caramel ice cream to be darker in colour, add 2-3 drops of caramel colouring to the cream in the mixing bowl.
If you would like your caramel ice cream to be darker in colour, add 2-3 drops of caramel colouring to the cream in the mixing bowl.

title: Energy smoothie
ingredients: 100 g pears, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place bananas and 100 g water into mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 5.
Add kiwi, pears, oat flakes, chia seeds, dates and remaining water and blend 20 sec/speed 8. Serve immediately.
tips: For a drink with a higher protein content, it is possible to increase the share of protein by adding one teaspoon of powdered protein in step 1.For a thicker result, substitute the water with the same quantity of ice cubes.
For a drink with a higher protein content, it is possible to increase the share of protein by adding one teaspoon of powdered protein in step 1.
For a thicker result, substitute the water with the same quantity of ice cubes.

title: Three-course meal for two: Vegetable soup, Chicken casserole with rice, Steamed apple
ingredients: 50 g bread roll  o 50 g white bread
5 sprigs fresh coriander  o 5 sprigs fresh parsley
250 g carrots, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
250 g courgettes, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g leek, white part only, cut in slices
500 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in strips (10 cm x 1 cm)  o 500 g turkey breast fillets, skinless, cut in strips (10 cm x 1 cm)
1 apple, cut in eighths  o 1 pear, cut in eighths
steps: Place bread roll, garlic clove and coriander in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 100 g carrots, 100 g courgettes and 50 g leek in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4. Transfer to Varoma dish.
Place chicken in Varoma dish on top of vegetables and season with 1 tsp salt, black pepper and thyme. Set aside.
Place apple, sugar, cinnamon and lemon zest on a sheet of baking paper, close parcel well and place on Varoma tray. Set aside.
Place onions, garlic cloves and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add bay leaf and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .

Remove bay leaf, add remaining 150 g carrots, remaining 150 g courgettes, remaining 50 g leek, water and 1 tsp salt. Insert simmering basket, weigh rice into it and mix well using spatula to wet all rice grains. Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish, set Varoma in position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula and set aside. Keep rice warm until ready to serve.
Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 5-9, increasing speed gradually. Transfer vegetable soup to a bowl and keep warm.
Preheat oven to 180°C.

Place milk, flour, butter, salt, black pepper and nutmeg in mixing bowl and cook 5 min/90°C/speed 4. Place chicken with reserved vegetables in a baking dish, cover with béchamel sauce and sprinkle with reserved flavoured breadcrumbs. Bake for approx. 20 minutes (180°C) or until brown. Serve vegetable soup as a starter, followed by baked chicken and vegetables casserole with rice and finish with steamed cinnamon apple for dessert.
tips: Steamed cinnamon apple can be served with vanilla or any other flavour of ice cream.
Courgettes, carrots and leek can be replaced with the same weight of other vegetables, such as broccoli.
Replace chicken breasts with white fish fillets.

title: Marzipan bites
steps: Place sugar and pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides with aid of spatula.
Add rose water and mix 20 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a bowl, shape into a ball and cover with cling film.
Place sugar into clean and dry mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10.
Add blanched almonds and grind 30 sec/speed 9, then 30 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula.
Add blossom water and rose water and mix 25 sec/speed 6, with aid of spatula. Remove marzipan from mixing bowl and form into a flattened ball. Wrap in cling film and reserve.

Shape reserved pistachio paste into 6 logs (17 cm) and set aside. Divide reserved marzipan in 2 equal pieces and keep wrapped with cling film until needed. Place one piece of marzipan onto a sheet of baking paper, flatten with hands, place a second sheet of baking paper on top and, with a rolling pin, rollout into a rectangular shape (5 mm thick). Trim the edges and cut obtaining 2 rectangular shapes (17 cm x 9-10 cm). Place a log of pistachio paste along the longest edge and roll the marzipan around to enclose the pistachio paste. Seal the joint with some water. Cut the filled roll into 4 pieces (4 cm each). Repeat process until all marzipan and pistachio paste is used up (use the scraps from trimming the edges for the extra 2 pistachio logs). Serve immediately or allow them to dry for a couple of hours before storing.
tips: To blanch 500 g almonds place 600 g water into mixing bowl, heat 8 min/100°C/speed 3, then add almonds into mixing bowl and boil 3 min/100°C/speed . Immediately rinse almonds under cold running water, peel them and place on kitchen towels to cool completely. Dry well before using almonds in any recipe.
The shape and size of marzipan bites can vary according to personal preference. For a more formal presentation, garnish marzipan bites with roughly chopped nuts.

title: Sweet cheese rolls (halawet el jebn)
ingredients: 1 tsp lemon juice, freshly squeezed  o 1 tsp citric acid
150 g white bread, crust removed, cut into pieces
500 g akkawi cheese, desalted, cut into pieces (see tip)
200 g mozzarella, rinsed and dried, cut into pieces
unsalted pistachio nuts, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place sugar, water, lemon juice and blossom water into mixing bowl and heat 10 min/115°C/speed 2. Transfer into a heat-resistant bowl and set aside to cool down. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place milk into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add bread, cornflour and heat 4 min/90°C/speed 2.
Add blossom water and rose water and cook 1 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Transfer into a shallow bowl and set aside to cool for approx. 40 minutes. Then refrigerate for 1 hour.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh medium wheat semolina and fine semolina in it and set aside
Place desalted Akkawi cheese into mixing bowl and grate 20 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place mozzarella into mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 6.
Add grated Akkawi and 260 g syrup and heat 8 min/80°C/speed 2.
Heat without measuring cup 8 min/80°C/speed 2 while adding reserved semolina-mixture slowly through the opening in mixing bowl lid. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool.

Lightly grease a sheet of baking paper with oil. Transfer dough on a work surface, divide into 4 pieces, cover with cling film and set aside. Place one piece of dough onto prepared baking paper, flatten with hands, place a second sheet of baking paper on top and, with a rolling pin, roll out into a rectangular shape of 2-3 mm thickness. Cut into strips (3 cm x 12 cm). Place 1 tsp of kashta cream on the bottom short edge and roll to form a short cylinder. Press down gently with your fingers to slightly flatten. Repeat with remaining dough and cream. Place a bit of cream in the centre of each roll and garnish with chopped pistachio nuts. Serve with syrup.
tips: To desalt Akkawi cheese, soak it for 12 hours or overnight in abundant water, changing the water every half hour in the first hours. Drain and pat dry before use.

title: Spicy sea bass (samke harra)
ingredients: 1500 g sea bass (2-4 pieces), gutted  o 1500 g gilthead bream, whole, gutted
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
250 g ripe tomatoes, cut into halves
steps: Distribute sea bass in Varoma dish and tray, drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle over and inside the fish with salt, pepper and cumin. Put bay leaves and lemon slices inside the fish and set aside.
Place fresh coriander, garlic, onions, tomatoes, water, paprika, 1 tsp salt, lemon juice and ground coriander into mixing bowl and chop 20 sec/speed 5.
Place Varoma into position and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, take fish filets apart and transfer to a serving dish, coat with sauce and serve.

title: Raw kibbeh
ingredients: 500 g lamb meat or beef meat, sinew free, cut into cubes (3 cm)  o 500 g beef, sinew free, cut into cubes (3 cm)
80 g fine bulgur wheat, soaked and well strained (see tip)
steps: Place onions, salt, pepper, mint and basil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place lamb and ice-cubes into mixing bowl and mince 3 min/speed 6.

Add bulgur, reserved onion mixture, Arabian spice mix and knead 2 min/. Transfer onto a serving platter, shape, score surface with a sharp knife and refrigerate until serving. Garnish with extra virgin olive oil and basil leaves before serving.
tips: Do not let rinsed bulgur rest for more than 30 minutes, as it will soak too much.
Raw kibbeh should always be eaten on the same day. Any leftovers should be cooked or fried.

title: Traditional mint tea
steps: Place water into mixing bowl and heat 8 min/100°C/speed .
Place tea leaves into simmering basket and rinse under cold running water.
Add sugar and mint to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and heat 10 min/90°C//speed 1. Remove simmering basket and transfer tea to small tea glasses. Serve immediately.

title: German Cookies
ingredients: 250 g butter, cut in cubes (2 cm)
3 - 6 drops food colouring paste, pink, brown and black
steps: Place potato starch and superfine flour in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/1 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place icing sugar in mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/1 sec/2 times.
Add butter, mix 3 min/speed 3.
Add reserved flour, mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl. Shape into a round ball. Cover with cling film and refrigerate for 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 140°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.

Take a small ball (20 g) and mix with 1-2 drops of pink food colouring. Take another small ball (20 g) and mix with 1-2 drops of brown food colouring. Take another small ball (20 g) and mix with 1-2 drops of black food colouring respectively. To form little cows, roll remaining dough into small balls (ø 2 cm), use pink dough to form nose, brown dough to form horns and black dough to form spots and eyes. Arrange cow-shaped cookies on lined baking tray.
Bake for 15 minutes (140°C, middle rack) until the cookie surface look dry and remain pale colour. Let cool completely and serve.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
For best results, use a fan-powered oven in this recipe.

title: Pulut Panggang (Grilled Rice Packets)
ingredients: 360 g Thai glutinous rice, soaked for 2 hours
1 banana leaf, cut in 16 pieces (15 cm x 8 cm)
steps: Place a square baking tin (14 cm x 14 cm x 5 cm) on mixing bowl lid, weigh in coconut milk and glutinous rice. Add salt and mix. Place pandan leaves on top of the rice. Place in Varoma dish. Divide dried shrimp floss into 16 equal portions.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 35 min/Varoma/speed 3, prolong time if necessary until rice is evenly cooked. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove pandan leaves. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Divide steamed glutinous rice into 16 equal portions.

Brush a piece of banana leaf with oil using a pastry brush. Place 1 portion cooked glutinous rice on the banana leaf, flatten it. Place 1 portion reserved dried shrimp floss in the centre on top of the cooked glutinous rice. Roll glutinous rice and seal parcels at both ends using toothpicks. Repeat the steps for remaining rice and dried shrimp floss until finished. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 100°C.
Baked for 10-15 minutes (100°C) or until the leaves are slightly dried up. Serve hot.
tips: When selecting the tin to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicon); ensure the size of tin is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Lion's Mane Mushroom Curry
ingredients: 300 g fresh lion's mane mushrooms, frozen, thawed
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in lion’s mane mushrooms. Add ground turmeric and 1/8 tsp salt to it, mix well and set aside to marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan with 50 g vegetable oil, pan fry marinated lion’s mane mushroom until golden brown (see tips).
Place garlic, ginger, onions and tomatoes in mixing bowl, blend 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee, cinnamon stick, star anise, bay leaves and curry leaves, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed .

Add chilli powder, garam masala, cumin powder, black pepper powder, jaggery sugar and 2 tsp salt, cook 5 min/Varoma//speed . Add coconut milk and almond paste through hole in mixing bowl lid, continue to cook 3 min/Varoma//speed .
Insert butterfly whisk, add reserved lion’s mane mushrooms, cook 2 min/Varoma/speed 0.5. Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves, serve hot.
tips: For a healthier option, use an air fryer to fry lion's mane mushrooms with a little spray of oil. Set the time and temperature according to manufacturer's instructions.
Almond paste can be made by soaking 20 g almonds in hot water for 10-15 minutes, blend de-skinned almond with 50 g water for 1 min / speed 10.
Recipe contributed by Mageswari Ramasamy.
You may add 100 g boiled baby potatoes in step 6.
For a vegan version, replace ghee with vegetable oil.

title: Christmas Upside Down Cake
ingredients: 60 g unsalted butter, diced, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease and line a round cake tin (Ø 20 cm) with baking paper.

Place butter and sugar in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/60°C/speed 2. Transfer to prepared tin, spreading evenly across base. Arrange mixed dried fruits, raisins and cherries evenly then place in refrigerator for 15 minutes.
Place butter and sugar in mixing bowl, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add flour, eggs, baking powder, vanilla extract, lemon zest, water and 2 tbsp dark rum, mix 1 min/speed 5. Mix further with spatula if necessary. Transfer to cake tin on top of mixed dried fruits and smooth surface with spatula.

Bake for 50 minutes (170°C) until golden and a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. While still hot, sprinkle cake with 4 tbsp dark rum. Leave in cake tin to cool for 10 minutes then invert cake tin onto a serving plate. Serve warm or refrigerate until ready to serve.

title: Pulut Pagi (Glutinous Rice Balls with Savoury Coconut Topping)
ingredients: 2 red bird's eye chillies (cili padi), deseeded (opcional)
50 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in glutinous rice and 600 g water. Soak for 4 hours or overnight. Drain through simmering basket. Set aside.

Place coconut milk, 300 g water, salt and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with soaked glutinous rice, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 3. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove simmering basket with spatula.

To shape glutinous rice ball, cupline measuring cup with a piece of cling film (10 cm x 10 cm). Scoop 2 tablespoon of glutinous rice and place on cling film. Wrap up glutinous rice and twist end of cling film to form a ball shape. Repeat with remaining glutinous rice until finished. Clean mixing bowl.

Place red chillies, bird’s eyes chillies, dried shrimp, lemongrass, shallots, garlic cloves, ground coriander, ground cumin, ground fennel and salt in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 4 sec/speed 6 again. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add grated coconut and oil, sauté without measuring cup 6 min/120°C/speed 1, prolong cooking time if necessary until golden brown. Transfer to a bowl. Unwrap reserved glutinous rice balls and top with a tablespoon of serunding udang. Serve immediately.
tips: To serve pulut pagi, you can also coat the glutinous rice balls with serunding udang.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Vegetarian Curry in Pumpkin Pot
ingredients: 3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only, bruised
15 g old ginger, cut in slices
5 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
100 g fresh lion's mane mushrooms, cut in pieces
50 g king oyster mushrooms (eringi), cut in pieces (4 cm)
25 g tofu puffs, cut in halves
25 g long beans, cut in 3 cm strips
1 medium-sized pumpkin, cored, as container (see tip)
steps: Place 2 stalks lemongrass, old ginger, galangal, turmeric, red chillies, dried chillies, coriander seeds, curry powder, coconut oil and 25 g water in mixing bowl, chop 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 20 sec/speed 10 again. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 1 stalk lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add pandan leaf, lion’s mane mushrooms, king oyster mushrooms, tofu puffs, carrot strips, long bean and coconut milk, 150 g water, toasted coconut paste, light soy sauce, salt and brown sugar, mix 20 sec//speed 1. Transfer into pumpkin and place pumpkin in Varoma dish. Close Varoma lid. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve hot.
tips: When selecting the pumpkin to be used in the Varoma, ensure the size of pumpkin is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
Use spoon to scoop out cooked pumpkin flesh and eat together with curry.

title: Roasted Pork Belly with Leek Stir-Fry
ingredients: 300 g roasted pork, cut in 1 cm strips
5 sprigs leek, cut in 3 cm strips
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add roasted pork, leeks, light soy sauce, water, rice wine and sugar, stir fry 4 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.

title: Nyonya Spice Paste
ingredients: 20 g dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften
6 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
30 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
20 g fresh ginger, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
1 torch lily, bud only, cut in quarters (opcional)
steps: Place soaked dried chillies, red chillies, shallots, garlic cloves, lemongrass, galangal, ginger, torch lily, shrimp paste and cooking oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add sugar and salt, sauté 15 min/90°C/speed 2. Use as a base for curries (see tip) or transfer to 2 airtight jars (400 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Use as a base for a tasty curry: combine Nyonya spice paste with curry  powder, coconut milk and tamarind juice and add chicken, seafood, meat or vegetables as preferred.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Yasai Yaki
ingredients: 100 g brinjals, cut in pieces (2 cm)
110 g siu bak choy, trimmed, horizontally halved
1 tbsp toasted sesame seeds, black and white, to garnish
steps: Place 200 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, weigh in brinjals and steam 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with spatula and set cooked brinjals aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place 40 g water in mixing bowl, boil 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Add mung bean sprouts, cabbage, siu bak choy, steamed brinjals, soy sauce and mirin, without measuring cup, stir fry 6 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a serving plate, drizzle with cold pressed sesame oil and sesame oil, then stir well. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Brown Rice Congee
ingredients: 1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 tbsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in minced meat. Add 1 tsp sesame oil, light soy sauce, rice wine, cornflour and white pepper powder. Mix and set aside to marinate.
Place garlic clove and onion in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 2 tsp sesame oil, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved minced meat, chicken stock powder, brown rice and water, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: If you prefer a thicker consistency, after step 4, place simmering basket instead of measuring onto mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing, and cook a further 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Braised Rice Wine Fish
ingredients: 15 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
3 sprigs spring onions, cut in 4 cm length
600 g fish (1 whole fish), descaled and gutted (see tips)
steps: Place cooking oil, ginger, black peppercorns and spring onion in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C//speed .

Insert butterfly whisk. Arrange fish around sides of mixing bowl on both sides of butterfly whisk with stomach facing up. Ensure that fish sits on top of blades. Add light soy sauce, dark soy sauce and rice wine over fish evenly. Cook 8 min/120°C//speed . Check if fish is cooked, prolong cooking time if necessary (see tip). Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: Take the fish out of the refrigerator and let defrost to room temperature for 15 minutes
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Sambal Belacan
steps: Place red chillies, bird's eye chillies and shrimp paste in mixing bowl and chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Serve as condiment for noodles and rice or transfer to 1 airtight jar (100 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Drizzle with freshly squeezed Calamansi lime juice upon serving.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Potato Peratal
ingredients: 600 g potatoes, cut in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm)
steps: Place potato cubes and water in mixing bowl, boil 20 min/100°C//speed . Drain through simmering basket. Transfer potato cubes to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place cooking oil, onions, curry leaves and green chilli slices in mixing bowl, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .
Add tomato wedges and chilli paste, stir fry 7 min/120°C//speed .
Add reserved potato cubes and salt, cook without measuring cup, 4 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Jaya Rani Gangathanam.

title: Long Bean Rice
ingredients: 300 g pork belly, skinless, cut in slices
6 Chinese dried mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed and cut in slices
30 g carrots, cut in small chunks
300 g long beans, cut in 5 cm length
20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork belly. Add ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp sesame oil and 1 pinch white pepper powder. Mix and set aside.
Place dried shrimp in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and mushroom slices, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add marinated pork belly, sauté 11 min/120°C//speed 1. Transfer dried shrimp, mushroom and pork belly to a bowl and set aside. Leaving excess oil in mixing bowl.
Add garlic cloves to mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add carrots and long bean, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place rice, reserved dried shrimp, reserved mushroom and reserved pork belly, 1 tsp salt, light soy sauce, rice wine, oyster sauce,1 pinch white pepper powder and water, cook 5 min/100°C//speed . Then, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 10 minutes.
Add reserved garlic cloves, carrots and long beans to mixing bowl, mix well with spatula. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Steamed Chicken Essence
ingredients: 2 whole chicken legs (approx. 900 g), preferably free range, halved at joints, rinsed
steps: Remove bone splinters from chicken legs. Pat dry with kitchen paper towels. Add ginger juice and salt to chicken legs. Mix and marinate, set aside for 20 minutes. Meanwhile continue with recipe.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice wine. Add dang gui slices and wolfberries. Let soak for 20 minutes.
Arrange marinated chicken, soaked dang gui slices and wolfberries in a stew pot (Ø 10 cm x 9 cm). Drizzle reserved wine on chicken pieces. Cover with pot lid and place in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma with stew pot into position, steam 45 min/Varoma/speed 3. Serve hot.
tips: Best served as part of a post-natal diet after delivery from day 12 onwards.
Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Sup Kambing (Aromatic Lamb Soup)
ingredients: 700 g lamb shanks, fat trimmed, cut in cubes (3 cm)
150 g red onion, cut in halves
25 g kurma mix powder, store-bought or homemade (see tips)
150 - 200 g potatoes, cut in cubes (2 cm)
2 - 5 bird's eye chillies (chilli padi), cut in halves
5 stalks fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped, to garnish
2 sprigs spring onions, thinly sliced, to garnish
steps: Place lamb shank and 1500 g water in mixing bowl, heat 10 min/50°C//speed . Discard water and set aside.
Place garlic cloves, ginger, green chillies, red onions and shallots in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 20 sec/speed 8 until smooth.
Add ghee, cumin seeds, cloves, bay leaves, ground black pepper, cardamom pods, lemongrass and star anise, sauté 13 min/120°C//speed 2 until oil is released.
Add kurma mix powder, reserved lamb shanks, tomatoes, potatoes, 800 g water, ground turmeric, salt, chicken stock powder and birds' eye chillies. start Slow Cook /1 h 30 min/98°C.
Cook again 15 min/100°C//speed . Garnish with fried shallots, chopped coriander leaves, chopped celery leaves and spring onion slices. Serve hot.
tips: Machine slicing service is available for frozen lamb bought in some butcher stores.
Replace kurma mix with 1 tsp ground cinnamon, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp fennel, 1 tsp ground white pepper, 1 tsp ground turmeric, 2 tsp ground coriander and 1 tsp ground nutmeg.
Remove excess fat from the soup using a ladle before serving.
Serve with bread or rice. Adjust spiciness according to personal preference.

title: Bibimbap burrito
ingredients: 400 g beef fillet steak, cut in strips (approx. 2 cm x 5 cm)
20 g fresh ginger root, sliced (2 mm)
½ tsp salt, plus 4-5 pinches for seasoning
30 g spring onions, cut in pieces
20 g oil, plus 1 tbsp extra for frying eggs
150 g fresh shiitake mushrooms, sliced (0,5 cm)
180 g short-grain rice, Korean or Japanese
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in beef and set aside.
Place garlic and ginger in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add gochujang paste, soy sauce, 50 g water, sugar and ½ tsp salt then mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to bowl with beef and mix well with spatula.
Place spring onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add oil, shiitake mushrooms, sesame seeds and 2-3 pinches salt then sauté 5 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, place rice in simmering basket and rinse well under cold water and drain. Transfer mushrooms to a bowl and set aside.

Place remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with rice. Place Varoma dish in position and weigh in spinach on the left and carrots on the right side. Insert Varoma tray and weigh bean sprouts onto it, then close Varoma and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 4. Meanwhile, fry beef in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat until soft, then transfer to a bowl. Set Varoma aside. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and transfer rice to a bowl. Transfer steamed bean sprouts to a small bowl, add 1 tsp soy sauce and mix. Squeeze spinach with spatula and transfer to a bowl. Add sesame oil and 2 pinches salt then mix and set aside. Heat 1 tbsp oil in the same frying pan and fry 4 eggs sunny side up. Remove from frying pan and set aside.

Place 1 tortilla on work surface. Arrange 1 line of ¼ cooked rice, ¼ spinach, ¼ shiitake mushrooms, ¼ carrots, ¼ bean sprouts and ¼ fried beef strips. Top with 1 egg upside down and carefully fold sides towards centre then roll up tightly. Repeat with remaining tortillas and prepared ingredients (see tip). Serve immediately.
tips: Wrap each burrito in baking paper and store in refrigerator until needed.
Gochujang paste is a savoury, sweet, and spicy fermented condiment popular in Korean cooking.

title: Chicken and pepper souvlaki with rice
ingredients: 20 g fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced
1 - 2 tsp toasted sesame oil (5-10 g), to taste
800 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in cubes (2-3 cm)
400 g peppers (approx. 2 peppers), cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place ginger, garlic cloves, soy sauce, honey, toasted sesame oil, barbecue sauce and black pepper in mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer marinade to a bowl.
Add chicken to marinade, stir to coat and allow to marinate in refrigerator for at least 15 minutes (this time can be used for preparing the peppers).

Thread the chicken cubes, alternating with peppers, onto skewers (approx. 18 cm long) and arrange skewers on Varoma dish and tray. Place remaining marinade, vegetable stock paste and salt in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, add long-grain rice to it, then add water over rice. Stir using spatula to wet all the rice. Set Varoma in position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside. Remove simmering basket using spatula, transfer rice to a serving bowl and cover to keep warm. Transfer cooking liquid to a bowl.

Place 400 g reserved cooking liquid and cornflour in mixing bowl, set Varoma back in position and cook 5 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside and adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot, presenting rice with chicken skewers on top and sauce on the side, or pour some sauce over the skewers and rice.
tips: Most travellers to Greece will have tasted souvlaki, the appetising barbecued meat skewers sold on many street corners. With this recipe you can easily prepare beautifully tender Thermomix®-style souvlaki at home, making them accessible even on a week night. And the best part is, as there’s no need to fire up the barbecue, this can be a year-round nourishing meal for the family.

Most travellers to Greece will have tasted souvlaki, the appetising barbecued meat skewers sold on many street corners. With this recipe you can easily prepare beautifully tender Thermomix®-style souvlaki at home, making them accessible even on a week night. And the best part is, as there’s no need to fire up the barbecue, this can be a year-round nourishing meal for the family.
For a stronger flavour, marinate the chicken overnight in the refrigerator in step 2.
For a stronger flavour, marinate the chicken overnight in the refrigerator in step 2.

title: White chocolate chip cookies
ingredients: 50 g milk chocolate, in pieces  o 50 g white chocolate, in pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line 3 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.
Place white chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, egg, flour, baking soda and salt in mixing bowl then mix 30 sec/speed 5.

Add reserved white chocolate and mix 20 sec//speed 3. Transfer dough to work surface, form into a ball then roll out into a rectangle approx. 0,5 cm thick using a rolling pin. Cut out cookies using cookie cutters and place on prepared baking trays (see tip).
Bake in batches for 10-12 minutes each (170°C) or until golden. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack. Allow to cool completely.

Place milk chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt 2 min/50°C/speed 3. Spread melted chocolate on cookies once they are cold, then decorate as desired with sprinkles. Serve immediately or store in an air-tight container.
tips: When placing the cookies on to prepared baking trays, make sure you keep them separated (approx. 5 cm) as they will extend during baking.
Use any shape of cookie cutters. The total number of cookies will depend on the size of the cookie cutters used.

title: Steamed potato frittata
ingredients: 100 g Emmental cheese or any other medium-hard cheese, cut into pieces
30 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
100 g cooked ham, in slices, cut into pieces
steps: Place potatoes into mixing bowl and chop coarsley Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Transfer potatoes to simmering basket and set aside.

Place 500 g water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, transfer potatoes to a bowl and set aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place Emmental, Parmesan and parsley into mixing bowl and grate 20 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place ham into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add grated cheese mixture, eggs, cooked potatoes, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper and mix 10 sec//speed 4.
Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish. Line Varoma tray with damp baking paper and make sure to keep some holes unobstructed. Transfer egg mixture onto Varoma tray and spread out evenly using spatula.
Place remaining 1000 g water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and slide frittata onto a serving plate. Serve immediately.

title: Duck, apricot and pine nut pastilla
ingredients: 1 ½ - 2 tsp ground cumin, to taste
ground cinnamon, plus extra for garnish
1 ½ - 2 tsp ground coriander, to taste
600 g duck breast, skinless, boneless, cut in pieces (3 cm)
150 g dried apricot, pitted, cut in quarters
1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
toasted pine nuts, plus extra for garnish
2 lemons, preferably organic, zest and juice
4 sheets filo pastry (approx. 48 cm x 25 cm)
steps: Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, ground coriander, fennel seeds and saffron and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add duck breast and 70 g dried apricots and sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .

Add water, chicken stock paste, 20 g toasted pine nuts, lemon zest and juice, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and reduce 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Meanwhile preheat oven to 220°C.
Then chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 80 g dried apricots and 30 g toasted pine nuts and mix using spatula.

Grease a springform tin (Ø 22-24 cm) with olive oil. Brush a sheet of filo pastry with olive oil, then line the springform tin with it, allowing the pastry to fall over the edge of the tin. Repeat with a second sheet of filo pastry, positioning the corners so that a star shape is formed. Pour the duck filling into it and spread evenly.

Fold edges of filo pastry over to enclose the filling. Cover with the remaining 2 sheets of filo pastry, brushing each with olive oil, and crumpling them attractively. Bake pastilla 20-30 minutes (220°C) or until crisp and golden brown. Serve pastilla garnished with pine nuts and dust with a pinch of cinnamon and icing sugar.

title: Chicken with red peppers
ingredients: 350 g red peppers, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
2 - 3 anchovy fillets, in oil or brine, well drained
700 g chicken legs, skinless, bone in (thighs and drumsticks separated)
50 g vegetable broth (opcional)  o 50 g water + tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade (opcional)
steps: Place 1 garlic clove and 20 g olive oil into mixing bowl and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add peppers, basil and 1 teaspoon of salt, cook 15 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl, discard the garlic and set aside.
Place remaining olive oil, remaining clove of garlic, thyme, rosemary, chilli, bay into mixing bowl and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add the anchovies, chicken pieces and beer and cook 25 min/120°C//speed 1. If necessary, add the broth and extend the cooking time by several minutes.
Add the cooked peppers, season, continue to cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer the chicken and peppers to a serving plate, let it rest for a few minutes and serve.
tips: Depending on the size of the chicken thighs, it may be necessary to extend the cooking time in step 5 by a few minutes.

title: Russian salad
ingredients: 600 g potatoes, cut into small cubes
steps: Place water into mixing bowl and insert simmering basket with the eggs.
Place Varoma dish into position and put potatoes, carrots, peas and green beans inside. Cover Varoma and steam 26 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Set Varoma aside. Place steamed vegetables in a large salad bowl. Season with salt to taste and allow to cool.
Drain the tin of tuna and place fish and chopped eggs into the bowl with the vegetables.
Add mayonnaise into the bowl with the vegetables, tuna and eggs and mix. Refrigerate until serving.

title: Green pancakes with ham and cheese
ingredients: 15 g olive oil, plus extra for frying
200 g frozen spinach leaves, thawed and squeezed
200 g medium-hard cheese, cut into pieces (e. g. Cheddar)
180 g cooked ham in slices, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place flour, milk, oil, eggs and salt in mixing bowl then mix 5 sec/speed 6.
Add thawed spinach and mix 20 sec/speed 7.

Heat a little olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Pour a small ladle of batter into the centre then spread out thinly. Cook for 2-3 minutes, flip over and cook for a further minute then transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining batter until batter is used up. Clean mixing bowl then prepare filling.
Preheat oven to 180°C and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 8. Remove 3 tbsp grated cheese and set aside for topping.
Add ham and pepper then chop 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Place a pancake on a clean surface then fill with 2½ tbsp ham and cheese mixture then roll and place on lined baking tray. Repeat with remaining pancakes. Sprinkle 3 tbsp reserved grated cheese over pancakes then bake for 15 minutes (180°C) until edges are golden and cheese has melted. Serve hot.

title: Monkfish tagine with preserved lemon
ingredients: 100 g onions, cut into quarters  o 100 g spring onions, cut into pieces
30 g fresh coriander, roughly cut, plus extra to garnish
1 tsp salt, plus one pinch extra
600 g monkfish fillet, skinless, boneless, cut into 4 pieces
30 g fresh mint, leaves only, plus extra to garnish
180 g carrots, cut into pieces (3 x 3 cm)
100 g turnips, cut into pieces (3 x 3 cm)
150 g potatoes, cut into pieces (3 x 3 cm)
1 preserved lemon, cut into quarters (see tip)
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place onions, garlic, ginger, red chilli, parsley and coriander into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 40 g olive oil, lemon juice and salt and mix10 sec/speed 2. Transfer to a large bowl and add monkfish, mix with spatula to coat and allow to marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Place mint into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add carrots, turnip, potatoes, preserved lemon, salt and pepper, cumin, turmeric, nutmeg, cinnamon and olive oil to the mixing bowl and sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .

Transfer contents of mixing bowl into simmering basket, reserving cooking liquid. Place water, marinade (without pieces of monkfish) and reserved cooking liquid into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with vegetables and cook 25 min/Varoma//speed .
Place pieces of monkfish on Varoma tray. Place Varoma into position and continue steaming 8 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and simmering basket, set aside and keep warm.

Insert measuring cup and blend 30 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Strain sauce using a sieve and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer monkfish tagine to a serving dish, sprinkle with mint and fresh coriander leaves and serve with the sauce.
tips: For a more generous accompaniment, add some wheat semolina which you can cook in the Varoma dish.

Preserved lemon is a common condiment in North African cuisine and a key ingredient in many Moroccan dishes such as tagines. Whole lemons are pickled in a brine of water, lemon juice and salt to obtain a slightly tart but very lemony flavour. If preserved lemons cannot be found, a small lemon and ½ teaspoon salt may be used instead. The flavour will not be the same, though.

title: Chicken tagine with honey and prunes
ingredients: 2 pinches freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place onions and garlic into mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1 without measuring cup.

Add 300 g water to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and place chicken, 3 pinches of salt, pepper, coriander, cumin, allspice, prunes and figs in it and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed . Meanwhile, place semolina, 1 tbsp olive oil and 3 pinches salt into a large bowl and mix with a fork. Add raisins and remaining water and allow to soak for a few minutes.

Remove simmering basket with spatula. Add honey and almonds to contents of mixing bowl. Reinsert simmering basket. Transfer semolina onto Varoma tray and spread it, place Varoma into position and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Fluff up semolina using a fork and transfer to a serving dish. Arrange meat and dried fruits all around it. Serve sauce separately.
tips: For a less sweet tagine, adjust the quantity of honey or add a little freshly squeezed lemon juice.
For a less sweet tagine, adjust the quantity of honey or add a little freshly squeezed lemon juice.

title: Pasta with leek and ajvar
ingredients: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (2-3 cm) (opcional)
1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
400 g short dried pasta, e.g. fusilli, penne, macaroni etc.
200 g leek, cut into rings (5 mm)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside
Place water, ajvar, cream, stock cube and salt in mixing bowl and bring to boil 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add pasta and leeks, and cook time indicated on packet/100°C//speed  until al dente. Arrange pasta on plates, garnish with grated parmesan (optional) and serve hot.
tips: Ajvar is a type of sweet to spicy relish, made from roasted red bell peppers. Ajvar originates in Serbian cuisine and is nowadays popular throughout the Balkans. You can find ajvar in the international section of supermarkets and in specialty shops.
If you enjoy spicy food, use the spicy ajvar variety or add some cayenne pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley.

title: Turkey burgers
ingredients: 1 bread roll, stale and cut into quarters
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Dice turkey (approx. 2 cm), remove sinews and allow to freeze for approx. 1 hour.
Place pieces of bread roll in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 8.
Add onion and chop 3 sec/speed 8.
Add frozen turkey, egg, paprika, mustard, salt, pepper, vegetable broth powder and water, and chop 30 sec/speed 7 with aid of spatula.
Shape 10 burgers from mixture (or 20 mini meatballs) and fry in hot oil until golden on both sides. Serve hot or cold.
tips: If desired, also chop fresh herbs such as parsley or basil with onion.Serve burgers with ketchup.
If desired, also chop fresh herbs such as parsley or basil with onion.
Serve burgers with ketchup.

title: Cocoa mocha almonds
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Line baking tray with baking paper.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg white and salt in mixing bowl and beat until stiff 2 min/speed 3.5.
Add sugar, vanilla sugar, cardamom, cinnamon, cocoa and espresso and beat again 20 sec/speed 3.5 weiterschlagen. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add almonds and stir in 20 sec//speed 1. Stir again with aid of spatula, then spread almonds on baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes (150°C)
Allow almonds to cool for 20 minutes. Break into bite-sized pieces and store in jars or little bags

title: Mediterranean pearl barley risotto
ingredients: 250 g pearl barley, medium, washed and drained
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade, vegan (see tip)  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l), vegan
50 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, cut into strips (5 mm)
steps: Place shallots in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pearl barley and cook 3 min/100°C//speed 1 without measuring cup.
Add wine and deglaze 1 min/100°C//speed  without measuring cup.

Add water, stock cube, salt, pepper and thyme, position simmering basket on mixing bowl lid instead of measuring cup and cook 20 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, roast pine nuts in a pan without fat and set aside.
Add courgette slices to mixing bowl, use spatula to carefully stir in and continue to cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Allow risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 3–5 minutes. Add dried tomatoes, roasted pine nuts and almond butter, use spatula to carefully stir in and serve immediately.
tips: Prepare the vegetable stock paste featured in The Basic Cook Book without parmesan and with vegan wine for a vegan variation of this paste.
If the courgettes are very large, cut them in half lengthwise first before slicing.

title: Spicy tomato salsa (dakkous)
ingredients: 1 small green chilli  o ½ tsp dried chilli flakes, adjust to taste
500 g ripe tomatoes, cut into quarters
steps: Place garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 8.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chilli, tomatoes, tomato paste, coriander, salt and pepper, chop 15 sec/speed 6, then cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Dakkous is a Middle Eastern tomato sauce which is served with rice dishes.
The sauce may be stored in a sealed jar in the refrigerator and heated as required.

title: Middle Eastern eggs
ingredients: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
10 g toasted pine nuts, to garnish
steps: Place onions, garlic and oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add spinach leaves and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1 without measuring cup. Season with nutmeg, sumac, salt, black pepper and mix with spatula.

Grease ramekins and place sautéed spinach at the bottom of each ramekin. Crack an egg on top of spinach in each ramekin. Season with salt and ground black pepper and distribute ramekins in Varoma dish and tray. Insert Varoma tray in dish and close.

Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, carefully remove ramekins from Varoma and garnish with pine nuts and a pinch of sumac before serving.
tips: Serve with pitta bread or any type of bread of your choice.
For a richer version, in step 6 add a teaspoon labneh onto the egg whites, avoiding to cover the yolk.

title: Lamb with rice and aubergines (maghlobat badenjan)
ingredients: 700 g lamb shoulder meat, in bite-size cubes, fat removed
350 g aubergine, peeled and cut into slices (2 cm)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh rice and 300 g water in it and set aside to soak.
Place onions and 10 g oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add lamb, cinnamon, salt, pepper and sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add 800 g water and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile brush aubergine slices with 10 g oil and roast in the oven under a hot grill for 20 minutes, turning over half way through, or pan-fry both sides until golden brown and set aside.
Drain lamb and onions through simmering basket reserving cooking liquid. Press lightly lamb onion mixture in simmering basket to form the first layer.
Place 850 g reserved cooking liquid back into mixing bowl and add remaining 450 g water (1300 g liquid in total). Drain rice and set aside.

Distribute aubergine slices on top of lamb in simmering basket forming a second layer then place drained rice on top of aubergines. Insert simmering basket and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set it aside for 15 minutes. Turn simmering basket upside down on a serving dish and garnish with pine nuts. Serve warm.
tips: Serve with Yoghurt and cucumber salad.

title: Steamed chicken roll and vegetables with vegetable sauce
ingredients: 400 g carrots, cut into pieces (4-5 cm)
1000 g chicken breast fillets, cut into cubes (3 cm)
450 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrot, courgette, potato etc.), cut into slices
100 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrot, courgette, potato), cut into slices
steps: Place pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place 500 g water into mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, weigh in carrots, cover Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside, discard water from mixing bowl.
Place chicken cubes into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 5.
Add 1 garlic clove, vinegar, 1 tsp salt, pepper, cinnamon and mix 1 min/speed 8. Transfer mince mixture into a deep bowl and set aside.

Place a sheet of baking paper on a work surface. Spread ¼ reserved ground pistachio nuts on baking paper forming a square (approx.18 cm x 18 cm). Take ¼ reserved mince mixture and press it between your palms to form a thin layer. Distribute meat onto ground pistachio layer to cover it completely. Place steamed carrots along one edge and roll with aid of baking paper forming a roll. Remove baking paper. Repeat to form 4 rolls and arrange them on Varoma tray.
Arrange 450 g mixed vegetables in Varoma dish, insert Varoma tray with chicken rolls and set aside.
Place 500 g water, 1 garlic clove, onions, 100 g mixed vegetables, bay leaves, 1 tsp salt and olive oil into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1.5.

Remove Varoma and set aside. Strain content of mixing bowl through a sieve and reserve cooking liquid (broth). Remove bay leaves, place back the strained vegetables into mixing bowl, add 150 g of the cooking liquid, ½ tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper and butter, blend 10 sec/speed 5. Serve chicken rolls with vegetables and pour some sauce on top. Serve remaining sauce on the side.
tips: For a thicker sauce, dissolve 20 g corn flour in 50 g water, add it into mixing bowl in step 8 and mix 10 sec/speed 5.
Reserve the extra cooking liquid for other preparations, e.g. soups or risottos.

title: Kuzi Ayam (Kelantanese Chicken Curry)
ingredients: 1000 g whole chicken legs, with bone, skinless and cut in pieces (5 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add 1 tsp salt to it. Place garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Transfer to the bowl with chicken. Mix and let marinate in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 200°C. Set aside a roasting tray with a roasting rack. Transfer reserved marinated chicken into prepared roasting tray. Bake for 20-30 minutes (200°C).
Place fried shallots in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee, ground coriander, ground fennel, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, white pepper powder, evaporated milk, tomato purée, tomato ketchup and water, cook 8 min/120°C//speed .

Add reserved baked chicken, 1 tsp salt, 20 g toasted almond flakes and 40 g fried golden raisins, stir well with spatula, cook 5 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with remaining toasted almonds and fried golden raisins. Serve hot.
tips: Serve with buns or roti jala.
Refer to Cookidoo® for the Shallot Oil recipe. Repeat this recipe three times for kuzi ayam.
You may use 50 g tomato paste to replace 100 g tomato purée.
Recipe contributed by Alya Amirah.

title: Bing Tang Hu Lu (Candied Strawberry Sticks)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Place a sheet of greaseproof paper on a heatproof counter or baking tray for later use.
Clean strawberries and remove stems. Prick a strawberry with on a lollipop stick, repeat the steps for remaining strawberries.
Place sugar, 70 g water and glucose syrup in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages .

At this step sugar mixture is very hot, do not touch it directly with your hands. Hold the end of the lollipop stick in your hand, coat the strawberries with sugar mixture, place them on the greaseproof paper and wait for it to set, and repeat the steps for remaining strawberries.

Immediately rinse and remove remaining sugar from the rim of mixing bowl with hot water, cover mixing bowl with lid and go to pre-clean mode. Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse mixing bowl.
Let cool to allow sugar coating of strawberry turn crunchy. Serve immediately.

title: Ma Lai Koh (Steamed Caramel Cake)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place self-raising flour and baking soda in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/2 sec/1 time. Transfer to a bowl. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 100 g sugar and 100 g water in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages . Meanwhile, line 2 bamboo steamers (Ø 15 cm) with baking paper.
Add coconut milk, pandan leaves and salt, cook without measuring cup 4 min/110°C/speed 1. Transfer to a measuring jug. Cool to room temperature. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs and 100 g sugar in mixing bowl, whisk 15 min/37°C/speed 3.5 until pale and creamy.
Whisk 20 sec/speed 2. Meanwhile, add cooled syrup through hole of mixing bowl lid.
Whisk 20 sec/speed 1.5. Meanwhile, add reserved flour mixture through hole of mixing bowl lid. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 20 sec/speed 1.5. Pour batter to fill 90% of bamboo steamers. Rinse mixing bowl.
