Place 1500 g water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C. Set Varoma dish into position, insert bamboo steamer with batter. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 3.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, test with a cake tester skewer if it comes out clean when it is inserted into the centre of the cake, prolong steaming time if necessary.

Set steamed cake aside. Arrange another bamboo steamers with batter in Varoma dish. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 3.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, test with a cake tester skewer if it comes out clean when it is inserted into the centre of the cake, prolong steaming time if necessary. Let cakes cool to room temperature before serving.
tips: Coconut milk shall be warm to prevent the caramel from hardening due to shock from sudden temperature change. Warm coconut milk by sitting coconut milk in a hot water bath before step 3.
You can also use muffin moulds to steam this snack, reduce steaming time to 15 minutes in step 9 and 10.
Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Pita Bread with Smoked Salmon and Truffle Honey Sauce
steps: Place milk and dried instant yeast in mixing bowl, warm 1 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add flour, knead Dough /11 min.
Add salt, knead Dough /1 min. Remove dough, cover with cling film and let rise at room temperature for 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 220 °C.

After the dough has risen, flatten the dough in a pasta maker (or roll it out thinly with a rolling pin) until the dough is thin (about 0.1 cm) and use an 8 cm diameter round cake ring (or round glass spout) to cut the dough into the rounds. Place the rounds on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 220 °C oven for 3-4 minutes or until the dough is puffed and the top is golden brown. Remove from oven and set aside to cool.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place sour cream, truffle oil and honey in mixing bowl, whip 2 min//speed 2. Remove butterfly whisk. Pour into a squeeze sauce jar and set aside in the refrigerator. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place honey and truffle oil in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/speed 3.5. Transfer to another squeeze sauce jar and set aside.
Make a small hole in each pita bread and squeeze reserved truffle sour cream sauce to fill in bread. Place on a serving plate and set aside.

Trim off any brown edges from smoked salmon slices and cut into rectangles. Roll up salmon slices and place on filled pita breads, top with chopped black truffle and truffle honey sauce. Serve immediately.

title: Chilli Lime Sauce
ingredients: 1 lime, zest only, no white pith
2 sprigs spring onion, trimmed and cut in quarters
steps: Place lime zest and spring onions in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lime juice, sweet chilli sauce and fish sauce, mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a sealable jar or bottle and refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: It also makes a delicious marinade for roasted meats and poultry.

title: Kuih Qasidah (Terengganu Savoury Cake)
ingredients: 100 g shallot oil, plus 2 tbsp for greasing (see tips)
steps: Place plain flour, sugar, salt, lye water and water in mixing bowl, cook without measuring cup 25 min/100°C/speed 3. Meanwhile, grease a square tin (20 cm x 20 cm) with 2 tbsp shallot oil. Set aside.

Add 50 g shallot oil and ghee, mix 2 min/speed 4. Transfer to prepared square tin. Flatten mixture surface with spatula and pour remaining shallot oil on top of mixture. Let cool completely. Cut into pieces (5 cm x 5 cm) and serve.
tips: Refer to Cookidoo® for the Shallot Oil recipe.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Mala Bakkwa
ingredients: ½ tbsp honey  o ½ tbsp maltose syrup
20 g Sichuan mala chilli powder, adjust to taste
40 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place minced pork, caster sugar, honey, chilli powder, rice wine, light soy sauce and ground black pepper in mixing bowl, knead 1 min/. Transfer mixture to a bowl and let marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Grease a layer of cooking oil on another baking paper, transfer marinated pork mixture onto the paper. Place a piece of plastic film on top and flatten the mixture (3 mm thickness) using a rolling pin. Remove plastic film. Use a round cutter (Ø 6 cm) and cut out bakkwa pieces. Arrange on lined baking tray.
Bake for 20 minutes (180°C). Then, turn over and bake for a further 10 minutes (180°C) or until brown colour and slightly charred. Serve warm or cool.
tips: The ratio of fat and lean meat of the minced meat will affect the hardness and mouthfeel of bakkwa. Use fatter minced meat (40% fat and 60% lean meat) for the best results.

title: 3Q Soft Bread
ingredients: 500 g high protein flour (bread flour), plus extra for dusting
250 g yam (taro roots), peeled and cut into pieces (2 cm)
50 g purple sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces (2 cm)
20 g chicken floss  o 20 g pork floss
steps: Grease a bowl with butter. Place high protein flour, salt, milk powder, sugar, yeast, egg, whipping cream and water in mixing bowl, mix 5 sec/speed 6, then knead Dough /3 min.
Add butter, knead Dough /5 min. Place dough in prepared bowl, cover with cling film and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes).

Place glutinous rice flour, cornflour, 180 g milk and 35 g caster sugar in mixing bowl, blend 5 sec/speed 6. Pour mixture onto a steaming plate (Ø 14 cm), cover with cling film and place in Varoma tray. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, weigh yam and purple sweet potatoes into it. Insert Varoma tray with plate, close Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, discard steaming liquid from steaming plate. Empty mixing bowl.
Place steamed glutinous rice flour mixture and 30 g butter in mixing bowl, knead Dough /2 min. Transfer to a plate, flatten and cover with cling film. Clean mixing bowl.

Place steamed yam, steamed purple sweet potatoes, 40 g caster sugar, 20 g butter and 40 g milk in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 5 until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Line a baking tray (40 cm x 40 cm) with baking paper. Punch down dough to deflate. Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Roll into ball shape and let rest for 15 minutes. Divide mochi and yam filling respectively into 6 equal portions.

Gently press dough balls with a rolling pin to flatten into circle shape. Place 1 portion of mochi on the centre of the dough, spread 1 portion of yam filling on top of mochi and add 1 spoonful of chicken floss. Wrap the filling with the dough into a triangle shape and pinch the edges firmly to seal the bun. Place on prepared baking tray with seam side down. Repeat with remaining ingredients until finished. Cover with cling film and allow to proof until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Preheat oven to 180°C.

Dust dough with high protein flour. Using a sharp knife, slash a few lengthwise slits on the surface of each roll. Bake for 25 minutes (180°C) until light golden brown. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing and serve.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mavis Ong.

title: Hong Kong Style Roasted Pork Belly
ingredients: 2 cinnamon sticks (approx. 0.5 cm thick)  o 1 tbsp ground cinnamon
1 piece pork belly, with skin (approx. 600 g), approx. 10 cm x 15 cm
steps: Place Sichuan peppercorns, star anise, fennel seeds, cinnamon sticks and cloves in mixing bowl, heat 5 min/Varoma//speed 1. Let mixing bowl stand for 10 minutes.
Grind 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Grind 30 sec/speed 10. Transfer into an airtight jar and use as needed.
Mix 2 tbsp five-spice powder, salt and sugar in a small bowl and set aside.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork belly set aside. Rub the spice mixture evenly over the pork belly but not the skin. Pierce the skin with a small sharp knife, making sure the holes are well spaced out. Wrap pork belly in aluminium foil, place in a bowl. Cover with cling film and allow to marinate in refrigerator for at least 8 hours.

Preheat oven to 220°C. Remove cling film, sprinkle coarse sea salt onto skin of marinated pork belly and roast for 30 minutes (220°C). Remove pork belly from oven, scrape off coarse salt, then carefully make more holes in the skin with a small sharp knife.
Reduce oven temperature to 200°C and roast pork belly for another 20 minutes (200°C). Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature. Remove aluminium foil, cut in pieces and serve.
tips: You can add other spices such as ground black pepper, chilli powder, nutmeg or turmeric to the five-spice powder.
Coarse sea salt absorbs the fat in the pork skin so that it becomes crispy when roasted. It can be purchased from supermarkets.

title: Thai Massaman Curry Paste
ingredients: 1 cinnamon stick (5 cm length), cut into 3
15 g fresh galangal (lengkuas), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
1 stalk fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place black peppercorns, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick and dried chillies in mixing bowl and cook without measuring cup 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh water into it and set aside. Place garlic cloves, shallots, galangal, lemongrass and shrimp paste in mixing bowl, start Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved spice mixture, start Blend /30 sec. Meanwhile, pour reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Add cooking oil and rock salt and sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Use as a base for Thai Massaman curry or transfer to 1 airtight jar (200 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Rich Fruit Cake
ingredients: 40 g red cherries  o 40 g dried cranberries
40 g dried apricots, cut in small pieces  o 40 g dried pineapples, cut in small pieces
200 g dark rum  o 200 g fresh orange juice
300 g butter, softened at room temperature
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in golden raisins, dark raisins, orange peel, red cherries and dried apricots. Rinse and dry fruit thoroughly. Add rum and cover with cling film. Store at cool dry place to soak overnight.
Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease a bundt cake pan (Ø 24 cm) and line with baking paper.
Place plain flour, baking powder, ground allspice and ground nutmeg in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/1 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place butter, sugar and salt in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/speed 3. Meanwhile, using a strainer, drain off excess liquid from reserved dried fruit, mix with reserved flour mixture.
Add eggs and treacle syrup, mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add reserved fruit mixture and dark chocolate chips, mix 15 sec//speed 3. Transfer to prepared cake pan.

Bake for 45 minutes (160°C). Cover cake loosely with aluminium foil. Continue to bake for 35 minutes or until a cake tester skewer comes out clean when it is inserted into centre of cake. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Cut into slices and serve.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.

Remaining rum can be kept in refrigerator to feed the cake. Use a cocktail stick to pierce all over the top of the warm cake. Slowly spoon rum over the cake. Cool completely, then remove the baking parchment, wrap loosely in clean baking parchment and store in an airtight tin. Feed the cake every week to 10 days.

title: Tofu Balls
ingredients: 100 g carrots, cut in chunks (3 cm)
20 g fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped
steps: Place carrots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place bean curds, kudzu powder and rock salt in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved carrots, coriander leaves and mushrooms, knead 30 sec/ until paste texture is well combined. To make tofu balls, wet your hand, put a spoonful of bean curd mixture on your palm and form into ball shape. Transfer tofu ball to Varoma tray. Repeat with remaining ingredients until finished.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Laksam (Kelantan Flat Rice Noodles in Fish Gravy)
ingredients: 1000 g whole mackerel (ikan kembong), gutted and descaled
1 torch lily (bunga kantan) , bud only, shredded
steps: Lightly grease 2 round steaming trays (Ø 20 cm). Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in hot water, set aside.

Place white rice flour, plain flour, 450 g water and salt in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 5. Meanwhile, pour hot water slowly onto mixing bowl lid, let it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer to a pouring jug and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, boil 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma dish into position, insert 1 prepared tray, weigh in 60 g reserved batter, close Varoma lid and steam 4 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove the tray with steamed rice pancake. Scrape out with spoon and roll into a log shape, transfer to a plate. Rotate another prepared tray and repeat the steps until all batter is finished. Let cool completely and cut into 2 cm pieces.
Place water and mackerel in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/100°C//speed . Transfer boiled mackerel to a bowl and set aside to cool. Keep boiled water in mixing bowl. Separate fish flesh from the bone.
Add fish bones to mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Strain with a fine mesh strainer and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place shallots, garlic cloves, ginger and shrimp paste in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved fish flesh, tamarind pieces, coconut milk, sugar, salt and ground black pepper, cook 10 min/98°C/speed 2 until sauce has thickened. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. In a serving plate, place a portion of rice rolls, scoop a ladle of coconut gravy, top with thinly sliced long bean, mung bean sprouts and shredded lily bud. Serve hot.
tips: Best served with sambal chilli belacan or chopped bird’s eye chillies (cili padi) with soy sauce.
For a faster version, replace rice rolls with store-bought fresh thick rice noodles (laksa noodles) and continue with recipe from step 4.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Inti Kelapa (Sweet Coconut Filling)
ingredients: 100 g palm sugar, cut in chunks
steps: Place palm sugar, brown sugar and water in mixing bowl, melt 5 min/115°C/speed 1.
Add grated coconut, salt and cornflour, cook 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Use as filling or transfer to a jar and store in refrigerator.
tips: The cornflour will keep the filling moist.
Sweet Coconut Filling can be used as filling for sweet buns, pulut inti and kuih ketayap.

title: Kuih Bangkit (Melt-in-Mouth Coconut Cookies)
ingredients: 400 g sago flour, plus extra for dusting  o 400 g tapioca flour, plus extra for dusting
6 pandan leaves, cut in 3 cm length
steps: Place a baking tray on mixing bowl lid, weigh in sago flour. Add pandan leaves. Bake in oven for 1 hour (100°C) (see tips). Discard pandan leaves. Allow to cool completely.
Place sugar in mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add coconut cream and egg yolks, mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add reserved sago flour, mix 20 sec/speed 2. Transfer wet dough to a large bowl, cover with damp kitchen towel. Allow dough to rest for at least 15 minutes before using.

Line baking tray with baking paper. Place dough onto lightly dusted pastry mat. Cut off ⅓ portion of dough with cake scraper, add sago flour bit by bit until the dough forms a smooth, soft and pliable dough. Roll out dough to 6 mm thickness with a rolling pin. Use a cookie cutter to cut out cookies and place onto prepared baking tray. Repeat the steps with remaining dough until finished. Preheat oven to 160°C.

Bake for 10 minutes (160°C) then reduce oven temperature to 130°C and bake for a further 10-15 minutes until light beige in colour. Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an airtight container.
tips: Preparing coconut cream: refrigerate 250 g undiluted fresh coconut milk for at least 3 hours until cream separates; skim off 110 g cream and place in a small bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use.

The baked flour should weigh not more than 355 g after baking in step 1. Place back in the oven and bake for further 30 minutes if the flour still weights more than 355 g. You may also dry-roast the flour it in a hot pan over low heat to reduce the moisture.

title: Three Course Meal (Multigrain Rice, Cod And Kai Lan)
ingredients: 10 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
2 sprigs spring onions, cut in 4 cm pieces
½ tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao) (opcional)
½ tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought
steps: Place a steaming plate (Ø 15 cm) on mixing bowl lid, weigh in cod fillets and ginger slices. Add spring onion, sesame oil, light soy sauce and glutinous rice wine. Mix and set aside to marinate.

Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add Jasmine rice and multigrain rice into it. Set Varoma dish in position, insert steaming plate with fish. Insert Varoma tray, add kai lan into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 4. Meanwhile, mix light soy sauce, sesame oil, rice wine, chicken stock powder and hot water in a small bowl.

Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer steamed kai lan to a serving plate. Drizzle with reserved soy sauce mixture. Carefully remove steamed fish from Varoma dish. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer cooked rice to a serving bowl. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Paal Appam
ingredients: 200 g white rice, rinsed, soaked for at least 3 hours
steps: Place soaked white rice, shredded coconut, cooked rice, sugar, salt and water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 4-10, increasing speed gradually. Transfer appam batter to a large bowl, cover with cling wrap. Set aside to ferment in a warm environment for 6-8 hours. Clean mixing bowl.
Place fermented appam batter, baking soda and coconut milk in mixing bowl, mix 15 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Preheat a non-stick appam pan on medium-high heat. Using a ladle, pour one ladleful of fermented appam batter into the pan. By holding the pan's handles, lift and swirl the pan to ensure the batter is spread evenly across the pan. Cover the pan with the lid and continue cooking on low heat until the edges are golden brown. Transfer appam to a plate and repeat with the remaining appam batter until finished.
Place rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, salt and ground cardamom in clean and dry mixing bowl, cook 5 min/80°C/speed 1. Transfer mixture to a bowl, serve warm together with appam.
tips: Paal Appam is traditionally served in Kerala with Black Chickpea Curry, Vegetable Stew or Egg Curry. In Sri Lanka, Muttai Appam (egg appam) is popular, where an egg is cracked directly into the middle of the batter and cooked just enough that it has a runny center.
Leftover batter can be stored in the fridge for up to 2 days. Before making the appam, remove the batter from the fridge and leave it at room temperature for an hour before cooking.
Recipe contributed by Isvarya Hari.

title: Baked Sushi
ingredients: 1 - 2 ripe avocados, cut in thin slices (opcional)
steps: Insert simmering basket. Weigh in rice and water, steam 20 min/100°C/speed 4. Meanwhile, place vinegar, sugar and salt in a small bowl and stir until completely dissolved.

Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer steamed rice to a baking dish and sprinkle vinegar mixture all over. Using a soft spatula, toss gently to distribute vinegar mixture and flatten rice surface. Sprinkle furikake on top of rice. Set aside and empty mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Place cream cheese, mayonnaise, sriracha chilli sauce and salt in mixing bowl, mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add mango, cucumber and crab sticks, mix 10 sec//speed 1. Transfer to reserved baking dish and spread evenly with spatula. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top.

Bake in middle rack for 15 to 20 minutes (200 °C) until lightly golden. Cut in 24 portions, place a portion of baked sushi rice on a sheet of nori seaweed, top with avocados slice and sashimi. Serve immediately.

title: Fruit Cake
ingredients: 180 g butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Grease and line a square cake tin (15 cm x 15 cm x 5 cm) with parchment paper. Set aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in flour. Add baking soda, cream of tartar and ground nutmeg to it. Mix and set aside.

Heat a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat, melt sugar with 30 g water and lemon juice. Do not stir, but occasionally swirl the saucepan, until sugar becomes fairly dark brown. Once the sugar has melted, carefully add another 30 g water.
Place hot caramel sauce and butter in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/speed . Meanwhile, mix 2 tbsp flour mixture and mixed fruits in a bowl.
Add reserved mixed fruits and concentrated orange juice to mixing bowl, mix 2 min/speed . Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Let cool for 30 minutes at room temperature.
Add reserved flour mixture, mix 20 sec//speed 3. Scrape down sides and bottom of mixing bowl with spatula to combine well.

Add eggs and vanilla extract, mix 10 sec//speed 3. Mix well with spatula if necessary to ensure that there are no flour lumps. Transfer to prepared cake tin, cover with cling wrap and place in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 60 min/Varoma/speed 1. Then steam again 60 min/Varoma/speed 1, prolong steaming time (see tips) until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Let stand for 30 minutes in Varoma dish. Remove cake tin from Varoma dish and let cool completely before unmoulding. Cut into slices and serve.
tips: This steamed cake tastes better the next day. Wrap cooled cake with cling wrap to retain the moisture. Allow to rest for a day and have the internal moisture more evenly distributed than when just steamed. This way, the flavours have more time to develop and spread throughout the cake and combine with other flavours as it rests.
After 90 minutes of steaming, ensure that there is always enough water for steaming in the mixing bowl (250 g liquid for every 15 minutes steaming).
Recipe contributed by Nor Hatina Md Salleh.

title: Chicken Paste Cakes
ingredients: 500 g chicken fillets, cut in pieces
30 g cooking oil, plus extra for shaping patties
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place chicken fillets in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg whites, cornflour, cooking oil, white pepper powder and chicken seasoning, knead 5 min/.
Add reserved garlic, spring onions and red chilli, mix 10 sec//speed 3.

Grease palm with some cooking oil, shape chicken mixture into 8 patties and place chicken patties into a bowl of cold water for 5 minutes. Then, line Varoma dish and Varoma tray with a layer of parchment paper. Arrange chicken patties on it.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma. Transfer steamed chicken paste cakes to serving plate. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.
Serve chicken paste cakes with chilli sauce.

title: Steamed Tapioca Kuih
ingredients: 500 g tapioca roots, peeled and cut in chunks
3 pandan leaves, cut in 5 cm length
steps: Grease a heat-resistant round steaming tray (max Ø 14 cm, 10 cm height - see tips) and set aside.
Place tapioca chunks in mixing bowl, chop 40 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add brown sugar, 80 g water, coconut milk and salt, mix 40 sec/speed 3. Transfer to prepared steaming tray and add pandan leaves on top. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert reserved steaming tray, close Varoma lid and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma and set it aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove pandan leaves, allow to cool before cutting into slices (1 cm x 4 cm). Garnish with grated coconut on top and serve.
tips: For best flavour and results, choose white flesh tapioca roots which are starchier.

When selecting the tray to be used in the Varoma, consider to: choose heat-resistant materials (eg. ceramic, metal or silicone); make sure the dish size is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.

title: Spanish tomato sauce
steps: Place crushed tomatoes, olive oil, sugar and salt into mixing bowl and sauté 30 min/100°C/speed 2. Pour into a soup tureen and use immediately or refrigerate in an air-tight container.
tips: If you decide to use fresh tomatoes, crush them first for 15 sec/speed 5. Then add rest of the ingredients and sauté 30 min/Varoma/speed 2.

title: Hot dogs
ingredients: 80 g medium-hard cheese, cut into pieces (e. g. Cheddar)
500 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
1 spring onions, for eyes, sliced (2 mm)
1 olive, black, pitted, for eyes and nose, cut in tiny pieces
steps: Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C and line a large baking tray with baking paper.
Place flour, yoghurt, milk, oil, butter, salt and baking powder in mixing bowl then knead 1 min/. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then knead again 15 sec/.

Tip dough out onto a lightly floured surface and divide into 12 equal-sized pieces. Take one piece and roll out to a rectangle (approx. 28 cm x 10 cm) then place a Vienna sausage in the centre along the length leaving a 2 cm border at both ends. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp reserved grated cheese along the sausage then roll up dough, encasing sausage and cheese filling. Squeeze a tail shape from 2 cm excess, shape a head with excess on the other side then place on baking tray. Repeat with remaining dough, sausages and cheese.
Bring remaining pieces of dough together and use to make ears and legs for dogs. Use slices of spring onion and tiny pieces of olive for eyes and nose.
Bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C) until golden. Allow to cool slightly before serving warm.
tips: Note to translator:1) the ingredient flour used in this recipe is plain wheat flour. Specify if not clear in your language. 2) the ingredient [vienna sausage] refers to a type of sausage that is typically used to prepare hot dogs. Use the most common denomination in your country for this type of sausage. >>delete after reading

Note to translator:1) the ingredient flour used in this recipe is plain wheat flour. Specify if not clear in your language. 2) the ingredient [vienna sausage] refers to a type of sausage that is typically used to prepare hot dogs. Use the most common denomination in your country for this type of sausage. >>delete after reading

title: Virgin Passion Fruit Mojito
ingredients: 50 g brown sugar, plus 2 tbsp extra for coating
10 g fresh mint, plus extra for garnishing
3 limes, preferably organic, quartered, plus extra for juicing and garnishing
400 g ice cubes, plus extra for serving
6 passion fruit, seeds only, plus extra for serving
steps: Place 2-3 tbsp brown sugar onto a small plate. Rub rim of each glass with lime quarter and dip in prepared sugar to coat. Set aside.
Place sugar, mint and lime in mixing bowl then blend 5 sec/speed 8.
Add ice cubes and lemonade then blend a further 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a jug, draining through a fine-mesh sieve. Discard sieve contents.
Place reserved lemonade and passion fruit in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 5.

Carefully fill ⅔ of each glass with ice cubes. Divide contents of mixing bowl between glasses. Top each glass with soda water. Serve immediately, garnished with fresh mint, lime slices and passion fruit halves (see Tip).
tips: If possible, use a kitchen blowtorch on glass rims coated with sugar for extra caramelised flavour.

title: Steamed bánh mì burgers with pickled carrots
ingredients: 1 fresh bird's eye chilli, deseeded, cut in pieces  o 1 fresh red chilli, deseeded, cut in pieces
500 g boneless pork meat, sinew free, cold, cut in pieces (3 cm)
15 g oil, plus extra for frying and greasing
3 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, plus extra for serving
steps: Place 1 garlic clove and chilli in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add pork, fish sauce, ½ tsp salt and pepper and chop 20 sec/speed 6. Divide meat into 4 equal parts and form each part into a round flat patty (approx. 1 cm thick). Place on a plate and refrigerate until needed. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 150 g water, 2 pinches sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, grease Varoma dish and Varoma tray then set aside.

Add flour, oil and ½ tsp salt then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to working surface and with greased hands, divide into 4 equal parts, then shape each piece into a ball. Place 2 balls in prepared Varoma dish and remaining 2 balls on prepared Varoma tray. Close Varoma and set aside for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, using a vegetable peeler, cut carrots and daikon into strips (approx. 8 cm x 2 cm) and place in a bowl. Clean mixing bowl.
Place remaining garlic clove and 3 sprigs coriander in mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add rice vinegar, 20 g water, remaining 1 tsp sugar and remaining ½ tsp salt then mix 10 sec/speed 2.5. Transfer to bowl with carrots and set aside.

Place remaining 600 g water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, mix mayonnaise and sriracha sauce in a small bowl. Set Varoma aside. Allow buns to cool for approx. 5 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan over high heat and fry meat patties approx. 5 minutes on each side until well done and golden brown, then set aside.

Cut one bun horizontally and spread pâté on bottom half. Add 5-6 cucumber slices, 1-2 tbsp pickled carrots, 1-2 tbsp sriracha mayonnaise, 1 pork patty and 2-3 sprigs fresh coriander. Place top bun on top. Repeat with remaining ingredients and serve immediately.
tips: For best results and a light colour, use low gluten wheat flour that can be found in Asian stores or flour with a low protein content.

title: Chocolate cake pops
ingredients: 400 g dark chocolate, in pieces (see tip)  o 400 g white chocolate, in pieces (see tip)
shredded coconut, raw or toasted, for coating (opcional)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a cake tin (approx. 20 cm x 20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place hazelnuts in mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place dates in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Transfer to bowl with ground hazelnuts and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs, oil, vanilla aroma and buttermilk in mixing bowl then mix 1 min/speed 3.

Add flour, cocoa powder, reserved dates and hazelnuts, baking soda, baking powder and salt then mix 30 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to prepared cake tin and bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C) or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before cutting in pieces. Clean mixing bowl.
Place freeze-dried raspberries in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place blanched almonds in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.

Place reserved chocolate cake and peanut butter in mixing bowl then mix with aid of spatula 30 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and mix with aid of spatula a further 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to work surface and form into a ball. Cover with cling film and freeze for 20 minutes.
Remove dough from freezer. Divide dough and shape it into 20 balls, then insert 1 cake pop stick into each ball. Place cake pops on a plate and freeze for 15 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add oil and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula and melt a further 2 min/50°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl.

Dip each cake pop in melted chocolate, rotating it so that it is evenly covered with a thick layer of chocolate. Hold it over the bowl and turn it to drain off excess chocolate. Decorate with reserved freeze-dried raspberry powder, chopped almonds, shredded coconut and sprinkles. Place cake pops in a jar or a piece of polystyrene (approx. 25 cm x 20 cm) and refrigerate until chocolate hardens. Serve immediately or keep in refrigerator until serving.
tips: Instead of using 400 g dark or white chocolate, use 200 g of each. Melt each chocolate separately, repeating step 8 and cleaning the mixing bowl in between.

title: Coconut Margarita
ingredients: 2 limes, quartered, plus extra slices to garnish
steps: Place salt and coconut flakes in mixing bowl then grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Place coconut milk and sugar in mixing bowl then cook 8 min/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, rub a quarter lime around the rim of 6 cocktail glasses, then dip in reserved salt and coconut mix. Set aside.
Transfer coconut milk into a bowl and allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Place ice cubes in mixing bowl and crush 5 sec/speed 5. Divide ice equally between prepared glasses.
Place cold coconut milk, Tequila, lime juice and triple sec in mixing bowl then mix 10 sec/speed 5. Pour into cocktail glasses, garnish with a slice of lime and serve immediately.
tips: Replace white sugar with brown sugar in step 2.
For a more tropical flavour, add 50-100 g pineapple juice step 5.

title: Soft Cake with Salted Caramel
ingredients: 120 g butter, cold, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a round cake tin (Ø 24 cm) and set aside.
Place butter and sugar in mixing bowl then mix 1 min/speed 4.
Add eggs and mix 30 sec/speed 4.
Add milk, flour, potato starch, vanilla and baking powder then mix 1 min/speed 4. Transfer mixture to prepared cake tin.
Bake for 40-45 minutes (180°C) or until golden. Allow to cool in cake tin for 10 minutes before transferring to a serving plate and leaving to cool completely.

To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar, salted butter, 60 g cream, 45 g water and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .

Add remaining 100 g cream and mix without measuring cup 2 min/speed , then cook without measuring cup 2 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer half of the caramel to a small bowl and allow to cool. Transfer remaining caramel to an air-tight container, allow to cool and store in refrigerator (see tip).
Place vinegar and remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl then start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
Drizzle cake with salted caramel then serve in slices.
tips: Use remaining caramel to prepare ice cream, iced coffee, pies or muffins.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.

title: Salmon and Leek Parcel with Rice
ingredients: 450 gram leek, halved lengthways, then sliced (5 mm)
1 teaspoon sea salt, plus extra to taste
¼ teaspoon black pepper, ground, plus extra to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place dill in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place leeks and 60 g water in mixing bowl then. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid then cook 7 min/100°C//speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add mascarpone, reserved chopped dill, salt and pepper then, without measuring cup, cook 2 min/90°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, line a large baking tray with baking paper (approx. 50 cm x 50 cm). Spoon leek mixture along the middle of the baking paper then rinse mixing bowl.

Place rice, 800-1000 g water, oil and salt in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and start Rice Cooker . Meanwhile, season salmon with salt and ground black pepper. Place salmon on top of leeks. Fold over baking paper, fold in ends to create a large parcel and bake for 20 minutes (200°C). Serve in portions with creamed leeks and cooked rice.
tips: The simple ingredients in this elegant dish allow the delicate flavour of fresh salmon to shine through. Partnered with steamed new potatoes, this easy main can be on the table in under an hour.

title: Tuna mousse
steps: Place tuna and anchovies, drained of any oil, into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ricotta, blend 30 sec/speed 5. Serve as preferred with small squares of toasted bread.
tips: These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.
These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.
Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.
Use the same method to make half portions.
Use the same method to make half portions.

title: Layered potato and meat pie (Pâté de pommes de terre du Limousin)
ingredients: 160 g unsalted butter, soft, cut in pieces
400 g potatoes, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place flour, butter, salt and water in mixing bowl and knead 30 sec/, then mix 10 sec//speed 2 to loosen the pastry. Transfer pastry to a work surface, divide in half and roll out each half on a work surface using a rolling pin. Line a baking tin (Ø 25 cm) with half of the pastry and set aside the rest. Clean mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 240°C.
Place garlic cloves, shallots, parsley, 1 pinch salt, 1 pinch pepper, egg yolks and sausage meat in mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 5.

Arrange 200 g sliced potatoes on the pastry base, sprinkle with remaining 1 pinch salt and 1 pinch ground black pepper, add meat filling, then the cover with the remaining 200 g sliced potatoes. Cover with the second pastry round and press edges together firmly. Bake for 10 minutes (240°C), then 15 minutes at 200°C. Serve hot.
tips: Potato pâté with meat is a traditional dish from the mountainous Limousin area of France.
If sausage meat is unavailable, use the sausage meat from your favourite variety of sausages.
For a variation, use ready made puff pastry for the top disc.
Substitute the meat for 200 g mushrooms. At the beginning of step 3 add the mushrooms to the mixing bowl, and chop 4sec/speed 8.

title: Falafel in square flatbread (r’gaif bread) with tahini sauce
ingredients: 3 stalks fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
½ - ¾ tsp ground cumin, to taste
20 g fresh yeast  o 1 heaped tsp dried instant yeast (10 g)
260 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
½ fresh red chilli, cut in halves and deseeded
400 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place garlic cloves and parsley in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add tahini, water, lemon juice, salt and ground cumin and mix 15 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate until serving. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place water and yeast in mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 1.

Add flour and salt and knead Dough /1 min 30 sec. Transfer to a lightly floured surface, divide dough with oiled hands into 8 equal portions and shape each into a ball. Coat each ball with oil and allow to rest for 10 minutes. Meanwhile continue with the recipe. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place spring onions, garlic cloves, parsley, mint and chilli in mixing bowl and chop 6 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add baking powder, chickpeas, salt, ground cumin and ground coriander and chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

If the chickpeas are not completely chopped chop a further 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and shape the falafel mix into 18 small balls (approx. Ø 4 cm). Arrange on a tray and freeze for 15 minutes before cooking.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and place in the oven.

On a well floured surface flatten the bread balls with your hand as much as you can, and stretch and shape the dough using your fingers, lifting up the edges and pushing outwards gently. Avoid making holes in the dough. Form 12 cm-15 cm square shapes, as thin as possible. Repeat this step for remaining dough balls.
Arrange dough squares on preheated baking tray and bake for 3-4 minutes (200°C) until the bread is just cooked, and still soft enough to roll. Roll up loosely and cool on a cooling rack.

To cook the falafels, place flour in a bowl, and roll the falafel balls in flour. Put oil in a sauce pan (Ø 20 cm) to a depth of 4 cm and heat on the stove. When the surface shimmers, drop a small piece of dough in the hot oil if it sizzles immediately the oil is hot enough to fry the falafels. Carefully place 3 balls at a time into the hot oil, making sure they don't stick to the bottom. Cook, turning, for about 6 minutes, or until the balls are an even golden brown on all sides. Remove with skimmer and drain on paper towels. Serve falafel with square flatbreads and tahini sauce.
tips: The falafel balls can be stored in the freezer at the end of step 6.
Add a cucumber salad to the falafel and flatbread.

title: Natillas
steps: Place sugar, eggs, milk, vanilla sugar and corn starch into mixing bowl. Mix 10 sec/speed 4 then heat 8 min/90°C/speed 2.
If there is any foam, heat 2 min/90°C/speed 2. If not, mix 2 min/speed 2.
Pour the contents immediately into 6 individual bowls or a deep serving dish (decorate with a National Marie-type biscuit on the top). Allow to cool and sprinkle with cinnamon before serving.
tips: The time is calculated with ingredients at room temperature. If using ingredients directly from the refrigerator, cook 10 minutes in step 1.If you prefer it thinner, don’t add corn starch in step 1.
The time is calculated with ingredients at room temperature. If using ingredients directly from the refrigerator, cook 10 minutes in step 1.
If you prefer it thinner, don’t add corn starch in step 1.

If you wish to add a lemon aroma, place the sugar and lemon peel zest in the clean and dry mixing bowl first and grind 30 sec/speed 5-10 increasing speed gradually. Then add the remaining ingredients and continue with the recipe.

If you wish to add a lemon aroma, place the sugar and lemon peel zest in the clean and dry mixing bowl first and grind 30 sec/speed 5-10 increasing speed gradually. Then add the remaining ingredients and continue with the recipe.

title: Chocolate chip gluten-free loaf
ingredients: 80 g butter, unsalted, softened, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C. Grease a loaf tin (approx. 25 cm long) with butter and set aside.

Place softened butter, gluten free flour, cornflour, sugar, xantham gum, baking powder, baking soda, salt, yoghurt and eggs in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chocolate chips and mix 10 sec//speed 3.

Transfer thick batter to prepared tin, even out the top and bake for 55-60 minutes (175°C) or until a toothpick or skewer inserted in middle comes out clean. Allow to cool in tin for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack. Allow to cool completely before slicing.
tips: To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products carefully to ensure traces of wheat or gluten have not been used as part of the production process.
To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products carefully to ensure traces of wheat or gluten have not been used as part of the production process.

title: Cream of red pepper and ginger soup
ingredients: 150 g red peppers, cut into pieces (3 x 3 cm)
150 g red onions, cut into quarters
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus 1 tbsp extra for roasting
120 g potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces (2 x 2 cm)
1 ½ tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 ½ vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
4 tbsp curd cheese (quark)  o 4 tbsp Greek yoghurt
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place pepper, onion and garlic cloves on baking tray and sprinkle with 1 tbsp olive oil. Roast for 30 minutes (200°C).
Place ginger in mixing bowl and blend 2 sec/speed 7.
Scrape down ginger from sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add olive oil, cumin and coriander and cook 5 min/100°C/speed .
Add potato, water, stock paste, salt and pepper and cook 30 min/100°C/speed .

Peel roasted garlic and add to mixing bowl with roasted pepper and onion. Cook 5 min/100°C/speed . Then blend 40 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to soup bowls and garnish with 1 tbsp curd cheese or Greek yoghurt. Serve immediately.
tips: Nutritional comments: This is a light, rich in minerals recipe that can be combined with a light main course.

title: Egg white omelette
ingredients: ½ tsp fine salt, plus extra to taste
steps: Place egg white, spring onions, courgettes, tomatoes and salt into mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 2.

Moisten a sheet of baking paper and wring well then line the Varoma tray. Make sure to keep some holes unobstructed. Spread the baking paper with olive oil and and insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish. Pour in the egg white and vegetable mixture, cover the Varoma with the lid and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Carefully remove Varoma lid, turn upside-down and place Vaoma dish on top. Transfer the egg white omelette onto a flat plate, top with the sliced bresaola, roll up and cut into slices. Serve immediately.
tips: An egg white omelette is high in protein with a very low content of carbohydrates and fats. There is no cholesterol as it is contained within the egg yolk. As well as being part of a fitness diet, it is suitable for any diet, in fact, as well as being very filling, it contains many essential amino acids so it is extremely useful in the diet of any sportsperson.

An egg white omelette is high in protein with a very low content of carbohydrates and fats. There is no cholesterol as it is contained within the egg yolk. As well as being part of a fitness diet, it is suitable for any diet, in fact, as well as being very filling, it contains many essential amino acids so it is extremely useful in the diet of any sportsperson.

title: Porridge with fresh fruit
ingredients: 400 g oat drink  o 400 g soy milk
200 g mixed fresh fruit, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place oat flakes and oat drink into mixing bowl and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Transfer porridge into two individual bowls, drizzle with honey and add fresh fruit. Serve immediately.
tips: Seasonal fruit can be used. Bananas are recommended due to their high content of potassium and remineralising effect.
The oat-based drink can be replaced by the same quantity of water.
If preferred, dried fruit can be added (nuts, almonds, raisins, apricots etc.).

title: Cream of chard soup
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
350 g white Swiss chard, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
200 g potatoes, peeled and cut into small pieces(1 cm)
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place chard, potatoes, onion, vegetable stock and water into mixing bowl, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add milk and cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1, then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer into soup plates.
Drizzle with a dash of olive oil and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Serve hot..
tips: Serve with toasted bread.

title: Moroccan sweet pastry (Briouats)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place almonds and sugar in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 6.
Add egg and orange blossom water, then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Line a small rectangular cake tin (5 cm x 20 cm) with baking paper. Cut sheets of filo pastry in half, so that they are the same size as the mould. Line the bottom of the tin with 2 half sheets filo pastry, brush with melted butter and cover with the almond and sugar mixture. Cover with the 2 remaining half sheets of filo pastry and brush with melted butter. Bake in oven for 20 minutes (180°C). Remove from oven, brush with the remaining honey and butter and allow to cool before serving.
tips: Depending on the size of the mould used, you may need to use 1 or 2 additional sheets of filo pastry.
Depending on the size of the mould used, you may need to use 1 or 2 additional sheets of filo pastry.

Orange blossom water is a by-product of the distillation of fresh bitter-orange blossoms for their essential oil. In Moroccan cuisine, it is mainly used as an ingredient for traditional sweets. If you are unable to find orange blossom water, use any flavouring to your liking (vanilla, cinnamon etc.). This however, will not result in the typical flavour of the briouats.

Orange blossom water is a by-product of the distillation of fresh bitter-orange blossoms for their essential oil. In Moroccan cuisine, it is mainly used as an ingredient for traditional sweets. If you are unable to find orange blossom water, use any flavouring to your liking (vanilla, cinnamon etc.). This however, will not result in the typical flavour of the briouats.

title: Egg canapés
ingredients: 20 - 30 stalks fresh chives, cut into rings
steps: Place quark, curry powder, mustard, salt and chives in mixing bowl, and mix 10 sec/speed 3.5.
Add eggs and mix 8 sec/speed 3.
Season egg mixture to taste and spread evenly on toast. Cut in diagonal halves, garnish with chives and serve.
tips: The eggs can first be cooked in the Thermomix®. Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with eggs, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1 and allow to cool.
The eggs can first be cooked in the Thermomix®. Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with eggs, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1 and allow to cool.

title: Spinach and tomato quiche
ingredients: 120 g vegan margarine, cold, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
30 g soy flour, full fat, as egg replacement
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
200 g spinach leaves, frozen, defrosted, well drained, roughly chopped (see tip)
150 g cherry tomatoes, cut in half
steps: Place wheat flour, margarine, water and salt in mixing bowl and knead 15 sec/speed 5 kneten. Remove pastry from mixing bowl, shape into a ball, wrap in cling film and chill for approx. 30 minutes. Meanwhile, rinse mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 190°C. Grease a quiche dish or loose-bottomed baking tin (Ø 26 cm).
Place garlic in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Place soy flour in a bowl and mix to a smooth paste with water.
Add soy flour mixture, silken tofu, olive oil, yeast flakes, starch, salt, pepper and nutmeg to mixing bowl and stir 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Pull drained spinach apart a little, add to mixing bowl and mix 10 sec//speed 3.

Press pastry into dish or tin and create a border of approx. 3 cm in height. Sprinkle pastry with breadcrumbs, spread out spinach filling, press cherry tomatoes face up into filling and garnish with flaked almonds.
Bake quiche for 45–50 minutes (190°C), remove from oven and allow to cool in dish/tin for approx. 10 minutes. Cut quiche into 8 slices and serve warm.
tips: Approx. 500 g frozen spinach leaves will be needed for 200 g defrosted and drained spinach.Soy flour is available in health food shops. I it is used as a vegan egg replacement.
Approx. 500 g frozen spinach leaves will be needed for 200 g defrosted and drained spinach.
Soy flour is available in health food shops. I it is used as a vegan egg replacement.

title: Soy goulash with dumplings
ingredients: 300 g bread rolls, stale, vegan, cut in half and then into slices (1 cm) (see tip)
30 g soy flour, full fat, as egg replacement
150 g soy chunks, dried, not soaked
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade, vegan (see tip)  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l), vegan (see tip)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
200 g mixed peppers (e.g. yellow and green), cut into strips (5 mm x 4 cm)
150 g button mushrooms, sliced (5 mm) or small ones cut in half
10 g fresh parsley leaves, chopped, for garnishing
steps: Place 150 g bread roll in mixing bowl, chop 8 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 150 g bread roll in mixing bowl, chop 8 sec/speed 6 and add to chopped bread.
Place parsley and onion in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add soy milk and heat 2 min/60°C/speed 1.
Place soy flour in a bowl and mix to a smooth paste with water.
Add soy flour mixture, yeast flakes, salt, pepper, nutmeg and chopped bread roll to mixing bowl and mix 20 sec//speed 3.5 with aid of spatula.

Grease 2 pieces foil (approx. 30 x 30 cm) with oil. Remove dumpling mixture from mixing bowl, knead by hand, divide into 2 halves and roll (length max. 17 cm, Ø approx. 5 cm). Wrap tightly in foil, close at either end and place in Varoma, ensuring enough steam slits remain open.
Rinse mixing bowl.
Place onion and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and sauté 3 min 30 sec/120°C/speed 1.

Add soy chunks, crushed tomatoes, water, red wine, stock cube, soy sauce, tomato puree, paprika powder, pepper, marjoram and cocoa powder and use spatula to stir. Place Varoma containing dumplings into position and cook 23 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside.
Add mixed peppers and mushrooms to mixing bowl and use spatula to carefully stir in. Reposition Varoma and cook 7 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside.
Season goulash to taste, carefully unwrap dumplings and cut each roll into 8 slices (approx. 2 cm thick). Arrange dumpling slices on 4 plates with goulash, garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.
tips: Nowadays, many bakeries sell vegan bread rolls. A split wheat or plain roll is most suitable. Cut the roll in half and slice (1 cm).
If the dumpling dough is too dry in step 7, add 20 g soy drink to mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/ /speed 3.5 with aid of spatula.
Soy chunks and soy flour (as egg replacements) are available in health food shops.
Prepare the Vegetable stock paste featured in The Basic Cook Book without parmesan and with vegan wine for a vegan variation of this paste.

title: Vegan coffee smoothie
ingredients: 1 - 2 pinches ground cinnamon, plus extra to sprinkle
500 g soy milk, unsweetened  o 500 g almond milk, unsweetened
steps: Place dates in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10.
Add espresso, bananas, peanut butter, cinnamon, soy milk, agave syrup and ice cubes then blend 1 min/speed 10. Divide between 4 glasses, sprinkle with ground cinnamon and serve immediately.

title: Kashta cream
ingredients: 150 g white bread, crust removed, cut into pieces
steps: Place milk into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add bread and cornflour and cook 4 min/90°C/speed 2.
Add blossom water and rose water and mix 1 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Use as needed.

title: Berry halva semifreddo
ingredients: 180 g mixed frozen red berries (e.g. raspberries, strawberries, blueberries)
steps: Place coconut cream in the freezer for one hour to chill (see tip).
Place sesame seeds into mixing bowl and dry roast 5 min/120°C/speed 2. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place pistachio nuts into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7, transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place tahini paste, chilled coconut cream, 70 g honey and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix 2 min/speed 4.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add 35 g chopped pistachio nuts and yoghurt and mix 15 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer the mixture into a round silicone mould of 1 lt capacity.
Place frozen berries and remaining 50 g honey into mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 6, with aid of spatula.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again 30 sec/speed 6, with aid of spatula.
Add the berry mixture to silicone mould with halva mixture and swirl with a fork to create a marble effect. Cover and freeze for at least 3 hours or overnight.

Remove semifreddo from the freezer, reverse into a serving plate and garnish with reserved chopped pistachio nuts, roasted sesame seeds and pomegranate seeds. Refrigerate until soft enough to slice and serve.
tips: Use 100 % natural coconut cream; coconut cream that has emulsifying agents added may cause the mixture to separate into creamy and watery layers.
Do not prolong the freezing time or the coconut cream will become difficult to handle.

title: Freekeh pilaf with broad beans
ingredients: 200 g fresh broad beans  o 200 g frozen broad beans
2 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
20 g unsalted pistachio nuts, roasted, finely chopped for garnish
steps: Place coriander and dill in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place 500 g water in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket on mixing bowl lid, weigh broad beans in it and rinse under cold running water. Insert simmering basket and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove basket with the aid of spatula, transfer beans into a bowl and allow them to cool. Empty mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh freekeh in it. Transfer to a sieve, rinse under cold running water and set aside.
Place garlic, onions and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Cook 3 min/120°C/speed 2. Meanwhile remove skin from beans and set aside.
Add freekeh to mixing bowl and cook 3 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add remaining 700 g water, vegetable stock paste, salt and pepper and cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1 or until al dente. Transfer to a deep serving dish, add lemon juice, reserved herbs and peeled broad beans, mix gently and adjust seasoning if needed. Allow to rest for a few minutes to absorb the liquid and serve warm sprinkled with chopped pistachio nuts.
tips: The beans come out of their skin easily if you break the skin and press them gently between forefinger and thumb.
For a complete meal accompany this dish with meat or fish.

Freekeh (also called farik) is wheat harvested while young and green and undergoes a roasting process. It can be replaced with other whole grains like quinoa, brown rice, spelt or bulgur, in this case adjust cooking time accordingly.

title: Chicken curry with okra (quwarman al dajaj)
ingredients: ½ tsp ground cayenne pepper, adjust to taste
1000 g chicken breast, cut into cubes (4 cm)
2 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 2 chicken stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
5 sprigs fresh coriander, finely chopped to garnish
steps: Place garlic, ginger, onions, olive oil, turmeric, Arabian spice mix, cumin, cardamom, cayenne pepper, cinnamon and paprika into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add tomatoes, chicken breast, water, pierced loomi, chicken stock paste and salt and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 0.5.
Add okra and cook 20 min/100°C//speed . Transfer into a deep serving dish and garnish with chopped coriander.
tips: Loomi is a lime that has lost its water content, usually after spending a majority of their drying time in the sun. They are used whole, sliced or ground as a spice in Middle Eastern dishes. Loomi can be replaced with regular lime or lemon.

title: Chicken pastilla
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
700 g chicken breast fillet, cut into pieces (2 cm)
½ tsp fine salt, adjust to taste
8 sheets brick pastry  o 8 sheets filo pastry
steps: Place almonds and sugar into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper, saffron, 1 tsp ground cinnamon and sauté 8 min/Varoma/speed  without measuring cup.
Add half of chopped parsley and mix 10 sec//speed 3. Transfer ¼ of onion-spice mixture to a bowl and set aside.
Add eggs and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer onion-egg filling to a bowl and set aside.

Prepare chicken filling: place reserved onion-spice mixture, remaining chopped parsley, chicken, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper, 1 tsp cinnamon and allspice into mixing bowl and sauté 4 min/Varoma//speed  without measuring cup.

Preheat the oven to 160°C. Brush a sheet of baking paper with olive oil using a pastry brush and use it to line a round springform tin (Ø 22 cm). Line the prepared tin with 3 sheets of brick pastry, overlapping them and allowing them to overhang over the sides of the tin, then distribute reserved onion-egg filling. Cover with 2 sheets of brick pastry and distribute chicken filling on top. Cover with 2 more sheets of brick pastry and spread with almonds and sugar. Bring overhanging edges of pastry sheets to the middle. Cover with last sheet of brickpastry, tucking it into sides of pastilla.

Brush top generously with oil and bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes (160°C). Turn pastilla out onto a shallow baking dish, remove baking paper and brush other side generously with oil and return to oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot, with almond layer facing up.
tips: In Morocco, pastilla is served dusted with icing sugar.
Pigeon pastilla is the most traditional version of this meat pie. Substitute the chicken in this recipe with pigeon meat, skin and bones removed.

title: Bahulu Gulung (Malay Roll Cake)
ingredients: 250 g strawberries, stems removed, cut in halves
steps: Place strawberries, 100 g sugar and lemon juice in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Cook 15 min/120°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease and line 4 baking tins (20 cm x 20 cm x 2.5 cm) with baking paper.
Place flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl, start Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk, add eggs, 150 g sugar and vanilla extract, mix 10 min/speed 4.
Add reserved flour mixture, mix 1 min/speed 1.
Remove butterfly whisk, pour batter into prepared baking tins (approx. 145 g each tin). Tap baking tin on top of kitchen counter to remove air bubbles. Bake for 5 - 10 minutes (200°C).

Remove cakes with baking paper from baking tins and let cool for 5 minutes. Peel off baking paper from cakes and place it on a new piece of baking paper respectively. Spread a thin layer of reserved strawberry sauce then roll up firmly using baking paper (see tips). Cut the cakes in slices and serve.
tips: Strawberry sauce should be slightly runny.
Wrap cakes with cling wrap to hold their shape if not cutting into slices immediately.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Ghee Rice
ingredients: 125 g yellow onion, cut in halves
½ tsp vegetable stock powder  o mushroom powder
15 g roasted cashew nuts, to garnish
steps: Place simmering basket on mixing bowl lid, weigh in parboiled basmati rice. Rinse and let it drain. Set aside to dry for 10 minutes.
Place ginger, garlic and yellow onion in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ghee, bay leaves, cinnamon stick and star anise, cook 3 min/Varoma//speed .
Add water, salt and vegetable stock powder, boil 8 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add reserved Basmati rice, coconut milk and diced carrots, start Rice Cooker .
Let it rest for 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with roasted cashew nuts, raisins, coriander leaves and mint leaves. Serve warm.
tips: You may replace parboiled basmati rice with basmati rice.
Recipe contributed by Mageswari Ramasamy.

title: Curry Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 500 g minced lamb  o 500 g boneless lamb leg, cut in cubes (1 cm x 1 cm)
3 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
700 - 800 g potatoes, cut in pieces (2 cm), peeled
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in lamb and meat curry powder. Mix well to marinate and set aside.

Place red chillies, dried chillies, lemongrass, curry leaves, shallots, garlic cloves, galangal, shrimp paste, ground coriander and water into mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 6-10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and kaffir lime leaves, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add reserved marinated minced meat, coconut milk, tomato ketchup, chilli sauce, brown sugar, salt and chicken stock powder, cook 20 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Transfer to a large ovenproof dish (30 cm x 20 cm x 5 cm). Set aside while making the topping. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, weigh in potatoes. Close Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile preheat oven to 190°C.
Carefully open Varoma lid, discard steaming water. Set Varoma aside. Insert butterfly whisk, place steamed potatoes, salt, ground black pepper, milk and butter in mixing bowl, mash 10 sec/speed 4.
Spread mashed potato topping over meat layer, then bake in preheated oven for 20-30 minutes (190°C) until golden. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

title: Meaballs with Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 60 g red capsicum, cut in pieces
60 g green capsicum, cut in pieces
20 g olive oil, plus extra ½ tsp
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 sprig fresh basil, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves and parsley in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add minced pork, minced beef, breadcrumbs, light soy sauce, salt, egg, Tabasco® and ground black pepper, mix 30 sec//speed 5.
Grease both of your palm and Varoma tray with cooking oil. Roll meat mixture and shape into meatballs (Ø 4 cm), place on greased Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onions, red capsicum, green capsicum, carrot and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 20 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 2.

Add crushed tomatoes, water, salt and ground black pepper, set Varoma dish into position, insert Varoma tray with meatballs. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer steamed meatballs to a serving plate. Drizzle tomato sauce and olive oil on meatballs. Garnish with basil leaves and serve warm.

title: Blue Mussels with Herbed Cream Sauce
ingredients: 500 g fresh blue mussels, cleaned, beard removed
steps: Place celery stalks, shallots and red chillies to mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 30 g olive oil and butter, sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.

Set Varoma dish into position, add blue mussels, white wine and water into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma//speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, check the cooked mussels and discard any that haven’t opened. Remove Varoma and set aside to keep warm .

Add lemon juice, whipping cream, salt, ground black pepper, dill, chervil, chopped spring onion and 15 g extra virgin olive oil to mixing bowl, mix 1 min//speed 2. Transfer steamed mussels to a serving plate, drizzle with herbed cream sauce and serve immediately.

title: Air Katira (Katira Drink)
ingredients: 375 g full cream evaporated milk (approx. 1 can)
1 tbsp basil seeds, soaked for 1 hour
1 tbsp malva nuts (kembang semangkok), soaked for 1 hour
1 tbsp gond katira, soaked for 1 hour
steps: Place raisins and 5 medjool dates in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place cashew nuts, rolled oats, 6 medjool dates and evaporated milk, blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add soaked basil seeds, soaked malva nuts and soaked gond katira, reserved chopped raisin-date mixture, water and honey, mix 30 sec/speed 10. Serve chilled.
tips: Gond katira is a natural gum obtained from the dried sap of several species of Middle Eastern legumes. It is a powerful antioxidant and is believed to have several health benefits, such as boosting immunity and recovery, easing constipation, improving skin health condition etc.
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Dragon's Beard Candy
ingredients: peanut powder (or black sesame powder), to taste
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place cornflour in mixing bowl, cook without measuring cup 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.5. Transfer to a deep rectangular baking dish. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 50 g water, glucose syrup and sugar in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages . Transfer to a 6-hole doughnut tray, let cool to room temperature until it has set. Immediately scrape the syrup off the rim of mixing bowl with spatula so that mixing bowl lid can be securely closed.
Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.

Take a sugar doughnut, place it into the dish with cooked cornflour, fully coat with cornflour and pull it while turning it into a 8-shape, while coat and pull to avoid the sugar strands sticking to each other, repeat about 16 times until it is as thin as hair, cut off a portion of sugar strands (about 10 cm), place 1 tsp peanut powder or black sesame powder and roll it up. Serve immediately.

title: Coffee Coconut Candy
ingredients: 50 g salted butter, cold, in one piece (60 mm x 40 mm x 20 mm)
2 ½ tsp instant coffee granules (eg Nescafé.®)
140 g full cream evaporated milk, room temperature
220 g fresh grated coconut, room temperature
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Line a square cake tin (10 cm x 10 cm) with parchment paper.

Place salted butter, caster sugar, instant coffee granules and 100 g evaporated milk in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages . Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add grated coconut and 40 g evaporated milk, cook 27 min/Varoma//speed 1.5. Immediately transfer to prepared tray and pat down lightly (about 1 cm height).
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
Let cool completely before cutting in cubes (1 cm) and store in an airtight jar.
tips: For best results, make sure all ingredients, except butter, are at room temperature.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Mushroom Meat Sauce
ingredients: 100 g dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften
1000 g pork belly, skinless, cut into thin slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place soaked shiitake mushrooms in mixing bowl and blend Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves, shallots and red chillies in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 10.

Add reserved mushroom mixture, pork belly, fermented soy bean paste, fish sauce, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, brown sugar, mushroom powder and cooking oil, cook 40 min/120°C/speed 1. Serve as condiment over porridge or transfer to 5 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
tips: For a lighter version with a finer texture, replace pork belly with 1000 g minced meat in step 3.
Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Kimchi Sauce
ingredients: 400 g Asian pear (singo pear), core removed, cut into quarters
110 g yellow onions (approx. ½ onion), cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place glutinous rice flour, water and sugar in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place singo pear, garlic cloves, ginger, onions, chilli flakes, fish sauce and fermented shrimp in mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 1 min/speed 8.
Add reserved glutinous rice mixture and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Serve as dipping sauce or transfer to 4 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Use kimchi sauce as a fermenting marinade to make your own kimchi.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Ginger Garlic Paste
ingredients: 500 g young ginger, peeled, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place ginger and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 1 min/speed 10. Use as condiment for cooking or transfer to ice cube trays (or small containers) and freeze for later use (see tip).
tips: Remove frozen cubes from ice cube trays and keep in a zip lock bag in the freezer for easy use in recipes.
Thaw ginger garlic cubes to room temperature before using.
This paste can be used for most recipes requiring ginger and garlic.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Dwaejibukgogi (Korean BBQ Marinade)
ingredients: 125 g Asian pear (singo pear), core removed, cut into quarters
3 g fresh ginger, cut into slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place pear in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place onions, garlic cloves, ginger, chopped spring onion, light soy sauce, brown sugar, ground black pepper, sesame oil and gochujang, blend 30 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved chopped pear, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Use as BBQ marinade for grilled or pan-fried meat or transfer to 1 airtight jar (250 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.
tips: This recipe can be used to marinate 500 g meat (chicken, pork or beef) or vegetables (e.g. mushrooms, brinjals, squash etc).

title: Purple Potato Mochi
ingredients: 500 g purple sweet potatoes, peeled, cut in chunks (4 cm)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add sweet potatoes to it. Close Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.

Place reserved steamed sweet potatoes in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Allow to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer blended sweet potatoes to a bowl. Divide into 15 equal portions and shape into small balls. Coat with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
tips: Sweet potatoes must be blended immediately while they are still hot to make mochi chewier.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Sesame Balls
ingredients: 50 g instant brown rice powder, plus extra for dusting
100 g toasted black sesame seed powder
steps: Place brown rice powder, black sesame seed powder and Medjool dates in mixing bowl, blend 12 sec/speed 10.
Put a spoonful of sesame mixture on your palm and form into a small ball. Repeat the step for the remaining mixture until finished. Dust with brown rice powder. Serve immediately.
tips: Use Medjool dates with a soft and creamy texture. If the dates are too firm, soak them in 100 g hot water for 10 minutes. Pat dry with kitchen towel before blending in step 1.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Umami Soup
steps: Place water, siu bak choy, shiitake mushrooms, Brazilian mushrooms, cashew nuts, 3-booster powder and red dates in mixing bowl, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 2.
Cook 60 min/98°C/speed 2. Add rock salt and cold pressed sesame oil to mixing bowl and mix well with spatula. Serve hot.
tips: You can make your own 3-booster powder by mixing nutritional yeast, wheatgerm and lecithin in the weight ratio of 1:2:2. Store remaining 3-booster powder in an airtight container.

Dried Brazilian mushrooms, Agaricus blazei Murrill (ABM) popularly known as ‘Cogumelo do Sol’ in Brazil, or ‘Himematsutake’ in Japan, is a mushroom native to Brazil, and widely cultivated in Japan for its medicinal uses. It is easily available in Chinese medicinal shops and organic shops.

Brazilian mushrooms, 3-booster powder and cashew nuts play pivotal roles to imitate the flavour of traditional Chinese chicken soup. The same combination can be used for other vegan dishes when it is required.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Millet Cakes
steps: Place millet, flaxseeds, 10 g agave nectar, 270 g water and rock salt in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 10. Transfer to 2 spring form pans (Ø 10 cm). Arrange the pans on Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, boil 6 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, allow cakes to cool for 30 minutes. Mix tahini paste, beetroot juice and 10 g agave nectar in a small bowl. Spread tahini mixture on steamed cakes, cut in slices before serving.
tips: The indicated weight of millet is wet weight after soaking. Dry weight is approximately 120 g.
Beetroot juice: Place 70 g peeled beetroot cubes into mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Repeat the step 3 times. Transfer to a fine mesh strainer to squeeze out the juice.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Sukiyaki
ingredients: 200 g long chinese cabbage, cut in pieces (4 cm)
300 g silken tofu (1 box), cut in slices (1 cm)
60 g yellow onions, cut in halves, thinly sliced
300 g beef slices (ribeye or beef chuck)  o 300 g pork slices (shoulder loin or belly)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add eggs into it, heat 10 min/60°C/speed 2. Remove simmering basket with spatula and set eggs aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place water and kelp in mixing bowl, cook 15 min/100°C//speed . Discard kelp.
Add bonito flakes, let rest for 20 minutes. Strain kelp stock with a fine mesh strainer into a jug and set aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in soy sauce, mirin, rice wine, sugar and 250 g reserved kelp stock. Set aside.

Place a heat resistant claypot on a portable gas stove. Arrange cabbage, tofu slices, shiitake mushrooms, leek slices, carrot slices and onion slices in the pot. Pour in reserved soy sauce kelp stock. Heat on medium heat and bring to a boil.

Crack reserved eggs into serving bowls and beat lightly with chopsticks. Cook beef slices one-by-one, dip cooked beef and vegetables in beaten egg and serve immediately. Add more kelp stock if water level is low. When most of the ingredients have been used, add udon to the pot. Cook until just tender and serve hot.
tips: Try different vegetables for sukiyaki such as napa cabbage, garland chrysanthemum (tong hao), spinach, bok choy, enoki mushrooms, king oyster mushrooms, shimeji mushrooms etc.
Replace udon with shirataki noodles (yam noodles) or vermicelli.
You can keep leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in the freezer for a month.

title: Sweet And Sour Condiment Sauce
ingredients: 200 g yellow onions, cut into chunks
80 g fresh ginger, cut into slices
1 ½ tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place onions, garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed .
Add tomato ketchup and sweet chilli sauce. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and cook 14 min/120°C/speed 1.
