Cook 1 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, pour rice wine onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Add sugar and salt to taste. Let it stand until mixing bowl temperature drops to 60°C. Serve as condiment for seafood or transfer to 3 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Purple Yam Huat Kuih (Taro Root Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: 200 g yam (taro roots), cut into cubes (2 cm)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, weigh yam cubes into it, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with spatula and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /50°C.
Add dried yeast powder and plain flour, mix 15 sec/speed 4. Start Fermentation /1 h/37°C.
Add cooled steamed yam, sugar, coconut milk and egg, mix 1 min/speed 5.
Add plain flour and double action baking powder, mix 30 sec/speed 4.
Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds until 80% full and arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.

title: Cranberry Almond Financier
ingredients: 135 g unsalted butter, cut in cubes (2 cm), plus extra for greasing
1 tbsp vegetable oil (hazelnut oil or almond oil)
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease 12 financier moulds.
Place butter in mixing bowl, heat without measuring cup 18 min/Varoma/speed 1 until brown colour. Strain through a fine mesh strainer to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place plain flour and ground almonds in clean and dry mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites, salt, corn syrup and caster sugar in mixing bowl, whisk without measuring cup 3 min/50°C/speed 3.

Add almond-flour mixture, cooled butter, vanilla extract, vegetable oil and dried cranberries, mix 2 min/speed 2. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a piping bag. Pipe batter into moulds until 90% full.
Bake at lower rack for 15-17 minutes (160°C) or until lightly golden. Remove from oven, let cool for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack. Serve warm or cool.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
In step 5, cover the batter with a plastic wrap placing the film on the surface of the preparation. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, better overnight before piping.

title: Key Lime Madeleines
ingredients: 170 g unsalted butter, cut in cubes (2 cm), plus extra for greasing
3 - 4 key limes, zest only, without white pith
some freeze dried strawberries, chopped  o some key limes, finely zest only
steps: Grease a 12-hole madeleine tin (7.5 cm x 5 cm). Place cake flour, baking powder and salt in clean and dry mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/70°C/speed 2. Transfer to another bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place caster sugar and lime zest in mixing bowl, grind 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add eggs and egg yolk, whisk 2 min/speed 3.
Add reserved flour mixture, mix 20 sec/speed 2. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add melted butter, mix 20 sec/speed 2. Transfer to a piping bag and refrigerate for 1 hour. Clean mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 220°C. Pipe batter to prepared madeleine tin until 80% full.
Bake for 10-15 minutes (220°C) or until lightly golden. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes. Transfer madeleines to a cooling rack and cool completely.

Place white couverture chocolate chips in mixing bowl, chop 7 sec/speed 7. Then melt 3 min/55°C/speed 2. Transfer into a bowl. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and put a cooling rack on it. Quickly dip cooled madeleine in melted chocolate (shell-shape side) and place them shell side up on cooling rack. Repeat with remaining madeleines. Sprinkle with chopped strawberries or lime zest. Allow to cool and serve.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven
The batter can be made up to 2 days ahead and kept covered in the refrigerator. Once baked, they taste best on the day they’re baked.

title: Scrambled Tofu
ingredients: 2 fresh shiitake mushrooms, cut in slices
300 g firm bean curds (taukwa) (approx. 2 blocks), mashed
1 pinch rock salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place water and mushrooms in mixing bowl, boil 4 min/120°C//speed 1.

Add carrots, celery, ground turmeric, bean curds, 3-booster powder, soy sauce and rock salt, stir fry 5 min/120°C//speed . Add cold pressed sesame oil to mixing bowl and mix well with spatula. Place 1 tbsp of bean curd mixture onto 1 lettuce leaf. Repeat with remaining ingredients until finished. Serve immediately.
tips: You can make your own 3-booster powder by mixing nutritional yeast, wheatgerm and lecithin in the weight ratio of 1:2:2. Store remaining 3-booster powder in an airtight container.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Kuih Sago (Steamed Sago Cake)
ingredients: oil, for greasing  o 1 banana leaf
4 pandan leaves, cut in strips (2.5 cm)
1 drop yellow food colouring, adjust to personal preference
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in grated coconut. Add salt to the bowl and mix. Set aside in refrigerator. Grease a round cake tin (Ø 20 cm) or line with banana leaf.
Place roselle calyces and 300 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Strain roselle juice through a fine mesh strainer and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place pandan leaves and 300 g water in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Strain pandan juice through a fine mesh strainer and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 100 g sago and 300 g water. Set aside. Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 100 g sago. Add reserved roselle juice and mix. Set aside. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in 100 g sago. Add reserved pandan juice and mix. Set aside for 30 minutes. Drain sago mixture separately with simmering basket. Divide sugar into 3 portions and mix with sago mixture respectively. Mix uncoloured sago mixture with yellow food colouring and transfer to prepared tin, arrange in Varoma dish.

Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer reserved green sago mixture to prepared tin and flatten with spatula to form the second layer.
Close Varoma lid, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer reserved red sago mixture to prepared tin and flatten with spatula to form the third layer.
Close Varoma lid, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3.5 or until sago turns translucent. Let sago cake cool completely before cutting in squares (4 cm x 4 cm). Coat with reserved grated coconut and serve.

title: Steamed Siew Mai
ingredients: 150 g low protein flour, plus extra for dusting
300 g chicken drumsticks, skinless, boneless, cut in cubes (3 cm)
300 g fresh prawn flesh, medium size, patted dry, flatten with knife, cut in small pieces
2 tsp sesame oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place water in mixing bowl and heat 2 min/80°C/speed 1.
Add flour, egg yolks and salt, mix 30 sec/speed 3, then Dough /2 min. Shape dough into a ball, transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and allow to rest for 15 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place shiitake mushroom and chicken cubes in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 5.
Add salt and white pepper powder, mix 1 min//speed 2.5.

Add prawn flesh, cornflour, sugar and sesame oil, mix again 2 min//speed 1.5. Transfer filling into a bowl and set in refrigerator for later use. Clean mixing bowl. Meanwhile, grease Varoma dish and Varoma tray with oil and set aside.

Divide dough into 30 equal portions and form into small ball shapes. Using a rolling pin, roll each dough ball on a floured surface into a round sheet, as thin as possible (siew mai skin, approx. Ø 7-10 cm each). Place 1½ tsp reserved meat mixture on siew mai skin. Pinch thumb and forefinger of left hand together to form a circle. Place a siew mai skin with filling on the circle and let it fall down slowly but not completely through the circle of your finger and thumb, meanwhile using the other hand to press meat slightly and to pinch sides of siew mai into many points, folding skin clockwise around the filling. The result should resemble a little purse with a flat bottom (open on top). Garnish each siew mai with a pinch of fish roe. Arrange siew mai with a little space between them on prepared Varoma dish and tray.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: Flying fish roe can be added as garnishing after steaming. If you have children at home to enjoy this dish together, please follow the recipe steps to steam the fish roe and shumai together until cooked.

title: Kacangma (Motherwort Chicken)
ingredients: 100 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
800 g kampung chicken (free-range chicken), whole legs, with skin and bone, cut in chunks (3 cm)
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down side of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sesame oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken, motherwort and distilled rice wine, cook 10 min/100°C//speed .
Add glutinous rice wine, cook 5 min/98°C//speed . Let stand in the mixing bowl until temperature drops to 70°C. Serve warm.
tips: Kacangma (motherwort) powder: in a preheated oven, bake 60 g (dried motherwort leaves) for 8 minutes (150°C). Place cooled leaves in clean and dry mixing bowl, grind 5 sec/speed 8. Store in an airtight jar.
Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Braised Chicken Feet and Abalone
ingredients: 400 g chicken feets, halved at joints, claws removed
15 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken feets. Pour hot water over chicken feet, let stand a few seconds, rinse and set aside.
Place another bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice wine and abalone. Add ginger to the bowl. Set aside and marinate for 5 minutes.
Place star anise, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cooking oil and garlic clove in mixing bowl, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed .
Add reserved chicken feets, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, water and lump sugar, cook 14 min/Varoma//speed 0.5.
Add reserved abalone, cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 0.5. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot.

title: Ginger Garlic Paste
ingredients: 500 g young ginger, peeled, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place ginger and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, start Blend /1 min. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Start Blend /1 min. Use as condiment for cooking or transfer to ice cube trays (or small containers) and freeze for later use (see tip).
tips: Remove frozen cubes from ice cube trays and keep in a zip lock bag in the freezer for easy use in recipes.
Thaw ginger garlic cubes to room temperature before using.
This paste can be used for most recipes requiring ginger and garlic.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Steamed Cumin Beef Buns
ingredients: 60 g carrots, peeled and diced (approx. 2 cm)
2 tsp cumin powder, adjust to taste
200 g beef, cut in cubes (approx. 1 cm)
210 g all-purpose flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place carrots and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add onions and oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 0.5.
Add dark soy sauce, rice wine, water, salt, sugar, cumin powder and beef cubes, mix 1 min/speed 2.5. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water, yeast, sugar, all-purpose flour, salt and milk in mixing bowl, knead Dough /1 min. Let it rest in the mixing bowl for 10 minutes.
Add oil, knead Dough /3 min. Remove dough from mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, then place it in a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside to rest for 10 minutes.

Divide the dough into 6 equal portions (approx. 60 g each). Sprinkle a little flour on the tabletop. Using a rolling pin and roll each dough portion into a round sheet with thin edges and thick center (approx. Ø 10 cm). Place reserved 50 g of cumin beef fillings in the center, pull up the dough, fold and twist the edges to seal tightly. Place it on parchment paper. Repeat the steps with the remaining 5 portions. Arrange them in Varoma tray and dish, cover with Varoma lid and let it proof for 1 hour.
Place water in mixing bowl, boil 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma. Let rest for 5 minutes. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

title: Vegetable Sambar
ingredients: 200 g split mung beans, rinsed, soaked for 2 hours
100 g carrots, cut in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm)
60 g French beans, cut in 2 cm length
steps: Place onions, ginger, garlic cloves and tomatoes in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add dried chillies, asafoetida, fenugreek, mustard seed, urad dhall, curry leaves, cumin seeds, sambar powder, hot water, salt and soaked mung beans, cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add carrots, potatoes and French beans, cook 1 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add cauliflower, continue to cook 4 min/Varoma//speed 1. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Datin Shakku.

title: Bread and tomato soup, Rolled spinach omelette and Steamed ratatouille vegetables
ingredients: 60 g medium-hard cheese (e.g. Gruyère, Emmental, Cheddar), cut in pieces
50 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for serving
50 g stale bread roll, cut in pieces (1-2 cm),  o 50 g stale white bread, cut in pieces (1-2 cm)
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
700 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces,  o 700 g canned tomatoes
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade,  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
400 g mixed vegetables (e.g. peppers, courgettes, aubergines), cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and 10 g extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add bread and sauté without measuring cup 5 min/120°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with baking paper with enough to go 2 cm up the sides. Transfer sautéed garlic bread to Varoma dish and set aside.

Place spinach, 10 g extra virgin olive oil, eggs and ½ tsp salt in mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 5.5. Transfer spinach-egg mixture to lined Varoma tray, spread to the borders, sprinkle with reserved grated cheese and insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish.
Place onions, carrots, 30 g extra virgin olive oil, tomatoes, 1-2 basil leaves, water, vegetable stock paste and ½ tsp salt in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.

Insert simmering basket and add mixed vegetables to it. Set Varoma in position and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma. With aid of baking paper lining, roll up the spinach omelette, keeping it wrapped in the baking paper. Meanwhile remove simmering basket using spatula, transfer cooked vegetables to a shallow serving dish, season with salt to taste and stir. Unwrap the spinach omelette and cut in slices (approx. 2 cm). Transfer slices to serving dish with vegetables and keep warm. Transfer tomato soup to a serving bowl, add reserved steamed garlic bread to the soup, drizzle with some extra virgin olive oil and garnish with roughly torn basil leaves. Serve the soup hot as a starter and the rolled omelette warm as a main dish, with the ratatouille vegetables on the side.
tips: 'Pappa al pomodoro', or bread and tomato soup, is classic comfort food in many Italian homes. While the soup is bubbling away, steam the next soothing course: a spinach and cheese rolled omelette presented in beautiful green spirals, served with hearty Mediterranean vegetables on the side.
For a smooth soup, after removing Varoma and simmering basket in step 6, blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Add the steamed garlic bread and serve as described in step 6.
Replace spinach in the rolled omelette with vegetables of your choice (e.g. cabbage, courgette).

title: Vegetable soup, Eggs en cocotte with spinach
ingredients: 100 g potatoes, cut in pieces (2 cm)
2 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
2 pinches ground pepper, plus extra to taste
400 g white bread, toasted, cut in strips
steps: Place carrots, leeks and turnips in mixing bowl and chop 7 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add potatoes, water, 1 tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper. Line Varoma dish with baking paper and set in position. Add baby spinach to Varoma dish and season with 20 g butter and ½ tsp salt. Close Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Remove Varoma, drain cooked spinach and, using a fork, divide among 8 ramekins (approx. Ø 7 cm, height 4 cm). Arrange diced tomatoes over the spinach. Break open 1 egg into each ramekin and season to taste with ½ tsp salt and 1 pinch pepper. Arrange 3 ramekins in Varoma dish and 5 on Varoma tray, set Varoma back in position and cook for a further 11 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside.

Add remaining 20 g butter to mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve soup hot as a starter, followed by the eggs en cocotte with toasted bread fingers for dipping, along with salt and pepper for individual seasoning at the table.
tips: The eggs, spinach and tomatoes are steamed in little dishes above a soup, perfect for lunch or a light dinner. Try sprinkling some cheese on top of the eggs before steaming, and feel free to adapt this warming winter soup to any season according to the vegetables you have on hand.

The eggs, spinach and tomatoes are steamed in little dishes above a soup, perfect for lunch or a light dinner. Try sprinkling some cheese on top of the eggs before steaming, and feel free to adapt this warming winter soup to any season according to the vegetables you have on hand.

For a different presentation, prepare and serve the eggs in heat-resistant glass jars.The cooking time for the eggs in step 3 can be adjusted according to the size of the eggs, their temperature and your cooking preference. Chilled medium eggs (53-63 g) cooked as directed by the recipe will result in firm egg whites and runny egg yolks. If using room temperature eggs, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Increase cooking time by 1 min 30 sec if you prefer semi-hard egg yolks.
For a different presentation, prepare and serve the eggs in heat-resistant glass jars.

The cooking time for the eggs in step 3 can be adjusted according to the size of the eggs, their temperature and your cooking preference. Chilled medium eggs (53-63 g) cooked as directed by the recipe will result in firm egg whites and runny egg yolks. If using room temperature eggs, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Increase cooking time by 1 min 30 sec if you prefer semi-hard egg yolks.

title: Chai latte ice cream
ingredients: 1 ½ tbsp black tea leaves, dried
4 - 6 ice cream cones  o 4 - 6 waffle biscuits
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place cream, black tea, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, ginger, nutmeg and fennel in mixing bowl, then heat 10 min/95°C/speed 2.5. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and set aside to steep for approx. 10 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place reserved sugar, egg yolks, milk and salt in mixing bowl then start Thicken /80°C. Strain infused cream through a fine-mesh sieve into a second bowl. Discard tea leaves and spices.

Add infused cream and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 6.
Add cream, butter, honey, vanilla extract and salt then heat 6 min/80°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut into pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a container.

Place remaining pieces of ice cream in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and smooth surface with spatula. Freeze for at least 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved.

Break ice cream cones into pieces. Place 1-2 tbsp crumbled ice cream cones in a serving glass, top with 1-2 tbsp whipped cream, drizzle with 1 tbsp chocolate sauce (spreading around sides of serving glass) and top with 2 scoops chai latte ice cream. Add a second layer of crumbled ice cream cones, whipped cream, chocolate sauce and top with 2 more scoops chai latte ice cream. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate sauce and serve immediately (see tip).
tips: Keep left over ice cream in freezer for up to 2-3 days.
To prepare just chai latte ice cream, start with steps 1-4 and finish with steps 7 and 8.

title: Squid in squid ink sauce (calamares en su tinta)
ingredients: 3 portions squid ink (approx. 12 g), dissolved in a little water
200 g brandy  o 200 g white wine
steps: Place onion, garlic and oil in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 5, then sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .
Add crushed tomatoes and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add squid and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add squid ink, brandy and water and cook 25 min/100°C//speed .
Add salt and pepper and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Check whether squid is tender. If not, cook a further 5 min/100°C//speed .

If squid releases a lot of water and sauce seems too liquid, reduce a further 5 min/Varoma//speed , placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to prevent splashes. Serve hot.
tips: Serve with white rice.

title: Blackberry Mojito
ingredients: 16 fresh blackberries, plus extra to garnish
15 g fresh mint, leaves only, plus extra to garnish
steps: Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and place blackberries and sugar in it. Place Varoma dish on mixing bowl lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside (see tip).
Add lemon juice and reduce 10 min/Varoma/speed 1 without measuring cup. Transfer syrup to a bowl, set aside and allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 4 blackberries and 2 tbsp cold blackberry syrup each in 4 glasses.
Place ice cubes in mixing bowl and crush 5 sec/speed 6. Divide equally between prepared glasses.
Place limes and mint in mixing bowl then chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add mineral water and rum then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Pour into a jug through a fine-mesh sieve and discard lime and mint bits. Divide lime and mint juice between glasses. Garnish with fresh blackberries and mint leaves, then serve immediately.
tips: In step 1, transfer steamed blackberries to a container and use as a topping for pancakes or toast.

title: Lamb and vegetable couscous (Bidawi)
ingredients: 400 g lamb meat for stew, boneless, cut in cubes (approx. 2 cm)
5 g fresh parsley leaves, plus extra, chopped, to garnish
5 g fresh coriander leaves, plus extra, chopped, to garnish
150 g carrot, cut in pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
150 g courgette, cut in pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
150 g turnip, cut in pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
150 g butternut squash, cut in pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in couscous, 350 g water and 40 g olive oil. Season with 2 tsp salt and mix with spatula. Set aside and allow couscous to absorb liquid for 15 minutes. Gently fluff couscous using a fork. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place tomatoes and onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add lamb, parsley, coriander, 1 tsp salt, ground pepper, saffron, 30 g olive oil, butter, 500 g water, carrot, courgette, turnip and butternut squash and cook 35 min/100°C/speed 1.

Set Varoma dish in position and add prepared couscous in it. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside. Serve lamb stew with vegetables on top of couscous and garnish with parsley and coriander.
tips: Adding oil to the couscous helps to separate the grains.
Butter may be replaced with "smen”, which is a Moroccan butter that is seasoned with spices.

title: Rabbit stew (Gibelotte)
ingredients: 100 g spring onions, cut in pieces
2 slices farmhouse bread, cut in cubes (2 cm)
1 rabbit, whole, skinless, head removed, cut in pieces
400 g fresh white button mushrooms, cut in quarters
steps: Place shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 1 tbsp rapeseed oil and spring onions and sauté without measuring cup 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp rapeseed oil in a frying pan, brown the bread cubes and set aside.

Fry bacon in the same frying pan. Meanwhile, lightly flour the rabbit pieces and then add to bacon in the frying pan and fry until golden. Transfer to the simmering basket and set aside. Deglaze frying pan with the white wine to collect all cooking juices.

Add cooking juices from the frying pan, 100 g mushrooms, bouquet garni, water, chicken stock cube, salt and ground pepper to the mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket. Set Varoma dish in position and add potatoes in it. Insert Varoma tray, arrange remaining 300 g mushrooms on it. Close Varoma and steam 45 min/Varoma//speed . Set Varoma aside and remove simmering basket with aid of spatula.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh 30 g cooked potatoes in it and set aside.
Arrange steamed rabbit and remaining potatoes in a dome on a serving dish. Add cooked mushrooms over the rabbit and potatoes. Set aside to keep warm.
Drain the contents of mixing bowl through the simmering basket, reserving the cooking liquid. Discard the bouquet garni.

Place reserved cooking liquid, reserved cooked potatoes to the mixing bowl, mix 10 sec/speed 7, then heat, without measuring cup 8 min/Varoma/speed 2. Pour the sauce over rabbit. Serve immediately, with toasted croutons.
tips: The number of portions for this dish may vary depending on the size of the rabbit.

If the rabbit chosen is large, it will not be possible to put it all into the simmering basket. Therefore put a few pieces in the Varoma, under the potatoes, making sure not to obstruct all the holes in the Varoma.
If you find that the sauce is too runny, add a little more cooked potatoes at step 5 to bind the sauce.
If there are no spring onions available, use ordinary onions, cut in half, and mix with the garlic and shallot at step 1.

title: Mango yoghurt ice cream
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add mango and water and puree 10 sec/speed 5.
Add yoghurt and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to ice cube trays and allow to freeze for at least 12 hours, ideally overnight.
Place half of ice cream cubes in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6. Then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Add remaining ice cream cubes to mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6. Then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to bowl with ice cream and serve immediately or transfer the mixture to ice lolly moulds and freeze 6-8 hours before serving.
tips: You will need 4-5 ice cube trays for these quantities. If you do not have that many ice cube trays, the mixture can also be transferred to shallow freezable conatiners (e.g. plastic, silicone) in step 3 and frozen and then cut into pieces.

You will need 4-5 ice cube trays for these quantities. If you do not have that many ice cube trays, the mixture can also be transferred to shallow freezable conatiners (e.g. plastic, silicone) in step 3 and frozen and then cut into pieces.

title: Crema catalana
ingredients: 300 g sugar, (200 g for the recipe and 100 g for burning)
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place milk, egg yolks, 200 g of sugar, corn starch, vanilla sugar and salt into mixing bowl and whisk 15 sec/speed 3.5.
Add lemon zest and cinnamon and heat 11 min/90°C/speed 2.
If there is any foam, blend 2 min/90°C/speed 2. If not, 2 min/speed 2 without heating.

Remove butterfly whisk, lemon zest and cinnamon. Blend 10 sec/speed 7. Pour mixture into 6 heat resistant dishes and leave to cool for at least 20 minutes. Sprinkle with 100 g of sugar and burn with a cook’s blowtorch, special burner or bake for a few minutes until the sugar has turned to caramel. Serve hot or cold.

title: Peas with ham
ingredients: 120 g Iberian ham, cut into small pieces
steps: Place onion and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Then sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add peas, water and salt. Heat 15 min/100°C//speed .
Add ham and heat 5 min/100°C//speed . Serve immediately.

title: Fish and prawn stock
ingredients: 200 g whole raw unpeeled shrimps, (only heads and shells, set meat aside)
steps: Place heads and shells of the prawns, leek and olive oil into mixing bowl. Sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2. Freeze meat and use it in another recipe.
Add water, monkfish bones, salt and parsley and cook 8 min/100°C/speed 2. Sieve through a fine mesh strainer and refrigerate in an air-tight container for later use.
tips: This stock can be prepared and frozen in individual portions so that it is ready to add to paellas, soups and sauces, etc.

title: Orange couscous with steamed salmon
ingredients: 4 salmon fillets, fresh or frozen and thawed
steps: Set Varoma dish onto Varoma lid (turned upside down). Place salmon fillets in Varoma dish and season with lemon juice, salt, pepper and rosemary.
Place orange zest into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and 1 tsp of salt into mixing bowl and place Varoma into position. Steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer steaming water to a bowl and set aside.

Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh 250 g couscous and add 250 g steaming water. Add orange zest and juice into the large bowl, allow to rest for around 5 minutes and then use a fork to fluff up the couscous.
Add watercress and salmon, pulled into flakes, to couscous and mix with spatula. Serve hot or cold.
tips: If watercress is not available, you can use arugula.For a salad season with a drizzle of olive oil just before serving.
If watercress is not available, you can use arugula.
For a salad season with a drizzle of olive oil just before serving.

title: Varoma-cooked vegetable ragout with omelette
ingredients: 4 - 5 sprigs parsley, leaves washed and dried
20 g Parmesan cheese or other cheese (opcional)
20 g onion, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
80 g celery stalks, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
40 g carrot, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
3 - 5 leaves fresh basil, washed and dried
400 g chopped tomatoes, canned or fresh
1 slice ham, cooked (opcional)  o 2 slice cheese (opcional)
steps: Line Varoma tray with washed, squeezed baking paper (take care not to obstruct side openings).
Place Parmesan and parsley in the mixing bowl. Chop 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer the mixture into a soup plate and set aside.
Place garlic, onions, celery and carrot, and basil leaves into mixing bowl. Chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add olive oil and blend 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, crack the eggs into the plate with the parsley and grated Parmesan, add a pinch of salt and mix with a fork. Pour the mixture into Varoma tray prepared in advance and set aside.
Place tomato, water and a teaspoon of salt into the mixing bowl. Place Varoma with the egg mixture (Varoma tray) and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.
When done, remove Varoma lid, turn upside down and place Varoma tray on it. Slide the omelette onto a flat dish, fill with the ham, roll up and slice.
Pour sauce into a serving bowl and use for other recipes (for instance, as a pasta dressing: see Step 8). To taste, pour some sauce over omelette and serve hot.
tips: To taste, the frittata may be filled with other meat, a sliced frankfurter, baby artichokes, or dried tomatoes in oil.
To taste, garnish the dish with baby tomatoes sliced in half and some basil leaves.

How to cook pasta (optional): Pour water into mixing bowl and bring to boil: 8min/100°C/speed 1. Add salt and tagliatelle pasta. Cook 4 min/100°C//speed 1. Pour into a serving bowl and mix in the sauce before serving.

title: Tex-mex burger
ingredients: 2 tsp Mexican spice mix or any other spice mix of choice
600 g beef mince, formed into 5 burger patties
6 slices Emmental cheese or any other medium-hard cheese (e.g. cheddar, gouda)
steps: Place water, yeast, milk, sugar, flour and 1 egg into mixing bowl and knead Dough /5 min.

Add butter and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough onto a previously floured work surface. Pull edges of dough towards centre 3-4 times. Roll into a ball, place in a large bowl, cover with a kitchen towel and allow to rise for 1-2 hours in a warm place until doubled in size. Clean mixing bowl.

At the end of first proving, transfer dough to floured work surface and knock it back firmly with your hands to let the gas escape. Shape into a log, then divide into 5 balls. Transfer buns to a baking tray lined with baking paper, making sure there is 5 cm between them. Cover with a kitchen towel and allow to rise again for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 210°C.

At the end of the second proving, break remaining egg into a bowl and beat it with a fork. Brush buns with egg using a pastry brush. Sprinkle buns with sesame seeds and bake for 15-20 minutes (210°C). Take buns out of oven and allow to cool.
Place shallots and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and Cayenne pepper and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed  without measuring cup.
Add brown sugar and sauté 2 min/100°C/speed  without measuring cup.
Add tomato passata, mustard, lemon juice and Worcester sauce and cook 5 min/100°C/speed .
Add cornstarch and cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1,then blend 30 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onions and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 10 g olive oil, spice mix and cayenne pepper and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed  without measuring cup.

Add tomatoes and corn and cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Heat remaining olive oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook burgers for 2 minutes on each side. Halve buns, spread barbecue sauce on both sides, place onion mixture, then a burger and a slice of Emmental on base. Place top of bun on burgers, place in oven and cook for 5 minutes (200°C). Remove from oven, add some salad leaves to garnish and serve immediately.

title: Mini pizzas
ingredients: 30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
steps: Lightly grease a large bowl with oil and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 2.
Add bread flour, tomato purée, oil and salt then knead 2 min/. Transfer dough to greased bowl, cover with cling film then leave to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hours).
Preheat oven to 230°C and line 2 baking trays with baking paper.
Once dough has doubled in size, use spatula to divide dough into 16 equal-sized-pieces. Form each one into a ball then roll into a circle (Ø 10 cm). Transfer to baking trays.
Spread passata evenly over dough bases then sprinkle mozzarella evenly over the top. Bake for 10-15 minutes (230°C) then serve warm.
tips: Many different varieties of pizza can be made. Top with your choosen ingredients at step 5, finishing with a scattering of grated mozzarella: ham and mushroom or ham and pineapple, olives, goat's cheese, peperoni or fresh basil leaves are examples of great additions to the cheese and tomato pizza in the recipe.

Many different varieties of pizza can be made. Top with your choosen ingredients at step 5, finishing with a scattering of grated mozzarella: ham and mushroom or ham and pineapple, olives, goat's cheese, peperoni or fresh basil leaves are examples of great additions to the cheese and tomato pizza in the recipe.

title: Pork tenderloin parcels
ingredients: 1 pinch fine salt, plus extra to taste
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
steps: Place garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 5.
Add leek, carrot, salt and pepper and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add wine and paprika and cook 2 min/120°C//speed .

Place tenderloins on 4 separate squares of baking paper (30 cm x 30 cm) and distribute sautéd vegetables evenly over each fillet. Fold baking paper to close packets and place parcels seam side up, 2 in Varoma dish and 2 on Varoma tray, tucking the folded ends of paper underneath the parcels. Leave some holes of the Varoma dish and tray unobstructed for steam to circulate.

Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open one parcel and check if tenderloin is cooked and prolong cooking time if necessary. Remove Varoma and allow to cool slightly. Serve tenderloins sliced and drizzled with some of the cooking liquid from the parcels.
tips: Accompany the tenderloins with white rice or mashed potatoes.

title: Layered chocolate orange slice
ingredients: 160 g unsalted butter, plus extra for greasing
70 g chocolate, orange flavoured, broken into pieces
120 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, broken into pieces
1 orange, zest only, no white pith
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a square baking tin (20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place orange flavoured chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place 160 g butter and dark chocolate into mixing bowl and melt 3 min/60°C/speed 2, or until melted.
Add sugar and eggs and mix 15 sec/speed 3.

Add vanilla extract, salt and flour and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mix for a further 5 sec/speed 3. Transfer half of the brownie mixture into a large bowl and set aside.
Transfer remaining brownie mixture in mixing bowl into the bowl with the crushed orange flavoured chocolate. Combine with spatula, then pour into prepared baking tin.
Bake for 10-15 minutes (180°C) or until just set. Set aside to cool in tin. Keep oven temperature at 180°C.
Place orange zest and sugar into mixing bowl and mill 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mill for a further 10 sec/speed 9.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add orange juice, orange liqueur, unsalted butter and eggs and cook 9 min/80°C/speed 3, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid. Transfer orange curd into a bowl and set aside to cool completely.
Spoon cooled orange curd over cooled brownie layer in baking tin and smooth out leaving a ½ cm gap around the edges.
Carefully spoon the remaining brownie mixture over the curd in baking tin, then bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C).
Allow to cool completely in tin, then place into refrigerator for 1 hour. Cut into small pieces and serve.

title: Cream of lettuce soup, sea bass with potatoes and watercress sauce
ingredients: 30 - 40 g watercress, washed and dried, plus extra for decoration
500 g potatoes, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
500 g sea bass, without head and innards
steps: Place watercress in mixing bowl and blend 4 sec/speed 7.
Scrape down watercress from sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add lemon juice, 1 tsp salt, pepper and olive oil and mix 20 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a sauce boat and set aside.

Pour water and 1 tsp salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with potatoes. Place Varoma dish into position, place 4-6 lettuce leaves and put sea bass on top, making sure some holes remain unobstructed. Sprinkle the inside and top of sea bass with 2 tbsp watercress sauce. Cover with remaining lettuce leaves. Cover Varoma and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and place sea bass and potatoes from simmering basket into a bowl (set 4-8 pieces of potato aside) to keep warm.

Add 4-8 reserved potato pieces and lettuce leaves to mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Pour the soup into two bowls and sprinkle with a few drops of watercress sauce or with a dash of olive oil. Serve sea bass and potatoes with remaining sauce and garnish with fresh watercress.
tips: Nutritional comments: This menu is very balanced and complete and can be combined with a dessert made with fresh seasonal fruit.
You can cook this recipe with other fish (bream, hake, etc.).

title: Crispy turkey and lentil meatballs
ingredients: 50 g stale white bread, cut into pieces
30 - 50 g milk, for soaking the bread
40 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
300 g turkey breast fillet, skinless, cut into pieces
150 g lentils, canned, drained (weight after draining) (see tip)
steps: Place bread and milk to soak in a bowl for approximately 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 20 sec/speed 9. Remove from mixing bowl and set aside.
Without cleaning the mixing bowl, add turkey and chop 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lentils, eggs, strained breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, bacon and salt and mix 20 sec//speed 4.
Form meatballs with the mixture and cover with flour. Fry the meatballs in hot oil until browned.
Dry on paper towels and serve hot.
tips: When using dry lentils, soak 120 g dry lentils in a bowl of cold water for around 4 hours. Place the strained lentils into mixing bowl and add 1.5 l water. Cook: 40 min/100°C/ /speed 1.The meatballs can be served hot or at room temperature.Serve meatballs with mayonnaise or ketchup.
When using dry lentils, soak 120 g dry lentils in a bowl of cold water for around 4 hours. Place the strained lentils into mixing bowl and add 1.5 l water. Cook: 40 min/100°C/ /speed 1.
The meatballs can be served hot or at room temperature.
Serve meatballs with mayonnaise or ketchup.

title: Wholemeal pasta with chickpea cream and prawns
ingredients: 1 sprig fresh rosemary, needles washed and dried
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to taste
20 g carrots, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
20 g celery, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
100 g whole wheat pasta, dried, e.g. penne rigate or other short type whole wheat pasta
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil.
Place shallot and rosemary into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add the olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add carrot and celery and blend: 5 sec/speed 5.

Add the chickpeas, water and salt and cook: 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the time indicated on the packaging. Blend contents of mixing bowl 30 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.

Place Varoma tray into Varoma dish and line with a sheet of baking paper. Make sure some holes remain unobstructed. Distribute the prawns inside and close the lid. Insert the Varoma and cook 7 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully remove Varoma lid, turn upside-down and place Varoma dish on top.
Transfer chickpea cream into deep plates, arrange the pasta and prawns on top. Add a dash of olive oil and, if liked, garnish with freshly ground pepper. Serve hot.

title: Lamb tagine with apricots and honey
ingredients: 200 g carrots, peeled and cut into pieces (approx. 4 cm)
20 g olive oil, plus 2 tbsp extra
500 g lamb shoulder meat, boneless, cut into pieces (4-5 cm)
1 tsp fine salt, plus 1 pinch extra to taste
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place onions and carrots into mixing bowl and chop 7 sec/speed 4.
Add olive oil and sauté 6 min/120°C/speed  without measuring cup.

Add lamb, ginger, cinnamon, saffron, lemon, honey, cumin, 1tsp salt and pepper and cook 60 min/80°C//speed . Meanwhile, place semolina, 2 tbsp olive oil and 1 pinch salt into a bowl. Mix with a fork and cover with water at room temperature. Allow to soak.

Place apricots and almonds into mixing bowl. Mix semolina gently with a fork to break any lumps and transfer into Varoma dish. Place Varoma back into position and cook again 15 min/100°C//speed . Transfer lamb tagine and semolina to deep plates. Sprinkle generously with coriander and serve hot.

title: Moroccan filled bread rolls (Batbout)
ingredients: 30 g fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
30 g fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
50 g yellow peppers, cut into pieces
50 g red peppers, cut into pieces
2 pinches freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
olive oil, for oiling hands and for frying
steps: Place water, yeast, flour, salt and turmeric into mixing bowl and knead 8 min/. Transfer dough to a bowl and set aside.
Place coriander, mint and parsley into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop again 5 sec/speed 8 if necessary.
Add reserved dough and knead 2 min/. Transfer to a bowl, cover with a tea towel and allow to prove for 1 hour.
Place onions, coriander, mint, parsley and yellow and red pepper into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add minced beef, salt, pepper, turmeric and cumin and mix 30 sec//speed 2.

Transfer reserved dough onto a work surface, divide into 8 equal parts and shape each into a ball. With lightly oiled hands, flatten each ball into a small pancake, place ⅛ of the filling in the middle and bring the sides to the middle to form square breads. Arrange these breads on squares of baking paper and allow to prove for 1 hour. Heat oil in a frying pan and cook the breads on medium heat for 2 minutes with the paper, then 5 minutes on each side without the paper. Serve warm or cold.
tips: Replace one third of the flour with fine semolina.
Replace one third of the flour with fine semolina.
As an accompaniment to drinks, sprinkle with sea salt when frying.
As an accompaniment to drinks, sprinkle with sea salt when frying.

title: Berry liqueur
ingredients: 450 g mixed frozen red berries, thawed
steps: Place berries, water, sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl, heat 15 min/90°C/speed 2. Pass through a fine sieve collecting the liquid and return this to mixing bowl.
Add rum, stir 10 sec/speed 3 and transfer to 2 bottles (500 ml each) (see tip). Allow to cool and store in refrigerator.
tips: Use just one type of berries to prepare the liqueur instead of mixed berries.To ensure the liqueur keeps for as long as possible, wash the bottles thoroughly and dry in a warm oven or wash in the dishwasher. Transfer the berry liqueur to the bottles while they are still warm.Unopened, the berry liqueur keeps for up to 3 months if stored in a cool, dry place
Use just one type of berries to prepare the liqueur instead of mixed berries.
To ensure the liqueur keeps for as long as possible, wash the bottles thoroughly and dry in a warm oven or wash in the dishwasher. Transfer the berry liqueur to the bottles while they are still warm.
Unopened, the berry liqueur keeps for up to 3 months if stored in a cool, dry place

title: Trout mousse
ingredients: 250 g smoked trout fillets, cut into pieces (approx. 4 fillets)
20 slices pumpernickel bread (see tip) or brown bread, bite-sized (Ø 4-5 cm)
steps: Place shallots in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7.
Add trout, crème fraîche, salt and pepper and blend 30 sec/speed 7.
Transfer mousse to piping bag with large nozzle, pipe onto pumpernickel/brown bread, garnish with dill and serve.
tips: Pumpernickel is a heavy, slightly sweet rye bread of German origin. It is traditionally made with coarsely ground rye and available in different shapes and sizes such as the round, bite-sized pieces used in this recipe. Pumpernickel can be replaced by brown bread or any other kind of bread. Use a cookie cutter to cut out snack-sized pieces.

Pumpernickel is a heavy, slightly sweet rye bread of German origin. It is traditionally made with coarsely ground rye and available in different shapes and sizes such as the round, bite-sized pieces used in this recipe. Pumpernickel can be replaced by brown bread or any other kind of bread. Use a cookie cutter to cut out snack-sized pieces.

title: Cheesy veggie oat bars
ingredients: 200 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
200 g carrots, cut into pieces (3 cm)
200 g courgettes, cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C and line a square cake pan (20 cm) with baking paper.
Place cheese and parsley into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10.
Add onions, carrots and courgettes and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oats and eggs and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer to prepared cake pan and bake 30-40 minutes (190°C) until golden brown.
Remove from oven and cut into pieces, allowing to cool in pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Za'atar pesto
ingredients: 130 g olive oil, plus extra for topping
40 g fresh za’atar leaves, washed and dried
5 sprigs parsley, leaves only, washed and dried
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid, weigh olive oil into jug and set aside.
Place toasted almonds in the mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 9
Add garlic, za’atar leaves, parsley leaves, salt, sumac and lemon juice and chop 10 sec/speed 7.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop 5 sec/speed 6.

Mix speed 4, without setting a time, while very slowly pouring olive oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer pesto into a jar with a twist-off lid, cover with a layer of olive oil and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
tips: Weigh the herbs before you wash them as the weight changes if the herbs are wet.
Serve pesto with pitta bread or any other bread of your choice. It also accompanies well raw vegetables or can be used to dress pasta or as a base for salad dressing.

title: Shrimp stuffed bell peppers
ingredients: 250 g Egyptian rice  o 250 g short-grain rice
300 g ripe tomatoes, cut into quarters
2 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
steps: Place fresh coriander into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place a deep bowl onto mixing bowl lid, insert simmering basket into it. Weigh in rice and 500 g water and set aside. Cut the tops of the peppers and reserve for later use, remove the seeds, place in a baking dish and set aside.
Place onions, garlic, 30 g oil, cumin, Arabic spice mix and cinnamon into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile preheat oven to 200ºC.
Add tomato purée, tomatoes, sugar, chili peppers, 1 tsp vegetable paste, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5.

Add 250 g water and drained rice from simmering basket into mixing bowl and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer rice mixture in a bowl, add shrimps, lemon juice, and reserved chopped coriander and mix gently. Without pressing the mixture, fill peppers up to ¾ with shrimp mixture, then replace cut-off top on each pepper and place back into ovenproof dish and set aside.

Place remaining 250 g water, 1 tsp vegetable stock paste, 10 g olive oil into mixing bowl and warm it 4 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer into ovenproof baking dish with stuffed peppers (liquid should be enough to cover up to 1 cm of the base of the baking dish). Cover with a sheet of aluminium foil and bake for 40-50 minutes (200°C). Remove cover and bake for additional 10 minutes. Serve warm.
tips: Serve with Yoghurt and cucumber salad.

title: Fish tagine with tahini
ingredients: 1000 g white fish fillets, skinless, boneless (e.g. dorade, sea bass)
fresh parsley leaves, chopped, to garnish
steps: Cut 200 g onions in slices and distribute into Varoma dish and tray. Distribute fish filets on top, making sure that some holes remain unobstructed, sprinkle with salt, drizzle with 10 g lemon juice and set aside.
Place remaining onions and sunflower oil into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 3.5, then sauté 18 min/Varoma/speed 1, without measuring cup. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place 500 g water into mixing bowl, set Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place 1 tsp salt, 90 g lemon juice, ½ tsp cumin, remaining 200 g water, tahini paste, vinegar and bitter orange juice into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 4.

Add reserved sautéed onions and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1 without measuring cup. Allow sauce to cool for approx. 20 minutes. Transfer fish filets into a serving dish and break them into chunks, pour tahini sauce onto fish and serve warm or at room temperature. Garnish with pine nuts and chopped parsley.
tips: Bitter orange juice can be replaced with a mixture of 50 g lemon juice and 100 g orange juice.

title: Chicken with bulgur and vegetables
ingredients: 800 g chicken breast fillets, cut into cubes (3 cm)
50 g fresh tomatoes, deseeded and diced, to garnish
1 sprig fresh parsley, leaves only, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place a deep bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, 20 g olive oil, lemon juice, ground coriander, paprika, 1 pinch cumin. Mix with aid of spatula and set aside for at least 2 hours to marinate.
Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in bulgur, rinse under running water, place on a plate and set aside to strain.

Place onions, carrots, courgettes, remaining 30 g olive oil, salt, pepper and 1 pinch cumin into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then remove measuring cup and sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer into simmering basket with bulgur and mix with aid of spatula.

Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with bulgur and vegetables and add tomato passata on top. Place Varoma dish and tray into position, distribute marinated chicken in Varoma tray and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside. Transfer bulgur and chicken into a deep serving bowl, pour remaining steaming liquid on top and let absorb. Garnish with pine nuts, diced tomato and fresh chopped parsley before serving.

title: Pig's Stomach And White Pepper Soup
ingredients: 1 whole chicken leg (approx. 350 g), with skin and bone
8 g Chinese dang gui (Chinese angelica roots), sliced
2 sprigs fresh coriander, roots and leaves separated
15 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Rub pig’s stomach inside out thoroughly with salt and wash thoroughly with water.
Place white peppercorns in mixing bowl, crush Turbo/1 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place cleaned pig’s stomach and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch 10 min/50°C//speed . Empty mixing bowl. Insert chicken leg into the pig’s stomach.
Place pig’s stomach with chicken, dang gui slices, coriander roots, rice wine, 1100 g water and reserved crushed white peppercorns in mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /3 h/98°C.

Add wolfberries, cook 15 min/98°C//speed . Carefully remove pig’s stomach from mixing bowl and set aside. Transfer soup to a serving bowl. Cut pig’s stomach and chicken leg into slices (1 cm), place pig’s stomach slices into the serving bowl. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mavis Ong.

title: Braised Mushroom With Broccoli And Beancurd Sheets
ingredients: 1700 g water, extra 2 tbsp water for mixing in Step 5
300 g broccoli, rinsed, cut in florets
8 dried Chinese mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed
steps: Place 1500 g water, 1 tbsp oil and salt in mixing bowl, boil 12 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add broccoli florets, blanch 2 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer blanched broccoli to a bowl. Discard blanching water.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 2 tbsp oil and mushrooms, cook 7 min/120°C//speed 1.

Add 200 g water, beancurd sheets, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, sesame oil and white pepper, cook 5 min/120°C//speed . Meanwhile, mix cornstarch with 2 tbsp water in a bowl and set aside.
Add reserved cornstarch mixture, cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Transfer broccoli and mushrooms to a large serving plate. Garnish with wolfberries. Serve warm.
tips: Broccoli can be replaced with bok choy.

title: Shiitake mushroom sauce
ingredients: 50 g dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, drained
steps: Place leek, garlic cloves and dried shiitake mushrooms into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add fermented soybean paste, dark soy sauce and water, without measuring cup, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve immediately or pour into a jar for storage in refrigerator.
tips: Adjust the amount of water according to fermented soybean paste thickness. Reduce the water amount used if soybean paste texture is thin and watery.
Adjust the amount of sugar and salt for seasoning according to saltiness of fermented soybean paste.
Best served with cold dishes or noodles.

title: Rosalinda Tart (Fancy Pineapple Tart)
ingredients: 1500 g pineapple (approx. 2 pineapples), peeled, core removed, cut in cubes (2 cm)
250 g butter, cold, cut in cubes (1 cm)
steps: Place pineapples in mixing bowl, chop 15 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again 15 sec/speed 5. Drain chopped pineapple using Varoma dish to discard excess liquid for 10 minutes.

Place chopped pineapple flesh, sugar, cinnamon stick, cloves and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, cook 40 min/120°C/speed 1 until it thickens. Transfer to a bowl and let cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of pineapple jam (approx. 5 g) and roll into a small ball. Repeat step with remaining jam.
Place butter and caster sugar in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add all-purpose flour, cornflour, custard powder, condensed milk and cold water in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Knead Dough /30 sec. Transfer dough onto pastry mat, form dough into round shape. Using a rolling pin, roll dough to 3mm thickness. Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Using a flower-shaped cutter (Ø 3 cm), cut out pastry and place onto prepared baking tray. Place reserved jam ball in the centre of tart pastry and shape into a dome. Using a pastry brush, brush pastry surface with beaten egg. Repeat steps with remaining dough.
Bake on middle rack for 20 minutes (170°C) until lightly brown. Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack.
Place white sugar in mixing bowl, pulverize 30 sec/speed 10.
Add egg white, cornflour and lemon juice, mix 10 sec/speed 6.

Divide icing into 2 equal portions in 2 small bowls. Mix green food colouring into one of the icings. Transfer both icings to 2 piping bags. Decorate tarts with royal icing and sugar flower as desired. Allow to dry completely before serving or storing in an airtight container.
tips: If the dough texture is too wet, add a little bit of flour. If the dough texture is too dry, add some butter.
If icing is too thick, add a few more drops of lemon juice or water.
Recipe contributed by Raznita Abdul Razak.

title: Gingerbread Milkshake
ingredients: 150 g gingerbread biscuits, homemade or storebought
steps: Place biscuits in mixing bowl, crush 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer 20 g crushed biscuits to a bowl and set aside.
Add vanilla ice cream, milk, ice cubes, ground ginger and ground cinnamon, blend 1 min/speed 7. Serve in glasses, topped with whipped cream and reserved gingerbread biscuits as desired.

title: Hojicha Canelé
ingredients: 45 g unsalted butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven 230°C. Place milk and butter in mixing bowl, melt 5 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add hojicha powder, caster sugar, egg yolks, plain flour, vanilla extract and salt, mix 15 sec/speed 3. Grease 15 non-stick canelé moulds generously. Pour batter into greased moulds until 90% full.

Bake at upper rack for 10 minutes (230°C). Reduce heat to 190°C. Continue to bake another 50 minutes (190°C) until surface turns dark brown and slightly burnt. Remove from oven, let cool for 5 minutes before unmoulding on a cooling rack. Serve warm or cool.
tips: Let the batter rest for at least 48 hours (or up to 4 days) before baking. Keep the batter in containers and refrigerate. Gently whisk the batter to reincorporate before baking.

Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven. Cross check your oven temperature with oven thermometer.
Best served with ice cream, whipped cream or jam.
Canelé is best eaten on the day they are baked. They lose their crunch within 2 hours after being taken from the oven.
Replace rum with your favourite liqueur, such as orange liqueur, kirsch etc.

title: Crunchy Caramel Popcorn
ingredients: 80 g salted butter, cut in pieces
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in popcorn. Line a baking tray with a pastry mat or baking paper and set aside.
Preheat oven to 150°C.
Place sugar, 80 g water and honey in mixing bowl, without measuring cup, start Sugar Stages .
Add butter through hole in mixing bowl lid, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing, cook * 8 min/120°C/speed 2 *.

Immediately pour caramel over reserved popcorn and stir quickly to coat popcorn, then immediately scrape off any mixture left on rim of mixing bowl using spatula so mixing bowl lid closes securely for Pre-clean mode. Transfer to prepared baking tray in a single layer and bake for 30 minutes (150°C), stirring popcorn half way through cooking (see tips).
Place vinegar and remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse mixing bowl.
Leave caramel popcorn on baking tray until completely cool and hardened (approx. 1 hour). Break into pieces and serve or store in a sealable container (see tips).
tips: You can use salted or unsalted popcorn. If the popcorn is warm when caramel is added it will be easier to coat.
As soon as the popcorn is in the oven, continue to the next step to run the Pre-clean mode.
You can store caramel popcorn in a sealable container in the pantry for up to 5 days.

title: Steamed Fish With Pickled Chilli And Black Beans
ingredients: 300 g silken tofu (approx. 1 block), cut in slices (1 cm)
1 garoupa (grouper) fish (800-1000 g), gutted, butterflied (see tips)
2 tbsp pickled chillies, cut in thin slices
2 - 3 sprigs spring onions, chopped, to garnish
steps: Arrange tofu slices on a steaming plate.
Place grouper fish on tofu slices. Top with pickled chilli slices and fermented black beans. Insert the steaming plate in Varoma tray and insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Check if the fish is cooked (see tip), prolong steaming time if necessary. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl. Discard steaming juice from plate and keep warm.
Place light soy sauce, sugar, chicken stock powder, water and cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 4 min/100°C/speed 1. Pour on steamed fish. Garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: To butterfly a whole fish, use the knife point to slice from the belly to the tail to halve the fish without cutting the backbone. Grab the fish and open it like a book.
To check whether the fish is cooked, the flesh should be tender enough to be pierced through easily by a fork or chopsticks.
Replace grouper fish with other freshwater fish varieties such as catfish (baung), barb (jelawat), patin fish etc.
Replace tofu slices with soaked mung bean jelly sheets (fenpi), mung bean vermicelli (dongfen), beancurd sheet (fuchok) or flat rice noodles (hor fun).

title: Sour Plum Sauce
ingredients: 200 g red onions, cut into halves
120 g salted plums in brine, drained, pits removed
600 g fresh black plums, pits removed, cut into quarters
steps: Place garlic cloves, red onions and red chillies in mixing bowl, blend 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salted plums and fresh plums, blend 20 sec/speed 6.

Add brown sugar, honey and white vinegar. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing and cook 45 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve as condiment or transfer to 2 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Tom Yum Paste
ingredients: 15 fresh red chillies, cut into halves, deseeded
50 g fresh ginger, cut into slices (0.5 cm)
2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
15 dried chillies, deseeded (see tips), soaked to soften
steps: Place red chillies, garlic cloves, kaffir lime leaves, ginger, galangal, lemongrass, shallots, raw sugar, shrimp paste, coriander and torch lilies in mixing bowl, start Blend /30 sec.
Add dried chillies, start Blend /1 min with aid of spatula. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add cooking oil, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Add fish sauce and lime juice, cook 3 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk. Use as condiment for tom yum soup or transfer to 3 airtght jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: To peel off garlic skin, place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec//speed 5. Remove garlic skin.
To deseed the chillies, cut dried chillies in halves, place in clean and dry mixing bowl and chop 10 sec//speed 5.

To easily peel the shallots, cut the tops off the shallots. Place them in mixing bowl, fill with water to cover shallots and stir 20 sec//speed 2. Then stir again 30 sec//speed 3.5. Drain shallots and remove the skins.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Steamed Papaya Milk
ingredients: 100 g ripe papayas, cut in cubes (2 cm)
steps: Place a steaming bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in papaya, lump sugar and milk. Cover with heat-resistant cling film.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, place steaming bowl with papaya into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 45 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove cling film. Serve warm or chilled.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Virgin Coconut Oil Chocolate
ingredients: 90 g cocoa powder, plus extra for dusting
60 g molasses powder, adjust to taste
steps: Place coconut oil, cocoa powder, brown rice powder, molasses powder and rock salt in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/speed 3-5, increasing speed gradually until smooth texture is achieved. Transfer to a 20-hole chocolate mould and insert nuts into each hole. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Unmould and dust with cocoa powder. Serve immediately.
tips: You may adjust the amount of cocoa powder according to your preference of sweetness.
Freeze chocolate for 30 minutes before serving if the chocolate melts too fast.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Cream of Lotus
ingredients: 50 g raw cashew nuts, soaked for 30 minutes
steps: Place lotus seeds and water in mixing bowl, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing, cook 30 min/95°C/speed 2.5.
Add cashew nuts, agave nectar and rock salt, blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to serving bowls and serve warm.
tips: The indicated weight of lotus seeds is wet weight after soaking. Dry weight is approximately 160 g.
The indicated weight of cashew nuts is wet weight after soaking. Dry weight is approximately 35 g.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Sate Lilit (Minced Beef Satay)
ingredients: 250 g beef tenderloin, partially frozen, cut in thin slices
100 g chicken thigh fillets, skinless, partially frozen, cut in thin slices
10 stalks fresh lemongrass, cut into 18 cm length, plus additional 1 stalk, cut into 3 pieces
steps: Place beef tenderloin and chicken thigh fillets in mixing bowl, chop Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place grated coconut, shallots, garlic cloves, red chillies, bird’s eye chillies, ginger, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, ground coriander, candlenuts, salt, brown sugar, tamarind paste, cooking oil and 3 lemongrass pieces in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Allow mixing bowl temperature drop to 60°C (approx. 5 minutes).

Add reserved beef tenderloin and chicken thigh fillets, knead Dough /1 min. Divide the paste into 10 portions, paste 1 portion onto thickest part of each lemongrass stalk. Repeat for the remaining paste until finished.
Heat up a frying pan, grill satay over medium heat until golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Replace beef with chicken.
Seafood sate lilit: In step 1, replace beef with 150 g of mackerel fillets and 100 g of shrimp meat. Add 10 g of shrimp paste in step 2.

title: Tomato Soup Paste
ingredients: 600 g fresh tomatoes, ripe, peeled skin and cut in quarters
150 g red onions, cut in quarters
20 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
2 tsp chicken stock powder, homemade or store-bought, adjust to taste
steps: Place tomatoes in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place red onions and ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add vegetable oil, sauté without measuring cup 7 min/120°C/speed .

Add reserved chopped tomatoes, tomato purée, oyster sauce and chicken stock powder, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing, cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Blend 10 sec/speed 6-8, increasing speed gradually. Let cool completely and pour in sterilised jars and store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
tips: To peel off tomatoes skin, score an X on the bottom of tomatoes and put in a bowl of hot water for 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl of cold water and peel the skin with a knife or your fingers.
The recommended ratio of tomato soup paste to water is 1:2. You may add 2 to 3 fresh tomatoes into the soup to enhance the flavor of your tomato hot pot soup base.
Use the tomato paste to cook tomato eggs, tomato noodles etc.

title: Ais Kepal Gula Melaka (Shaved Ice with Palm Sugar Syrup)
ingredients: 100 g palm sugar, cut in chunks
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in ice cubes. Set aside in freezer. Place coconut milk and salt in mixing bowl, heat 7 min/90°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place palm sugar and water in mixing bowl, cook 7 min/90°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place reserved ice cubes in mixing bowl, crush 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and shape into balls. Drizzle with palm sugar syrup and coconut milk. Serve immediately.
tips: For fluffy crushed ice, ensure the ice cubes are weighed before use and kept in the freezer during preparation, until used  in step 3.
Homemade ice cubes work best in this recipe.

title: Steamed Pork Belly in Lotus Leaf
ingredients: 400 g pork belly, with skin, cut in thin slices (0.3 cm)
1 tsp Chinese rose essence wine (mei gu lu)
1 tbsp ginger juice (see tips)  o ¼ tsp baking soda
1 dried lotus leaf, soaked in hot water to soften (see tips)
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork belly, light soy sauce and oyster sauce. Add dark soy sauce, white pepper powder, sugar, salt, sesame oil, rose essence wine, cornflour, five-spice powder and ginger juice and mix. Set aside and marinate for 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Place reserved marinated pork belly onto lotus leaf. Distribute ginger and lychee evenly over the pork belly. Wrap it up and ensure the pork belly is wrapped securely.

Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position, insert the lotus leaf wrapped pork belly (see tips), close Varoma lid and steam 50 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma. Carefully open Varoma lid, unwrap lotus leaf and transfer steamed pork belly together with lotus leaf to a plate. Serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, place pork belly and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch before cooking 30 min/45°C/ /speed . This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.
Partially freeze pork belly before cutting for perfect thin slices.
If you can’t find fresh lychee, use canned lychee, adjust the sugar amount to taste.
Ginger juice preparation: place 30 g ginger in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 7. Transfer to muslin cloth to extract ginger juice. Set aside.
Ensure the size of lotus leaf wrap is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
You can wrap the lotus leaf parcel with a layer of aluminium to prevent leakage.

title: He Tao Zhi Ma Hu (Sweet Walnut Sesame Soup)
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place prepared tray onto mixing bowl lid and weigh walnuts and sesame seeds onto it, then bake for 15 minutes (150°C). Set aside to cool.
Place reserved walnuts in mixing bowl, mill 10 sec/speed 7.
Add reserved sesame seeds, glutinous rice flour, sugar and water. Cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1, then blend 3 min/speed 10. Serve as desired.
tips: Black sesame seeds are rich in magnesium, calcium and zinc. They are also high in fibre, vitamin B and iron - all of which can help fight the signs of aging. Black sesame seeds can be found at most Asian food stores and some gourmet food stores.
To make glutinous rice flour, place 50 g glutinous rice into mixing bowl, mill 1 min/speed 10.

title: Miso Ramen
ingredients: 1 tbsp awasemiso (mixed miso), or any dark miso, adjust to taste
50 g sweet corn on the cob
1 tsp toasted sesame seeds, to garnish
3 - 4 cashew nuts, lightly toasted, to garnish
steps: Place 1500 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, bring to a boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add ramen noodles to simmering basket, without measuring cup, cook time indicated on packet/100°C/speed 1 or until al dente. Remove simmering basket using spatula, allow noodles to drain and transfer to a serving bowl. Empty mixing bowl.

Place 300 g water, miso, soy sauce, 3-booster powder, seaweed sprouts, carrot and sweet corn cobs in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/98°C/speed 0.5. Transfer to serving bowl with ramen. Garnish with sesame seeds and cashew nuts. Serve hot.
tips: You can make your own 3-booster powder by mixing nutritional yeast, wheatgerm and lecithin in the weight ratio of 1:2:2. Store remaining 3-booster powder in an airtight container.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Lemon Rice
ingredients: 1 tsp chana dhal, soaked for 20 minutes, drained
20 g roasted peanuts, with skin, plus extra for garnishing
20 g roasted cashew nuts, without skin, plus extra for garnishing
60 g lime juice  o lemon juice
steps: Place gingelly oil, mustard seeds, urad dhall, chana dhal, curry leaves, ground turmeric, asafoetida, salt, roasted peanuts and roasted cashew nuts in mixing bowl, sauté 6 min/120°C//speed .
Insert butterfly whisk in mixing bowl, add cooked rice and lime juice, mix without measuring cup, 2 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk, transfer to a serving dish. Serve immediately.
tips: To prepare 450 g cooked rice, you may use approximately 250 g rice. Make sure the rice has cooled down before use in step 2.
Use lime juice for more authentic taste.
Recipe contributed by Kumudhini Selva Kumaran.

title: Hokkaido Cupcakes
ingredients: 50 g fresh mixed berries, to garnish
steps: Preheat oven to 165°C. Place egg yolks and 20 g caster sugar in mixing bowl, mix 3 min/speed 3.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 1 min/speed 3.5.
Add vegetable oil, milk and flour, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites, 40 g caster sugar and cream of tartar in mixing bowl, whisk 3 min/40°C/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Fold egg whites into reserved egg yolk mixture in 3 batches, mix well with spatula. Pour cake batter into 5 cupcake cases until ¾ full. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Bake on middle rack for 20-25 minutes (165°C). Let cool on cooling rack.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream, 10 g caster sugar and instant custard powder in mixing bowl, whisk 1 min/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a piping bag with nozzle (Ø 3 cm).
Insert nozzle of piping bag into centre of cupcakes and fill with custard cream. Garnish with icing sugar and mixed berries before serving.
tips: Always preheat your oven before baking. The baking time and temperature illustrated here are general guidelines. Make necessary adjustments on the time and temperature to suit your oven.
Recipe contributed by Tan Ping Ping.

title: Ginseng Wolfberry Bird's Nest
ingredients: 20 g bird's nest (approx. 4), soaked and cleaned
6 - 8 American ginseng root, cut in slices
steps: Place water and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add bird’s nests, ginseng root slices, wolfberries and lump sugar, cook 60 min/80°C//speed . Check if bird's nest is softened, prolong cooking time if necessary. Transfer to soup bowls and serve hot.

title: Moonlight Over the Lotus Pond (Stir Fried Vegetable Mix with Prawns)
ingredients: 50 g fresh Chinese yam, cut in thin slices
20 g red capsicum, cut in slices
20 g lotus roots, cut in slices
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid. Weigh in prawns and cornflour. Add salt and white pepper powder to the bowl and mix. Set aside to marinate for 20 minutes.
Place cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 2 min/Varoma/speed .
Add reserved prawns, stir fry 1 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place yam, red capsicum, lotus root slices and snow peas in mixing bowl, stir fry 3 min/Varoma//speed .
Add reserved prawns, black fungus and ginkgo, stir fry 1 min/Varoma//speed .
Add salt and sugar, stir fry 30 sec/Varoma/speed . Transfer to a serving plate and serve hot.

title: Ang Chow Chicken (Red Fermented Rice Wine Chicken)
ingredients: 1200 g chicken thigh fillets (approx. 4 pieces), with skin, cut in pieces (4 cm)
20 g old ginger, cut in slices
100 g red glutinous rice wine dregs (ang chow)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken. Add 1 tsp salt, 1 tbsp sesame oil and 2 tbsp red glutinous rice wine. Mix and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to marinate.
Place 1 tbsp sesame oil and old ginger in mixing bowl, sauté 4 min/120°C//speed .

Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, ½ tsp salt, red glutinous rice wine dregs, light soy sauce and molasses sugar, cook 14 min/Varoma//speed . Drizzle with 2 tbsp red glutinous rice wine. Transfer to a serving dish. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Kek Tapak Kuda (Horseshoe Cake)
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a baking tin with baking paper.
