Insert butterfly whisk, place eggs, egg yolks, caster sugar and cake stabilizer in mixing bowl, mix 4 min/speed 2- 4, increasing speed gradually until fluffy.
Add flour, milk powder, baking powder and vanilla extract, mix 4 min/speed 4.
Without measuring cup, mix again 20 sec/speed 1, meanwhile slowly pour melted butter through hole in mixing bowl lid. Remove butterfly whisk. Further mix with spatula if necessary.
In a small bowl, mix 3 tablespoons of reserved batter with cocoa powder well and transfer to a piping bag.
Transfer remaining reserved batter to baking tin. Pipe reserved cocoa batter onto batter surface in baking tin. Swirl the batter in a zig-zag motion by using a toothpick to form a marble pattern.

Bake on middle rack for 20-25 minutes (170°C). Let cool for 5 minutes. Remove cake form baking tin and cut cake in half. Place cake on top of cling wrap. Spread hazelnut and chocolate cream on the plain surface of the cake and fold it to form a horseshoe shape. Repeat step with another half of the cake. Fully wrap the cake with cling wrap and let cool in refrigerator for at least 3 hours. Cut in slices and serve.
tips: Recipe contributed by Zeti Khalid.

title: Pink Barley Tabbouleh with Pistachios
ingredients: 60 g pistachio nuts, roasted, shelled, unsalted
200 g cooked beetroot, cut in pieces
steps: Place pistachio nuts in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place parsley, mint and basil in mixing bowl then chop 4 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, onions, tahini, lemon juice, miso paste, salt and pepper then mix 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a serving bowl and set aside.
Place beetroot in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4.

Insert simmering basket and weigh barley into it. Add water and cook 30 min/100°C//speed 3. Meanwhile, cut tomatoes and cucumber in cubes and add to serving bowl. Remove simmering basket using spatula and transfer barley to serving bowl. Drain contents of mixing bowl through simmering basket and add to serving bowl then mix well. Serve immediately, sprinkled with pistachio nuts.

title: Raspberry and orange buttermilk ice cream
ingredients: 100 g orange juice, frozen in ice cube trays
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen orange juice cubes, raspberries and buttermilk and crush 10 sec/speed 6. Mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula until creamy. Serve immediately.

title: Cannelloni with artichoke filling and tomato sauce
ingredients: 140 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
200 g smoked cheese (e.g. smoked scamorza, smoked Edam cheese), cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
20 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
300 g fresh artichoke hearts  o 300 g canned artichoke hearts, drained
40 g celery stalk, cut in pieces
400 g canned tomatoes  o 400 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese and smoked cheese in mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic clove and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add artichokes and white wine and cook without measuring cup 15 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile grease Varoma dish and tray.
Insert measuring cup and mix 40 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add ricotta cheese, 300 g reserved grated cheese, eggs, salt and black pepper and mix 40 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a disposable icing bag or freezer bag and allow to cool for a few minutes.

Cut a hole in the piping bag to the same diameter as the dried cannelloni tubes and fill them with stuffing mixture. Arrange filled cannelloni in greased Varoma dish and tray, leaving a little space between them and lightly brush the cannelloni with extra virgin olive oil to avoid sticking. Clean mixing bowl.
Place celery stalk, onion, carrot, garlic clove, tomatoes, water, sugar, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 5.
Set Varoma in position and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve cannelloni hot, covered in sauce and sprinkled with remaining grated cheese.
tips: Have you ever imagined steaming cannelloni in your Varoma? The steam tenderises the pasta beautifully. Serve this tasty dish to both vegetarians and meat-lovers (who may not notice the lack of meat), then feel free to use this recipe as a starting point to create your own special version – see our variations to help you get started.
Frozen artichoke hearts can be used instead of fresh or canned.

Mushroom cannelloni: replace artichokes with 400 g sliced fresh mushrooms. In step 3 add mushrooms and white wine and cook without measuring cup 15 min/100°C/speed 1. Drain mushroom mixture through simmering basket, return drained mixture to mixing bowl and continue recipe from step 4.
For meat-lovers, add 100 g pancetta or bacon cubes in step 4.

title: Steamed aubergine and ricotta lasagne
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
300 g aubergines, cut in small cubes (approx. 1 cm)
30 g celery stalk, cut in pieces
steps: Choose a rectangular dish (approx. 23 cm x 15 cm x 7 cm) that fits in Varoma dish (see tip) and set aside. Place Parmesan cheese, parsley and pepper in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer 2 tsp to a small bowl and the remainder to another small bowl, and set both aside.

Place 500 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl and bring to a boil 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Pour boiling water into the rectangular dish and add one pasta sheet at a time to soak. Stir gently to keep pasta sheets separate in the first few minutes of soaking. Meanwhile cut aubergines in cubes (1 cm) and set aside.
Place garlic clove, onions, carrots, celery and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6, then sauté without measuring cup 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add aubergines, 1 tsp salt and crushed tomatoes and cook 15 min/Varoma//speed 1.

Drain pasta sheets by pouring onto Varoma tray and letting the water drain away. Cover base of the rectangular dish with a thin layer of aubergine ragout. Place a layer of pasta sheets over the sauce, cover with another thin layer of ragout, sprinkle with one third of the larger amount of reserved Parmesan-parsley mixture and distribute 4-5 heaped tsp ricotta on top without spreading it. Repeat to make 4 pasta layers, finishing with a layer of ragout. Cover lasagne dish with damp baking paper and place in Varoma dish.

Place 600 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, remove baking paper, sprinkle lasagne with remaining Parmesan-parsley mixture, cut in squares and serve hot.
tips: Steamed lasagne? Really? Really! Our testers were amazed at the delicate texture of the pasta, combined with the rich aubergine sauce and fresh ricotta. The Parmesan topping, green from being grated with fragrant parsley, is an eye-catching alternative to the usual grilled cheese topping.

Use any kind of rectangular or oval container (ceramic, heat-resistant plastic etc.) that fits in the Varoma dish while leaving some holes unobstructed for steam to circulate. You can also fold a disposable aluminimum tin if it is too large. Or use the Varoma tray (see variations).
Mix 1 tsp grated lemon zest into the ricotta before using it in step 5.
Artichoke lasagne: replace aubergines with sliced artichoke hearts (fresh or defrosted).
Courgette lasagne: replace aubergines with sliced courgettes.

If you cannot find a suitable container, the lasagne can be steamed in the Varoma tray: line the Varoma tray with a large sheet of baking paper (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm), with the excess hanging over the edges. Assemble the lasagne as directed by the recipe, then fold the overhanging baking paper over the lasagne. Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish and proceed as directed by the recipe in step 6. To serve, cut lasagne and plate each portion individually.

title: Paneer tikka pizza
ingredients: 2 tsp dried instant yeast  o 20 g fresh yeast, crumbled
20 g oil, plus extra for brushing
250 g paneer cheese, cut in cubes (1-2 cm)
200 g peppers, cut in pieces (1-2 cm)
200 g onions, cut in pieces (1-2 cm)
370 g tomatoes, deseeded, cut in pieces
steps: Place 50 g water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl with oil.

Add 170 g water, flour, oil and salt then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl, cover with reusable food wrap and set aside to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Clean mixing bowl. Continue with recipe.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in paneer, peppers and onions. Set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add yoghurt, coriander, chilli powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice and salt then mix 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with vegetables and paneer, mix well with spatula and allow to marinate for 45 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, basil and oregano in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add tomatoes and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil, sugar, salt and pepper then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Towards end of rising time, preheat oven to 230°C and line 4 baking trays with baking paper.

Divide dough into 4 balls then, on a floured work surface, roll out 4 circles (approx. Ø 22 cm). Cover each circle with reusable food wrap while rolling out remaining circles to prevent dough from drying out. Transfer pizza bases to prepared baking trays and top each evenly with tomato sauce, paneer topping and mozzarella. Bake each for 11-15 minutes (230°C) until edges are golden (see tip). Sprinkle with chilli flakes and serve hot, cut in slices.
tips: Instead of making 4 individual pizzas, make 1-2 larger ones. Adjust baking time accordingly.

title: Potato fritter burgers with spinach
ingredients: 500 g waxy potatoes, peeled, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
450 g frozen spinach leaves, defrosted, drained well (approx. 350 g after draining)
steps: Place potatoes, onions, eggs, oat flakes, 1 tsp salt and nutmeg in mixing bowl then chop 12 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place remaining 100 g onions, garlic clove, spinach, ½ tsp salt and pepper in mixing bowl then chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add oil and cook 8 min/120°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, heat clarified butter in a non-stick frying pan on medium heat. Add 1 tbsp potato mixture, flatten into a patty (approx. Ø 7 cm) and fry on both sides until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining potato mixture (recipe yields approx. 20 pieces).
Scoop 1 heaped tbsp. spinach mixture onto a potato fritter and cover with a second potato fritter (see tip). Repeat with remaining potato fritters and spinach until finished. Serve hot.
tips: Garnish potato fritter burgers to your liking, e.g. with sliced cheese, ham or a sunny side up fried egg.

title: Lemon grass beef salad
ingredients: 300 g lettuce, cut in strips (1-2 cm)
20 g fresh coriander, cut in pieces (2 cm)
60 g roasted peanuts, salted or unsalted
350 g beef fillet steak, cut in strips (6 cm x 1 cm)
30 g fresh lemon grass, sliced diagonally (approx. 1-2 mm)
1 tsp hot chilli oil (opcional)  o 1 tsp sriracha sauce (opcional)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in lettuce, mint leaves and fresh coriander. Divide between 4 serving bowls and set aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in water and corn starch. Stir well and set aside.
Place peanuts in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions and oil in mixing bowl, then start High Temp. .
Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add beef, then start High Temp. .

Add lemon grass, reserved cornflour mixture, fish sauce, honey, sesame oil, ground pepper and hot chilli oil. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl and around mixing knife with spatula, then cook 3 min/100°C//speed .
Divide beef between prepared salad bowls. Sprinkle with reserved chopped peanuts, top with chilli slices and add lime wedges. Serve immediately with baguette slices.

title: Vanilla ice cream sandwiches
ingredients: 100 g dark chocolate, in pieces  o 100 g white chocolate, in pieces
nuts (e.g. pistachio, peanuts, almonds), chopped and toasted (see tip)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolks, milk, vanilla and salt then start Thicken /80°C.

Add cream and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Meanwhile, prepare sandwich biscuits. Clean mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.

Place flour, butter, eggs, sugar, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer to a work surface, shape into a ball, wrap in cling film and refrigerate for approx. 15 minutes. Using a rolling pin, roll out into a disc (approx. 5 mm thick). Using a cookie cutter (Ø 7-8 cm), cut out 24 discs and place on prepared baking trays (see tip). Bake for 10-12 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a container.

Place remaining ice cream pieces and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and smooth surface with spatula. Freeze for approx. 2 hours. Meanwhile, prepare chocolate coating. Clean mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add coconut oil and warm 2 min/50°C/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place a sheet of baking paper on a chopping board. Place a cookie cutter (Ø 1 cm smaller than cutter used for cutting biscuits) onto 1 sandwich biscuit and add 1-2 tbsp ice cream inside cookie cutter. Carefully remove cookie cutter and cover with second biscuit. Dip half sandwich in chocolate coating and sprinkle with chopped nuts (see tip). Place on prepared chopping board and freeze until desired consistency is achieved or serve immediately.
tips: Cut left over dough in pieces and bake for 10-12 minutes (180°C). Allow to cool and crush, then use biscuit crumbs to coat sandwiches.
Use your preferred type of sprinkles or freeze-dried fruit (e.g. strawberries, raspberries).
Store left over ice cream in freezer for up to 2-3 days.
Replace sandwich biscuits with thin wafer sheets or waffles.
Fill sandwich biscuits with any other ice cream of your choice.

title: Prawn croquettes (croquetas de gambas)
ingredients: 200 g raw prawns, peeled, cut in pieces (1 cm)
steps: Place oil in mixing bowl and heat 5 min/120°C/speed .
Add prawns and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed . Transfer prawns to a bowl and set aside, leaving oil in mixing bowl.
Add butter and melt 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add flour around blades of mixing knife and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add cornstarch, milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg and mix 10 sec/speed 7, then cook 25 min/100°C/speed 4.
Add reserved prawns and mix well using spatula, then cook 3 min/100°C/speed 2.
Pour béchamel sauce into a disposable piping bag and leave to cool (approx. 30 minutes). Keep in refrigerator for at least 8 hours.

Place breadcrumbs in a deep dish. Cut off tip of piping bag so that opening is approx. 2-3 cm in diameter. Pipe filling onto breadcrumbs and, using a pair of scissors, cut portions of approx. 4-5 cm long. Roll croquettes in breadcrumbs, dip in beaten egg and then roll in breadcrumbs again. Repeat process until all croquette mixture has been used to form approx. 70 croquettes.
Heat oil in a small pan over high heat. Fry croquettes in batches until golden, drain on kitchen paper and serve hot.
tips: If you don't have a disposable piping bag, pour the béchamel sauce into a moistened baking dish (to prevent it from sticking) and leave to cool. Then shape the croquettes using 2 spoons and dip them in the beaten egg and breadcrumbs.
Croquettes can be frozen at the end of step 8. Allow croquettes to thaw for 2-3 hours before frying as per recipe.

title: Hedgehog chocolate buns
ingredients: 100 g milk chocolate, cut in pieces
16 g raisins  o 16 g pine nuts
8 almonds, crushed  o 8 pecan nuts, crushed
1 egg yolk, whisked with 1 tbsp water, for brushing
steps: Lightly grease two large bowls with butter and set aside. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.
Place milk, butter, fresh yeast and sugar in mixing bowl then warm 3 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add bread flour and salt then knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough to one of the prepared bowls, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place milk, butter, fresh yeast and sugar in mixing bowl then warm 3 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add bread flour, cocoa powder and salt then knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough to second bowl, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Divide white dough into 4 equal pieces. Repeat with chocolate dough. Cover with a damp tea towel.

On a lightly floured surface, flatten 1 piece of dough and place 3 pieces of chocolate on it. Fold dough towards the centre to close and pinch the seam. Roll into a ball then roll it into a slightly oval shape. Hold dough with one hand and use thumb and index finger of the other hand to pull one side of the ball to shape the mouth of the hedgehog. Using kitchen scissors carefully snip into the dough to make the spikes on top of each hedgehog.

Press in 2 raisins to make eyes and 1 almond piece to make the snout of each hedgehog. Repeat with remaining dough. Place hedgehog buns on prepared baking trays spacing approx. 5 cm apart as they expand during baking.

Cover buns with cling film or a damp tea towel and let rise for approx. 30 minutes. Towards the end of rising time, preheat oven to 180°C. Brush buns with whisked egg yolk using a pastry brush and bake for 15 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool before serving.
tips: Combine a smaller piece of white dough and a smaller piece of chocolate dough to make bicoloured buns at the beginning of step 7.

title: Gluten-free mini pizzas
ingredients: 700 g gluten-free flour (see tip), plus extra for dusting
1 tsp citric acid  o 30 g lemon juice
5 - 6 black olives, pitted, cut in slices
1 carrot, cut in slices or triangles
100 g small mozzarella balls, cut in half
steps: Place 400 g water, fresh yeast and sugar in mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add gluten-free flour, oil and salt and knead Dough /3 min. Meanwhile, line Varoma dish with baking paper. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish and set aside.
Place remaining 250 g water and citric acid in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /1 h/40°C.
Transfer dough to a floured work surface and divide into 10 equal portions. Stretch out each piece into a circle (approx. Ø 15 cm).
Preheat oven to 200°C. Meanwhile, line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.

Spread tomato sauce over each pizza base. Decorate with vegetables to create faces or animals. Use courgette and olives to make eyes, red peppers to make the mouth, corn to make teeth, carrots to make the nose and mozzarella to make cheeks. Transfer mini pizzas to prepared baking trays. Bake for 10-15 minutes (200°C). Allow to cool for 3-5 minutes before serving.
tips: Gluten-free flour behaves differently from normal flour. Depending on the brand, the dough may become too wet. After kneading step 2, check the texture of the dough and add 50-80 g flour if necessary and knead a further 1 min/.

title: Dalgona coffee with Irish cream
steps: Place water in mixing bowl and bring to the boil 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add instant coffee and sugar then whisk 4 min 30 sec/65°C/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk.

Divide ice cubes between 2 glasses. Divide milk between glasses and add 1-2 tbsp Irish cream liqueur to each. Top with 1-2 tbsp whipped coffee. Sprinkle with 1-2 pinches of ground cinnamon and serve immediately.

title: Marble sponge slice with peach crème
ingredients: 100 g starch, e.g. corn starch or potato starch
470 g peach halves, canned (weight after draining)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs, sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and whisk until creamy 1 min/speed 4.
Add flour, starch and baking powder and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Spread half of mixture onto prepared baking tray.

Add cocoa powder to mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Spread cocoa mixture on top of the light mixture and marble with a spoon handle. Bake 15-18 minutes (180°C). Meanwhile, sprinkle 2-3 tbsp sugar on a tea towel.

Immediately after baking, turn sponge cake out onto the kitchen towel sprinkled with sugar. Coat the baking paper with cold water, remove and allow sponge cake to cool. Meanwhile, prepare the filling.
Soak gelatine in some water according to packet instructions. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream in mixing bowl, beat until stiff speed 3 and set aside. Remove butterfly whisk.
Cut 2 peach halves into thin wedges and set aside. Place remaining peaches into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Then heat 3 min/70°C/speed 1.
Squeeze out gelatine, add and dissolve 1 min/speed 2.
Add quark, sugar and vanilla sugar and mix 10 sec/speed 2.5.
Add whipped cream and stir 5 sec/speed 2.5. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool in refrigerator until mixture is firmer and spreadable. This takes approx. 90 minutes.

Set 5 tbsp crème filling aside. Divide sponge cake into 2 equally-sized squares. Spread remaining peach cream on one half, ensuring that edges are covered with enough cream. Lay other half on top, mark 10 slices and add a dab of cream in the centre of each. Decorate with reserved peach wedges and chill for approx. 2 hours. Cut 10 slices and serve.
tips: Other tinned fruit such as apricots or pears can be used instead of peaches.
Other tinned fruit such as apricots or pears can be used instead of peaches.

title: Angolan chicken peanut stew with maize meal porridge (Muamba de ginguba com galinha e funge)
ingredients: 500 g roasted peanuts, unsalted, without skin
1200 g chicken meat, skinless and boneless, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place peanuts in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in okra and add juice of 2 lemons. Stir well with spatula to remove froth and allow to rest for approx. 15 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with the recipe.
Place tomatoes, onions, garlic cloves and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add water and 150 g reserved peanuts and blend 15 sec/speed 7.
Add chicken, salt and piri piri chilli and cook 25 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, rinse okra with water and dry thoroughly with a tea towel. Remove ends and cut in pieces.
Add okra and cook 10 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and keep warm. Clean mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and in weigh maize meal and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl and heat 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add reserved maize meal and cook 14 min/100°C/speed 5. Serve chicken stew with maize porridge.
tips: Okra are a natural thickener for stews and sauces. Slice them thinly to achieve more thickness.

title: Squid à la provençale
ingredients: 200 g red peppers, cut in pieces
30 g olive oil, plus extra for frying
1 lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
400 g courgettes, cut in cubes (approx. 1 cm)
100 g yellow pepper, cut in strips (approx. 3 cm long)
200 g fennel bulb, cut in strips (approx. 3 cm long)
steps: Place garlic clove, onions and red peppers in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add olive oil and sauté without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile heat a frying pan with olive oil and fry the squid rings briefly over high heat. Season with 2 pinches salt, Espelette pepper, lemon zest and juice and basil. Lay 1 sheet of folded baking paper in the Varoma dish, in order to make a pouch. Spoon the contents of the frying pan into prepared Varoma dish, close the pouch and set Varoma dish aside.
Add tomatoes, 3 pinches salt and white pepper to mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 5.

Insert the simmering basket and add the courgette in it. Set Varoma dish in position, add the yellow pepper and the fennel around the pouch, close Varoma and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and simmering basket with the aid of spatula and keep hot.

Add olives to mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and heat 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Serve the vegetable mixture with sauce and accompanied by the squid rings.
tips: This is typically Provencal, healthy and colourful with lots of vegetables
Fresh or frozen squid can be used in this recipe, cut the rings into even size for even cooking

title: Champagne crème brûlée
ingredients: 100 g Champagne  o 100 g sparkling wine
steps: Preheat oven to 100°C.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Place cream, Champagne and egg yolks in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to 6 ramekins and bake for 1 hour (100°C).
Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 20 minutes at room temperature. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until ready to serve.
To serve, sprinkle crèam with brown sugar and caramelise them using a kitchen blowtorch. Serve immediately.
tips: Allow the crème brûlée to completely cool before finishing with the caramelised brown sugar.
Substitute any kind of white wine for the champagne.

title: Almond briouats with honey and sesame seeds
ingredients: 250 g filo pastry, cut in strips (36 cm x 6 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Spread 125 g blanched almonds in a single layer on the prepared baking tray and toast for 5-10 minutes (200°C) or until lightly browned. Allow to cool.
Place reserved toasted almonds, remaining 125 g blanched almonds and sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 7.

Add ground cinnamon, salt, butter and orange flower water and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and shape the almond paste into cherry-sized balls (approx. 40) and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Brush the bottom ⅔ of a strip of filo pastry with melted butter. Place one almond paste ball near the bottom. Wrap up the bottom of the dough to enclose the filling, and shape the triangle by folding the filling, up to the right and then left, until reach the end of the dough. Trim the excess dough to make a neat flap, dab a little egg yolk on the flap to help seal and tuck it into the fold. Repeat for the remaining almond paste balls.

Place a large frying pan (Ø 26 cm) over high heat and fill with 3-4 cm of vegetable oil. Fry briouats in batches (approx. 1-2 minutes), turning occasionally, until golden all over. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.

Place honey and orange flower water in mixing bowl and heat 4 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile place Varoma tray on Varoma lid and set aside. Transfer hot honey to a bowl. Using two forks dip each briouat in the hot honey and place them in the Varoma tray to drain. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and allow to cool before serving.
tips: The briouats can be kept in a tightly sealed container at room temperature for two weeks, or in the freezer for 2 months. If storing in the freezer, place a sheet of cling film between layers to make it easy to remove only as many briouats as you need.

Filo pastry dries out very quickly, so handle it carefully. Unroll the sheets of filo pastry, and cover the pile with a piece of cling film. Remove one at a time, replacing the cling film after each one.
Instead to dipping the briouats in hot honey you can serve the briouats dusted with icing sugar.

title: Sfenj - Moroccan doughnuts
ingredients: 20 g fresh yeast  o 1 heaped tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)
steps: Place water and yeast in mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 1.5.
Add plain flour and salt and knead Dough /3 min until smooth. Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with tea towel and allow to rest at room temperature for approx. 2 hours or until double in size.

After resting time fill olive oil in a wide and deep pot (approx. 2 cm high), then heat on the stove with medium heat. Fill a bowl with water, dip hands in it, then pull off a piece of dough about the size of a small plum. Use the fingers to make a hole in the ball of dough, stretch the hole wide to make a ring, and carefully place dough ring into the hot oil using a wooden spoon.

Fry the sfenj until golden brown, turning once or twice. Remove the fried sfenj with a skimmer and transfer it to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat the shaping and frying until dough is used. Sprinkle fried sfenj with icing sugar and serve warm.

title: Three course meal for two in 30 minutes
ingredients: 50 g bread roll  o 50 g white bread
5 sprigs fresh coriander  o 5 sprigs fresh parsley
250 g carrots, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
250 g courgettes, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g leek, only the white part, cut into slices
500 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut into strips (10 cm x 1 cm)  o 500 g turkey breast fillets, skinless, cut into strips (10 cm x 1 cm)
1 apple, cut into eighths  o 1 pear, cut into eighths
steps: Place bread roll, garlic clove and coriander into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 100 g carrots, 100 g courgettes and 50 g leek into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4. Transfer into Varoma dish.
Place chicken into Varoma dish on top of vegetables and season with 1 tsp salt, black pepper and thyme. Set aside.
Place apple, sugar, cinnamon and lemon zest on a sheet of baking paper, close parcel well and place onto Varoma tray. Set aside.
Place onions, garlic cloves and extra virgin olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add bay leaf and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .

Remove bay leaf, add remaining 150 g carrots, remaining 150 g courgettes, remaining 50 g leek, water and 1 tsp salt. Insert simmering basket, weigh rice into it and mix well with spatula to wet all rice grains. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish, place Varoma into position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside. Keep rice warm until ready to serve.
Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 5-9, increasing speed gradually. Transfer vegetable soup into a bowl and keep warm.
Preheat oven to 180°C.

Place milk, flour, butter, salt, black pepper and nutmeg into mixing bowl and cook 5 min/90°C/speed 4. Place chicken with reserved vegetables into a casserole dish, cover with béchamel sauce and sprinkle with reserved flavoured breadcrumbs. Bake for approx. 20 minutes (180°C) or until brown. Serve vegetable soup as a starter, followed by baked chicken and vegetables casserole with rice and finish with steamed apple for dessert.
tips: Steamed apple can be served with vanilla or any other flavour of ice cream.
Courgettes, carrots and leek can be replaced with the same weight of other vegetables, such as broccoli.
Replace chicken breasts with white fish fillets.

title: Paella with kidney beans
ingredients: 1 pinch fine salt, plus extra to taste
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
100 g fresh green peas  o 100 g frozen green peas, defrosted
120 g fresh green beans, cut into pieces
100 g canned kidney beans, rinsed under cold water
60 g Kalamata olives, pitted  o 60 g black olives, pitted
1 tbsp fresh parsley leaves, finely chopped
steps: Place onions and garlic cloves into mixing bowl and chop 7 sec//speed 5.
Add olive oil and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed  without measuring cup
Add water, saffron, salt, pepper, tomatoes, carrots, green peas, green beans, green and yellow courgettes and herbes de Provence and cook 13 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add brown rice and continue to cook 8 min/100°C/speed .
Add kidney beans and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with Kalamata olives, provençale olives, fresh parsley and serve immediately.
tips: If you can't find yellow courgettes, increase the amount of green courgettes.
Vary the amount and type of olives to taste.

title: Turkey rolls with gorgonzola
ingredients: 200 g fresh baby spinach, washed and dried
250 g Gorgonzola or other type of blue cheese (e.g. Roquefort, Stilton), cut into pieces
steps: Place turkey escalopes between two sheets of heat-resistant cling film or baking paper and flatten with a meat mallet to a height of ½ cm.
Place shallot into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add spinach and cook 6 min/100°C/speed 1. Strain spinach well through simmering basket.

Remove cling film or baking paper from turkey escalopes and top with strained spinach. Distribute 100 g Gorgonzola evenly on escalopes. Use heat-resistant cling film or baking paper to roll escalopes up tightly and close rolls to form parcels.
Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position, arrange turkey rolls into Varoma dish and Varoma tray and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and empty mixing bowl.
Place remaining Gorgonzola, milk, flour, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and cook 10 min/90°C/speed 4.
Remove cling film or baking paper and arrange rolls on individual plates, drizzle with Gorgonzola sauce and serve immediately.

title: Full menu: lentils, pork tenderloin and salad
ingredients: 300 g dried lentils, (weighed before soaking)  o 2 cans lentils cooked, (800 g), washed and drained
100 g peppers, (red or green), cut into pieces
60 g extra virgin olive oil, (plus a little extra to season)
2 tsp beef extract  o 1 tsp soy sauce
1 tsp mixed dried herbs, (oregano, thyme, rosemary, etc.)
100 g Serrano ham, cut in cubes  o 100 g bacon cubes
steps: Put lentils into plenty of water to soak at least two hours beforehand. Wash and drain them using simmering basket.

Place onion, pepper, garlic, carrots and 50 g of olive oil into the mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 4. Sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, wash the vegetable mixture into Varoma tray under the tap to remove any ice and separate the vegetables. Place eggs into Varoma dish. Season tenderloin steaks with beef extract, pepper, ½ tsp of paprika, herbs, liquid caramel, 10 g of olive oil and lemon juice and wrap well in cling film. Place steaks into Varoma with eggs in the centre. Insert Varoma tray, cover and set aside.
Add 1 tsp of paprika, chorizo, ham, lentils, bay leaf, 1 tsp of salt and water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma in position and steam 30 min/Varoma//speed .

Remove Varoma and pour the lentils into a soup tureen. Place salad in a serving dish. Unwrap, cool, shell and slice the hard-boiled eggs. Season the salad with salt and olive oil and garnish with slices of the hard-boiled egg. Unwrap tenderloin steaks and cut into slices. Serve the lentils as a starter and the salad with the sliced steaks as the main course.
tips: The tenderloin steaks can be wrapped in tin foil instead of cling film, or put in a roasting bag.
For 2 people – use half the ingredients.*Time: the times are the same, except for step 2 (reduce the sauté time to 5 minutes).

title: Vegetable-topped bread
ingredients: 50 g extra virgin olive oil, plus a little extra for greasing the baking tray
100 g red pepper, cut into pieces
100 g green pepper, cut into pieces
100 g courgette, unpeeled and cut into pieces
steps: Pre-heat oven to 200°C and grease a baking tray.
Place extra virgin olive oil, water and lard into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add yeast, flour, salt and sugar and mix 30 sec/speed 6.
Transfer dough to the greased baking tray and roll very thinly using a rolling pin or hands.

Place red and green pepper, onion, courgette, extra virgin olive oil, salt and paprika into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4. Cover the dough with the vegetables and bake for approximately 20 minutes (200°C). Serve hot or cold.
tips: Vegetarian version: replace lard with olive oil when making the dough.
Vegetarian version: replace lard with olive oil when making the dough.

title: Chicken with egg and almond sauce
ingredients: 1200 g chicken thighs, skin on, with bones
steps: Place almonds into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place hard-boiled eggs into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place olive oil, onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add chicken and sauté 8 min/120°C//speed .

Add white wine, water, saffron, salt, bay leaves, pepper, almonds set aside and cook 22 min/Varoma//speed . Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to help evaporation and avoid spattering.
Pour chicken into a dish and serve, garnishing with the chopped eggs.
tips: This recipe tastes better the day after.

title: Olive oil, garlic and almond soup
ingredients: 100 g breadcrumbs, white (from the day before)
steps: Place almonds, garlic, salt, breadcrumbs, olive oil, vinegar and water into mixing bowl and grind 2 min/speed 5-10 increasing speed gradually. Transfer into a soup tureen and refrigerate until serving.
Serve very cold with peeled white grapes and/or flaked almonds.
tips: If you wish, just before serving, replace 300 g of water with the same weight in ice cubes added at the end and mix at speed 1 until they melt.
If you wish, just before serving, replace 300 g of water with the same weight in ice cubes added at the end and mix at speed 1 until they melt.

title: Ham croquettes with fast béchamel sauce
ingredients: 50 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for frying
steps: Place Serrano ham into mixing bowl and chop Turbo/0.5 sec/5 times. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place eggs into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4. Transfer into another bowl and set aside separately.
Place extra virgin olive oil, butter and onion into mixing bowl. Chop 2 sec/speed 5 and then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add flour and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add milk, nutmeg, pepper and salt. Mix 10 sec/speed 6.
Add two spoonfuls of the ham set aside and heat 8 min/120°C/speed 4.
Allow to stand for 5 minutes. Add the rest of the ham and the chopped eggs and mix well with spatula.
Transfer béchamel sauce to a piping bag (placed into simmering basket) or in a previously moistened baking dish (to prevent sticking) and allow it to cool. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours.
Once cold, shape the croquettes and dip them in the whisked eggs and then in the breadcrumbs. Fry them in a small pan with plenty of hot oil. Remove the excess oil with a paper towel and serve hot.

title: Orange roll
ingredients: 400 g sugar, plus extra for sprinkling
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray (approx. 32 cm x 25 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place sugar and zest of 1 orange into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add orange juice, eggs, corn starch and butter and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer to baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C).
Remove the baking paper and sprinkle with plenty of sugar. Roll using the paper and allow to cool slightly before removing. Serve cold.

title: Fast meat bread
ingredients: 500 g flour, plus extra for sprinkling
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180°C. Grease a square cake tin (approx. 26 cm x 26 cm) with butter and sprinkle with flour.
Place chorizo, ham and bacon into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place eggs, oil, milk and salt into mixing bowl and blend 2 min/37°C/speed 3.
Add flour and baking powder and mix 1 min/.
Add meat and stir with spatula. Transfer to tin and bake for around 40 minutes (180°C). Serve straight from the oven.
tips: You can add leftover chicken or beef, cooked and shredded.
You can add leftover chicken or beef, cooked and shredded.

title: Ham mousse
ingredients: 250 g cooked ham, cut into slices or pieces
steps: Place ham into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ricotta, salt and pepper, blend 20 sec/speed 5. Serve as preferred with small squares of toasted bread.
tips: Use the same method to make half portions.
Use the same method to make half portions.
These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.
These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.
Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.

title: Indian-style chicken burger
ingredients: 250 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
400 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut into pieces (3 cm)
5 pinches freshly ground black pepper, to taste
200 g cucumber, thinly sliced (approx. ½ cucumber)
80 g red peppers, cut into thin strips
steps: Place water, yeast, milk, sugar, flour, curry powder and 1 egg into mixing bowl and knead 5 min/.

Add salt and butter and knead 2 min/. Transfer dough onto a previously floured work surface. Pull edges of dough towards the centre 3-4 times, roll it into a ball, place it in a large bowl, cover with a kitchen towel and allow to rise for 1-2 hours in a warm place until doubled in volume. Clean the mixing bowl.

At the end of first proving, transfer dough to floured work surface and knock it back firmly with your hands to let the gas escape. Divide dough into 8 pieces, shape into balls and lay them out on a baking tray lined with baking paper, making sure there is approximately 5 cm between each one. Cover with a kitchen towel and allow to rise again for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 210°C.

At the end of the second proving, break remaining egg into a bowl and beat it with a fork. Brush buns with egg using a pastry brush. Sprinkle buns with sesame and cumin seeds and bake for 20-25 minutes (210°C). Take buns out of oven and allow to cool.
Place cashew nuts into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add chicken breasts, egg, curry powder, 2 pinches of salt and 2 pinches of pepper and chop 30 sec/speed 6. With floured hands, divide mixture into 8 and shape into 8 chicken patties. Set aside.
Place garlic, 4 sprigs of coriander and mint into mixing bowl and blend 5 sec/speed 7.
Add yoghurt, cream cheese, remaining salt and pepper and blend 30 sec/speed 5.
Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan and fry chicken burgers for a few minutes on each side until golden. Meanwhile, cut the buns in half.

Spread yoghurt sauce on bottom half of bun, fill with a layer of cucumber, a chicken burger, then another layer of cucumber. Finally add peppers and remaining coriander. Put top half of bun on burgers and serve hot.

title: Pasta salad with vegetables
ingredients: 150 g courgettes, cut into slices (0,5 cm)
100 g spring onions, cut into pieces
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to garnish
300 g mixed peppers (e.g. red, yellow and green), cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
320 g pasta, type conchiglie or other short, dried pasta
steps: Arrange the courgettes in the Varoma tray.
Place onions into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and peppers and cook 12 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer into a salad bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and cook 14 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Add salt and pasta and cook time indicated on packet/100°C//speed 1. Strain the pasta and transfer to the salad bowl with the cooked vegetables. Add mozzarella balls and cherry tomatoes. Garnish with a dash of olive oil and with fresh basil leaves.
Serve warm or cold.

title: Pizza with red pepper sauce, spinach and eggs
ingredients: 30 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
2 tsp dried instant yeast  o 20 g fresh yeast, crumbled
240 g medium-hard cheese (e.g. Gouda, Cheddar etc.)
200 g red peppers, cut into pieces
20 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 tsp smoked paprika powder  o 1 tsp sweet paprika powder
plain flour for dusting and rolling
300 g frozen chopped spinach, defrosted and well-drained
steps: Grease a large bowl and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then heat 2 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add flour, oil and salt then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl and cover with cling film. Leave to rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Clean and dry mixing bowl then continue with recipe.
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 7 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions and red peppers in mixing bowl then chop 8 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Add passata, tomato purée, salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper and sugar, then place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on lid of mixing bowl and cook 4 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile preheat oven to 200°C and grease 2 large baking trays then set aside.

On a lightly floured surface, divide dough into two and roll each piece out into a rectangle then place one on each baking tray. Spread sauce on dough then sprinkle spinach followed by reserved chopped cheese over the top. Bake for 15 minutes (200°C).
Crack 2 eggs over each pizza then bake for a further 5 minutes (200°C). Serve hot, cut into slices.
tips: You can substitute spinach and eggs with almost anything you have in the fridge (e.g. ham, salami, mushrooms, mixed peppers, courgette, olives).

title: Vegetable and hazelnut cheese muffins
ingredients: 100 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
60 g medium-hard cheese (e.g. cheddar, gruyère etc.), cut into pieces (1,5 cm)
100 g carrots, cut into pieces (2.5 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease or line a 12 hole muffin pan with paper baking cups and set aside.
Place cheese into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8.
Add carrots and hazelnuts and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, milk and eggs and mix 8 sec/speed 3.
Add flour, baking powder, salt and cayenne pepper and mix 10 sec/speed 5.
Add peas and mix 10 sec//speed 3 with aid of spatula. Transfer to prepared muffin pan, fill baking cups to nearly full and bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C). Serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Vegetable cheese muffins with pancetta:Reduce salt to 1 tsp in step 5, then add 100 g pancetta or ham pieces with peas in step 6 and mix 10 seconds longer.
Vegetable cheese muffins with pancetta:Reduce salt to 1 tsp in step 5, then add 100 g pancetta or ham pieces with peas in step 6 and mix 10 seconds longer.

title: Quinoa biscuits
ingredients: 170 g gluten-free all-purpose flour mix (see tip)
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place butter and golden syrup into mixing bowl and heat 2 min/60°C/speed 1, or until butter has melted.
Add baking soda and mix 5 sec/speed 3.
Add grapeseed oil, vinegar, quinoa flakes, water, brown sugar, gluten free plain flour and desiccated coconut and knead 1 min/.
Spoon tablespoonfuls of mixture onto prepared baking tray, allowing room for biscuits to spread during baking.
Bake for 12-15 minutes (160°C) or until golden brown.
Cool on baking tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely (approx. 30 minutes) before serving.
tips: Make your own gluten free plain flour using the recipe in this collection.Store biscuits in a sealable container for up to 1 week.To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products to ensure no traces of wheat or gluten have been used as part of the production process.
Make your own gluten free plain flour using the recipe in this collection.
Store biscuits in a sealable container for up to 1 week.
To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products to ensure no traces of wheat or gluten have been used as part of the production process.

title: Chicken ball kebabs with rice
ingredients: 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, needles washed and dried
50 g stale white bread, crust removed, in pieces
30 - 50 g milk, for soaking the bread
30 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
30 g mixed fresh herbs, (e.g. thyme, marjoram, basil, oregano)
1 pepper (vegetable), any colour, cut into 16 square pieces
½ tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
150 g risotto rice, e.g. Arborio or Carnaroli
steps: Place chicken breast fillets into a bowl with shallot, one sprig of rosemary, parsley, marjoram and white wine. Marinate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, soak breadcrumbs in milk in a bowl.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place the mixed herbs into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Gently squeeze out marinade from meat and, with mixing knife moving at speed 5, add meat through hole in mixing bowl lid. Then chop 10 sec/speed 8.
Add strained bread, Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper and chop 10 sec/speed 4. Remove mixture from mixing bowl and, with slightly wet hands, form 16 meatballs.

Assemble kebabs by placing 1 slice of courgette, 1 meatball, 1 piece of pepper and so on onto the skewers until all ingredients are used up. Moisten and wring a sheet of baking paper then line Varoma tray, making sure to keep some holes unobstructed. Arrange kebabs onto Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water and stock paste into mixing bowl, place simmering basket into position with the rice, place Varoma into position and cook: 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. At the end of the cooking time, remove Varoma and simmering basket with aid of spatula, strain rice and set aside.
Empty mixing bowl and inside it place olive oil and remaining rosemary and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Season rice with rosemary-flavoured oil.
Serve kebabs accompanied by the rice.
tips: If preferred, substitute the marjoram with fresh sage leaves.
At step 7, if preferred, add a pinch of chilli powder.
After cooking in the Varoma, the kebabs can be transferred to a hot frying pan with a dash of oil for several minutes or grilled in the oven.

title: Mediterranean pastries
ingredients: 270 g puff pastry, ready rolled (approx. 24 x 40 cm)
150 g medium-hard cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm) (e.g. Gruyère or Gouda)
60 g dried tomatoes in oil, drained
20 basil leaves, fresh, cut into thin strips
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease 6 soufflé moulds (Ø 8 cm, 4 cm high).
Cut puff pastry into 6 squares and line soufflé moulds.
Place cheese in mixing bowl, grate 6 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place artichoke hearts and tomatoes in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cheese, sour cream, eggs, basil, oregano, salt and pepper and stir 20 sec//speed 3. Transfer to moulds, bake for 25–30 minutes (200°C) and allow to cool for 5 minutes. Carefully remove from the moulds and serve hot or cold.

title: Crostini with mushrooms and fontina
ingredients: 400 g fresh button mushrooms, cut into slices
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line baking tray with baking paper.
Place parsley in mixing bowl, chop 2 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add mushrooms, red wine, salt and pepper and sauté 5 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add chopped parsley and stir 5 sec//speed 1.
Top bread slices with cheese, arrange crostini on baking tray and allow to melt 10–15 minutes (180°C).
Top crostini with mushrooms, season with a little black pepper as desired and serve immediately.
tips: Top bread slices with cheese first before preparing the mushrooms.
Try using ½ tsp herbes de Provence instead of parsley.
The Italian fontina cheese can be replaced with gruyère.

title: Poppy seed and rosemary crispbread
ingredients: 80 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
4 sprigs fresh rosemary, needles removed from stalk
40 g butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place parmesan in mixing bowl, chop roughly 5 sec/speed 8.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place rosemary and 150 g wheat in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10 and transfer to a bowl.
Place remaining 150 g wheat in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10.

Add poppy seeds, milk, butter, salt, pepper, cardamom and rosemary and flour mixture, knead 1 min/. Set aside and allow to stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 160°C and grease 2 baking trays.

Divide dough into two and place each on a baking tray. Dust generously with flour and roll out on the baking trays, ensuring dough is thinner at centre than at sides. Cut longer side into 5 strips (à 8 cm) and shorter side into 3 strips (à 10 cm) to create 15 squares (10 x 8 cm) per baking tray. Spread half of the parmesan over the dough per tray and bake the trays of crispbread for 20 minutes (160°C) each. Allow to cool briefly, break into the pre-cut squares and leave to cool completely on a cooling rack. Store dry in a jar.
tips: Sprinkle dough with sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds or sesame before baking.
Sprinkle dough with sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds or sesame before baking.

title: Lemon hibiscus iced tea
ingredients: 100 g ice cubes, plus extra for serving
lemon, cut in slices, to garnish
steps: Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and bring to the boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Add hibiscus flowers through hole in mixing bowl lid, insert measuring cup and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Transfer tea to a jug and allow to cool (approx. 2 hours). Discard contents of simmering basket.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add lemon juice, ice cubes and reserved hibiscus tea then mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to 8 glasses and garnish with lemon slices, mint leaves and ice cubes, then serve immediately.
tips: Adjust the amount of sugar according to personal preferences.

title: Watermelon ice lollies
ingredients: 1 lemon, 1 thin strip of zest removed (4 cm long) plus juice
800 g watermelon, cut into pieces, deseeded
steps: Place sugar and lemon zest in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add watermelon, lemon juice, salt and vodka and puree 30 sec/speed 10.Transfer to ice lolly moulds and freeze for at least 8 hours (ideally overnight).
Remove ice lollies from freezer, remove from moulds and serve immediately.
tips: If ice lollies are intended for children, leave out the alcohol.
If ice lollies are intended for children, leave out the alcohol.

title: Iced matcha coconut caramel latte
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 100 g coconut milk, butter and salt in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .
Add remaining 100 g coconut milk, mix without measuring cup 2 min/speed 2, then cook without measuring cup 2 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer coconut caramel sauce to a sterilized jar and allow to cool.
Place matcha powder, milk and 200 g ice cubes in mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 8.
Place 2 tbsp coconut caramel sauce into each glass, fill with remaining 400 g ice cubes up to ⅔ and pour over matcha milk. Serve immediately.
tips: Store any remaining coconut caramel sauce in refrigerator.

title: Soft Date Cake with Walnuts
ingredients: 3 ½ oz walnut halves  o 3 ½ oz pecan halves
8 oz unsalted butter, cut into pieces
5 oz maple syrup  o 5 oz date syrup
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a bundt cake pan (9 in.) with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
Place walnuts into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place dates and water into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/160°F/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, butter, egg and vanilla and mix 40 sec/speed 6.

Add 2 oz reserved chopped walnuts and mix with spatula. Transfer mixture into prepared cake pan and bake 45 minutes (350°F) or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in pan (approx. 20 min.) before transferring to a serving plate.
Slowly drizzle maple syrup on top of cake and sprinkle with remaining 1.5 oz chopped walnuts before serving.
tips: Replace 5 oz maple syrup or 5 oz date syrup with 5 oz honey.

title: Pasta salad with salmon and vegetables
ingredients: 400 g fresh salmon fillets, skinless  o 400 g swordfish fillets
240 g short dried pasta (e.g. mezze penne rigate), 10 minutes cooking time
350 g cherry tomatoes, cut into halves or quarters
steps: Place water, orange juice and salt into mixing bowl. Place salmon fillets into Varoma dish and frozen green peas onto Varoma tray. Place Varoma into position and steam 12 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Add pasta through hole in mixing bowl lid, and return Varoma to position. Cook 10 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside and drain pasta through simmering basket, briefly rinsing it under cold water to stop cooking. Place pasta into a serving bowl and stir in 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil (approx. 10 g).
Without cleaning mixing bowl, place garlic clove and remaining 30 g extra virgin olive oil into mixing bowl and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove garlic clove if desired.

Add steamed salmon fillets, steamed peas, capers and black olives and cook 3 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer onto pasta, add cherry tomatoes and combine. Season to taste with black pepper and lemon juice and serve at room temperature or chilled.
tips: - If frozen green peas are not available, they can be replaced with canned green peas, drained: add them at the end of step 2 into the serving bowl with pasta and extra virgin olive oil.- Garnish with chopped parsley, to taste.

- Salmon can also be replaced with skinless trout fillets. Depending on the quality and type of fish, steaming time in step 1 can be adjusted to your preference.- If you prefer bigger pieces of fish, don’t add fish into the mixing bowl in step 4. Instead, cut fish into pieces and gently combine into the salad with the spatula.- If you prefer a stronger garlic flavour, rather than removing the garlic clove, chop it 5 sec/speed 6 in step 3 before sautéing.

title: Kingfish pie
ingredients: 30 g vegetable oil, plus extra for greasing
600 g white fish fillet, skinless, boneless (e.g. kingfish), cut into cubes
200 g red onions, cut into quarters
2 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
1 tbsp dried chilli flakes, adjust to taste
1 egg, lightly beaten with 1 tbsp water
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh water in it and set aside.
Place flour, egg, milk powder, oil and salt into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 5.

Mix speed 3 while slowly pouring reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a stream onto rotating blades to create a soft dough. Transfer dough onto a work surface, divide dough into 2 equal pieces. Transfer into a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a towel and set aside for 1 hour. Meanwhile clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place kingfish cubes in a bowl, add lemon juice and salt, refrigerate to marinate. Meanwhile, go on with the recipe
In a small bowl mix tamarind in hot water and pass mixture through a fine sieve into a bowl to remove seeds and skins. Set aside.
Place coriander into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, onions, ground cumin and oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes, sugar, vegetable stock, reserved tamarind mixture and chilli flakes and chop 10 sec/speed 6.
Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add chopped coriander leaves into mixing bowl and mix with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool.
Preheat oven to 170ºC. Grease a round baking dish (approx. Ø 30 cm), dust with flour and set aside.

Transfer pieces of dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead them briefly. Using a rolling pin, roll out one piece of dough into a circle slightly larger than the prepared baking dish and use it to cover base and sides of baking dish. Spread half of the tamarind-tomato sauce into dough-lined baking dish, place pieces of marinated fish over the sauce, spoon over the remaining tomato sauce and sprinkle with pine nuts. Roll out the second piece of dough and cover pie. Seal well around the edges, brush pie surface with an egg beaten with 1 tbsp water and bake for 30-40 minutes (170°C), or until golden brown. Serve warm.

title: Za'atar mix substitute
ingredients: 1 tbsp sesame seeds, toasted (or dry roasted)
steps: Place sumac, thyme, marjoram, oregano, sesame seeds and salt into mixing bowl and grind 3 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a jar and store in a dry place.
tips: Traditional Za’atar mix is made with dried za’atar leaves. In this case substitute thyme, marjoram and oregano with 6 tbsb dried za’atar leaves.

title: Creamy Moroccan bean soup
ingredients: 450 g broad beans, fresh  o 450 g broad beans, frozen
steps: Place shallots into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 4 min/120°C/speed  without measuring cup.
Add 300 g beans, courgettes, tomatoes and 400 g water and cook 10 min/100°C/speed .
Place remaining beans in Varoma dish, place Varoma into position and continue cooking for 10 min/Varoma/speed . Transfer beans to a bowl and set aside.
Add mint, coriander, cumin and salt to mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.
Add 200 g water and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer the soup to individual soup plates, distribute reserved beans on top and serve immediately.

title: Pumpkin Baba Ganoush
ingredients: 400 g pumpkin flesh, cut in pieces (1-2 cm)
20 g toasted sesame seeds, plus extra for garnishing
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add pumpkin into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.

Place cooked pumpkin, garlic clove, sesame seeds, cumin, paprika and lemon juice in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 6-8, gradually increasing speed. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. Cover with cling film. Set aside in refrigerator. Garnish with pumpkin seeds and sesame seeds. Serve chilled.
tips: Best served with raw vegetables or toasted pita bread.

title: Black Glutinous Rice Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
steps: Place black glutinous rice in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 200 g water, dried yeast powder, 200 g plain flour, 50 g sugar in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.
Start Fermentation /1 h/37°C. Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases.

Add 250 g plain flour, 200 g sugar, egg, baking powder, coconut milk and reserved black glutinous rice, mix 1 min/speed 6. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, start Kettle /100°C.
Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Honey loquat paste
steps: Place loquat into mixing bowl and chop 1 min/speed 10.
Add icing sugar. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid. Cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Allow to cool completely before pouring into an airtight jar.
Place airtight jar onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in honey. Stir well with clean dry chopsticks and store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

title: Flower Pot Egg Pudding
ingredients: 100 g chocolate sandwich cookies (eg. oreo®), filling removed
1 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o vanilla extract
steps: Place gelatine powder and water in a small bowl, mix well and set aside.
Place chocolate cookies in mixing bowl, crush 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer crushed cookies into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place milk, egg yolks, sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl, heat 4 min/50°C/speed 1.
Add gelatine mixture and mix 4 min/85°C/speed 2 until dissolved.
Add cream and mix 30 sec/speed 2.5. Transfer egg pudding mixture into 8 glass jars (100ml each) about 3 quarter full. Place them in the refrigerator for 2-3 hours until set.
Remove set egg pudding from refrigerator. Place a spoonful of crushed cookies over the top of the pudding and garnish with a mint leaf. Serve chilled.

title: Fried Chives Pockets
ingredients: 20 g dried shrimp, small size, rinsed, toasted
300 g Chinese chives, cut in small pieces, approx. 0.5 cm
steps: Place flour, water, oil and salt in mixing bowl, knead Dough /3 min. Remove dough and shape into a round ball, cover with cling film and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Crack the eggs into a small bowl and beat well to form an egg wash. Set aside.
Place cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 2 min/Varoma/speed .
Without measuring cup, cook 6 min/Varoma/speed , meanwhile, pour the beaten egg mixture through the hole in mixing bowl lid. When it is done, scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dried shrimp, chives, sesame oil, oyster sauce, white pepper, five-spice powder, and salt, then mix 1 min//speed 3 with the aid of spatula.

Divide the reserved dough into 6 equal portions, shape them into small round ball shape. Flatten 1 dough ball and roll out into a big round sheet using rolling pin, place 1/6 of the chive fillings onto the flatten dough sheet, fold the dough in half to seal and pinch out the lace. Repeat with remaining ingredients until finished.

Heat oil in a non stick flat pan on medium heat, place chive pockets onto the heated pan, slowly fry the chive pockets over low heat, flip them once the bottom has turned golden brown, cover the pan with a lid. Repeat with remaining chive pockets until finished. Serve hot.

title: Tomato Chutney
steps: Place onions, urad dhall, curry leaves, dried chillies, green chillies and salt in mixing bowl, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add tomatoes, tamarind paste and asafoetida, cook 6 min/120°C//speed 1. Then blend 10 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer chutney to 2 sterilized glass jars (400 g each), leave to cool completely before covering. Serve together with other main dishes as condiment.
tips: Recipe contributed by Prithivi Natchiar Nagendran.

title: Pineapple and Apple Chutney
ingredients: 2 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, cut in quarters
water, sufficient to cover the apples
350 g pineapples, peeled, cored, cut in pieces (3 cm x 3 cm)
12 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked in hot water, adjust to taste
steps: Place apples in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 4. Transfer chopped apples to a bowl of water sufficient to cover the apples and set aside.
Place pineapple in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 3.5. Transfer chopped pineapple to another bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place dried chillies, ginger and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, blend 6 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add vinegar, sugar, salt and ground cinnamon, heat 12 min/120°C//speed 1.
Blend again 6 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 6 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add chopped apples, chopped pineapples, candied ginger and raisins, cook 27 min/110°C//speed . Cook a further 5 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer chutney to 2 sterilized glass jars (400 g each), leave to cool completely before covering. Serve together with other main dishes as condiment.
tips: This chutney can be stored in refrigerator for up to 2-3 months.
Pineapple and apple chutney can be served with biryani and curry.
Recipe contributed by Sunita Thomas.

title: Lemon Mousse with Basil Slush
steps: Soak gelatine sheet in cold water to soften.
Place sugar and lemon zest in clean and dry mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add lemon juice, egg yolks, egg and butter, cook 17 min/90°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, drain gelatine sheet.
Add soaked gelatine sheet, mix 20 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to set. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place water, lime juice and sugar in mixing bowl, cook without measuring cup 25 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and let cool completely before refrigerating for 1 hour.
Place cooled lime juice and basil leaves in mixing bowl, blend 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a freezable container (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and set aside in freezer for 1 day.
Soak gelatine sheet in cold water to soften.
Place water, sugar and lime juice in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, drain gelatine sheet.
Add soaked gelatine sheet, mix 1 min 30 sec/55°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to set. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place sugar and lemon zest in mixing bowl, grind 20 sec/speed 10.
Insert butterfly whisk, add egg whites, whisk without measuring cup 2 min/speed 3.5 or until stiff peaks formed. Transfer to a bowl and set aside in refrigerator.

Place lemon cream in a dessert bowl, cover with lemon frosting and top with lime jelly. Using an ice cream scoop, scoop out basil slush balls and place in the center, garnish with mixed berries in the bowl, then sprinkle crushed digestive biscuit around the bowl and garnish with basil leaves. Serve immediately.
tips: If you can't find gelatine sheets, replace with gelatine powder. Soak gelatine powder with 1 tbsp cold water to soften. One gelatine sheet equals to 1 tsp gelatine powder.

title: Butter Buns with Lobster Seafood Salad
ingredients: 20 g fresh cherry radish, cut in thin slices
extra virgin olive oil, to garnish
fresh red chillies, shredded, to garnish
steps: Place 10 g butter in mixing bowl, heat 2 min/70°C/speed 1.
Add 80 g butter, flour, milk, eggs, sugar and dried yeast, mix 4 min//speed 4.

Add salt, knead Dough /1 min. Transfer dough to a pastry mat, roll dough into a round shape and cover with cling film. Leave in a warm place to proof until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Punch down to deflate dough, roll dough into a log shape. Divide dough into 12 portions with spatula and form each portion into an oblong shape. Arrange dough balls in Varoma dish and let rest for 15 minutes.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Transfer butter buns to a plate and set aside to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place a glass jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh in sunflower oil. Set aside.

Place egg yolks, lemon juice, salt and ground black pepper in mixing bowl, mix without measuring cup 2 min/speed 4. Meanwhile, very slowly pouring oil onto mixing bowl lid letting it trickle into mixing bowl to emulsify. Transfer to a bowl or airtight container and set aside in refrigerator.
Insert a toothpick or bamboo skewer horizontally into abdomen of lobster and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add lobster into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer lobster to a bowl of ice water.
Set Varoma dish into position again, add prawns into it, steam 3 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, using scissors, deshell lobster, cut lobster meat into slices and set aside.
Mix steamed prawns, shredded shallots, cucumber dices, shredded ginger, cherry radish slices, lemon juice, lime juice, chopped spring onion, salt and reserved mayonnaise in a bowl and set aside.

Slice butter buns lengthwise without cutting it completely through, arrange seafood salad in the middle of the bun, top with 2 lobster slices, sprinkle with sea salt and olive oil, garnish with parsley leaves and shredded chillies. Serve immediately.

title: Romesco Dip
steps: Place almonds in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 7.
Add capsicums, vinegar and ground smoked paprika, mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salt to season, mix 5 sec/speed 4. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator for up to 3 days.
tips: Roast capsicum over a gas flame, turning with tongs until blackened all over. Place into a glass bowl and cover with plastic wrap for 10 minutes or until cooled. Peel and remove skin and deseed before step 2.
This dip also makes a great relish for grilled meats or toasted sandwiches, and can be added to risotto or soup as a flavoursome condiment.

title: Cherry Blossom Steamed Dumplings
ingredients: 180 g medium-sized prawns, deshelled and patted dry with kitchen towel
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place prawns, salt, sugar, white pepper powder, potato starch, egg white, sesame oil and rice wine in mixing bowl, mix 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in wheat starch, 40 g potato starch and purple sweet potato powder. Place 170 g water in mixing bowl, boil 2 min/100°C/speed 2.

Slowly pour hot water into bowl with mixed flour and immediately stir until combined. Then, add remaining 40 g starch into it. Transfer dough to a pastry mat. Using hands, knead dough into a ball shape.

Roll dough into an oblong shape and cut in 16 equal portions, cover with cling film to prevent from drying out. Roll each portion into a round shape. Grease rolling pin with some oil, roll out each dough into a round disc (Ø 10 cm).

Place a portion of reserved marinated prawn filling (approx. 10 g) in center of dumpling skin. Pull edge of skin upward and fold into pentagon shape. Using thumb, gently pleat some folds on each side of pentagon and connect with another side of pentagon by sealing edges to form a flower shape. Repeat this step for remaining doughs.
Distribute prawn dumplings on Varoma dish and Varoma tray. Close with Varoma lid.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, boil 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 5 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Cynthia Wong.

title: Crispy Rice Chocolate Hearts
steps: Place peanut butter, butter and sugar in mixing bowl, mix 1 min/speed 7.

Add crispy rice, mix 30 sec/speed 2. Refrigerate for 15 minutes until firm. Using a spoon, scoop take a scoop of peanut rice mixture and shape into balls (around 15 pieces). Lightly flatten into round discs.

Place dark chocolate coins in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 7. Then melt 4 min/50°C/speed 1. While the melted chocolate is still warm, transfer to heart shaped silicon mould until ⅓ full. Immediately insert reserved peanut discs and lightly push to allow melted chocolate cover peanut discs.
Freeze for 5-10 minutes. Check if chocolate has set, prolong freezing time if necessary. Remove chocolate hearts from tray. Serve chilled.
tips: Replace crispy rice with cornflakes or chopped almond.

title: Yu Sang
ingredients: 60 g plum sauce, homemade or store-bought
200 g Japanese cucumber, peeled, deseeded, finely shredded
100 g unripe mango, peeled, pit removed, finely shredded
100 g unripe papaya, peeled, deseeded, finely shredded
100 g raw salmon, sashimi grade or roasted duck, shredded
60 g pomelo segments, separated to sacs
20 g toasted pine nuts, coarsely chopped
4 kaffir lime leaves, deveined, finely shredded
steps: Place passion fruit pulp, plum sauce, lime juice and honey in mixing bowl, mix 3 min//speed 2. Strain with fine mesh strainer. Transfer to a glass jar and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place peanuts in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec//speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

On a large serving plate, arrange ice plant loosely in centre. Arrange carrot shreds, cucumber shred, mango shreds and papaya shreds in center and form a small dome, allowing ice plant to be partially seen. Top vegetable shreds with salmon slices. Arrange reserved peanuts, pomelo sacs, cabbage shreds, cornflakes, pine nut, coriander leaves and sesame seeds around the dome.

To serve, squeeze lime wedges on salmon slices. Top with kaffir lime leaves, five-spice powder, white pepper powder and olive oil. Drizzle reserved passion fruit dressing evenly on serving plate. Serve immediately and toss before enjoying.
tips: The vegetable and fruit used in this recipe are high in water content. Use a salad spinner to remove excess water from these ingredients.
Replace any fruit or vegetable with your favourite choice.

Traditionally, Yu Sang (“Prosperity Toss”) is served during the Chinese New Year to usher in prosperity.  At the table, all diners lift their chopsticks and toss the Yee Sang, the higher the better, while uttering statements of good intentions and blessings.

title: Steamed Glutinous Rice With Mud Crab
ingredients: 2 tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
2 cm fresh ginger, cut in 8 slices
1 spring onion, cut in 4 cm length
1 banana leaf, cut to round piece (Ø 18 cm)
4 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed, squeezed, cut in cubes
100 g Chinese sausages (lap cheong), casings removed, cut in cubes
steps: Mix crabs, 1 tbsp rice wine, 4 ginger slices and spring onion in a bowl. Set aside in refrigerator.
Place shallots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 4 ginger slices, cooking oil and dried shrimp, sauté 10 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, line a bamboo steamer (Ø 15 cm, see tip) with banana leaf.
Add mushroom cubes and sausage cubes, cook 6 min/120°C//speed .
Add glutinous rice, 1 tbsp rice wine, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar and salt, cook 4 min/120°C/speed .
Add 300 g water, cook 3 min/100°C//speed . Transfer rice to lined bamboo steamer. Cover with steamer lid. Place in Varoma dish. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 700 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Carefully open Varoma lid, open bamboo steamer lid, arrange crabs on rice. Close Varoma lid. Steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve hot.
tips: Replace bamboo steamer with a steaming tray (Ø 15 cm).

title: Lap Mei Fun (Chinese Waxed Meat Rice)
ingredients: 1 waxed duck thigh, cut in 2 pieces
300 g waxed pork belly, cut in 3 pieces
20 g fresh ginger, cut in slices
30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, boil Kettle /100°C.

Add waxed duck thigh, waxed pork belly, Chinese sausage and Chinese liver sausage, blanch 10 min/100°C//speed . Transfer blanched waxed duck thigh, waxed pork belly, Chinese sausage and Chinese liver sausage to a serving bowl and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ginger slices, dried shrimp and sesame oil, sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
