Add Basmati rice, 900 g water, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, rice wine, reserved waxed duck thigh, waxed pork belly, Chinese sausage and Chinese liver sausage. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing, start Rice Cooker . Take out waxed duck, waxed pork belly, Chinese sausage and Chinese liver sausage, cut in thin slices. Transfer cooked rice to serving bowl and mix well. Top with sliced duck, sliced pork belly, sliced sausage and sliced liver sausage. Garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Sarawak Ragi Huat Kuih (White Yeasted Steamed Cupcakes)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in cold rice. Add caster sugar and water to the bowl and mix. Place ragi in mixing bowl, pulverise 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to bowl with rice and mix well. Cover and leave to ferment at room temperature for 2 days.
Place white rice flour, 250 g water, fermented rice and caster sugar in mixing bowl, blend 40 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Start Fermentation /3 h/40°C. Then mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add fruit salt, mix 40 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl. Clean mixing bowl. Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases.
Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, arrange 5 empty cupcake moulds to it. Close Varoma lid and preheat 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Carefully open Varoma lid, stir batter well and pour into hot cupcake moulds until 80% full. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.5.
Set steamed cupcakes aside, arrange remaining 4 empty moulds in Varoma. Close Varoma lid and preheat 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Carefully open Varoma lid, stir batter well and pour into hot cupcake moulds until 80% full. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Sea Coconut Braised Fish Maw Soup
ingredients: 30 g dried fish maw, soaked overnight to soften, rinsed, cut into pieces (3 cm)
20 g sea coconut, cut in slices
30 g dried snow fungus, soaked to soften, cut in small pieces
steps: Place fish maw, yu zhu, sand ginseng, lily bulb, sea coconut, snow fungus, red dates and water in mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /1 h/98°C. Transfer to soup bowls and serve hot.
tips: Fish maw is a dried seafood product. It is rich in protein and gelatin. Sea coconut is a common soup ingredient in summer. It has a nourishing effect on the lungs, removes dryness and clears internal heat.

title: Pork Trotter Jelly
ingredients: 800 g pork trotter, with skin and bone, cut in pieces (3 cm)
100 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place 1500 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add pork trotter to it and blanch 15 min/50°C/speed 4. Remove simmering basket using spatula. Rinse pork trotter and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place reserved blanched pork trotter, pig’s skin, ginger, cloves, star anise, bay leaf, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, lump sugar, fish sauce, salt, 800 g water and rice wine in mixing bowl, start Slow Cook /3 h/95°C.
Cook 10 min/Varoma//speed . Debone pork trotter and cut meat in small pieces. Thinly slice pig’s skin. Place in a glass bowl.
Strain gravy through simmering basket into the glass bowl. Leave to cool at room temperature for 30 minutes before refrigerating at least 4 hours or overnight.

Scrape off the white layer of fat on top of the jelly. Turn the glass bowl onto a cutting board and let the jelly drop down onto cutting board. Cut into slices and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve cold.
tips: Best served with chilli sauce.
Recipes contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Mushroom Meat Sauce
ingredients: 100 g dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften
1000 g pork belly, skinless, cut into thin slices (0.5 cm)
steps: Place soaked shiitake mushrooms in mixing bowl and blend Turbo/2 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves, shallots and red chillies in mixing bowl, start Blend /10 sec.

Add reserved mushroom mixture, pork belly, fermented soy bean paste, fish sauce, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, brown sugar, mushroom powder and cooking oil, cook 40 min/120°C/speed 1. Serve as condiment over porridge or transfer to 5 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
tips: For a lighter version with a finer texture, replace pork belly with 1000 g minced meat in step 3.
Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Sweet And Sour Condiment Sauce
ingredients: 200 g yellow onions, cut into chunks
80 g fresh ginger, cut into slices
1 ½ tbsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place onions, garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl, start Blend /10 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed .
Add tomato ketchup and sweet chilli sauce. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and cook 14 min/120°C/speed 1.

Cook 1 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, pour rice wine onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Add sugar and salt to taste. Let it stand until mixing bowl temperature drops to 60°C. Serve as condiment for seafood or transfer to 3 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Sherry Choo.

title: Wafu dressing
steps: Place rice wine into mixing bowl, without measuring cup, heat 3 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add lemon juice, soy sauce, mirin, sugar and sesame seed, cook 3 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer into glass jar and cool completely before using. Serve as condiment or pour into a jar for storage in refrigerator up to 1 week.
tips: Best served as dipping sauce for karaage (Japanese deep fried food) or sauce for cold noodles.

title: Green Mustard Pig's Trotter, Emperor Chicken and Ladies' Fingers With Sesame Dressing
ingredients: 5 g dang gui (Chinese angelica root) slices
20 g dang shen (codonopsis root), cut into 5 cm length
1200 - 1400 g whole chicken (1 whole chicken), with skin and bone
15 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
60 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1000 g pig's trotter, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)  o 1000 g roasted pork trotter, cut in pieces (5-6 cm)
10 dried chillies, adjust to taste, deseeded, rinsed
150 g salted vegetables (hum choi), soaked for 10 minutes
300 g ladies' fingers, stems trimmed (refer to step 7)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in longan, dang gui, dang shen and yu zhu. Add red dates to the bowl. Cover with water, soak to soften and set aside. Rub chicken inside out with salt. Set aside for 30 minutes.

Insert ginger, wolfberries, chuan xiong and reserved herbs into the cavity. Layer lotus leaf on parchment paper. Place chicken onto lotus leaf, drizzle rice wine and wrap chicken like a parcel. Insert in Varoma dish.
Place white sesame seeds in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/1 sec/2 times.
Add mayonnaise, white rice vinegar, light soy sauce, sugar, mirin and sesame oil, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place pig’s trotter, tamarind pieces, 800 g water, chillies, salted plums, chilli bean paste, fermented soybean paste, light soy sauce, salt and sugar into mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, cook 50 min/Varoma//speed . Carefully open Varoma lid, check if chicken is cooked evenly (see tips), prolong cooking time if needed. Remove Varoma and set aside. Transfer steamed chicken into a serving dish and unwrap to serve.
Add 200 g water, mustard leaves and salted vegetables to mixing bowl, cook 10 min/Varoma//speed .

Set Varoma dish into position, add ladies’ fingers to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 5 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer steamed ladies’ fingers to a serving plate, drizzle with reserved sesame sauce. Transfer stewed pork to a serving bowl and serve hot.
tips: To remove the smell from raw pork, before cooking place pork trotter and 600 g water in mixing bowl, blanch 30 min/50°C//speed. This will also remove impurities and blood within the meat.

Check whether the chicken is cooked after steaming. Chicken should be tender enough to be pierced through easily with a fork or chopsticks. If it is not cooked, set Varoma dish back into position and continue steaming in step 6.
You can marinate chicken at least 3 hours or overnight before cooking.

title: Spicy Bean Curds
ingredients: 1 ½ - 2 tbsp red chilli powder, adjust to taste
2 tsp minced fresh ginger, adjust to taste
300 g firm bean curds (taukwa), cut in big chunks (3-5 cm)
steps: Line baking tray with baking paper. Preheat oven to 110°C.
Place red chilli powder, black soy powder, ground turmeric, cold pressed sesame oil, 3-booster powder, ginger and rock salt in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place another bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in bean curd. Reserve 1 tbsp spice mixture and coat bean curds with remaining spice mixture evenly, then arrange on prepared baking tray, bake for 1 hour (110°C).
Place water, molasses powder and reserved spice mixture in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/70°C/speed 3 until thickened. Drizzle sauce over on baked bean curd and serve hot.
tips: You can also make your own 3-booster powder by mixing nutritional yeast, wheatgerm and lecithin in the weight ratio of 1:2:2. Store remaining 3-booster powder in an airtight container.
Serve with steamed rice.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Roselle Jelly
ingredients: 10 roselle calyces, fresh or dried, deseeded
some fresh fruit cubes e.g. kiwis, mangoes, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place roselle calyces and water in mixing bowl, cook 25 min/100°C/speed 1. Discard roselle calyces.
Add psyllium husks and agave nectar, mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer to serving cups immediately. Allow to cool completely before refrigerating. Garnish with fruit cubes. Serve chilled.
tips: Place 150 g psyllium husk in mixing bowl, pulverise 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to an airtight container and store in a cool and dry place. Use as desired.
You can also cut roselle jelly in cubes and serve with cold soy milk and fresh cut fruit as a sweet soup dessert.
This recipe cleanses the intestine and and promotes healthy digestive function.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Lap Mei Fan (Chinese Wax Meat Rice)
ingredients: 20 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 tsp lump sugar (opcional)  o 1 tsp raw sugar (opcional)
150 g French beans, cut in 6 cm length
1 sprig spring onion, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add waxed duck thigh and waxed pork belly, blanch 10 min/100°C//speed . Drain through Varoma dish and rinse, transfer to a bowl and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place a small bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in premium soy sauce, first draw soy sauce and rice wine. Add lump sugar to the bowl. Place the bowl in Varoma dish and set aside.

Place 1250 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice to it, then add reserved waxed duck thigh and waxed pork belly onto rice, set Varoma dish into position, add Chinese sausages and liver sausages to it. Close Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.
Carefully open Varoma lid, insert Varoma tray, add French beans onto the tray. Close Varoma lid and steam 3 min/Varoma/speed 3.
Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer waxed duck thigh and waxed pork belly to a bowl and set aside. Transfer steamed rice to a serving bowl.

Carefully open Varoma lid, take the small bowl with seasoning sauce out of Varoma dish, drizzle it on steamed rice. Mix well with spatula. Slice French beans, Chinese sausages, liver sausages, waxed duck thigh and waxed pork belly and place on rice. Garnish with spring onion and serve warm.
tips: For authentic style, heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a claypot over medium heat, add steamed rice and steamed seasoning sauce. Mix well and cook 5 minutes until aromatic. Add French beans and sliced meat onto rice, garnish with chopped spring onion.

title: Lotus Leaf Glutinous Rice
ingredients: 150 g chicken thigh, with skin, boneless, cut in cubes (2 cm)
1 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
300 g glutinous rice, soaked for 2 hours, rinsed
40 g cooking oil, plus extra for greasing
100 g Chinese sausages (approx 2 sausages), cut in slices (0.2 cm)
15 g Chinese dried mushrooms, soaked to soften, cut in halves
2 lotus leaves, soaked in hot water to soften, stem removed, cut in halves
2 salted egg yolks, cut in halves (opcional)
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a small fine sieve and squeeze out juice into a small bowl, reserving it. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken thigh. Add reserved ginger juice, 1 tbsp light soy sauce, ½ tsp dark soy sauce, sesame oil and rice wine, mix well to marinate and set aside for 30 minutes in a cool place or in refrigerator.

Place 1300 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add glutinous rice to it, without measuring cup, cook 16 min/100°C/speed 3.5. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Transfer cooked rice into a large bowl, mix well with 2 tbsp light soy sauce, ½ tsp dark soy sauce, salt, sugar and white pepper powder. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves and shallots in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil and dried shrimp, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed .

Add reserved marinated chicken and marinade, 60 g Chinese sausage slices and mushrooms, stir fry 5 min/120°C/speed . Transfer into reserved bowl with rice and mix well with spatula. Grease lotus leaves with cooking oil and line with salted egg yolk halve and 10 g Chinese sausage slices. Fold in quarter portion of reserved rice mixture. Press lightly until firm and wrap into a parcel. Repeat the steps with remaining lotus leaves and ingredients until finished. Place all wrapped lotus leaf rice in Varoma dish.
Place 800 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma into position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve hot.
tips: You can steam Chinese sausages to soften for easier slicing.
There are two types of glutinous rice in the market. Local glutinous rice requires longer cooking time. Siam glutinous rice is best for this recipe as it is cooked faster with shorter soaking time.

title: Onde Onde Cupcakes
ingredients: 100 g cold butter, cut in cubes (2.5 cm)
150 g palm sugar, cut in chunks (3 cm)
175 g cream cheese, softened at room temperature
steps: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a 12-hole muffin pan with cupcakes cases.
Place self-raising flour, all-purpose flour and baking soda in mixing bowl, grind Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter and brown sugar in mixing bowl, mix 2 min/speed 5.

Insert butterfly whisk, add reserved flour, salt, eggs, desiccated coconut, coconut milk and pandan paste, mix 2 min/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Scoop batter into each cupcake case until ¾ full. Bake for 15-18 minutes (170°C) or until the cakes spring back when gently touched. Remove from oven and transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Place palm sugar in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, salt and thickened cream, cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and leave to cool to room temperature before transferring to a piping bag with nozzle (Ø 3 cm). Clean mixing bowl.
Place cream cheese, icing sugar and pandan juice in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer frosting to another piping bag with nozzle (Ø 3 cm) and set aside.
Using a cupcake hole punch, make a hole in the middle of each cupcakes. Pipe in the cooled caramel, then pipe frosting over cupcakes. Sprinkle cupcakes with toasted coconut flakes before serving.

title: Mustard Green Rice
ingredients: 20 g dried shrimp, soaked to soften
5 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked to soften, stems removed, cut in slices
10 g chicken stock powder  o 10 g mushroom seasoning powder
200 g roasted pork belly (siew yoke), cut in pieces (1 cm)
steps: Place shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dried shrimp, shiitake mushroom slices, cooking oil and mustard green, sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, chicken stock powder, water and white pepper powder, boil 8 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add roasted pork and rice, stir well with spatula, start Rice Cooker . Let stand for 15 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Red Yeast Rice Huat Kuih (Steamed Cupcakes)
ingredients: ½ tsp red yeast rice powder (see tip)
steps: Line cupcake moulds (Ø 6 cm) with cupcake cases. Place cooked rice, 300 g water and caster sugar in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10.

Add white rice flour, double action baking powder and red yeast rice powder, mix 10 sec/speed 4. Pour batter into prepared cupcake moulds and arrange cupcakes in Varoma dish and tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, boil 6 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3.5. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer cupcakes to a serving plate. Serve warm.
tips: Red yeast rice powder: place red yeast rice grain into clean and dry mixing bowl, pulverise Turbo/1 sec/5 times. Use as desired.
Recipe contributed by Lau Bee Lee.

title: Steamed Pork Patty with Salted Egg
ingredients: 180 g lean pork fillets, partially frozen, cut in cubes (1 cm)
120 g pork fat, partially frozen, cut in cubes (1 cm)
80 g pickled cucumber, cut in pieces
¼ tsp homemade chicken stock powder
1 sprig fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place pork fillets and pork fat in mixing bowl, mince 12 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pickled cucumber, chicken stock powder, ice water, oyster sauce, tapioca starch, sesame oil and white pepper powder, mix 10 sec//speed 3.

Grease a steaming bowl (Ø 15 cm) with sesame oil. Put a salted egg yolk in the bowl. Spread reserved pork mixture over egg yolk and fill up to ⅔ of the depth of the bowl. Do not overfill. Press into reserved pork mixture to make a hole and place remaining egg yolk in it. Place prepared bowl in Varoma dish.

Place water in mixing bowl, boil 7 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma into position, steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma. Carefully open Varoma lid, put a serving dish over the steaming bowl. Flip upside-down to turn the pork patty out. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: For a faster version, replace homemade chicken stock powder and pickled cucumber with store-bought ingredients.

When selecting the bowl to be used in the Varoma, choose heat-resistant materials (e.g. ceramic, metal or silicone); ensure the size of the bowl is appropriate and the Varoma lid can be closed completely; make sure some steaming holes (slots) remain unobstructed.
Replace pickled cucumber with 80 g pickled lettuce or water chestnuts in step 2.

title: Talam Daging Berlauk (Savoury Minced Beef Layer Cake)
ingredients: 180 g beef chuck, cut in cubes, partially frozen
1 fresh red chilli, cut in cubes
10 stalks sweet leaf (sayur manis), leaves only
steps: Place beef in mixing bowl, grind 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place rice flour, cornflour, plain flour, egg, coconut milk, 800 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl, mix 35 sec/speed 5. Then cook 4 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Transfer to a round tray (Ø 21 cm) and place in Varoma dish. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place shallots and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, reserved beef, curry powder, dried shrimp, ½ tsp salt and ground black pepper, sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chilli, fried shallots and sweet leaf, mix 30 sec/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and clean mixing bowl.

Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish with reserved flour mixture into position. Close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer reserved beef mixture onto steamed cake. Let cool completely. Cut into slices and serve.
tips: Refer to Cookidoo® for the Shallot Oil recipe.

title: Miso soup, Sake seafood with rice
ingredients: 300 g white short-grain rice (e.g. sushi rice), rinsed and drained
60 g Chinese cabbage, cut in pieces (2 cm)
100 g onions, cut in thin slices (2 mm)
40 g carrot, cut in thin strips (2 mm)
10 - 12 large raw prawns, peeled and deveined (from approx. 170 g prawns)
300 g clams, shells scrubbed,  o 300 g fresh mussels, shells scrubbed and de-bearded
60 g sake  o 60 g rice wine
200 g silken tofu, cut in cubes (1.5 cm) (opcional)
steps: Place 1200 g water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and add short-grain rice to it.

Select a heat-resistant bowl that fits in Varoma dish (approx. Ø 20 cm top, Ø 12 cm bottom, height 9 cm) and make sure the bowl leaves some holes unobstructed so steam can circulate. Place bowl in Varoma dish and set Varoma dish in position.

Place Chinese cabbage, onions, carrot, kombu, prawns, clams and squid rings in the bowl. Sprinkle with Japanese soy sauce, sake, salt, sesame oil and 40 g water, close Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile, mix miso paste with 200 g water in a small bowl until dissolved and set aside.
Set Varoma aside, remove simmering basket using spatula, transfer steamed rice to a bowl and cover to keep rice warm.
Stir miso-water mixture again and add to mixing bowl. Add wakame flakes, set Varoma back in position and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside.
Add silken tofu to mixing bowl and cook 2 min/100°C//speed 1. Adjust seasoning to taste (see tip). Serve soup as a starter, followed by steamed seafood and rice as the main course.
tips: This combination recipe illustrates how your Thermomix®# #can be used to prepare a soup, main dish and rice all at once, resulting in clean, bright flavours and a healthy family meal.
Taste the soup before serving; if it isn’t salty enough, dissolve 10-20 g additional miso paste in the soup.

Soy sauce comes in different strengths and flavours. The most common Japanese soy sauce is usually lighter and slightly less salty than dark Chinese soy sauce. If only dark soy sauce is available, decrease quantity to 50 g.
Wakame and kombu (kelp) are two kinds of edible seaweed that are often used in Japanese, Korean and Chinese cuisines.
Replace soy sauce with flavoured Japanese soy sauce (e.g. kelp, dried bonito, clam), or add ¼ tsp instant dashi powder.

title: Thai-style prawn broth, Spicy apples
ingredients: 4 cooking apples (e.g. Boskoop, Bramley, Reine des Reinettes)
800 g raw prawns with heads and shells, peeled
3 pinches ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Hollow out the apples with an apple-corer, removing the cores and leaving the bases intact. Place each one on a sheet of heat-resistant cling film or baking paper (20 cm x 20 cm). Fill each apple cavity with ½ tsp vanilla sugar, 1 star anise, 1 pinch ginger, 1 clove and 1 pinch cinnamon. Close each parcel tightly, place in Varoma dish and set aside.
Place onions, ginger and chilli in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil, prawn heads and prawn shells and sauté without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, set peeled raw prawns aside in refrigerator.
Add water, rice vinegar, fish sauce, cloves, star anise, salt and black pepper. Set Varoma with spicy apples in position and steam 35 min/Varoma/speed . Remove Varoma and set aside.

Filter broth through a sieve over a large bowl, pressing solids using spatula to extract their juices. Discard solids, rinse mixing bowl well and pour filtered broth back into it. Add Chinese egg noodles to mixing bowl, set Varoma back in position and cook 4 min/Varoma/speed . Remove Varoma.

Add wakame, reserved peeled raw prawns and soy bean sprouts to mixing bowl. Set Varoma back in position and cook 3 min/Varoma//speed 0.5. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep apples warm. Transfer soup to a soup tureen, add coriander leaves, combine and serve immediately. Serve the apples for dessert.
tips: The slightly sweet and spicy flavours of this Thai broth complement the prawns and noodles beautifully. Take advantage of the steam produced by the broth to cook an easy yet delicious fruit dessert. Because so few ingredients are used in the spiced apples, it’s important to use high-quality natural vanilla sugar.

The slightly sweet and spicy flavours of this Thai broth complement the prawns and noodles beautifully. Take advantage of the steam produced by the broth to cook an easy yet delicious fruit dessert. Because so few ingredients are used in the spiced apples, it’s important to use high-quality natural vanilla sugar.
Wakame is an edible seaweed that is often used in Japanese, Korean and Chinese cuisines.If apples are large and prevent closing of Varoma lid slice off the top portion of the apples.
Wakame is an edible seaweed that is often used in Japanese, Korean and Chinese cuisines.
If apples are large and prevent closing of Varoma lid slice off the top portion of the apples.
Replace soy bean sprouts with finely sliced fresh mushrooms.
Replace soy bean sprouts with finely sliced fresh mushrooms.

title: Hibiscus and Raspberry Tart
ingredients: 350 g fresh raspberries, plus extra to garnish
30 - 40 g honey (opcional)  o 30 - 40 g stevia powder, white (opcional)
mixed fresh red berries, to garnish
steps: Place mixed seeds, muesli and dates in mixing bowl then blend 10 sec/speed 10.

Add butter and melt 2 min/50°C/speed 1, then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a loose-based rectangular tart tin (30 cm x 12 cm) and spread out to cover base and sides. Set aside in refrigerator to chill. Clean mixing bowl.
Place hibiscus tea in a bowl and cover with boiling water, then let steep for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place raspberries, honey (if using), agar agar and 20 g water in mixing bowl then cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, strain hibiscus tea and reserve prepared tea.

Add prepared tea and coconut milk then blend 30 sec/speed 9. Transfer to prepared tin and even surface with spatula. Refrigerate until set. Serve garnished with raspberries, mixed red berries and mint leaves.

title: Pink Waffles with Fruit
ingredients: 10 - 20 g honey (opcional)  o 10 g granulated stevia (opcional)
steps: Separate egg yolks and egg whites into 2 bowls.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites in mixing bowl and whisk 2 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place almond milk, beetroot juice, oil, flour, reserved egg yolks, honey (if using) and baking powder in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 5. Gradually add whipped egg whites and mix them into batter. Transfer to a bowl.
Preheat waffle maker.

Add 1-2 tbsp batter and bake until golden. Allow to cool on a cooling rack. Repeat with remaining batter. Spread with mascarpone cheese and sprinkle with coconut flakes then serve alongside mixed fresh berries.

title: Pike perch fillets with fresh corn polenta
ingredients: 400 g pike-perch fillets, skin on (4 fillets, 1 cm thick),
1 orange, preferably organic, zest and juice
600 - 700 g fresh sweetcorn kernels (from 5-6 corn cobs)
400 g mixed vegetables, cut in slices (5 mm), or bite-size pieces (e.g. carrots, broccoli, cauliflower)
steps: Place fish fillets in a large bowl and set aside. Place fish sauce, sesame oil and dill in mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Pour over fish fillets and turn gently to coat. Cover bowl and allow to marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl, then proceed with the recipe.
Place 1 strip of orange zest (1 cm x 5 cm) and water in mixing bowl and blend 5 sec/speed 8. Insert simmering basket, add sweetcorn kernels, freshly squeezed orange juice and 1 tsp salt.
Set Varoma dish in position and add vegetables to it. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile line Varoma tray with baking paper.

Arrange drained marinated fish fillets on prepared Varoma tray. Remove Varoma, insert Varoma tray and set Varoma back in position. Steam 11-13 min/Varoma/speed 1, extending steaming time as needed, depending on thickness of fish fillets. Remove Varoma and set aside.

Remove simmering basket using spatula, empty mixing bowl and transfer steamed sweetcorn kernels to mixing bowl. Add ½ tsp salt and 20 g butter and blend 30 sec/speed 6 to make the sweetcorn polenta. Transfer steamed vegetables to a serving bowl and season with ½ tsp salt and 20 g butter. Serve sweetcorn polenta with fish fillets and steamed vegetables.
tips: Polenta is now widely known outside of Italy, but have you ever tried polenta made with fresh corn? The fresh sweet taste of corn with a zesty orange flavouring is a surprising yet pleasing complement to the marinated fish. If fresh corn is not in season, use frozen or canned corn kernels. As for the fish, any white freshwater fish will give great results in this recipe.

Polenta is now widely known outside of Italy, but have you ever tried polenta made with fresh corn? The fresh sweet taste of corn with a zesty orange flavouring is a surprising yet pleasing complement to the marinated fish. If fresh corn is not in season, use frozen or canned corn kernels. As for the fish, any white freshwater fish will give great results in this recipe.

Fish sauce and sesame oil are available in the Asian section of supermarkets or in Asian stores.If you’re in a hurry, omit marinating the fish: place the fish and marinade ingredients directly on the Varoma tray lined with baking paper.To cut the kernels off a fresh corn cob, use a sharp knife to slice from top to bottom, avoiding the cob itself as much as possible. Alternatively use a corn stripper.
Fish sauce and sesame oil are available in the Asian section of supermarkets or in Asian stores.
If you’re in a hurry, omit marinating the fish: place the fish and marinade ingredients directly on the Varoma tray lined with baking paper.
To cut the kernels off a fresh corn cob, use a sharp knife to slice from top to bottom, avoiding the cob itself as much as possible. Alternatively use a corn stripper.
Use any type of freshwater fish with firm white flesh. Adjust steaming time in step 4 according to the texture and thickness of the fish fillets.
Use any type of freshwater fish with firm white flesh. Adjust steaming time in step 4 according to the texture and thickness of the fish fillets.

title: Melon and Cucumber Sour (Mocktail)
ingredients: 400 g cantaloupe melon, flesh only, cut in pieces, plus extra in balls for serving
200 g cucumbers, peeled, cut in pieces
5 g fresh basil leaves, plus extra for serving
steps: Place melon, cucumber, basil, lemon juice, lime juice, egg white and ice cubes in mixing bowl then blend 20 sec/speed 9.

Add agave syrup and tonic water then mix 10 sec/speed 6. Fill half of each glass with ice cubes. Divide melon and cucumber sour between glasses. Serve immediately, garnished with melon balls, lime zest and basil leaves.

title: Kimchi risotto
ingredients: 20 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
160 g risotto rice, e.g Canaroli, Arborio
½ tsp chicken stock paste  o ½ chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l) (see Variation)
sesame seeds, any colour, for sprinkling
steps: Place Parmesan in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, leek, kimchi and onions in mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add oil and bacon (if using) then sauté 3 min 50 sec/120°C//speed 0.5.
Add rice and cook without measuring cup 2 min/100°C//speed 1. Scrape base of mixing bowl with spatula to loosen rice.
Add water, soy sauce, sugar, stock paste, salt and pepper then cook 12 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add half reserved Parmesan and butter. Stir gently with spatula then insert measuring cup and leave to stand in mixing bowl for 2 minutes.
Serve immediately, sprinkled with remaining grated Parmesan, spring onions and sesame seeds.
tips: Replace chicken stock paste or cube with the same amount of vegetable stock paste or cube.

title: Miso fish with green beans and chickpea puree
ingredients: 2 tbsp white wine  o 2 tbsp sake
4 white fish fillets, skinless, boneless (approx. 200 g each)
30 g vegetable oil, plus extra for greasing
200 g fresh shiitake mushrooms, sliced (1 cm)  o 200 g fresh mushrooms, sliced (1 cm)
800 g canned chickpeas, drained (approx. 500 g after draining)
10 g fresh ginger root, cut in slices (2 mm)
300 g green beans, fresh or frozen
steps: Place miso paste, sugar, honey, white wine, soy sauce, and 1 tbsp sesame oil in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Place fish fillets in a large bowl. Coat fish with marinade using a pastry brush, cover and place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 240°C. Grease a large baking dish with vegetable oil.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in mushrooms. Add remaining 3 tbsp sesame oil and stir well.

Place mushrooms in baking dish and place marinated fish fillets on top. Gently wipe off any excess marinade from fish fillets. Place baking dish in oven and bake for 15-20 minutes (240°C) or until golden brown. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.

Place drained chickpeas, water, vegetable oil, salt and ginger in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position and weigh in green beans. Cover with Varoma lid and steam 15 min/100°C/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Divide chickpea puree between serving plates. Place one fish fillet on each plate, add baked mushrooms and steamed green beans and serve immediately.

title: Gorgonzola gelato with sautéed pears and toasted walnuts
ingredients: 150 g Gorgonzola, dolce (soft), cut in pieces
400 g pears (with firm flesh, e.g. Corella, Williams), cored and deseeded, cut in pieces (3 cm)
finely chopped walnuts, toasted, for garnishing (opcional)
steps: Place 150 g sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolks, gorgonzola and 100 g milk then start Thicken /80°C.

Add remaining 320 g milk, cream and salt then heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Clean mixing bowl.
Place clarified butter, pears and sugar in mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. .
Add brandy, cardamom and allspice then reduce without measuring cup 5 min/Varoma//speed . Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool completely.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream to a container and freeze for approx. 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved.
Serve gorgonzola ice cream with sautéed pears, sprinkled with toasted walnuts.

title: Chocolate and chilli gelato with whiskey syrup
ingredients: 1 dried red chilli (see tip and variation)
100 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, in pieces
30 g maple syrup (opcional)  o 30 g honey (opcional)
steps: Place sugar and chili in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7.
Add prepared chilli sugar, egg yolks, cocoa powder, milk and salt then start Thicken /80°C.

Add cream and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.

Place whiskey, sugar, water, maple syrup, salt, cinnamon and vanilla extract in mixing bowl then reduce without measuring cup 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl, allow to cool completely and refrigerate until needed.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 15 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to a container.

Place remaining pieces of ice cream in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and smooth surface with spatula. Freeze for approx. 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved. Serve drizzled with whiskey syrup.
tips: Always check the spiciness of dried chilli used. Adjust the level of spiciness to your preference.
Replace dried bird's eye chilli with 2-3 pinches cayenne pepper.
Replace bourbon whiskey with any type of whisky according to your preference.

title: Beetroot and goat cheese ice cream with crackers
ingredients: 300 g soft goat cheese, in pieces
250 g cooked beetroot, cut in pieces
steps: Place 150 g sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolks and 260 g milk then start Thicken /80°C.

Add remaining 140 g milk, cream, goat cheese and 1 pinch salt then heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.

Place flour, olive oil, sesame seeds, balsamic vinegar and ¼ tsp salt in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer to work surface, shape into a ball, cover with a large bowl or wrap in cling film and leave to rest for approx. 20 minutes. Clean mixing bowl.
Place beetroot in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add water, lemon juice and remaining 2-3 pinches salt then cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.

Preheat oven to 200°C. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough between two sheets of baking paper into a circle (approx. 3 mm thick). Carefully transfer rolled out dough onto a baking tray. Remove top sheet of baking paper and prick dough with a fork. Using a round cookie cutter (Ø 5 cm), cut out approx. 35 crackers. Carefully remove dough around cut out crackers. Bake crackers for approx. 10 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown (see Tip). Allow to cool completely.
Blend beetroot sauce 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool completely. Refrigerate until needed.

Place frozen ice cream mixture in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) using a long sharp knife. Place half the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream to a container.

Place remaining frozen ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and smooth surface with spatula. Using a spoon, add 1 tbsp prepared beetroot sauce and slowly mix it into ice cream. Repeat with remaining beetroot sauce and freeze for approx. 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved. Serve with crackers.
tips: After baking first batch of crackers, transfer them to a plate. Place remaining cracker dough on the same baking tray and bake for 10 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown and crisp. Allow to cool completely. Place in mixing bowl and crush 5 sec/speed 10. Use as a sprinkle for ice cream, as addition to granola or with yoghurt.

title: Wholegrain Easter bread with eggs and smoked trout
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh dill, (approx. 20 g), leaves only
100 g red onions, halved, plus extra for garnish, cut in rings
560 g wholemeal flour, plus extra for dusting
water, to fill to 1 l mark
150 g smoked trout fillets, cut in pieces
steps: Place dill and red onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place milk, honey and fresh yeast in mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add prepared onion-dill mixture, wholemeal flour, egg, butter and salt then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer to a bowl and leave to rise until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.

Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Medium hard. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool completely, peel and cut in quarters then set aside.
Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer prepared dough to a lightly floured surface and divide into 3 pieces. Roll each piece into a rope (approx. 75 cm). Join 3 ropes at one end, plait keeping braid tight and join all 3 ropes again at other end. Place plait onto prepared baking tray, tuck pinched ends at both sides of bread under to keep secured and form a wreath (approx. Ø 30 cm). Cover with cling film and leave to rise in a warm place for a further 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 180°C.
Brush with egg yolk and bake for approx. 30 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown (see Tip).

Transfer Easter bread onto a serving platter and allow to cool completely. Place mixed salad leaves, prepared eggs and smoked trout fillets in the middle. Drizzle with lemon juice, garnish with reserved red onion rings then season with freshly ground black pepper and serve.
tips: Cover wholegrain Easter bread with aluminium foil if it turns too dark before the end of baking time.

title: Piggy buns
ingredients: 1 tsp citric acid  o 30 g lemon juice
steps: Place milk, fresh yeast and 20 g sugar in mixing bowl then warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add flour, salt, remaining 30 g sugar, egg and butter and knead Dough /2 min. Meanwhile, line Varoma dish with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish and set aside.
Place 250 g water and citric acid in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /1 h/40°C.

Transfer dough to a floured surface and divide into 9 equal pieces. Shape into balls and place 8 pieces on prepared baking tray. Divide remaining ball in two halves. Divide one half into 8 pieces and remaining half into 16 pieces. Shape 8 pieces into noses and remaining 16 small pieces into ears.

Attach ears to upper part of each ball. Attach nose to front of each ball and press down lightly. Stick 2 pine nuts into nose to create nostrils and place two cranberries above the nose to create eyes. Repeat with remaining pieces of dough, cranberries and pine nuts.

Preheat oven to 200°C. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Whisk egg yolk with 1 tbsp water and brush buns using a pastry brush. Bake for 15 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool and serve warm or cold.
tips: Create other animal shapes like hedgehogs or bunnies.

title: Caterpillar chocolate roll
ingredients: 100 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, in pieces
steps: Place a small bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in flour and baking powder and set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add eggs and whisk 6 min/speed 3.

Sieve reserved flour and baking powder into mixing bowl then mix 15 sec/speed 2.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer batter to prepared baking tray. Gently smooth out cake batter into corners. Bake for 10-11 minutes (180°C) or until golden. Allow to cool for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add cream and melt 2 min/50°C/speed 3.

Place a sheet of baking paper on top of slightly cooled cake, then place a chopping board on it. Hold both sides of baking tray and chopping board and carefully turn cake over. Remove baking tray and place a clean, damp tea towel on the baking paper sticking to the cake. Leave to rest for approx. 5 minutes or until the baking paper is slightly humid and soft. Remove tea towel and gently peel off baking paper from cake.

Spread chocolate ganache evenly over cake using spatula. Starting from the short end and using baking paper to assist, roll up the cake to form a log, then place it seam down on a serving plate. Refrigerate for 2 hours.
Place milk chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula then melt 2 min/50°C/speed 3.

Using a sharp knife, cut off 1 slice (approx. 3 cm) to form the head of the caterpillar, but keep it close to the roll. Cover the roll, including the head, with melted chocolate using spatula. Once done, place the slice for the head flat and cover the face with chocolate. Decorate the roll with sprinkles and use candies to make caterpillar's eyes and mouth. Put head back in place and stick 2 lollipops on top for antennae. Refrigerate for 10-15 min.
Cut caterpillar in 7 slices and serve immediately or store in refrigerator.
tips: Choose your favourite sweets and candies to decorate the caterpillar.

title: Lemongrass and mint prosecco
ingredients: 100 g lemon grass, cut in pieces (approx. 5 cm)
1 lime, cut in slices, to garnish
steps: Place sugar, lemon grass and water in mixing bowl and cook 20 min/Varoma//speed 1 without measuring cup. Leave to infuse in mixing bowl for 10 minutes.
Insert simmering basket, hold it in place using spatula and strain syrup into a sterilised glass bottle. Allow syrup to cool completely.
Divide ice cubes between 6 wine glasses. Add 2 tsp lemongrass syrup and top off with Prosecco. Serve garnished with 1-2 lime slices and fresh mint leaves.
tips: Store remaining lemongrass syrup in refrigerator.

title: Caramel Doughnuts
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar, honey, butter, 60 g cream, 45 g water and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .
Add remaining 105 g cream and mix without measuring cup 2 min/speed 2.

Cook without measuring cup 2 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer half of the caramel to a small bowl and allow to cool. Transfer remaining caramel to an air-tight container, allow to cool and store in refrigerator (see tip).
Place vinegar and remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl then start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
Place dried yeast, 100 g flour and 100 g milk in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 2. Allow mixture to rest for 1 hour in mixing bowl, until bubbles form.
Add remaining flour and milk, egg, brown sugar, butter, salt and vanilla and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and allow to rise for approx. 2 hours.
Preheat oven to (180°C). Line a baking tray with baking paper.

Roll out dough to 1 cm thickness on a pastry board. Cut out circles using a cookie cutter (Ø 8 cm), then cut a smaller circle in the centre of each. Transfer doughnuts to a baking sheet lined with baking paper and allow to rise for 1.5 hours.
Bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C), removing from oven before doughnuts brown too much. Allow to cool completely.
To glaze doughnuts, pour caramel over doughnuts using a spoon, then sprinkle with chopped hazelnuts, leave to dry and serve.
tips: Use remaining caramel to prepare ice cream, iced coffee, pies or muffins.
Unglazed doughnuts will remain soft for several days when stored in a sealed plastic bag. Glaze just before serving.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.

title: Cheese mousse
ingredients: 1 bunch mixed fresh herbs (Parsley, marjoram, thyme, sage, basil, mint), the leaves washed and dried
steps: Place garlic and fine herbs into mixing bowl into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream cheese, ricotta, salt and pepper, blend 30 sec/speed 5. Serve as preferred with small squares of toasted bread, or white celery and red radicchio leaves.
tips: Use the same method to make half portions.
Use the same method to make half portions.
These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.
These mousses are also delicious with steamed or boiled potatoes, julienne vegetables or crackers.
Will keep 2-3 days in a refrigerator.

title: Plum slice
ingredients: 350 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place milk, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and heat 2 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add flour, butter, egg and salt, knead 2 min/ and allow to rise in closed mixing bowl for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Knead pastry again 1 min/. Transfer dough to a floured worksurface. Roll out to baking tray size, transfer to lined baking tray and shape a crust.

Mix icing sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl. Lay plum halves tightly in a tiled form with inner surface facing upwards and press into pastry. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar and bake in preheated oven for approx. 35 minutes (200°C).
Allow pie to cool on baking tray, cut into 20 slices ad serve lukewarm or cold.
tips: Serve plum slices with whipped cream.
Serve plum slices with whipped cream.

title: Xerém maize meal with fresh tuna
ingredients: 400 g fresh tuna, without skin and bones, cut in cubes (3 cm)
½ tsp ground dried piri piri chilli
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in tuna. Season with ½ tsp salt and piri piri chilli and set aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in maize meal and set aside.
Place onions and lard in mixing bowl then chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add reserved marinated tuna and cook 7 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place coconut milk and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl and cook 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Remove simmering basket and cook 2 min/100°C/speed 4, while adding reserved maize meal through hole in mixing bowl lid. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Cook 15 min/100°C/speed 4. Transfer xerém onto a serving plate and place tuna on top. Serve immediately.
tips: Leftover maize meal is delicious fried in a little olive oil.
Replace tuna with 400 g fresh swordfish

title: Mozambican chicken curry
ingredients: 20 g fresh ginger root, cut in slices
1200 g chicken, cut in pieces (approx. 1 whole chicken, see tip)
1 pinch piri piri chilli, dried, ground
steps: Place onions, garlic cloves, ginger root and oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add chicken, coconut cream and salt, mix with spatula and cook 20 min/100°C//speed .
Add coconut milk and piri piri chilli and cook 3 min/100°C//speed . Serve garnished with chopped coriander.
tips: Mozambican curry, unlike Indian curry, does not use similar spices such as saffron and curry powder.

To cut the whole chicken into pieces, ensure that you have a sharp knife and have washed your hands. Begin by removing the legs, and cutting them into two pieces at the joint. Now remove each wing by making a cut in the breast near to the wing, this piece of breast meat will keep the wings together. Now remove the breast - cut along the side of the breast bone and cut down keeping as close to the bone as you can. It is easier to make long slicing movements here, and you will not leave as much meat on the bone. Now remove the ‘oysters', two small pieces of meat on the backside, just alongside the backbone.
Reserve the chicken carcass to make stock. If not using straight away, freeze for later use.

title: Black nougat
ingredients: orange zest, from one organic orange
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C.

Place almonds on a baking tray and bake for 10 minutes (180°C). Meanwhile line a square cake tin (22 x 22 cm) with baking paper. Cut two sheets of wafer paper in the size of the tin and place one in it.
Place honey in mixing bowl and cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Add roasted almonds and orange zest and cook 30 min/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer to prepared tin and distribute it evenly over the entire surface using an angled spatula. Cover with the second sheet of wafer paper and press lightly with your hand so that the mixture sticks to the sheet. Allow to rest for 2 hours at room temperature. Remove the nougat from the tin, then cut it into small pieces using a very sharp knife. Serve immediately or keep in a sealed box at room temperature.
tips: Black nougat is a speciality of Provence and is one of the 13 Provençal Christmas desserts.
Sheets of wafer paper or rice paper can be found in specialised shops or can be ordered on the Internet.
The air temperature can affect the success of this recipe. It is best to avoid making it on a hot day, choose a cooler day for the best result.

title: Provençal alouettes
ingredients: 15 g fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
8 beef slices, sliced very thin (taken from a silverside)
steps: Place garlic cloves and parsley in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula. Transfer 2 tbsp chopped parsley in a bowl and set aside.
Add bacon cubes and chop 20 sec/speed 6.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Distribute the filling over the beef slices, roll them up to form the alouettes and fasten them using cooking string, then set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add 15 g olive oil and reserved chopped parsley and sauté, without measuring cup 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile heat remaining 15 g olive oil in a frying pan on the stove, brown the alouettes and set aside.

Add chopped tomatoes, thyme, bay leaf, 1 tsp salt, 3 pinches white pepper, wine and water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, add potatoes in it and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile arrange 4 sheets of baking paper on a work surface and add on each sheet 2 alouettes. Spread the olives, ½ tsp salt and the remaining 4 pinches white pepper over the 4 beef alouettes, then set aside.

Remove simmering basket and set the potatoes aside. Place 4 tbsp of sauce on each prepared alouette, then close up pouches and arrange them in Varoma dish and tray. Set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and add juice from the alouettes to mixing bowl. Transfer the meat and the potatoes to a container and keep warm.
Set simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing and reduce the sauce 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve alouettes with potatoes and sauce.
tips: For melt-in-the-mouth alouettes, ask your butcher for silverside cut into fairly thin slices, almost as if for a carpaccio.
Take the beef out of the refrigerator at least an hour before you prepare the dish, it will be all the more tender!

title: Olive oil cake (Pompes à l'huile)
ingredients: 80 g orange flower water, to taste
15 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 1 ½ tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)
650 g wheat flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place water, orange flower water, yeast, flour, salt, sugar and olive oil in mixing bowl and knead 8 min/.

Transfer to a floured work surface. Divide dough in 2 pieces, flatten each piece with the palm of the hand in order to obtain an oval shape. Make 5 grooves, one lengthwise down the centre and 2 horizontal on either side of the two cakes. Lay the pompes à l’huile on a baking tray lined with baking paper, cover with a tea towel and leave to rise for 1-2 hours in a warm draught-free place.
Preheat oven to 180°C.

Place a small heat-resistant bowl filled with water in the bottom of the oven. Place prepared tray in the oven and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until the pompes à l'huile are golden brown. Keep them wrapped in a tea towel and serve at room temperature.
tips: The tradition of the 13 desserts eaten on Christmas night still exists in Provence. The pompe à l'huile is one of these delicacies.
Placing a dish of water in the oven encourages a softer crust on the outside of the bread

title: Sweet buns (Navettes)
ingredients: 500 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place plain flour, caster sugar, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add eggs, orange flower water, butter and water and mix 2 min/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and allow to rest in refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line 3 baking trays with baking paper and set aside.

Transfer dough onto a floured work surface and divide in 4 pieces. Roll each piece into a 30 cm sausage, then divide each of these into 7-8 pieces, making about 30 in total. To shape each piece into a boat shape, roll into a ball, and pinch each end out into the shape. Make a very visible incision down the middle lengthwise so that it does not close up during baking. Shape remaining balls and arrange navettes on prepared trays.
Use a pastry brush to brush the navettes with milk and bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C) (the navettes must stay pale). Serve the navettes warm or keep them in an air-tight container.
tips: The Provençal navette is traditionally eaten at Candlemas. Crepes are very popular in France, Provence has always preferred this pastry, created in 1871. The boat shape is a reminder of the boat that Saint Marie is believed to have arrived in the Provencal coast.
The navettes will keep for up to one week in an airtight container.

title: Cherry and almond clafoutis pudding
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Grease an ovenproof baking dish and set aside.

Place almond milk, eggs, sugar, flour, almond extract and vanilla extract in mixing bowl and mix 40 sec/speed 4. Transfer mixture to prepared dish. Arrange the cherries on top and bake for 1 hour (150°C).
Cool the clafoutis at room temperature, before refrigerating for around 2 hours. Serve cold, sprinkled with icing sugar.
tips: If you make this clafoutis during the cherry season (June, July or August), replace the canned cherries with very ripe, soft fruit.

This clafoutis is particularly tasty made with canned amarena cherries. This variety is a small Italian morello cherry, brown in colour, which is grown mainly in the Modena region. It is widely used in chocolate-based desserts.

title: Mussels with crème fraiche and herbs (Mouclade)
ingredients: 100 g Pineau de Charentes  o 100 g Sherry
steps: Place shallots and parsley in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6.
Add butter and sauté without measuring cup 4 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add Pineau de Charentes and pepper. Set Varoma dish in position and add mussels in it. Close Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and keep warm. Strain the cooking water using a fine sieve above a bowl.

Place cooking water, crème fraîche and egg yolks in mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 10, then heat 3 min/80°C/speed 3. Meanwhile, remove one of the 2 shells from each mussel. Keep the mussels in their shells in the Varoma to keep hot. Serve the mussels in shallow dishes, and spoon over the sauce.
tips: Pineau is a speciality of western France, it is a rich golden fortified wine, approx 17% ABV, made from grape must.
If you are short of time, omit the stage of removing one shell from each mussel, and simply leave the mussels in the whole shell.
This recipe can also be prepared with 1500 g clams.
Regular mussels can be used if the Bouchot variety is not available.

title: Mixed berry jam tart
ingredients: 500 g mixed berries, fresh (e.g raspberries, blackberries, blueberries) (see tip)
1 vanilla pod, split lengthways, seeds scraped
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
150 g butter, chilled, cut into pieces
30 g shredded coconut, toasted, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Using a vegetable peeler, remove lemon zest and set aside. Remove white pith from lemon flesh and set flesh aside separate to the zest.
Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then grate 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mixed berries, reserved lemon flesh, brown sugar and split vanilla bean and seeds and cook 25 min/100°C/speed 1.
Cook for a further 10-15 min/Varoma/speed 2, until setting point is reached (see tip), placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Allow jam to cool in mixing bowl, remove vanilla pod, then pour into an air-tight container and store in refrigerator until needed. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a tart tin (Ø 25 cm) and set aside.
Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate 20 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat grating 20 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add plain flour, egg yolks, caster sugar, salt and 150 g butter and mix 10 sec/speed 5, then knead Dough /20 sec. Wrap pastry in cling film and place in refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Roll out ⅔ of the pastry onto floured work surface. Line prepared tart tin with rolled out pastry, then place pastry case into refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes. Wrap remaining ⅓ of the pastry in cling film and place back into refrigerator to rest.
Remove tart tin from refrigerator and spoon mixed berry jam into pastry case. Roll out remaining ⅓ pastry, then using a pastry cutter, cut into strips (1 cm wide).
Place pastry strips in a criss-cross pattern over the top of the tart case, spacing each strip 4 cm apart. Brush pastry with milk and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until pastry is golden.
Allow tart to cool before sprinkling with toasted coconut (optional) and serving.
tips: You can use any berries in this recipe except strawberries. Due to their high water content, strawberries are not recommended as this will affect the setting and consistency of your jam.
Try using any jam of choice to fill this tart (e.g. apricot, citrus marmalade, rhubarb)
Setting point test: place a saucer into the freezer until chilled. Place 1 tsp jam onto chilled saucer. If set, jam will quickly form a gel consistency.

title: Vegetable fideuá
ingredients: 1 chilli, dried, without stalk and seeds
100 g green pepper, cut into small pieces
100 g red pepper, cut into small pieces
250 g green asparagus, without the hard part and chopped into 2-3 cm pieces
150 g ripe tomatoes, cut into small pieces
½ tsp food colouring, yellow (see tip)
2 stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)  o 1 - 2 tsp salt
steps: Place garlic, onion, chilli pepper, green pepper, red pepper and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Sauté 7 min/120°C//speed .
Add asparagus and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add mushrooms, tomatoes, saffron and colouring and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .
Add water and stock cubes and stir 8 min/100°C//speed .
Add noodles and peas and stir 7 min/100°C//speed 1. Pour into a bowl, let stand for 5 minutes and serve immediately.
tips: You can use 1/2 tsp of Kurkuma instead of food colouring.

title: Clams marinières
ingredients: 150 g fish broth  o 150 g water with 1 tsp of salt
2 tsp fresh parsley, chopped, only the leaves
steps: Place onion, garlic and extra virgin olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, place clams into Varoma dish and rinse them with warm water. Set aside.
Add paprika, white wine and fish broth into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and steam 14 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Set Varoma aside. Add parsley, breadcrumbs and salt. Mix 10 sec/speed 2. Place clams in a serving dish, pour sauce over clams and serve immediately.

title: Seafood rice
steps: Place clams in salted water so that they release all of the sand (approx. 30 minutes).

Shell prawns (set the meat aside) and place the shells, the heads and the water into mixing bowl. Wash the clams with hot water. Put the Varoma into position, insert the clams and cover with the Varoma lid. Steam 14 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside without removing the Varoma lid. Strain the stock with a fine mesh strainer and set aside. Rinse the mixing bowl and mixing bowl lid well.
Place garlic, chopped tomatoes, red and green pepper and olive oil in the mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add rice and sauté 2 min/120°C//speed .

Add half of the parsley, saffron, salt, white wine, orange juice and set aside stock, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid to aid evaporation and avoid spattering and cook 13 min/100°C//speed 1.

When the cooking is finished add the meat of the prawns into mixing bowl and stir with spatula. Transfer the clams to a serving bowl. Pour the rice over the clams and stir lightly with the spatula. Garnish with the remaining chopped parsley and serve immediately.

title: Mustard and dill vinaigrette
ingredients: 100 g extra virgin olive oil, smooth
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid to weigh the olive oil. Set aside.
Place salt, brown sugar, vinegar and mustard into mixing bowl. Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 4. Gradually pour olive oil onto mixing bowl lid.
Add dill and mix 5 sec/speed 3. Pour into a sauceboat or a jar and refrigerate until use.
tips: Ideal as an accompaniment for salmon.
Ideal as an accompaniment for salmon.

title: Artichokes Romana
ingredients: 1 bunch parsley, leaves washed and dried
steps: Clean artichokes, removing the toughest leaves and the inner choke, leaving artichoke heads whole. Slice off tips of the leaves (about 3 cm) and stalk (leaving the stem). Leave artichokes to soak in a bowl with water and lemon juice (keeping aside a spoonful), so they do not turn black. Add peel of the squeezed lemon too.
Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Without washing it, place clove of garlic into mixing bowl with the peeled, chopped artichoke stalks, the set aside spoonful of lemon juice, a pinch of salt, and 20g oil. Chop 5 sec/speed 4. Fill the heart of the artichokes with this mixture, pressing down firmly.
Place wine, water and vegetable stock cube into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and add the artichokes with the stems upward. Cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil and sprinkle with remaining parsley, and serve hot.

title: Coffee Liqueur
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and pulverize 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add coffee and vanilla seeds. Mix 20 sec/speed 3. Leave to cool into mixing bowl for at least 30 minutes.
Add alcohol and mix 5 sec/speed 2. Bottle and store in a dark place for at least 1 month before serving.
tips: We recommend leaving the bottled liqueur to rest for at least 30 days before consuming, so the flavour is more balanced.
We recommend leaving the bottled liqueur to rest for at least 30 days before consuming, so the flavour is more balanced.
Chocolate liqueur: replace the coffee with 500 g of milk and add 100 g of bitter cocoa powder. At Step 1, place milk, sugar and cocoa powder in the mixing bowl and cook 15 min/90 °C/speed 4.
Chocolate liqueur: replace the coffee with 500 g of milk and add 100 g of bitter cocoa powder. At Step 1, place milk, sugar and cocoa powder in the mixing bowl and cook 15 min/90 °C/speed 4.

title: Lamb loin with pink peppercorn sauce
ingredients: 60 g shallots (approx. 2 shallots), peeled and cut into halves
220 g water, plus 1 tbsp extra to deglaze frying pan
½ tsp meat stock paste, homemade, to taste (see tip)  o ½ meat stock cube (for 0.5 l)
2 tsp pink peppercorns  o 2 tsp pickled green peppercorns
300 g potatoes (small), unpeeled, washed and cut into pieces (2 x 2 cm)
700 g lamb loin, boneless (cut into pieces of 6-8 cm)
150 - 200 g green asparagus, trimmed and cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
steps: Place butter, shallots and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, and sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Add water, stock paste and 1 tsp peppercorns into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in potatoes and cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, place a large oiled frying pan over medium-high heat and season lamb with salt and pepper. Once the pan is hot, sear lamb on both sides (approx. 1-2 minutes each side) until lightly browned.

Transfer seared lamb into Varoma dish and onto Varoma tray and set Varoma aside. Place 1 tbsp water into hot frying pan and stir over heat to de-glaze the pan. Turn off heat and allow pan to cool on stove top.

Arrange asparagus and carrots around seared lamb in Varoma dish and on Varoma tray, place Varoma into position and cook 4 min/Varoma/speed 1. Lamb will be cooked medium-rare. If desired, continue cooking until lamb, asparagus, carrots and potatoes are cooked to your liking.
Transfer lamb, vegetables and potatoes onto a serving plate or large bowl and cover to rest and keep warm. The lamb will continue to cook as it rests. Reserve stock in mixing bowl.
In the measuring cup, combine whisky and corn starch together, and set aside.
Add remaining 1 tsp peppercorns, cream, reserved pan juices and reserved whisky and corn starch mixture to stock in mixing bowl and reduce 10-12 min/90°C//speed , without measuring cup.
Slice lamb and serve with potatoes, carrots and asparagus, drizzled with pink peppercorn sauce.
tips: Pink peppercorns can be found at specialty grocery stores.
Use small potatoes such as new potatoes or fingerlings.

title: Jacket potato mice
ingredients: 60 g medium-hard cheese, cut into pieces (e. g. Cheddar)
6 spaghetti strands, broken into 3 cm lengths, for garnish
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C and line a baking tray with foil.
Slice approx. 5 mm off the top of each potato then cut a cross into potato flesh without cutting the skin. Place prepared potatoes onto baking tray and bake for 50-60 minutes (200°C).
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 8.
Using an oven glove to hold potato, spoon out flesh, leaving about 1 cm flesh on skin so potato holds its shape, then transfer potato flesh to mixing bowl.
Add butter and chives then mix 20 sec/speed 4.
Spoon potato mixture back into skins then garnish with carrots for ears, peas for eyes and nose and spaghetti for whiskers.
Return to oven to warm through for 10 minutes (200°C). Serve hot.

title: Aubergine mille-feuille with yoghurt and mustard sauce
ingredients: 30 g slivered almonds, toasted, for decoration
steps: Place water into mixing bowl and heat 13 min/100°C/speed . Meanwhile, make a cross cut at the base of tomatoes and place 3 tomatoes in simmering basket.
Insert simmering basket and blanch tomatoes 1 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set tomatoes aside.
Insert simmering basket with the other 3 tomatoes and blanch 1 min/100°C/speed 1. Peel all blanched tomatoes, cut into 4 pieces and remove seeds. Place on Varoma tray and set aside.

Wash aubergines and cut into slices of approx. 1 cm thick (allow 2 slices per person). Put into Varoma dish, place Varoma tray with tomatoes, cover and place Varoma into position. Steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and let it cool. Drain and rinse mixing bowl.

Cut mozzarella into 12 slices of approx. 5 mm thick. On a plate, make layers starting with one slice of aubergine, two of tomato and one of mozzarella. Continue with another slice of aubergine, two of tomato and one of mozzarella. Finish by placing a slice of smoked salmon on top. Repeat for the remaining servings.

Prepare the sauce by placing natural yoghurt, mustard and olive oil into mixing bowl. Mix 10 sec/speed 5. Pour some of the sauce over each mille-feuille and the rest into a sauce boat. Garnish with a fresh basil leaf and a few slices of toasted almonds. Sprinkle each mille-feuille with a little olive oil and serve.
tips: Nutritional comments: This dish stands out for proteins of high biological value that the mozzarella, smoked salmon and yoghurt contribute.

title: Spicy turkey skewers
ingredients: 500 g turkey meat, boneless, skinless  o 500 g chicken breast fillet, skinless
1 tsp yeast extract (e.g. Bovril®, Cenovis®, Marmite®)
4 pieces orange zest, no white part (1,5 x 5 cm)
30 g brown sugar  o 30 g sugar
steps: Immerse 24 wooden skewer sticks in cold water for 30 minutes. Cut turkey in thin strips of 2 x 10 cm and of 5 mm thickness. Skewer each strip of turkey onto skewer stick passing through the meat several times so that it is flat along the stick. Place all skewers in airtight container and set aside.
Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7.

Add cayenne peppers, peanuts, peppercorns, yeast extract, orange peel, orange juice, sherry, brown sugar, paprika, vinegar and soy sauce and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Pour mixture over turkey skewers. Leave to marinate in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

Strain skewers reserving the marinade. Pour the reserved marinade into mixing bowl and place Varoma dish into position. Place skewers inside, some perpendicular to others. Cover Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and place skewers on a hot dish. Pour sauce over skewers and serve immediately.
tips: Check that the sauce is well reduced. If not, cook again 2-3 min/Varoma/speed 2 without the measuring cup.

title: Stuffed veggie snails
ingredients: 20 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g fresh baby spinach, washed and dried
steps: Line Varoma tray with a sheet of baking paper that has been moistened and squeezed, making sure that some holes remain unobstructed.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl, grate 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer grated cheese into a bowl and set aside.
Break egg into bowl with grated Parmesan, mix with a pinch of salt and beat with a fork
Pour egg mixture into Varoma tray prepared earlier and set aside. Place carrots into Varoma dish.

Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket into position and arrange spinach inside. Place Varoma into position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. When cooking time has ended, remove lid of the Varoma, turn over and place Varoma tray on top of lid.
Transfer omelette to a flat plate, top with ham and squeezed spinach, roll up and cut into slices (2-3 cm).
Cut carrots into flat and square strips as wide as the omelette slices (2-3 cm).
Place carrot strips on the plate and arrange omelette slices on top.
Insert 2 rosemary leaves into each bean to create the antennae. Position the bean on the carrot to create the head of the snail.
Serve immediately.
tips: To make the presentation on the plate more appealing and playful, you can create scenes out of vegetables: hedges made of salad leaves, trees created with broccoli florets, flowers made from carrot discs - let your imagination run wild!

To make the presentation on the plate more appealing and playful, you can create scenes out of vegetables: hedges made of salad leaves, trees created with broccoli florets, flowers made from carrot discs - let your imagination run wild!

title: Lasagna rolls
ingredients: 25 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
150 g frozen spinach leaves, defrosted and squeezed
steps: Soak the lasagne sheets in tepid water for 20 minutes. Move them now and then to prevent them from sticking together
Meanwhile, place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add spinach, salt, pepper and nutmeg and cook 4 min/120°C/speed 1.
Combine ricotta, Parmesan cheese and egg, chop 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a dish and set aside.
Preheat the oven to 200°C with the grill function. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Strain the lasagne sheets well and lay them on a clean cloth. Distribute 2-3 tablespoons of the filling along the long side of the lasagne sheet and roll up. Cut the roll into 3 parts and arrange the smaller rolls on the prepared tray. Top each roll with 1-2 tablespoons of tomato passata and sprinkle with mozzarella and oregano.
Cook in a hot oven for 10 minutes (200°C). Remove from the oven, pierce each roll with a small skewer and serve.

title: Protein pudding
ingredients: 50 g unsalted pistachio nuts, shelled and peeled
1 gelatine leaf, soaked in cold water for 10-15 minutes
steps: Place pistachios into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Set 1 tbsp aside to garnish.
Add sugar and grind 30 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and turn over the mixture with spatula.
Add 20 g milk and mix 1 min/speed 4, until it achieves the consistency of cream.
Add the remaining milk, protein powder, strained gelatine and bitter cocoa and cook 6 min/90°C/speed 2.
Moisten 3 ramekins (Ø 6 cm) and pour in the mixture. Cover with transparent film and leave to cool completely.
When cool, return the moulds to the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.
Just before serving, turn out puddings onto individual plates and decorate with the reserved chopped pistachios.

title: Chicken in peach sauce
ingredients: 120 g onions, cut into halves (approx. 2 onions)
500 g chicken breast fillets, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place onion in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken fillets and sauté 3 min/120°C//speed .
Add |400 g water, stock cube and 2 tsp curry powder and cook 10 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, drain peaches, retaining syrup. Cut peach halves into bite-sized pieces.
In a small bowl, mix starch with 40 g water.
Add starch, cream, 150 g peach syrup, 1–2 tsp curry powder, salt, pepper and paprika to mixing bowl, and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add peaches, stir 1 min/100°C//speed , season to taste and serve immediately
tips: Accompany with leaf salad and rice, potatoes (cooked separately) or fresh crispy bread.

title: Hazelnut ice cream
steps: Place hazelnuts in mixing bowl and chop coarsely 5 sec/speed 6.
Add milk, cream and 100 g sugar, bring to boil 6 min/100°C/speed 2 and leave to infuse in mixing bowl for 1 hour. Pass through a sieve lined with cheese cloth into a bowl and set aside.
Place 50 g sugar and egg yolks in mixing bowl and whisk until creamy 30 sec/speed 3.5.

Add lukewarm milk mixture and whisk until creamy 6 min/80°C/speed 4. Transfer mixture to ice cube trays and allow to cool at room temperature before freezing. Allow to freeze for approx. 4 hours (ideally overnight).
Place frozen ice cream cubes in mixing bowl and crush 5 sec/speed 6. Then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula until creamy. Use ice cream scoop to shape into balls and serve.
tips: If you do not have enough ice cube trays, the mixture can also be transferred to shallow freezable conatiners (e.g. plastic, silicone) in step 4 and frozen.

title: Crispy olives
ingredients: 250 g medium-hard cheese, mature, cut into pieces (3 cm) (e.g. Gruyère or Gouda)
120 g butter, cold, cut into pieces
200 g green stuffed olives, well drained
steps: Place gouda in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10.
Add flour, butter, salt and paprika powder and knead 1 min 30 sec/. Shape pastry into a roll (Ø 3 cm) and chill for approx. 1 hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 220°C and line baking tray.
