Cut pastry into slices 1 cm thick. Place an olive on each slice and shape into a ball. Place pastry balls on baking tray, bake for approx. 15 minutes (220°C) and serve hot or cold.
tips: The cheese is easier to grate if slightly frozen.
The cheese is easier to grate if slightly frozen.
Use olives stuffed with red pepper, garlic or almonds.
Use olives stuffed with red pepper, garlic or almonds.

title: Indian mustard
ingredients: 250 g mustard seeds, white or yellow
steps: Place mustard seeds in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place orange juice, vinegar and sugar in mixing bowl and bring to boil 8 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add cumin, curry powder, ginger, cinnamon, turmeric, salt and mustard flour and stir 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to 2 jam jars with twist-off lids (each 500 g) and close firmly. Store Indian mustard in a cool, dry place.
tips: To ensure the mustard keeps for as long as possible, wash the jars thoroughly and dry in a warm oven or wash in the dishwasher. Transfer the mustard to the jars while they are still warm.
Unopened, the mustard can keep up to 6 months if stored in a cool, dry place.
The mustard tastes best if allowed to steep for 2 weeks before use.
Store in the refrigerator after opening.

title: Aubergine papeton with tomato coulis
ingredients: 1000 g aubergines, cut in pieces (approx. 3 cm)
100 g white onions, cut in halves
600 g ripe tomatoes, cut in halves
steps: Place 500 g aubergines in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 500 g aubergines in mixing bowl and chop again 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to the bowl with reserved chopped aubergine and set aside.
Place garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil and chopped aubergines and sauté 25 min/110°C/speed 2, then blend 30 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a loaf tin.
Add eggs, milk, salt and cayenne pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 4.
Transfer mixture to the prepared loaf tin. Place the tin in a gratin dish, put in the oven and pour in hot water to halfway up the sides of the loaf tin. Bake for 1 hour (180°C). Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves and onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add tomatoes, sugar, thyme, salt and white pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 9, then cook 15 min/100°C/speed 3.
Add basil leaves and stir using spatula. Serve the warm papeton in slices with tomato coulis.
tips: A speciality of Avignon, a papeton is an aubergine-and egg-based flan which is served covered in a tomato coulis.
Papeton can be eaten warm and cold
If you have any left-over coulis, you can use it to accompany pasta or rice, or freeze it.
Prepare the tin by lining with baking paper, instead of dusting with flour, and the recipe will be gluten free.
If you prefer to have a smooth tomato coulis with no bits, mix it for 7 sec/speed 10 before serving

title: Millet flour bread
steps: Place millet and buckwheat into mixing bowl and mill 1 min/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place water, fresh yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and mix 1 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2.
Add gluten free flour, millet and buckwheat flour, salt, extra virgin olive oil and knead 2 min/.

Lightly grease a sheet of baking paper and line a loaf tin (25 x 10 x 11 cm). With aid of spatula, transfer dough from the mixing bowl into the prepared loaf tin. Sprinkle top of loaf with sesame seeds.
Cover the dough and leave to prove in a warm place for 30-45 min or until it doubles in volume. Preheat oven to 190°C.
Bake the bread in the pre-heated oven (190°C) for 45-50 min. Transfer bread to a colling rack and let it cool down. Serve cut in slices.

title: Fruit nectar
ingredients: 300 g mixed fresh fruits, cut in pieces as needed
1 lemon, peeled, white pith and pips removed
steps: Place mixed fresh fruit, lemon and sugar in mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 9.
Add water and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Serve immediately with ice cubes.
tips: If the peel of the fruit is edible, leave it on to enjoy all fibre and vitamins it contains.
If the fruit is very ripe or sweet, the sugar can be omitted completely.
Instead of peeling the lemon you can squeeze out the juice and add it in step 2.
Make nectar with a single type of fruit or mix different types, for example:- 100 g orange, 100 g apple and 100 g pear- 200 g orange and 100 g mango- 100 g kiwi fruit and 200 g strawberries.

title: Arseeyah
ingredients: 60 g butter, cut in pieces  o 60 g ghee
500 g chicken breast, cut into small cubes (1-2 cm)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice and cover with 200 g water. Set aside for 10 minutes. Meanwhile go on with the recipe.
Place 40 g butter into mixing bowl and melt 2 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add chicken cubes, cardamom, pepper and salt and cook 12 min/100°C/speed .
Drain rice through simmering basket, then transfer rice into mixing bowl together with remaining 1000 g water and cinnamon stick, mix well with aid of spatula and cook 20 min/100°C/speed .

Remove cinnamon stick, cook a further 10 min/100°C/speed 1 and then blend 1 min/speed 4. The arseeyah mixture should be thick. Transfer into a deep serving dish and add remaining 20 g butter or ghee on top and allow to melt before serving hot.
tips: Arseeyah is a simple and hearty rice and chicken dish. It is considered one of the Emirati great comfort foods. It is a great food for young children but adults love to eat it as well.

title: Gazelle horns
ingredients: 80 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 4 min/90°C/speed 2.

Add flour, lemon zest and 60 g orange blossom water and knead 30 sec/. Transfer pastry to a bowl and cover with cling film. Allow to rest for 15 minutes in the refrigerator. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place almonds in mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10.
Add 70 g of reserved icing sugar, cinnamon and 50 g orange blossom water and mix 30 sec/. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Preheat the oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside. Divide the pastry in half using the spatula, and keep one of the pieces in refrigerator. Roll the other piece out thinly (2 mm) on a work surface using a rolling pin. Cut out circles using a circular cookie cutter (Ø 8 cm). Make small crescent shapes from the almond paste and lay one on each of the pastry discs. Close each circle like a turnover and shape into a small crescent. Cut off the excess pastry using a pastry wheel. Repeat the operation until there is no more pastry, also using the reserved pastry in the refrigerator.

Lay the crescents out on the prepared baking tray and cook in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes (180°C). They should not turn golden. Remove the gazelle horns from the oven, roll them in the remaining icing sugar and serve at room temperature.
tips: Oriental cuisine is very rich in almond- and honey-based pastries to accompany the traditional mint tea. Oriental cakes come in shapes inspired by nature or fauna, such as these gazelle horns.

title: Sarsi Cordial
steps: Place sarsi wood, water, molasses sugar, cane sugar and pandan leaves in mixing bowl, cook 45 min/100°C/speed 1. Using kitchen tong, remove sarsi wood and pandan leaves. Let cool completely. Serve as cordial or transfer to a sterilized bottle (1.5 litres) using a fine mesh strainer and store in refrigerator.
tips: To serve, dilute 3-4 tablespoons of cordial in 250 g cold water or adjust to taste.
Carbonated sarsi: Replace water with sparkling mineral water.
Recipe contributed by Widyana Ali.

title: Almond Cashew Paste
steps: Place almonds, cashew nuts and 70 g water in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g water, blend 20 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a sterilized glass jar (300 g) and keep refrigerated. Best use within 2 weeks.
tips: To remove almond skin, soak almonds in hot water for 10 minutes.
Almond cashew paste can be used as a dairy free substitute for yogurt and cream. Can be added to curry and even as pizza topping for a creamy and rich dairy free alternative.
Recipe contributed by Sakuntala Khalaiselvan.

title: Steamed Seafood Tower
ingredients: 30 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao) (opcional)
1 sprig spring onion, sliced, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in crabs, prawns, lala clams, 25 g ginger slices and rice wine. Add ½ tsp salt to the bowl, mix well and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add dried anchovies, 25 g ginger slices, ½ tsp salt, sugar and white pepper powder to it, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1.
Arrange seasoned crabs and prawns in Varoma dish. Arrange seasoned lala clams in Varoma tray. Set Varoma into position, steam 17 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Carefully remove Varoma and set aside, remove simmering basket with spatula and discard dried anchovies. Add spinach into mixing bowl, cook 2 min/100°C//speed 1.5.
To serve, arrange seafoods onto a plate, garnish with spring onion slices. Transfer spinach soup into a bowl, garnish with wolfberries. Serve immediately.
tips: Seafood variation can be adjusted according to personal preference. For example, replace clams with fish or squids.

title: Talam Gula Melaka (Steamed Palm Sugar Cake)
ingredients: 150 g gula Melaka, cut in small pieces
steps: Grease a round baking tin (Ø 17.5 cm) with vegetable oil.
Place gula Melaka, cane sugar and 400 g water in mixing bowl, cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Using a fine mesh strainer, sieve gula melaka mixture into a bowl and set aside to cool. Empty mixing bowl.
Place mung bean flour, 60 g rice flour, tapioca starch, alkaline water and reserved gula Melaka mixture in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Cook 5 min/90°C/speed 2. Stir well and transfer to prepared baking tin and place in Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 50 g rice flour, coconut milk, hot water and salt in mixing bowl, stir 30 sec/speed 3. Stir well and transfer to a bowl, set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, boil 8 min/100°C/speed 1.
Set Varoma into position, steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Stir reserved coconut milk mixture using a spoon and transfer on top of the steamed gula Melaka layer, steam further 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid immediately and let cool completely. Cut in small pieces and serve.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Roselle Payasam
ingredients: 15 g cashew nuts, cut in half length wise
100 g vermicelli, cut in 4 cm length
70 g small sago, soaked for 10 minutes
10 g fresh roselle calyx  o 8 g dried roselle calyces, cut in 1 cm length
steps: Place ghee, cashew nuts and raisins in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/120°C//speed . Transfer cashew nuts and raisins only to a bowl and set aside. Remain ghee in mixing bowl.
Add vermicelli and sago in mixing bowl, heat 4 min/120°C//speed  .
Add roselle and water, cook 6 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add evaporated milk, unsweetened almond milk, sugar, salt and vanilla extract, cook 6 min/100°C//speed 1. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with reserved cashew nuts, raisins and crushed pistachios. Serve hot.
tips: Recipe contributed by Datin Shakku.

title: Canarian Potatoes with Red and Green Sauce
ingredients: 80 g rusk, cut in small pieces
200 g fresh coriander leaves, plus extra for garnishing
steps: Place extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add rusk, toss 4 min/120°C/speed 0.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place red capsicum, garlic, red wine vinegar and water in mixing bowl, blend 2 min/speed 6.
Add ground black pepper, salt and reserved rusk mixture, mix 1 min/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside in refrigerator. Clean mixing bowl.
Place coriander leaves, green capsicum, garlic and water in mixing bowl, blend 3 sec/speed 5.
Add salt, extra virgin olive oil and white wine vinegar, mix 4 min/speed 4. Transfer to an airtight container and set aside in refrigerator. Clean mixing bowl.
Wash baby potatoes thoroughly and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, add potatoes into it. Close Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Carefully open Varoma lid, transfer potatoes to a bowl of cold water and let cool completely.
To assemble, arrange baby potatoes on serving plates. Top with red sauce and green sauce. Garnish with coriander and serve immediately.

title: Egg Pudding With Passion Fruit
steps: Place sugar and water in mixing bowl, heat 17 min/120°C//speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Scatter sugar evenly into 4 rectangular ramekins (8 cm) and set aside. Using a kitchen blow torch, caramelize sugar until dark brown.

Place egg yolks in mixing bowl, stir 2 min/speed 2. Meanwhile, drizzle reserved syrup in a thin stream through hole of mixing bowl lid. Transfer to prepared moulds evenly, cover with heat-resistant cling film and arrange in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl, boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Set Varoma into position, steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, remove moulds from Varoma. Let cool for 1 hour and refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

Using an offset spatula, scrape around edges of moulds to help releasing the puddings, invert moulds onto dessert plates, carefully remove puddings. Cut in pieces and drizzle with passion fruit pulp. Serve chilled.
tips: You can make these puddings in ramekins or moulds that fit into the Varoma dish, making sure that some holes remain unobstructed.

title: Hokkaido Scallop Sashimi with Avocado and Lime
ingredients: 15 g fresh red chillies, deseeded, cut in pieces
400 g ripe avocados, flesh only and cut in pieces
10 g fresh lemongrass, white part only
1 tsp coarse sea salt, to garnish
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper, to garnish
20 g crispy fried shallots, to garnish
steps: Place red chillies, shallots, coriander, lime juice, Tabasco® and salt in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add avocado, mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film (placed directly onto surface) and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place lemongrass, red chillies, coriander, kaffir lime leaves, shallots, fish sauce and lime juice in mixing bowl, blend 30 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend again 30 sec/speed 6.
Add oyster sauce, sesame oil, Worcestershire sauce and olive oil, mix 30 sec/speed 2. Transfer to a plastic container and set aside in refrigerator.

Cut scallops into slices (5 mm). Spread avocado sauce on a serving plate, layer scallop slices on avocado sauce. Drizzle with lime sauce, garnish with sea salt, ground black pepper and fried shallots. Serve immediately.

title: Summer Ice Cream Cake
ingredients: 20 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed (approx. ½ lemon)
300 g whipping cream (35 % fat content), chilled
100 g white grape, seedless, plus extra for decorating
100 g red grape, plus extra for decorating
steps: Place raspberry, sugar and lemon juice in mixing bowl, cook 4-6 min/90°C/speed 4 until slightly thickened. Transfer to a small jug and set aside to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a springform tin (Ø 20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Place biscuits and almonds in mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to base of prepared tin, using the back of a spoon, press down lightly. Bake for 10 minutes (180°C). Leave to cool completely (approx. 30 minutes).
Insert butterfly whisk. Place sugar and eggs in mixing bowl, heat 6 min/60°C/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl and butterfly whisk.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream and rose water in mixing bowl, whip 10-20 sec/speed 4, until soft peaks form, watching carefully through hole in mixing bowl lid to avoid over-whipping. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer cream to chilled reserved custard and using spatula, fold to combine. Add dried cranberries, pistachio nuts, white grapes and red grapes to reserved custard mixture and fold through using spatula.

Transfer custard mixture to reserved cooled base and then pour half of the reserved berry coulis over custard. Using a wooden skewer, stir berry coulis through custard mixture to create a marble effect. Place in freezer to set for at least 4 hours. Once frozen, decorate with raspberries, strawberries and extra grapes. Serve with remaining berry coulis.
tips: Try making individual cakes using muffin or friand tins.

title: Tahini Dipping Sauce
ingredients: 10 g red fermented bean curd (nam yee)
steps: Place tahini paste, peanut butter, chive flowers, sesame oil, water, oyster sauce, red bean curd and sugar in mixing bowl, start Blend /40 sec. Transfer to a bowl and serve.

title: Shacha Sauce
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Place sesame seeds, dried anchovies and dried shrimp on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15-20 minutes (150°C) or until dried anchovies are golden brown, tossing with a spatula halfway through to evenly coat and avoid burning. Remove from oven and set aside.

Place cooking oil, light soy sauce, shallot oil, sesame oil, garlic cloves, peanuts and baked sesame shrimp mixture in mixing bowl, blend 35 sec/speed 10, gradually increasing speed. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add ground ginger, grated coconut, chili powder, five spice powder and sugar, cook 40 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer to 3 sterilized airtight jars (250 g each), let cool and store in refrigerator. Serve as desired.
tips: Upon serving hot pot, you can eat with shacha sauce, light soy sauce, white vinegar and spring onion and minced garlic as your own unique dipping sauce.
Use as a condiment to prepare stir fried shacha beef slices or shacha cabbage.

title: Chocolate Banana Cream Pie
ingredients: 80 g dark chocolate coins, courveture, plus extra for garnishing
2 - 3 bananas, cut in slices, plus extra for garnishing
steps: Place digestive biscuits and butter in mixing bowl, mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a heart shaped springform tin (ø 20 cm). Spread crumb mixture in base of prepared springform tin. Use a back of a spoon to press crumb mixture down firmly to make a compact layer.
Place dark chocolate coins in mixing bowl, melt 5 min/55°C/speed 1. Transfer to prepared springform tin. Refrigerate for 10 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Mix lemon juice and banana slices in a bowl. Place banana slices on prepared springform pan. Spread peanut butter evenly on banana.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream and caster sugar in mixing bowl, whip without measuring cup speed 3.5, without setting a time, until the cream is thickened and holds a medium peak, watching carefully through the hole of mixing bowl lid to avoid over-whipping. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer whipped cream to a piping bag with nozzle (ø 3 cm).
Pipe frosting onto the pie. Sprinkle cream pie with toasted coconut, banana slices and chocolate chips before serving.

title: Sour Plum Candy
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Place dried salted plums in silicone chocolate moulds individually and set aside.

Place 50 g water, maltose syrup and brown sugar in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages . Pour the syrup evenly into the prepared chocolate moulds and immediately scrape the syrup off the mouth of mixing bowl with spatula so that mixing bowl lid can be securely closed.
Place 1000 g water in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse mixing bowl.
Once sour plum candies have cooled to room temperature, they can be unmoulded and kept refrigerated in an airtight jar or serve immediately.
tips: Use drier sour plums for this recipe.
After starting the mode in Practice 3, the main pan will first preheat itself until the main pan reaches the temperature required for the recipe, and then the sugar making mode will start timing.

title: Chewy Gula Melaka Coconut Candy
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place gula Melaka, sugar, water, condensed milk and butter in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid, start Sugar Stages .
Add desiccated coconut, mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a pastry mat, flatten into a rectangular shape (13 cm x 17 cm). Let cool completely.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl, start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
Using a dough scraper, cut into cubes (1.5 cm). Use fingers to smoothen the edges and shape to cubes. Wrap in glutinous rice paper then cellophane wrappers. Serve immediately.
tips: Recipe contributed by Ginny Chan.

title: Coconut and Osmanthus Jelly
steps: Place coconut milk and sugar in mixing bowl, heat 5 min/80°C/speed 1.
Add 2 tsp gelatine powder, mix 30 sec/speed 3. Pour into a baking tray (15 cm x 15 cm) and refrigerate. Clean mixing bowl.
Place osmanthus sugar, water and 2 tsp gelatine powder in mixing bowl, heat 5 min/80°C/speed 1. Let mixing bowl temperature drop to 50°C.
Pour cooled osmanthus syrup mixture on coconut milk jelly and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Cut in squares and serve chilled.

title: Kimchi Sauce
ingredients: 400 g Asian pear (singo pear), core removed, cut into quarters
110 g yellow onions (approx. ½ onion), cut into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place glutinous rice flour, water and sugar in mixing bowl, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place singo pear, garlic cloves, ginger, onions, chilli flakes, fish sauce and fermented shrimp in mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Start Blend /1 min.
Add reserved glutinous rice mixture and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Serve as dipping sauce or transfer to 4 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Use kimchi sauce as a fermenting marinade to make your own kimchi.
Recipe contributed by Mandy Kee.

title: Red Thai Curry Paste
ingredients: 2 stalks fresh lemongrass, white part only
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in water and set aside. Place dried chillies, white peppercorns, cumin seeds and coriander seeds in mixing bowl, cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Grind 1 min/speed 10.
Add garlic cloves, shallots, coriander roots, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime zest, shrimp paste and salt, start Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Start Blend /30 sec. Meanwhile, pour reserved water onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Add cooking oil, sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Use as a base for red Thai curry or transfer to 1 airght jar (500 g) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Stir fried prawns with dragon well tea (Longjing tea prawns)
ingredients: 500 g raw prawns, peeled and cleaned
steps: Pat dry prawns with kitchen towel. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns, sugar and Chinese rice wine. Mix well and wrap with cling film. Set aside and refrigerated for 4 hours.
Place cooking oil into mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, mix longjing tea leaves and hot water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add reserved prawns and salt, without measuring cup, stir fry 5 min/Varoma//speed  .
Add reserved longjing tea leave-water mixture, stir fry 1 min/100°C//speed . Serve immediately.

title: Tri-Colour Ginger Rice
ingredients: 300 g short-grained brown rice (Japonica rice), soaked overnight (approx. 480 g after soaking)
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add 480 g soaked brown rice, ginger and galangal to it, cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Discard ginger and galangal. Transfer cooked rice into a thermal serving bowl and cool for 10 minutes.

Divide cooked rice into 3 equal portions. Mix 1 portion of cooked rice with ⅓ tsp rock salt and beetroot juice in a bowl. Mix 1 portion of cooked rice with ⅓ tsp rock salt and carrot juice in another bowl. Mix 1 portion of cooked rice with ⅓ tsp rock salt and spinach juice in another bowl.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to beetroot rice and mix well. Repeat the step with carrot rice and spinach rice respectively. Serve warm.
tips: The weight of brown rice indicated in step 1 is wet weight after soaking. Dry weight is approximately 300 g.
Beetroot juice: Place 100 g peeled beetroot cubes in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Repeat the step 3 times. Transfer to a fine mesh strainer and squeeze out the juice with the back of a spoon.
Carrot juice: Place 100 g peeled carrot cubes in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Repeat the step 3 times. Transfer to a fine mesh strainer and squeeze out the juice with the back of a spoon.
Spinach juice: Place 100 g baby spinach leaves in mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 8. Repeat the step 3 times. Transfer to a fine mesh strainer and squeeze out the juice with the back of a spoon.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Fresh Prawn Paste
ingredients: 15 g Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in cold water, chopped spring onions and ginger. Let stand for 15 minutes. Sieve the water into a bowl and discard spring onions and ginger.

Place prawn flesh, reserved onion-ginger water, egg white, rice wine, tapioca starch and salt in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 3.5. Transfer to a container and keep in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before cooking. Use as desired.
tips: You may shape the paste into prawn balls or transfer the prawn paste to a pastry bag and pipe directly into any soup base.

title: Stir Fried Prawns with Dragon Well Tea (Longjing Tea Prawns)
ingredients: 500 g whole prawns, cleaned and shells removed
2 tsp Chinese rice wine (Shaoxing Hua Tiao)
1 tsp longjing tea leaves (dragon well tea), dried
steps: Pat dry prawns with kitchen towel. Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in prawns, sugar and Chinese rice wine. Mix well and cover with cling film. Set aside and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Place cooking oil in mixing bowl, heat 3 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, mix longjing tea leaves and hot water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add reserved prawns and salt, without measuring cup, stir fry 5 min/Varoma//speed  .
Add reserved longjing tea leave-water mixture, cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Serve immediately.

title: Lai Chi Kang (Longan Dessert)
ingredients: 100 g candied winter melon, cut in halves
10 g white fungus, soaked to soften, hard part removed, cut in small pieces
1 tsp basil seeds, soaked in 200 g water for 15 minutes
4 malva nuts, soaked in 300 g water for 15 minutes
steps: Place water, pandan leaves, candied winter melon, brown sugar, dried longans, red dates, white fungus and lemon slice in mixing bowl. Mix well with spatula, start Slow Cook /1 h/90°C.
Add basil seeds, malva nuts, raisins and barley, simmer 5 min/98°C//speed . Top with roasted peanuts and small sagos. Serve hot or cold.
tips: Place 20 g barley and 1000 g water in mixing bowl, boil 50 min/98°C//speed .
Recipe contributed by Suriya Abdullah.

title: Steamed Oyster Mushrooms
ingredients: 150 g fresh ginger, peeled, cut in slices
steps: Place ginger in mixing bowl, blend 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place a stainless steel steaming plate (Ø 15 cm) on mixing bowl lid, weigh in oyster mushrooms, spread 50 g reserved ginger paste evenly on top of mushrooms. Insert steaming plate in Varoma dish.

Place water in mixing bowl, bring to a boil 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma into position, steam 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Carefully open Varoma lid, add miso paste onto steamed mushrooms and mix well. Serve immediately.
tips: The remaining ginger paste can be used in other recipes.
Using a stainless steel steaming plate allows efficient heating and steaming the mushrooms within the time indicated.
Recipe contributed by Wong Kee Yew.

title: Wolf Herring Fish Dumplings
ingredients: 500 g wolf herring fish (ikan parang), flesh only (see tips)
steps: Place fish flesh in mixing bowl, chop 30 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 2 tsp salt and baking soda, knead Dough /2 min.
Add tapioca starch, ice water and wheat starch, knead Dough /3 min.
Add sugar, white pepper powder and sesame oil, mix 15 sec/speed 3.

Place 1 tablespoon fish mixture in the centre of each dumpling wrapper. Fold the wrapper in half over the filling to make a semi-circle shape. Pinch the seam in the centre and hold it with one hand while using the other hand to pleat the top edge of the wrapper from the middle outwards on both sides. Transfer to a sealable container and store in refrigerator until ready to use (see tips).
tips: Using a spoon, scrape fish flesh from fillets (with skin), avoid red areas near bones that contain blood.
Serve fish dumplings by cooking them in the hotpot until they float on the soup surface, or deep frying in hot oil until crispy and golden brown.
Replace wolf herring with mackerel.

title: Black-eyed bean stew with whole squid
ingredients: 40 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to drizzle
500 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces,  o 500 g canned tomatoes
370 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, leek, celery stalks), cut in slices (1 cm)
1 tsp salt, plus extra for the squid
1 pinch freshly ground pepper, plus extra for the squid
350 g black-eyed beans, dried, soaked for at least 4 hours (see tip),  o 350 g dried green lentils, rinsed and drained
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade,  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
1000 g whole baby squid, cleaned, fresh or defrosted  o 1000 g raw squid rings, fresh or defrosted
steps: Place onions, garlic clove and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes and tomato purée and blend 7 sec/speed 6.

Add 100 g mixed vegetables, sweet paprika, salt, pepper, drained soaked black-eyed beans, water and vegetable stock paste. Arrange remaining mixed vegetables and squid in Varoma dish and tray, season with salt and pepper, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and combine using spatula. Set Varoma in position and steam 30 min/Varoma//speed . Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm and check that beans are cooked through. If not, cook a further 5-10 min/Varoma//speed .

Add lemon juice to beans and allow to rest in mixing bowl for 10 minutes. Transfer stew to a deep serving plate, sprinkle with chopped fresh coriander and serve hot with squid and vegetables on the side.
tips: The combination of beans and seafood is common in many Mediterranean countries. In this recipe the small black-eyed beans serve as a bed for the pleasant firmness of the squid, giving this dish an interesting balance of flavour and texture. Packed with nutrients, this recipe feeds many and can be adapted to your ingredients and preferences.

Soak black-eyed beans in 900 g cold water. The net weight after soaking will be approx. 750-800 g. Black-eyed beans are sufficiently soaked when the skin can be peeled off easily (usually after 4 hours). If it’s more convenient, you can leave them to soak overnight.
Replace whole baby squid with other types of seafood (e.g. calamari, prawns, cuttlefish), adjusting steaming time accordingly.

title: Lamb’s lettuce cream soup, Broccoli with olive sauce
ingredients: 80 g onions, cut in halves,  o 80 g shallots, cut in halves
600 g broccoli, cut in florets (5 cm)
150 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3 cm)
1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade,  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place black olives, parsley, garlic cloves, capers, lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil and salt in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onions and garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add butter and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, place broccoli in Varoma dish, season with salt and ¼ tsp black pepper and set aside.
Add potatoes to mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add ¼ tsp black pepper, vegetable stock paste and water, set Varoma in position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Add lamb’s lettuce, cream, sugar, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce to mixing bowl and blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve soup as a starter and broccoli with olive sauce as a side dish, along with a main dish of your choice.
tips: Lamb’s lettuce is more commonly served in a salad, but also makes a vivid green, velvety smooth, slightly nutty-flavoured soup. The tangy black olive sauce, similar to a tapenade, gives steamed broccoli a whole new dimension, making it a flavourful side dish to be served with the main dish of your choice.
Instead of lamb’s lettuce, use butterhead lettuce, red radish leaves or baby spinach.
Garnish the soup with crisp fried bacon.
Some of the black olive sauce can also be served as a condiment to flavour the soup.
Add an additional 20-30 g extra virgin olive oil to the black olive sauce to use it as a dressing for salad or a sauce for pasta.

title: Pink Crêpes with Chickpea and Almond Hummus
ingredients: 150 g cooked beetroot, cut in pieces
steps: Place almonds in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add chickpeas, water, lemon juice, tahini, garlic and salt then blend 20 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Blend a further 20 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place beetroot, eggs, milk, oil, flour and baking powder in mixing bowl then blend 20 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Heat a non-stick frying pan and add a ladle of crêpe batter then swirl to cover base of pan. Fry until set and golden brown then flip and fry a further 1 minute or until cooked. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve crêpes with rocket salad, hummus, sprinkled with sesame seeds.

title: Pink Moon Milk
ingredients: 30 g honey (opcional)  o 30 g stevia powder, white (opcional)
steps: Place milk in mixing bowl and warm 8 min/95°C/speed 1.

Add honey (if using), cherries, rose water, ashwagandha (if using) and cardamom in mixing bowl then blend 30 sec/speed 10. Serve immediately, sprinkled with rose petals (if using), preferably before bedtime.

title: Marinated peppers
ingredients: 700 g mixed peppers (e.g. red, green, yellow, orange)
1 tsp ground cumin  o 3 pinches ground pepper
steps: Place water in mixing bowl and bring to a boil 5 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, deseed peppers and cut them in pieces or strips.

Set Varoma dish in position, add peppers, close Varoma and steam 12-14 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until peppers are tender but still have a slight crunch. Remove Varoma, transfer peppers to a serving bowl or jar and empty mixing bowl.

Place extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, cumin and salt in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Pour dressing over peppers, combine thoroughly using spatula and allow to cool and marinate for at least 30 minutes. Season to taste and serve as a side dish at room temperature or chilled.
tips: As a side dish, these marinated peppers add a fresh and colourful note to your meal. They are particularly welcome on a buffet table, and stored in an air-tight, sterilised jar they make an attractive homemade hostess gift.
Serve with fish or grilled meat.
Allow to marinate longer to intensify the flavour.
You can store the peppers in a clean jar in the refrigerator for up to one week.
Mediterranean style peppers: In step 2, after steaming the peppers, add anchovies, capers, oregano and black olives to the serving bowl.

title: Asparagus, Parmesan rice and lemon sabayon sauce
ingredients: 30 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and vegetable stock paste in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and add basmati rice to it.

If ends of asparagus are woody, snap or cut them off, or peel lower third of stems if preferred. Arrange asparagus in Varoma dish, stacking each layer in alternate directions to allow steam to circulate. Set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula, transfer rice to a serving plate, drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, cover and set aside. Check whether asparagus is cooked. If not, set Varoma back in position and steam a further 5-10 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep asparagus warm. Set scale to zero and transfer 120 g cooking liquid to a small bowl (scale will show ‘-120 g’ when mixing bowl is set back in position), discarding the rest. Set small bowl aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg yolks, salt, black pepper and lemon juice in mixing bowl and whisk 10 min/70°C/speed 3 while slowly pouring reserved cooking liquid on mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades.
Sprinkle rice with grated Parmesan cheese. Place asparagus on top of rice, spoon lemon sabayon sauce over asparagus and serve immediately.
tips: The luscious lemon sabayon sauce for this vegetarian dish is almost as luxurious as hollandaise, without all the butter. If you prefer potatoes to rice, use the same cooking method, just make sure to check the cooking times on both the asparagus and the potatoes, removing whichever one is cooked through before the other.

The luscious lemon sabayon sauce for this vegetarian dish is almost as luxurious as hollandaise, without all the butter. If you prefer potatoes to rice, use the same cooking method, just make sure to check the cooking times on both the asparagus and the potatoes, removing whichever one is cooked through before the other.
If using white asparagus, in step 3 steam a further 5 min/Varoma/speed 1 after removing simmering basket with rice.
If using white asparagus, in step 3 steam a further 5 min/Varoma/speed 1 after removing simmering basket with rice.

title: Virgin Apple Cider Old Fashioned
ingredients: 3 oranges, preferably organic (approx. 170 g each), quartered
1 apple, cored, halved and sliced, for garnishing
fresh rosemary, sprigs only, for garnishing
steps: Place oranges in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, sugar, cloves, ginger and cinnamon then cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Sieve through a fine-mesh sieve into a jar and allow to cool completely.

Place 3-4 tbsp bitter orange simple syrup in each glass, divide ice cubes between glasses. Add 1 tbsp maple syrup to each glass. Fill ⅔ of each glass with apple cider. Top with soda wate®r. Serve immediately, garnished with apple slices, cinnamon stick and rosemary sprigs (see Tip).
tips: Store any remaining bitter orange syrup in an air-tight container in the refrigerator and use to make more drinks. Nutritional values include the entire amount of prepared syrup.

title: Virgin Lemon and Thyme Cocktail
ingredients: 40 g fresh thyme, sprigs and leaves, plus extra for garnishing
500 g lemons, quartered, plus extra zest for garnishing
200 g ice cubes, plus extra for serving
steps: Place thyme, sugar, water and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid then reduce 20 min/Varoma/speed 2. Sieve through a fine-mesh sieve into a jar and allow to cool completely.
Place lemons, water and 200 g ice cubes in mixing bowl then blend 15 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a jug, draining through a fine-mesh sieve. Discard sieve contents. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place prepared lemonade, 150 g prepared thyme syrup, apple cider vinegar and honey in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Meanwhile, place 3-4 ice cubes in each martini glass. Divide prepared cocktail between martini glasses. Serve immediately, garnished with thyme and lemon zest.

title: Sweet potato cheesecake bars
ingredients: 150 g flour, plus extra for dusting
300 g sweet potatoes, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add butter, flour, 1 egg, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a work surface, form into a ball, wrap in cling film and refrigerate for approx. 30 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position and weigh sweet potatoes into it. Cover Varoma and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside. Empty and clean mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a baking tin (approx. 30 cm x 20 cm x 6 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

On a floured surface, using a rolling pin, roll out chilled dough into a rectangle the same size as the prepared tin. Transfer to prepared tin and press to line the bottom, then set aside. Separate remaining 3 eggs.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites in mixing bowl and whisk 3 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Place reserved egg yolks, ricotta, cream cheese, 80-100 g condensed milk, 10 g cornflour and vanilla extract then mix 20 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again 10 sec/speed 6. Pour mixture over dough base.

Place steamed sweet potatoes, remaining 60 g condensed milk and remaining 10 g cornflour in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 6. Using a tablespoon, drop blobs of sweet potato mixture over cheese mixture, keeping them approx. 4 cm apart. Using a skewer or the tip of a knife, drag around the mixture to make a marble pattern.
Bake for 35-40 minutes (180°C) or until mixture is almost set and slightly golden on top. Allow to cool completely and refrigerate before cutting into bars or squares (approx. 4 cm) and serve.

title: Low fat vanilla and raspberry skyr ice cream
steps: Place xylitol in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolks, milk and vanilla seeds then start Thicken /80°C.

Add skyr and xanthan gum then mix 30 sec/speed 3. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 8 hours. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean mixing bowl.

Place raspberries, agave syrup and water in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 12 min/Varoma//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool completely. Refrigerate until needed. Clean mixing bowl.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream to a container.

Place remaining ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream. Using a spoon, mix in reserved raspberry sauce and freeze for approx. 2 hours or until desired consistency is achieved. Serve in scoops.
tips: Skyr is a cultured dairy product from Iceland. It has the texture of strained yogurt and a mild, slightly sour dairy flavor. Skyr is available in a variety of flavours.

title: Green coloured eggs
ingredients: 5 g green tea leaves, dried  o 5 g yerba mate leaves, dried
water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place eggs, green tea leaves and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Carefully transfer contents of mixing bowl to a bowl and leave eggs in liquid to intensify colour (see Tip).
Allow to cool and serve or store in refrigerator and consume within 1 week.
tips: Allow eggs to remain in dyeing water to intensify the color. Leave eggs for at least 30 minutes up to several hours until the desired colour intensity is reached.
Rub the eggs with a cloth soaked in vinegar to roughen the shells and ensure the colour adheres. Results of dyeing with natural ingredients may vary, depending on quality colour agents.
To create patterns on egg shells, place flowers, herbs or grass leaves on raw eggs and seal the eggs tightly in nylon socks before placing them in mixing bowl for cooking in step 1.

title: Pull apart bread with eggs and sun-dried tomatoes
ingredients: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)
water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place rosemary and sun-dried tomatoes in mixing bowl then chop 10 sec/speed 7.5.
Add water, milk, sugar and yeast and warm 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add flour, oil and salt then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with cling film and leave to rest until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Clean mixing bowl and continue with recipe.

Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Medium hard. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool briefly, peel and set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a loaf tin (approx. 30 cm x 10 cm), then sprinkle with breadcrumbs.

Divide dough into 6 equal pieces and using a rolling pin roll out into circles (approx. Ø 12 cm). Place 1 cooked egg in centre of 1 dough circle and close carefully to form a ball. Repeat with remaining dough circles and eggs. Brush balls with pesto rosso and place them side by side in prepared loaf tin. Sprinkle with reserved Parmesan cheese and bake for approx. 45 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown (see Tip). Allow to cool then serve.
tips: If bread turns too dark before end of baking time, cover with aluminium foil.

title: Savory tart with tuna, eggs and capers
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
125 g butter, cold, in pieces, plus extra for greasing
250 g flour, plus extra for dusting
350 g canned tuna, in brine or water, drained
50 g red onions, cut in rings (1 mm)
steps: Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool completely, peel, cut in quarters then set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a tart tin (Ø 26 cm) then set aside.

Place butter, flour, egg, water and salt in mixing bowl then mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer pastry to prepared tart tin (Ø 26 cm) and line bottom and sides by pressing evenly to form a rim (approx. 1.5 cm). Prick the bottom with a fork and bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Transfer to a serving platter and allow to cool completely. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.

Place 300 g tuna, white wine vinegar, lemon juice, egg yolk, anchovies, oil, honey, ground black pepper and salt in mixing bowl then mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer tuna mixture to prepared tart base and spread out evenly with spatula.
Garnish tart with rocket salad, cherry tomatoes, capers, cooked eggs, red onion rings and remaining 50 g tuna. Serve immediately (see Tip) or chill in refrigerator until needed.
tips: Serve with a fresh green salad.
Replace capers with black olives.

title: Layered bread
ingredients: 1 tsp citric acid  o 30 g lemon juice
80 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
50 g olives, black or green, cut in rings
50 g sun-dried tomatoes, cut in slices
olives, to make eyes and mouth
steps: Place 290 g water, fresh yeast, flour, sugar, butter and salt in mixing bowl and knead Dough /5 min. Meanwhile, line Varoma dish with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish and set aside.
Place remaining 250 g water and citric acid in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /1 h/40°C. Set Varoma aside. Empty and dry mixing bowl.
Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Remove 3 tbsp grated cheese from mixing bowl and set aside.
Add pine nuts, garlic, basil, extra virgin olive oil and salt to remaining parmesan in mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 7.

Transfer dough to a floured surface and, using a rolling pin, roll out into a rectangle (approx. 40 cm x 60 cm). Spread reserved pesto over dough, top with olives and sun-dried tomatoes. Cut dough into squares (approx. 9 cm) using a knife or pastry wheel.

Place one square on top of the other and pile up 6-7 squares. Hold a loaf tin (30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm) upright on work surface and carefully place dough squares inside, layering up until tin is full. Cover with cling film or tea towel and leave to rise for 15 minutes. Towards the end of rising time, preheat oven to 200°C.

Sprinkle with reserved 3 tbsp grated Parmesan cheese and bake for approx. 30 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Carefully remove from tin onto a cooling rack and allow to cool. Stick 2 skewers into 2 olives and place them on top of the bread to create antennae. Use sun-dried tomatoes to make mouth. Serve warm or cold.
tips: Serve with a yogurt and crème fraîche dip.
Store remaining basil pesto in refrigerator for up to 3 days.
Replace basil pesto with any other type of pesto (e.g. red pesto, rocket pesto etc).

title: Unicorn lemonade
ingredients: coloured sprinkles, e.g. blue, purple and pink
1 red grapefruit, peeled, white pith removed
steps: Place raspberry syrup and water in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 3. Transfer to an ice-cube tray and freeze until solid.
Place sprinkles on a plate and set aside. Place agave syrup on another plate and dip the rim of 6 glasses in it, then dip in sprinkles. Place glasses in freezer until needed.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add lemon, lime, grapefruit, ice cubes and water then blend 5 sec/speed 10. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place using spatula and strain lemonade into a jug.
Divide reserved citrus lemonade between glasses filling them ¾. Slowly add 2 tbsp Blue Curaçao syrup and garnish with 1-2 frozen raspberry syrup ice-cubes. Serve immediately (see tip)
tips: Blue Curaçao syrup is a non-alcoholic syrup with a light orange flavour and a vibrant blue colour.
Serve with lime slices or wedges.

title: Pumpkin leaf stew with prawns (M'boa com xima)
ingredients: 2 fresh red chillies, cut in slices
400 g pumpkin leaves, cut in thin strips (0.5 cm)  o 400 g turnip leaves, cut in thin strips (0.5 cm)
500 g raw prawns, unpeeled, heads removed
steps: Place peanuts in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add tomatoes, coconut milk, red chillies, salt and reserved chopped peanuts and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add pumpkin leaves, mix with spatula and cook 20 min/120°C//speed .
Add prawns and mix well with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and keep warm. Clean mixing bowl.
Place coconut milk and salt in mixing bowl and heat 10 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add rice flour and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool for 5 minutes before turning out onto a serving plate. Serve M'boa with Xima.
tips: This recipe freezes well. Allow to cool to room temperature, then transfer to a suitable container and place in freezer.
Replace fresh prawns with dried prawns.
Replace pumpkin leaves with chard leaves.

title: Angolan fish stew (Calulu)
ingredients: 5 g fresh marjoram, plus extra for seasoning
200 g aubergine, cut in pieces (2 cm)
80 g collard greens, cut in thin strips (0.5 cm)
50 g fresh spinach, cut in thin strips (0.5 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in okra. Add lemon juice, mix well with spatula to remove froth and allow to rest for 15 minutes. Rinse okra with water and dry thoroughly with a tea towel. Trim off ends and cut in pieces, then set aside.
Place onions, tomatoes, marjoram and chilli in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add vegetable oil, aubergine, collard greens, spinach, dried okra, bay leaf, pepper, 1 tsp salt, cumin and flour. Set Varoma dish in position, weigh in grouper steaks, season with 1 tsp salt and marjoram. Close Varoma and steam 35 min/Varoma//speed . Set Varoma aside and remove skin and bones from fish. Transfer fish to a serving dish and combine with sauce from mixing bowl. Serve immediately.
tips: Prepare up to the beginning of step 3, setting aside until later if needed
Use frozen spinach instead of fresh.

title: Cod with aïoli
ingredients: 1 raw crapaudine beetroot  o 1 raw beetroot
lemon juice, freshly squeezed (from one lemon)
30 g raw crapaudine beetroot, cut in small cubes
steps: Place a jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh 170 g olive oil in it and set aside.
Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add remaining 30 g olive oil and mix 20 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add egg yolks, mustard, salt and Espelette pepper and whisk 3 min/speed 4, while very slowly pouring reserved 170 g olive oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion.Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to bowl and store in refrigerator. Clean mixing bowl.
Arrange each cod fillet on a piece of baking paper. Season fillets with olive oil, salt and Espelette pepper. Close up the pouches, add place them in Varoma dish and tray and set aside.
Preheat oven to 60°C.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile cut turnip and beetroot into thin slices then cut nice carrot chips using a mandoline, then set the cut vegetables aside in a container filled with cold water and ice to keep them fresh and crunchy. Remove Varoma and keep the pouches on a dish and place in the oven (60°C). Empty mixing bowl.
Place shallot, leek and celeriac in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil, lemon juice and diced raw beetroot and mix 10 sec//speed 2.

Place 2 tbsp of raw vegetable salad in the centre of the plate, top with cod fillets and spread a thick layer of aioli over the fish. Arrange the slices of turnip, beetroot, carrot chips, chopped parsley, lamb's lettuce and red radishes around the cod and serve immediately.
tips: When making the aioli in step 4, take care to drizzle the oil very slowly around the lid.
Aioli is a good accompaniment for many kinds of fish.

title: Duck foie gras
ingredients: 800 g water, plus extra to cool
steps: Separate the lobes of the foie gras and de-vein using a sharp pointed knife, removing veins from end to end. Place on a plate and season the entire surface with 2 tbsp cognac, 1 tsp salt and 1 pinch mixed peppercorns. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Turn over the foie gras and season entire surface again with 2 tbsp cognac, 1 tsp salt and 1 pinch mixed peppercorns. Refrigerate again for 30 minutes.

Place foie gras at the centre of a large (approx. 50 cm x 50 cm) sheet of cling film. Fold cling film over, enclosing foie gras to form a sausage, taking care to push the air out. Repeat the process with 4 other sheets of cling film, tightening the ends each time. Make knots in the ends of final sheet.
Place water in mixing bowl. Place foie gras parcel in Varoma dish. Set Varoma in position and steam 12 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Remove Varoma, turn the foie gras carefully onto the other side, close with Varoma lid, set Varoma back in position and steam further 12 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and transfer steamd foie gras parcle carefully to a large bowl of cold water, add ice cubes and allow to cool for around 30 minutes. Drain and store foie gras package in refrigerator for 1 day, before serving. Serve sliced on toast.
tips: Use a frozen de-veined foie gras, taking care to allow it to defrost beforehand in the refrigerator.
Serve the foie gras with a fig compote or onion confit.

Serve with a soft Jurançon AOC or a Pacherenc de Vic Bilh: the Petit Manseng grape has a liveliness which lightens the foie gras by balancing its slight bitterness with softness. A classic and harmonious pairing.

title: Spiced pork terrine
ingredients: 300 g pork throat fat, cut in pieces (approx. 2 cm)
500 g pork chine, boneless, cut in pieces (approx. 2 cm)
1 - 2 tsp fruit brandy (e.g. apple) (optional)  o 1 - 2 tsp warm water
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh pork throat fat and pork chine in it and allow to freeze for 40-60 minutes to make chopping easier.
Mix fruit brandy, warm water and raisins in a bowl to macerate. Set aside to soak for 5 minutes. Meanwhile continue with the recipe.
Place nuts in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a frying pan and dry-fry for 3 minutes until toasted.
Place apricots, figs and prunes in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Chop again 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to bowl with raisins and set aside.
Place 200 g part-frozen pork meat in mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place again 200 g part-frozen pork meat in mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with chopped meat.
Place again 200 g part-frozen pork meat in mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with chopped meat.
Place remaining 200 g part-frozen pork meat in mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 5.

Add reserved chopped meat, toasted nuts, chopped fruit mixture, nutmeg, cinnamon, ground ginger, egg, salt and pepper and mix 1 min//speed 2. Transfer the mixture to a terrine dish, pressing down with back of a spoon. Place bay leaves on top and cover with pork caul fat. Cover the dish. Refrigerate overnight for flavours to blend.
The next day, preheat oven to 140°C.

Place terrine in a bain-marie (see Tips), cover and cook in the oven (140°C) for 1 hour and 45 minutes. Allow to cool at room temperature. Store in the refrigerator. Serve on a slice of farmhouse bread.
tips: Weigh the salt in the measuring cup to ensure you do not use more than necessary.
To ensure that the pork fat does not catch on the blade when mixing, chop the meat little by little, mixing the pork fat and the pork chine as you go.

To cook the terrine in an oven using a bain-marie, place the terrine dish on a roasting tray, put in the oven and pour hot water into the corner of the tray, until it comes 2 cm from the top of the roasting tray. Cover with aluminium foil before cook.
Serve with a wine from south-west France, like a Minervois or Fitou.

title: Turkey roulade with pancetta and porcini sauce
ingredients: 600 g turkey breast fillet, skinless, boneless, butterflied
260 g pancetta, sliced  o 260 g prosciutto, sliced
20 g dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and squeezed
steps: Place rosemary into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place a long piece of heat-resistant cling film or baking paper on work surface and place butterflied turkey breast fillet in the centre. Distribute 4 slices of cheese on the meat and sprinkle with some of the rosemary. Top with a layer of pancetta. Continue creating more layers by alternating cheese slices, rosemary and pancetta until all ingredients are used up.

With aid of cling film or baking paper, roll turkey breast tightly to a compact log. Close log by tying each end of cling film or baking paper tightly with kitchen string. Place roll into Varoma tray, close Varoma lid and set aside.
Place garlic and shallot into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and sautee 3 min/120°C/speed 1
Add water, white wine, stock cube and soaked and squeezed porcini mushrooms. Place Varoma into position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Carefully remove Varoma lid, turn turkey roll, close Varoma and steam a further 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add Worcestershire sauce, cream and pepper to mixing bowl, mix 3 min/100°C/speed 4. Then blend 30 sec/speed 5-8, increasing speed gradually.
Unwrap turkey roll and discard excess cooking liquid. Cut roll into 1,5 cm slices and arrange on a serving dish. Drizzle with sauce and serve warm.
tips: Serve the turkey roll accompanied by cooked green beans.
If desired, after unwrapping the turkey roll, roast it 10 minutes in a hot oven (250°C) until golden.

title: Cherry tomatoes stuffed with goat's cheese and prosciutto
ingredients: 80 g dry-cured ham, in slices (e.g. Prosciutto)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
steps: Cut tops off cocktail tomatoes and use a teaspoon to carefully hollow out. Level bottoms of tomatoes to ensure they stand firmly on serving platter. Turn tomatoes upside down to drain on a paper towel.
Place ham in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 8.
Add goat’s cream cheese, ricotta, salt and pepper and stir 30 sec/speed 4. Season to taste.
Fill tomatoes with cheese and ham mixture and chill. Remove stuffed tomatoes from fridge approx. 30 minutes before serving and arrange on a platter.
tips: If available, yellow cocktail tomatoes go very nicely with the red tomatoes.The tomatoes can be stuffed 3–4 hours in advance.Any leftover cheese and ham mixture can be used in sandwiches or for bruschetta or crostini.
If available, yellow cocktail tomatoes go very nicely with the red tomatoes.
The tomatoes can be stuffed 3–4 hours in advance.
Any leftover cheese and ham mixture can be used in sandwiches or for bruschetta or crostini.

title: Gilthead bream baked in a salt crust
ingredients: 1 gilthead bream, gutted, cleaned with its head and scales (800-1000 g)
20 g extra virgin olive oil, (a dash)
steps: Place water into mixing bowl and heat 8 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, set Varoma dish onto Varoma lid, so as not to mark the work top. Cover the bottom of Varoma dish with half of the coarse salt. Carefully wash and dry the bream with a paper towel and place it on the salt, then cover the fish totally with the rest of the salt.
Place Varoma into position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Wait 5 minutes until the temperature has dropped before opening the Varoma.

Open Varoma from the side facing away from you. Break the salt and, very carefully, remove the fish (Varoma lid can be used to clean off the salt). Remove the rest of the salt and the skin and separate the four fillets.
Place fillets of bream on the plates and sprinkle with olive oil and lemon juice.
tips: Serve with potatoes or steamed vegetables.

title: Pepper vinaigrette
ingredients: 100 g green pepper, cut into pieces
100 g red pepper, cut into pieces
steps: Place green pepper, red pepper, onion, hard-boiled egg, olive oil, wine vinegar and salt into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Pour vinaigrette into a container and refrigerate until use.
tips: Ideal as an accompaniment for steamed mussels, seafood salpicón, boiled octopus, steamed potatoes, etc.
Ideal as an accompaniment for steamed mussels, seafood salpicón, boiled octopus, steamed potatoes, etc.

title: Sautéed onions and garlic
steps: Place olive oil, onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 4.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Use immediately as a base for sauces or stews or refrigerate in an air-tight container.
tips: If you prefer the onions and garlic more finely sliced, at the end chop a further 5 sec/speed 5.

title: Sautéed vegetables
ingredients: 3 leeks, finely cut (only the white part, approx. 300 g)
3 ripe tomatoes, cut into quarters (approx. 300 g)  o 200 g peeled tomatoes, drained and whole (fresh or canned)
steps: Place olive oil, onion, garlic, leeks and tomatoes into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté 10 min/120°C/speed 1. Use immediately as a base for sauces or stews or refrigerate in an air-tight container.
tips: If you prefer the vegetables more finely sliced, at the end chop a further 15 sec/speed 6.

title: Coffee granita
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add water and coffee powder and heat 8 min/90°C/speed 2.
Add cognac and mix 5 sec/speed 3, transfer to ice cube trays and allow to freeze for at least 6 hours, ideally overnight.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream into mixing bowl, beat until stiff 2 min/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk set cream aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place frozen coffee cubes into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer coffee granita and whipped cream to 6 glasses and serve immediately.

title: Raspberry and lime sorbet
steps: Place sugar and lime zest in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add raspberries and lime juice and chop 10 sec//speed 5.
Add ice cubes and blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 9 with aid of spatula. Serve immediately.

title: Mr. Tomato Head
ingredients: 60 g canned tuna in oil, well-drained
4 - 5 fresh basil leaves, washed and dried
steps: Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket inside and place courgettes and basmati rice into simmering basket. Cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Cut the tops off the tomatoes and set aside. Cut a small section from the base of the tomatoes (to create a stand) without piercing through the bottom.
Remove the seeds from the tomatoes using a teaspoon and small knife. Turn upside down and strain.
Transfer rice and courgettes to a large bowl and leave to cool down. Add a dash of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, flaked Parmesan cheese and drained tuna, mix with a wooden spoon.
Cut olives into discs (to form the eyes), create the smile (mouth) from the slice of cheese and cut basil into thin strips (the hair).
Using a small, sharp knife, cut an opening the same size as the smile into each tomato and place the piece of cheese inside. Fill tomatoes with rice mixture.
Position strips of basil (the hair) on top of the rice stuffing and place the top of the tomato previously set aside (the hat) on top. Arrange olives (eyes) under the top of the tomato.
Serve immediately.

title: Amarena cherry ice cream
ingredients: 150 - 170 g amarena cherries, in syrup, drained (1 jar)
steps: Place sugar and vanilla pod in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg yolks and cream and heat 5 min/80°C/speed 2. Remove mixing bowl lid and let cool down to 50°C (takes approx. 15 minutes when lid is open).

Add yoghurt and lime juice and stir 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to ice cube trays and freeze. Arrange amarena cherries on a dish, making sure none are touching, and also freeze. Allow both to freeze for approx. 8 hours (ideally overnight).
Place frozen cubes in mixing bowl and blend until creamy 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula.
Add frozen amarena cherries and stir 5 sec//speed 7 with aid of spatula. Serve immediately.
tips: Amarena cherries are small dark coloured Italian cherries, usually bottled in syrup. The amarena cherries take approx. 8 hours to freeze. They will not become rock hard, but rather can still be squeezed.If canned cherries are used instead of Amarena cherries, reduce freezing time to 2 hours.Reserve the cherry syrup and serve with the ice cream or other desserts as a sauce.If you like the pieces of cherries smaller, do not activate reverse mode in the final step.

Amarena cherries are small dark coloured Italian cherries, usually bottled in syrup. The amarena cherries take approx. 8 hours to freeze. They will not become rock hard, but rather can still be squeezed.
If canned cherries are used instead of Amarena cherries, reduce freezing time to 2 hours.
Reserve the cherry syrup and serve with the ice cream or other desserts as a sauce.
If you like the pieces of cherries smaller, do not activate reverse mode in the final step.

title: Spiced nuts
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C. Line baking tray with baking paper.
Place starch, icing sugar, 1 tsp salt, 2 tsp sweet paprika, 1 tsp hot paprika, 1 tsp curry powder in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place peanuts and egg in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec//speed .

Add spice mixture and mix 30 sec//speed . Arrange peanuts on baking tray. Separate peanuts with a fork and bake for approx. 12–15 minutes (150°C). Meanwhile, place 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp sweet paprika, ½ tsp hot paprika and ½ tsp cumin in a large bowl and mix.
Mix peanuts into the bowl of spices and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Add oil, mix, allow to cool completely and serve in individual portions or store in an air-tight container.
tips: Vary the nuts to taste and season for example with ground rosemary, smoked salt or cayenne pepper.The spiced nuts keep longer if they are kept in airtight packaging in a cool, dry place.
Vary the nuts to taste and season for example with ground rosemary, smoked salt or cayenne pepper.
The spiced nuts keep longer if they are kept in airtight packaging in a cool, dry place.

title: Hot orange chocolate on a stick
ingredients: orange zest, 2 strips (1 x 4 cm each)
100 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, in pieces
steps: Place sugar, orange zest and cinnamon in mixing bowl and chop 12 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dark chocolate and milk chocolate and chop 8 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Then melt 3 min/60°C/speed 2.5.
Transfer chocolate to 8 silicone chocolate moulds (each 15 g) and allow to cool at room temperature for 5 minutes.

Stick 1 wooden skewer or spoon into the centre of each chocolate. Allow the chocolate to cool for a further 30 minutes, then cool completely in the fridge for 2 hours. Carefully remove from the moulds, transfer to gift bags and store dry.
tips: Alternatively, 6 larger moulds (25–35 g) can be used.Unopened, Hot orange chocolate on a stick keeps for up to 2 months if stored in a cool, dry place.Serve Hot orange chocolate on a stick with mugs of hot milk to make hot chocolate.
Alternatively, 6 larger moulds (25–35 g) can be used.
Unopened, Hot orange chocolate on a stick keeps for up to 2 months if stored in a cool, dry place.
Serve Hot orange chocolate on a stick with mugs of hot milk to make hot chocolate.

title: Sweet or savoury pancakes
ingredients: 25 g soy flour, full fat, as egg replacement
vegetable oil for frying, e.g. butter-flavoured rapeseed oil (vegan)
steps: Place wheat flour, soy flour, sugar, salt and soy drink in mixing bowl, mix 20 sec/speed 4 and allow to steep in mixing bowl for 10 minutes.
Add baking powder and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Fry 4 pancakes (Ø 20–22 cm) from the batter in a non-stick pan. Add a sweet or savoury topping to the pancakes and serve hot.
tips: Soy flour is available in health food shops. It can be used as a vegan egg replacement to make dough.Any plant-based substitute can be used instead of milk, e.g. rice drink, soy-rice drink, almond milk, etc.Replace a portion of the liquid (100–150 g) with carbonated mineral water. This will make the pancakes fluffier.The quantities can be doubled; the Thermomix® settings will remain the same.
Soy flour is available in health food shops. It can be used as a vegan egg replacement to make dough.
Any plant-based substitute can be used instead of milk, e.g. rice drink, soy-rice drink, almond milk, etc.
Replace a portion of the liquid (100–150 g) with carbonated mineral water. This will make the pancakes fluffier.
The quantities can be doubled; the Thermomix® settings will remain the same.

Sweet pancakes: Sprinkle finished pancakes with icing sugar, cinnamon and sugar, or drizzle with maple syrup. Add thin slices of apple or other fruit (e.g. cherries, blueberries, rhubarb) to the unset batter in the pan and brown on both sides as desired.Savoury pancakes:Add chopped herbs to the pancake batter and garnish finished pancakes with tomatoes.Add vegetables (e.g. spinach, pre-steamed leek, mushroom slices or peas) to the unset batter in the pan and use vegan cheese alternatives, as desired.

Sweet pancakes: Sprinkle finished pancakes with icing sugar, cinnamon and sugar, or drizzle with maple syrup. Add thin slices of apple or other fruit (e.g. cherries, blueberries, rhubarb) to the unset batter in the pan and brown on both sides as desired.

Savoury pancakes:Add chopped herbs to the pancake batter and garnish finished pancakes with tomatoes.Add vegetables (e.g. spinach, pre-steamed leek, mushroom slices or peas) to the unset batter in the pan and use vegan cheese alternatives, as desired.

title: Apricot yoghurt dip with curry
ingredients: 240 g canned apricots, drained (weight after draining)
steps: Place 100 g drained apricots in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 140 g apricots, natural yoghurt, ketchup, lemon juice, curry powder, salt and cayenne pepper into mixing bowl and puree 10 sec/speed 6.
Add chopped apricots and stir 5 sec//speed 2 verrühren. Season to taste, transfer to a bowl and serve as desired.
tips: This dip is great with turkey, chicken or fish burgers.
This dip is great with turkey, chicken or fish burgers.

title: Stir fried broccoli with carrot
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place garlic cloves into mixing bowl, chop 10 sec//speed 5. Carefully avoiding to touch the blades, remove garlic skin. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add broccoli florets, carrots and salt, cook 6 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: To achieve softer texture of the broccoli, prolong up to 1 minute cooking time in step 3.
Add 50 g of fresh mushrooms and/or red peppers in step 3 to enhance its colour and nutritional value.

title: Nasi Lemak
ingredients: 1 ½ pandan leaf, tied into knots
1 stalks fresh lemon grass, white part only and sliced
20 - 40 g chilli, dried, large and mild heat, deseeded and soaked to soften
½ piece cucumber, sliced, to garnish
steps: Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add rice, coconut milk, ginger, pandan leaves, lemongrass and salt to it. Stir well with spatula.
Set Varoma dish into position, add eggs to it. Close Varoma lid and cook 18 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Remove Varoma and place eggs in cold water before removing egg shell. Cut into halves and set aside.
Remove simmering basket with spatula. With aid of spatula, transfer cooked rice into a thermal serving bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in tamarind paste and water. Mix, deseed and set aside. Place dried chillies, garlic cloves, shallots and cooking oil into mixing bowl, blend 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add light soy sauce, sugar, salt and tamarind-water mixture, cook 12 min 30 sec/120°C//speed 2.

Without measuring cup, cook 1 min 40 sec/120°C//speed 2 , meanwhile, add deep fried anchovies and onions through hole of mixing bowl lid. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. In a serving plate, add a portion of cooked coconut rice, sambal and reserved eggs, garnish with sliced cucumber and roasted peanuts. Serve hot.
tips: Instead of deep fried crispy anchovies, try toasting the anchovies in oven for 15 minutes at 150°C or until light golden brown. The anchovies will become crispy once it is cooled.
Add 1 tbsp of coconut oil in step 4 after rice is cooked to enhance coconut aroma.
Thermal serving bowl is ideal to keep cooked rice warm.

Replace coconut milk with virgin coconut oil for better health benefit. Omit 200 g of coconut milk and add 1300 g of water in step 1. In step 4, add 60 g of virgin coconut oil into the cooked rice and mix well.

title: Baked falafel kofta
ingredients: 100 g white bread, toasted and cut into pieces
200 g potatoes, cut into cubes (2-3 cm)
200 g red onions, cut into quarters
10 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing and brushing
130 g canned chickpeas, drained  o 130 g cooked chickpeas, drained
250 g cooked black-eyed beans, drained  o 250 g canned black beans, drained
2 tbsp lemon juice  o 2 tbsp lime juice
steps: Place toasted bread into mixing bowl and grind 9 sec/speed 9. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket, add potato cubes in it and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula, set aside to cool and empty mixing bowl.
Place garlic, onions and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and then sauté 4 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add reserved cooked potatoes, parsley, coriander, chickpeas, black eyed beans, cumin, salt, black pepper, tahini paste and lemon juice and chop 10 sec/speed 6 with aid of spatula, adjust seasoning if needed. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 180ºC. Grease a baking tray with oil and set aside.

With oiled hands form small balls and roll them in reserved bread crumbs to coat. Press gently to form small patties and transfer to prepared baking tray. Brush falafel with olive oil and bake in preheated oven (180°C) for 15 minutes. Turn them over, brush other side with olive oil and continue baking for another 15 minutes. Serve hot or warm.
tips: Serve with tahini dip (tarator).
For a gluten free alternative replace the bread with 50 g almonds. In step 1 grind the almonds 7 sec/speed 8.

title: Layered patties and vegetables with bell pepper sauce
ingredients: 150 g spring onions, cut into pieces
900 g lamb shoulder meat, minced  o 900 g beef, minced
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
1 tsp ground white pepper, plus extra to taste
400 - 500 g onions, 300 g cut in halves
150 g red peppers, cut into pieces
20 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
200 - 250 g green peppers, cut into 8 rings
steps: Place parsley and spring onions into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lamb mince, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp ground white pepper and mix 30 sec/speed 3. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate for 20 minutes.

Place 300 g onions cut in halves, red bell peppers and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then remove measuring cup and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed . Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add canned tomatoes, tomato purée, water, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp pepper and mix 5 sec/speed 3.

Lightly grease Varoma dish and tray. Slice remaining 100-200 g onions, crosswise to obtain 8 slices. Distribute 5 onion slices in Varoma dish and 3 in Varoma tray. Shape mince into 8 patties.| Place patties on top of onions and cover each patty with a potato slice, a tomato slice and a green pepper ring. Any leftover potato slices can be distributed between the patties. Season with salt and pepper, set Varoma into position and cook 50 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve layered patties and vegetables with pepper sauce.
tips: For an even more appealing presentation, transfer steamed patties into an ovenproof dish, pour some sauce on top and brown for 5 minutes under the grill.
To rewarm or gratin: transfer layered patties and vegetables into an oven dish, pour some sauce on top and place under the preheated oven grill for 5 minutes or until grilled.
