Extra sauce could be used for further uses as e.g. to dress rice or pasta.

title: Lotus Seeds With Lily Bulb Dessert Soup
ingredients: 100 g fresh lotus seeds, deveined, halved
80 - 100 g lump sugar, adjust to taste
50 g fresh lily bulbs, peeled into petals
steps: Insert simmering basket, weigh in red dates, wolfberries and lotus seeds. Add honey dates to it. Remove simmering basket with spatula and wash under running tap water to clean and drain. Set aside.
Place water and lump sugar in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket with red dates, wolfberries, lotus seeds and honey dates, cook 60 min/98°C/speed 2.
Carefully add lily bulbs to simmering basket, cook again 20 min/98°C/speed 2. Transfer to serving bowls, serve hot or chilled.

title: Mandarin Almond Cookies
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place butter, sugar and mandarin zest in mixing bowl, beat 3 min/speed 4.
Add orange flavour and egg, mix 1 min/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ground almonds, flour, cornflour and chopped almonds, mix 40 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a pastry mat.

Divide dough evenly into 4 portions and roll each into cylinder shape (Ø 3 cm). Place cookie doughs in freezer to chill for 30 minutes or until firm. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 160°C and line a baking tray with parchment paper and set aside.

Cut each chilled and firm dough into slices (8 mm thickness) and arrange on prepared baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes (160°C) or until light golden brown. Carefully remove cookies from oven and allow to cool on a wire rack. Serve or store in an air-tight container for up to 2 weeks.

title: Peruvian Seabass Salad
ingredients: 320 g yellow capsicums, cut in pieces
½ tsp Hainan yellow capsicum sauce
1 sweet corn on the cob, separate kernels and leaves
steps: Place yellow capsicum, milk and water in mixing bowl, cook 40 min/95°C//speed 1. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place using spatula and strain cooking water, reserve capsicum in mixing bowl. Remove simmering basket with spatula.

Add celery, ginger, shallots, lime juice, salt, yellow capsicum sauce and light soy sauce to mixing bowl, chop 10 sec/speed 5. Then blend 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Line Varoma tray with baking paper and set aside.
Cut seabass fillets in cubes (2 cm x 2 cm), season with sea salt and arrange on 8 corn leaves. Arrange corn leaves with fish on Varoma tray, drizzle with reserved yellow capsicum marinade.

Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma dish into position, insert Varoma tray with fish. Close Varoma lid and steam 16 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer corn leaves with seabass on a warmed serving plate. Empty mixing bowl.
Place red chillies, shallots and lime juice in mixing bowl, chop 3 sec/speed 5.

Add celery leaves, coriander leaves and reserved corn kernels, mix 10 sec//speed 1. Transfer to serving plate with seabass, garnish with fried shallots and ground black pepper. Using a kitchen blow torch, sear the edges of corn leaves to release aroma. Serve immediately.
tips: The corn leaves are for presentation purpose only.

title: Sour Plum Sauce
ingredients: 200 g red onions, cut into halves
120 g salted plums in brine, drained, pits removed
600 g fresh black plums, pits removed, cut into quarters
steps: Place garlic cloves, red onions and red chillies in mixing bowl, blend 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add salted plums and fresh plums, start Blend /20 sec.

Add brown sugar, honey and white vinegar. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to prevent splashing and cook 45 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve as condiment or transfer to 2 airtight jars (300 g each) and store in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.
tips: Recipe contributed by Lim Kim Sian.

title: Sea Vegetable Stew
ingredients: 10 g dried Japanese kelp (kombu), cut in squares (2 cm x 2 cm), rinsed
6 dried shiitake mushrooms, rinsed, soaked to soften for 30 minutes
300 g white radish, peeled, cut in chunks (2 cm)
1 fresh red chilli  o 1 dried chilli
steps: Place circular kelp head, kelp, mushrooms, white radish, ginger, chilli, cold pressed sesame oil, 3-booster powder, sea salt, light soy sauce, blackstrap molasses, water, molasses powder and balsamic vinegar in mixing bowl, cook 45 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: You can make your own 3-booster powder by mixing nutritional yeast, wheatgerm and lecithin in the weight ratio of 1:2:2. Store remaining 3-booster powder in an airtight container.

title: Braised Sea Cucumber With Roast Pork
ingredients: 300 g roasted pork (siew yoke), cut in cubes (3 cm)
5 dried chillies, deseeded, soaked to soften (opcional)
350 g sea cucumber, presoaked, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
steps: Place ginger and garlic cloves in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, roasted pork cubes and dried chillies, cook 4 min/Varoma//speed .
Add sea cucumber, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, water, sugar and white pepper powder, cook 50 min/98°C//speed .
Cook again 15 min/Varoma//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Cooking time required for sea cucumber can vary depending on the type used.

title: Braised Eggs
ingredients: 1 Chinese black cardamom pod (cao guo), cracked open
100 g white onion, cut in pieces
steps: Use a small knife or needle to pierce a tiny hole on the larger side of the egg (see tips).

Place reserved eggs in mixing bowl and add water to fill to the 1 L mark, then start Egg Boiler /Medium soft. Using a slotted spoon, carefully transfer eggs into simmering basket and run under water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool briefly. Peel off shells and set eggs aside.

Place 900 g water, nutmeg, bay leaves, cao guo, cinnamon stick, star anise, peppercorns, white onion, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, salt and sugar in mixing bowl, cook 18 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer to a large bowl and let cool thoroughly for later use. Arrange reserved eggs in the bowl, cover with cling film, and set aside in the refrigerator to soak for 12 hours. Take out the eggs and serve chilled.
tips: Piercing a hole in the air space of the eggs can make it easier to cool and peel off the eggshell. You can also omit this step.
Excess marinade can be frozen and stored well, and can be used after boiling before the next usage.

title: Virgin Chai Vanilla Cocktail
ingredients: 2 vanilla bean pods, halved, seeds only
whole nutmeg, freshly grated, for sprinkling
steps: Place water in mixing bowl and bring to a boil 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add tea, insert measuring cup and leave to rest for 10 minutes. Sieve tea through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Discard tea leaves.

Place brewed tea, cinnamon, star anise, cloves, fennel seeds, cardamom, vanilla seeds and sugar in mixing bowl then cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a glass jar or bottle then allow to cool completely. Clean mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place 200 g chai vanilla syrup and egg white in mixing bowl then whisk 2 min/speed 3.5.
Add cream and whip 1 min 30 sec/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add ice, ginger beer and salt then mix 20 sec/speed 5. Divide between 4 margarita or cocktail glasses. Serve immediately, garnished with star anise and sprinkled with freshly grated nutmeg.

title: Tahini and almond ice lollies
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, plus 2 pinches extra
200 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, in pieces
steps: Place almonds in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add egg yolks, tahini, milk, vanilla seeds and 2 pinches salt then start Thicken /80°C. Meanwhile, toast reserved chopped almonds in a dry frying pan over medium heat until golden brown. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Add cream and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2.5. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream to a container.

Place remaining ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream. Fill 16 ice lolly molds, insert sticks and freeze for approx. 2 hours or until solid (see tip). Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7.

Add coconut oil, honey and remaining ½ tsp salt, then warm 5 min/60°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, line a chopping board with baking paper and set aside. Transfer chocolate sauce to a tall glass. Dip each ice lolly in chocolate sauce, then coat in prepared toasted almonds, allow to cool for 10-15 seconds and place on baking paper. Transfer to freezer and freeze for approx. 1 hour before serving.
tips: Fill as many ice lolly moulds as you need and keep left over ice cream in a container in the freezer for up to 2-3 days.

title: Gin and lavender gelato
ingredients: 1 ½ - 2 tbsp edible lavender flowers (approx. 5 g)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add milk and lavender then heat 6 min/95°C/speed 2.5. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and let steep for approx. 10 minutes. Pour through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl. Reserve milk, discard lavender.
Place half of lavender milk, egg yolks and vanilla in mixing bowl then start Thicken /80°C.

Add remaining lavender milk, crème fraîche, lemon juice and gin, then heat 3 min/70°C/speed 2. Pour custard up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) or 3-4 ice cube trays and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before placing in freezer for at least 10 hours.

Place frozen ice cream in refrigerator for 5-10 minutes, then cut into pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) with a long sharp knife. Place half of the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer ice cream to a container.

Place remaining frozen ice cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4 with aid of spatula. Transfer to container with ice cream and freeze for approx. 4 hours or until desired consistency is achieved or serve immediately.

title: Orange coloured eggs
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place eggs, onion skins and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Carefully transfer contents of mixing bowl to a bowl and leave eggs in liquid to intensify colour (see Tip).
Allow to cool and serve or store in refrigerator and consume within 1 week
tips: Allow eggs to remain in dyeing water to intensify the color. Leave eggs for at least 30 minutes up to several hours until the desired colour intensity is reached.
Rub the eggs with a cloth soaked in vinegar to roughen the shells and ensure the colour adheres. Results of dyeing with natural ingredients may vary, depending on quality colour agents.
To create patterns on egg shells, place flowers, herbs or grass leaves on raw eggs and seal the eggs tightly in nylon socks before placing them in mixing bowl for cooking in step 1.

title: Yellow coloured eggs
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place eggs, turmeric powder and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Carefully transfer contents of mixing bowl to a bowl and leave eggs in liquid to intensify colour (see Tip).
Allow to cool and serve or store in refrigerator and consume within 1 week.
tips: Allow eggs to remain in dyeing water to intensify the color. Leave eggs for at least 30 minutes up to several hours until the desired colour intensity is reached.
Rub the eggs with a cloth soaked in vinegar to roughen the shells and ensure the colour adheres. Results of dyeing with natural ingredients may vary, depending on quality colour agents.
To create patterns on egg shells, place flowers, herbs or grass leaves on raw eggs and seal the eggs tightly in nylon socks before placing them in mixing bowl for cooking in step 1.

title: Red-bown coloured eggs
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place eggs, beetroot juice and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Carefully transfer contents of mixing bowl to a bowl and leave eggs in liquid to intensify colour (see Tip).
Allow to cool and serve or store in refrigerator and consume within one week.
tips: Allow eggs to remain in dyeing water to intensify the color. Leave eggs for at least 30 minutes up to several hours until the desired colour intensity is reached.
Rub the eggs with a cloth soaked in vinegar to roughen the shells and ensure the colour adheres. Results of dyeing with natural ingredients may vary, depending on quality colour agents.
To create patterns on egg shells, place flowers, herbs or grass leaves on raw eggs and seal the eggs tightly in nylon socks before placing them in mixing bowl for cooking in step 1.

title: Scotch Eggs with celeriac and carrot salad
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
300 g celeriac, cut in pieces (2 cm)
300 g carrots, cut in pieces (2 cm)
600 g beef, boneless, sinew free, cut in pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl and start Egg Boiler /Medium. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool briefly and peel, then set aside.
Place celeriac and carrots in mixing bowl then chop 6 sec/speed 4.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add yoghurt, mayonnaise, lemon juice, honey, salt and white pepper then mix 5 sec//speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place shallots and parsley in mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add beef and mince 16-20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add 1 egg, mustard, 20 g breadcrumbs, salt and white pepper then mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and divide mixture into 6 equal parts. Whisk remaining egg in another bowl. Place remaining 50 g breadcrumbs in a third bowl.

Flour cooked eggs, coat each egg carefully with 1 part prepared meat mixture to form a ball and squeeze carefully to seal. Dip coated egg first in whisked egg, then coat with breadcrumbs and set aside. Repeat with remaining cooked eggs, meat mixture, whisked egg and breadcrumbs.

Heat deep-frying oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat and deep-fry Scotch eggs for approx. 5 minutes or until golden brown. Carefully remove fried Scotch eggs using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve Scotch eggs immediately with celeriac-carrot salad (see Tip).
tips: Scotch eggs and celeriac-carrot salad can be prepared in advance and kept in refrigerator for up to 1-2 days.
Keep in mind that this recipe contains raw or not fully cooked eggs.
Serve with lemon slices.

title: Light blue coloured eggs
ingredients: 150 g red cabbage, cut in pieces (3 cm)
water, to fill to 1 l mark
steps: Place red cabbage in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Hard. Carefully transfer contents of mixing bowl to a bowl and leave eggs in liquid to intensify colour (see Tip).
Allow to cool and serve or store in refrigerator and consume within 1 week.
tips: Allow eggs to remain in dyeing water to intensify the color. Leave eggs for at least 30 minutes up to several hours until the desired colour intensity is reached.
Rub the eggs with a cloth soaked in vinegar to roughen the shells and ensure the colour adheres. Results of dyeing with natural ingredients may vary, depending on quality colour agents.
To create patterns on egg shells, place flowers, herbs or grass leaves on raw eggs and seal the eggs tightly in nylon socks before placing them in mixing bowl for cooking in step 2.

title: Eggs in Falafel coating with yoghurt sauce
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
110 g spring onions, cut in rings (1 cm)
steps: Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Medium. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Peel eggs and set aside.
Place yoghurt, lime juice, honey, cardamom, black pepper and salt in mixing bowl then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Place spring onions, garlic, fresh coriander leaves and fresh parsley leaves in mixing bowl then chop 4 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add egg yolk, chickpeas, oil, lemon juice, ground coriander, cumin and salt, then blend 15 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add flour, baking powder and breadcrumbs then mix 10 sec/speed 5. Place a sheet of cling film on work surface. Divide falafel mixture into 6 portions. Place 1 portion on prepared cling film, cover with a second sheet of cling film and flatten carefully using a rolling pin. Remove top sheet of cling film. Place 1 cooked egg on falafel mixture and coat egg with the help of cling film to form a ball. Remove cling film and set aside. Repeat with remaining falafel mixture and eggs.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan on high heat and deep fry eggs in falafel coating for approx. 5 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately (see Tip) with yoghurt sauce.
tips: Serve on fresh spinach leaves or a salad.
Note that this recipe contains raw or not fully cooked eggs.

title: Eggs with herb sauce and Easter biscuits
ingredients: water, to fill to 1 l mark
100 g flour, plus extra for flouring
1 bunch fresh chives, (approx. 10 g), cut in rings
6 tsp caviar  o 6 tsp lumpfish roe
steps: Place eggs and water (up to 1 l mark) in mixing bowl then start Egg Boiler /Medium soft. Use a slotted spoon to carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Allow to cool and peel, then set aside.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place cream, flour, baking powder, cumin seeds and salt in mixing bowl then mix 30 sec/speed 3. Transfer dough to a floured surface.

Roll out dough with a rolling pin (approx. 0.5 cm thick). Cut out biscuits (see Tip) with a cookie cutter (approx. 8 cm x 5 cm). Transfer biscuits to prepared baking tray and bake for approx. 15 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Meanwhile, continue with recipe. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place parsley and chives in mixing bowl then chop 4 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add crème fraîche, milk, lemon juice, agave syrup, salt and black pepper then mix 5 sec/speed 4. Divide between 6 glass jars, place one prepared egg in each jar, add one biscuit and top each with 1 tsp caviar and 1 tsp fresh cress. Serve immediately.
tips: Note that this recipe contains raw or not fully cooked eggs.

The number of biscuits depends on the size of the cookie cutter used. Cut out at least 6 biscuits to accompany the 6 glass jars with herb sauce and eggs. Store remaining biscuits in an air-tight container.

title: Milk chocolate bars
ingredients: 15 g pistachio nuts, raw, chopped, for decorating
15 g blanched almonds, cut in pieces, for decorating
steps: Place cocoa nibs, sugar and milk powder in mixing bowl then grind 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula and grind a further 1 min/speed 6.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula and grind 2 min/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula and grind a further 2 min/speed 6. Transfer to a small bowl that fits into Varoma dish and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place 600 g water in mixing bowl and bring to a boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, cover the bowl containing chocolate powder with cling film and place it in Varoma dish. Place Varoma lid on Varoma dish.

Set Varoma in position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Towards the end of steaming time, fill a large bowl with enough ice cold water so that the bowl with chocolate stands in water more than halfway up. Set Varoma aside. Carefully place bowl containing melted chocolate in bowl with water using oven gloves and allow to cool for 2 minutes.

Place bowl with melted chocolate back in Varoma dish. Place Varoma lid on Varoma dish. Set Varoma in position and heat 15 min/80°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, prepare 4 silicone chocolate bar moulds and place them on a chopping board. Set Varoma aside. Divide tempered chocolate between prepared moulds.

Sprinkle freeze-dried raspberries, pine nuts, ground pistachio nuts, blanched almonds and hazelnuts on top of chocolate bars. Refrigerate until solid (approx. 5 hours). Serve immediately or store in an air-tight container in refrigerator.
tips: Raw chocolate bars have a grainy texture as opposed to smooth store-bought chocolate as this goes through a specific grinding process.

Tempering chocolate is not mandatory, however, the process ensures an even texture and colour. If not tempered, white stains may appear on the surface of the chocolate bars when the cocoa oil separates from the cocoa nibs.
Replace freeze-dried raspberries with freeze-dried strawberries, cherries, blackberries or banana.

Replace silicone chocolate bar moulds with aluminium foil: fold 1 of 4 pieces of aluminium foil (approx. 25 cm x 20 cm) in half and fold the sides up. Fold the corners to create a rectangle (approx. 20 cm x 10 cm). Repeat with remaining 3 pieces of aluminium foil.
Create your favourite combinations using different types of dried fruits and nuts (e.g. peanuts, cranberries, pecan nuts, apricots etc.).

title: Tarte Tatin
ingredients: 100 g butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 220°C. Grease a round cake tin (Ø 24 cm) and set aside.
Place flour, butter, water and salt in mixing bowl and knead 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer pastry to work surface and shape into a rough square. Wrap in cling film and refrigerate until needed.

To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stages mode, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with the other ingredients in the mixing bowl.

Place sugar, butter, 30 g water and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages . Meanwhile, peel apples, cut in quarters and then cut each quarter in half. Set aside.
Once caramel is ready, transfer immediately to prepared cake tin and arrange apple slices tightly on caramel.
Place vinegar and remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl then start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
Remove pastry from refrigerator and using a rolling pin, roll out to a circle roughly the size of the cake tin. Place on top of apples, tucking pastry around the edges to cover apples.

Prick pastry with a fork and bake for 30 minutes (220°C) or until golden brown. Remove from oven and immediately turn the tart over onto a serving plate. Allow to cool slightly and serve warm or cold.
tips: Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.

title: Guinean prawns
ingredients: 1000 g raw prawns, peeled and deveined
1 tsp ground dried piri piri chilli
½ tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o ½ chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
150 g cucumber, peeled and deseeded, cut in sticks (5 cm x 1 cm)
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in prawns and lemon juice. Add chilli powder and salt, combine with spatula and set aside to marinate. Meanwhile, continue with the recipe.
Place olive oil, onions and chicken stock paste in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1 .
Add cucumber and reserved marinated prawns and cook 7 min/120°C//speed . Serve immediately.
tips: Serve with cooked white rice.

title: Cachupa with pork and beans
ingredients: 200 g dried white sweetcorn kernels (type canjica)
2200 g water, plus extra for soaking
400 g bacon, cut in pieces (2 cm)
300 g pork spare ribs, cut in individual ribs
300 g kale, cut in thin strips (1 mm)
350 g sweet potato, cut in pieces (2 cm)
250 g pumpkin, cut in pieces (2 cm)
1 fresh red chilli, cut in slices
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in broad beans, white sweetcorn kernels and popcorn kernels. Add 1 crushed garlic clove, 1 bay leaf, cover with water and allow to soak for approx. 24 hours. Meanwhile continue with recipe.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in bacon, spare ribs and white wine. Add 1 bay leaf, 2 crushed garlic cloves, 1 tsp salt and pepper, mix and refrigerate for approx. 24 hours.
Place drained broad beans and corn, 1500 g water, 1 tsp salt and 1½ tsp olive oil in mixing bowl and cook 45 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place reserved marinated meat, chorizo, 1 tsp salt and 700 g water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position, weigh in kale and sweet potato. Insert Varoma tray and weigh in pumpkin. Close Varoma and steam 50 min/Varoma//speed . Set Varoma aside. Drain mixing bowl contents through a sieve, reserving broth. Cut cooked chorizo in slices.
Place onions, 30 g olive oil and 1 garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add red chilli and sauté 3 min/100°C//speed .
Add tomatoes, reserved cooked meat and chorizo and sauté 3 min/100°C//speed .
Add reserved cooked broad beans and corn, drained butter beans, 100 g reserved meat broth 1 tsp salt, and cook 10 min/120°C//speed .
Mix with spatula and cook 10 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to a serving dish, add reserved kale and sweet potato, reserved pumpkin and stir. Serve cachupa seasoned with chilli sauce.
tips: To speed up the soaking time for the dried beans, put all ingredients into a pan, cover and bring to the boil. Remove from heat and leave to stand for 2 hours.
Replace dried broad beans with 400g tinned or frozen beans, and dried corn kernels with 800g tinned or frozen corn.

title: Fish stew with cassava flour (Muzongué com musseque)
ingredients: 200 g salt cod, soaked and drained
400 g sweet potatoes, cut in slices
400 g cassava root, cut in slices
steps: Place garlic cloves, salt and lemon juice in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7. Place grouper steaks in a bowl and pour over marinade. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Clean mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in cassava flour and set aside.
Place onions and tomatoes in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add palm oil and sauté 6 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add water, insert simmering basket and weigh in salt cod and sweet potatoes. Set Varoma dish in position and weigh in cassava root. Insert Varoma tray and place marinated grouper on it. Close Varoma and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Set Varoma aside, remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and transfer contents of Varoma and simmering basket to a bowl and set aside.

Transfer 100 g broth (only top layer with the most fat) with a ladle from the mixing bowl to a bowl, add reserved cassava flour and stir well to create the musseque. Pour remaining broth over steamed grouper and vegetables, serve with musseque and bananas.
tips: Cassava flour is a naturally gluten free flour
In step 6 it is important to use the fat from the broth to blend with the cassava flour and thicken the stew.
If grouper is unavailable, use another firm white fish, e.g. cod or bream.

title: Spiced fish stew
ingredients: 130 g roasted red peppers, preserved (see tip)
240 g floury potatoes, cut in pieces (1-2 cm)
1 chicken stock cube  o 1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade
1 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o 1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
200 g celeriac, cut in thin slices
10 g fresh coriander leaves, plus extra, chopped, to garnish
300 g floury potatoes, cut in pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
400 g white fish fillet, skinless, cut in pieces (5 cm)
steps: Place a jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh in olive oil and set aside.
Place roasted red pepper, garlic cloves and red chilli in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add potatoes, saffron, water and chicken stock cube and cook 16 min/100°C/speed 1, then blend 1 min/speed 5.
Mix 40 sec/speed 4 while very slowly pouring reserved olive oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion.
Add salt and ground pepper and mix with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside in refrigerator until ready to serve. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cumin seeds and coriander seeds in mixing bowl and heat 3 min/100°C/speed 1, then grind 1 min/speed 9.
Add roasted red peppers, red chillies, garlic cloves and salt and blend 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place fennel seeds, cumin seeds and coriander seeds in mixing bowl and heat 3 min/100°C/speed 1, then grind 30 sec/speed 9.
Add garlic clove, red chilli, onions, celery and saffron and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil, salt and pepper and sauté 5 min/100°C//speed .
Add water, chicken stock, tomatoes, celeriac, coriander and potatoes and cook 15 min/100°C//speed .

Add 30 g prepared Harissa. Set Varoma dish in position, weigh in fish and mussels. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma//speed . Set Varoma aside and remove bones from steamed fish and shell steamed mussels.

Add cooked fish, shelled mussels and lemon juice to the stew in mixing bowl and gently mix with spatula. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, and serve with toasted bread, alongside potato sauce and harissa.
tips: Harissa is a spicy condiment popular in North Africa. Leftover harissa paste can be stored in a jar in the refrigerator. Serve as a hot sauce.
Roasted red peppers can be bought ready roasted in a jar. To make roasted peppers yourself, halve and deseed whole red peppers and roast in a preheated oven for 30 minutes (180°C).

title: Veal fillet with mirabelle plums
steps: Place lemon juice, honey, soy sauce and five-spice powder in mixing bowl and heat 1 min/40°C/speed 2. Transfer to a large bowl, place it on mixing bowl lid, weigh veal in it and marinate for at least 1 hour.

Remove veal from the bowl, reserving the marinade. Heat olive oil and butter in a frying pan and brown the veal on all sides. Lay the browned veal on a large sheet of baking paper (approx. 50 cm x 50 cm), season with salt and pepper, add thyme and bay leaf, close baking paper into a pouch and place in the Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed . Meanwhile pit mirabelle plums and cut in halves.

Remove Varoma, open pouch, add mirabelles and reserved marinade to it, close it up, cover Varoma and set Varoma back in position and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside. Serve the meat sliced, garnished with the mirabelles, spoon the meat juices over and serve hot.
tips: Veal is very popular in French cooking, and this dish is very typical.
For a lactose-free recipe, only use olive oil (30 g) in step 2.
Mirabelle plums are a small orange coloured french plum, if they are unavailable, use any other kind of plum.

title: Veal in tuna sauce
ingredients: 80 g canned tuna in oil, drained
10 g capers and a little extra for the garnish
1 white veal top round roast, (800-1000 g)
steps: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid and pour in the sunflower oil to weigh. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place tuna, capers and anchovies into mixing bowl and blend 4 sec/speed 7.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend 4 sec/speed 7.

Add vinegar, egg, egg yolk, lemon juice, salt and mix 3 min/speed 5. While doing so, slowly pour the oil onto the mixing bowl lid, around the measuring cup, so it drops in a fine thread and emulsifies. Mix again 2 min/speed 5.
Season the veal round with the salt and pepper, wrap in cling film and place into Varoma. Cover and set aside.
Pour water into the mixing bowl, place Varoma into position and steam 35 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma, allow the veal round to cool and refrigerate, without removing the cling film, for 12 hours.

Cut meat into slices and place them in a large serving dish, in a single layer. Serve the meat cold in slices and covered with part of the sauce, with more capers to garnish. Place rest of the sauce in a sauce dish.

title: Peppers stuffed with salted cod brandade
ingredients: 400 g salt cod, soaked and shredded (without skin and bones)
1 can piquillo peppers, preserved, (approx. 20-24 pieces), approx. 490 g net weight
150 g red pepper, in 2 or 3 pieces
1 leek, (only the white part) in 2 or 3 pieces
steps: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and add olive oil, sunflower oil and sauté 6 min/120°C/speed . Transfer the contents to a heat resistant jug and set aside.
Place salted cod, milk and white pepper into the mixing bowl and heat 6 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove mixing bowl lid and mixing bowl and allow to solidify for 10 minutes.
Return mixing bowl to its position and blend 30 sec/speed 5-10 increasing speed gradually.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. With the measuring cup inserted, blend 3 min/speed 5. Meanwhile, pour the set aside garlic oil very slowly onto the mixing bowl lid.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Pour into a bowl and allow to cool completely (approx. 12 hours in the refrigerator, until solidifying).
Strain piquillo peppers into simmering basket. Set aside one piquillo pepper for the sauce. Fill the others with the brandade and place them into a casserole dish.
Place fresh red pepper, leek and olive oil in the mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Pre-heat oven to 180°C.
Add cream, chopped piquillo pepper set aside, salt and pepper to the mixing bowl and heat 7 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Wait 5 minutes to cool slightly and blend 30 sec/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.
Pour the sauce onto the peppers and bake (180°C) for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
tips: To soak the salted cod: place in abundant water for at least 24 hours, changing the water at least 3 or 4 times.
Refrigerate any leftover stuffing. You can also serve the brandade with toast in other recipes.
For good brandade, it is important to use salted cod.

title: Lamb stew
ingredients: 900 g lamb meat for stew, boneless, cut (3 cm x 3 cm)
steps: Place garlic and oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add lamb seasoned with salt and pepper and sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .
Add paprika, vinegar, thyme, oregano and bay leaf and sauté 7 min/120°C//speed .
Add white wine and cook 10 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to a dish and serve hot.

title: Turrón
ingredients: 1 tsp cinnamon, ground, (plus more for sprinkling)
steps: Place 300 g of almonds on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes (180°C, without pre-heating). Allow almonds to cool for at least 2 hours.
Place sugar and lemon zest into mixing bowl and grind 40 sec/speed 10.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add toasted almonds and cinnamon. Grind 15 sec/speed 6.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Blend 30 sec/speed 6 until the mixture has a slightly oily consistency similar to sawdust.
If it has not reached the required consistency, scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 30 sec/speed 6.

Line a wooden box with sheets of baking paper, ensuring they overlap on the sides. Sprinkle the paper on the inside of the box with cinnamon and transfer the mixture, pressing downwards and smoothening with a spoon. Cover the turrón with the paper and close the box. Allow to stand for at least 30 minutes before cutting into portions for serving.

title: Green mojo
steps: Place garlic and coriander into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add salt, olive oil and vinegar. Blend 3 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually to bind the sauce and obtain a uniform texture. Pour into a bowl and serve with potatoes, seafood or fish, or refrigerate in an air-tight container.
tips: For a more intense colour, add a few leaves of parsley which also soften the taste of the coriander.
For a more intense colour, add a few leaves of parsley which also soften the taste of the coriander.

title: Bread stew with tomato and onion
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in the bread and water and allow to soak.
Place olive oil, onion, garlic and tomatoes into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add soaked bread with water, salt and pepper and cook 7 min/100°C//speed . Sprinkle with chopped coriander and serve.

title: Meat pasties
ingredients: ½ tsp meat stock paste  o ½ meat stock cube
270 g flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place butter, olive oil, onions and carrots into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add meat, soy sauce, wine, meat stock paste and salt and cook 25 min/120°C/speed 1.
Blend 15 sec/speed 8.
Add milk and flour and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Clean mixing bowl.
Place butter and lard into mixing bowl and heat 2 min/100°C/speed 2.

Add water, flour and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Form into a ball, wrap in cling film and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Sprinkle a surface with flour and roll out pastry thinly. Cut out a square of approx. 12 x 12 cm, place 1 tsp of filling in the middle and brush with water. Seal leaving some air inside, squeeze the edges and cut off the excess with a pastry cutter. Repeat the process until all the pastry and filling has been used up. Fry pasties in plenty of hot oil. Place on a paper towel to remove excess oil. Serve hot or cold.
tips: Can be baked in the oven. Brush with egg yolk and put in a pre-heated oven at 180°C for around 15-20 minutes.

title: Neapolitan
ingredients: 30 g water, to be adjusted according to weight of fondant
steps: Place sugar and water into mixing bowl, then heat 25 min/120°C/speed 2 without measuring cup. Then let temperature fall to 70°C.

Insert butterfly whisk and whip 2 min/speed 4, then again 2 min/speed 2. Transfer onto a work surface and knead until paste is white and uniform. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and leave to mature for 2-3 days in refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs, sugar and vanilla essence into mixing bowl and whip 15 min/65°C/speed 3.5.

Add flour and cornstarch, then whip 10 sec/speed 1. Finish off by gently incorporating flour with aid of spatula if necessary (see tip). Empty mixture out onto prepared tray and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes (180°C). Clean mixing bowl. Remove cake from the oven, allow it to cool and cut it across into three equal parts.
Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggsand sugar into mixing bowl and whip 15 min/65°C/speed 3.5.

Add flour, cornstarch and cocoa, then whip 10 sec/speed 1. Finish off by gently incorporating flour with aid of spatula if necessary (see tip). Empty mixture out onto prepared tray and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes (180°C). Clean mixing bowl. Remove cake from the oven, allow it to cool and cut it accross into three equal parts.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Then melt 3 min/55°C/speed 1.

Add cream and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Cover one third of chocolate biscuit with ganache, place one third of vanilla biscuit on top, also cover it with ganache, then place one third of chocolate biscuit on top. Repeat operation with remaining biscuit, alternating 2 parts vanilla biscuit and 1 part chocolate biscuit. Clean mixing bowl.

Place white fondant, cut into pieces, and 10% of its weight in water into mixing bowl, then melt 6 min/37°C/speed 1. Coat each of the two cakes with white icing. Sprinkle with chocolate or coloured sprinkles and trim to get a clean edge with a sharp knife. Cut each cake into slices and keep cool until ready to serve.
tips: For best results, prepare the white fondant 2-3 days in advance.It is best to finish incorporating the flour using the spatula so that the mixture does not collapse and keeps its lightness.
For best results, prepare the white fondant 2-3 days in advance.
It is best to finish incorporating the flour using the spatula so that the mixture does not collapse and keeps its lightness.

title: Chicken and pear pie
ingredients: 160 g butter, unsalted, chilled, plus extra for greasing
160 g cornflour (starch), plus extra for dusting
1 leek, white part only, cut into pieces
600 g chicken meat, skinless, boneless, cut into cubes (3 cm) (see tip)
½ tsp black pepper, freshly ground
1 tbsp vegetable stock paste  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
150 g pear (approx. 1 pear), peeled, core removed and cut into cubes (2 cm)
steps: Grease a high-sided pie dish (23 cm) and set aside.
Place rice flour, cornstarch, salt and xanthan gum into mixing bowl and combine 5 sec/speed 4.
Add butter and combine 10 sec/speed 6.
Add egg, vinegar and water and mix 10 sec/speed 6, then knead Dough /30 sec.
Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or floured work surface and work into a tight ball. Wrap in cling film and place into refrigerator to chill for a minimum 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Roll out ⅔ of the pastry between a silicone bread mat and a sheet of baking paper or between two sheets of baking paper into a circle (Ø 25 cm).
Line pie dish with rolled out pastry, then place into refrigerator to chill for 15 minutes. Wrap remaining pastry in cling film and place into refrigerator until ready to use.
Blind bake pastry case for 20 minutes (180°C) or until lightly golden (see tips). Set pastry case aside to cool while you prepare the filling.
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Place garlic and leek into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add chicken, thyme and pepper and cook 5 min/90°C//speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Place a ceramic or glass bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh water into it. Add cornflour to ceramic or glass bowl and stir until cornflour has dissolved.
Add cornflour and water mixture, stock paste and wine and cook 5 min/90°C//speed 1.
Add pear and cook 8 min/90°C//speed 1.
Add cream and combine 20 sec//speed 1.
Transfer chicken and pear filling into pastry case. Remove remaining pastry from refrigerator, then roll out on a silicone bread mat or floured work surface into a circle (Ø 23 cm).

Place pastry circle over pie and seal the edges by pressing down with your fingertips or a fork. Make two slits in the center of the pastry to allow steam to escape, then bake for 40-50 minutes (200°C) or until pastry is golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Blind baking is the process of baking a pie crust without the filling to keep pie crust from becoming soggy. Prick pastry base with a fork, line with baking paper and baking weights (e. g. dried beans) and bake as indicated in the recipe.
Use boneless and skinless chicken thighs or chicken breast fillets. Chicken thigh meat will add more flavour to the filling, though.
Serve Chicken and pear pie as a hearty meal with your favourite steamed vegetables or salad on the side.
Leftovers store well in a sealable container in the refrigerator for lunches the next day.
To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products as some may contain traces of wheat or gluten.

title: Strawberry and pear pudding
ingredients: 1000 g pears, peeled and cut into pieces
steps: Soak gelatine leaves in a bowl with cold water.
Place water and lemon juice into mixingbowl and heat 3 min/100°C/speed 3.
Add pear pieces and cook 10 min/80°C/speed 2. Remove mixing bowl and wait a few minutes for it to cool.
Add soaked and well strained gelatine and sugar and blend 10 sec/speed 10.
In 10 dariole moulds, place a layer of sliced strawberries and pour in some pear gelatine. Put ramekins in freezer until the mixture sets and hardens (so that the layers are well defined).

Divide ⅓ of the pear gelatine over the ramekins and let set again. Add another layer of strawberry slices and repeat the entire process ending with slices of strawberry and pear gelatine. Keep in refrigerator and remove from ramekins the following day before serving.
tips: You can also use a cake mould (31 x 15 x 10 cm). If you use a metal mould, line it with cling film.

title: Turkey roulades with minted pea mash
ingredients: ½ lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
2 pinches fine salt, plus extra to taste
2 pinches freshly ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
4 - 6 sun-dried tomatoes, in oil, well drained
400 g turkey breast fillet, skinless (4 slices)
4 fresh mint leaves, washed and dried
steps: Place lemon zest, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop 6 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sun-dried tomatoes and garlic into mixing bowl and chop Turbo/0.5 sec/3 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Stretch out turkey slices on the work surface and, if necessary, flatten with a mallet. Season one side of each slice with lemon zest seasoning. Roll each slice into rolls with Ø 4 cm and length 10-12 cm. Tie with kitchen string and brush with 10 g olive oil. Place roulades in Varoma dish.
Place water and stock into mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and add peas. Insert Varoma and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Set Varoma aside and keep turkey rolls warm. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and strain contents. Empty mixing bowl. Place cooked peas into mixing bowl, add lemon juice, mint leaves, olive oil, salt and pepper and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Mix with aid of spatula and repeat chopping if required.
Remove string from roulades and slice, top slices with reserved sun-dried tomato paste.
Serve with mint pea mash.

title: Red mullet couscous with peppers
ingredients: 450 g red peppers, cut into large pieces
280 g yellow peppers, cut into large pieces
220 g green peppers, cut into large pieces
30 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed (1 lemon)
1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
600 g red mullet fillets (approx. 18-20 fillets) (see tip)
steps: Insert simmering basket, weigh in 200 g red pepper and set aside. Place remaining red, yellow and green peppers into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and transfer to Varoma dish.

Place fish stock and lemon juice into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, place Varoma into position and cook 12 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile, place couscous, olive oil, salt and pepper into a bowl. Rub couscous in a circular motion between your hands to moisten grains evenly and remove any lumps that may form, cover with water and stir using spatula to moisten the couscous evenly. Cover and allow to soak for 5 minutes. Gently fluff couscous with a fork to separate the grains and transfer to Varoma tray.
Remove Varoma and set aside. Add chopped peppers to couscous in Varoma tray and mix. Remove simmering basket with cooked red peppers and set aside.

Place red mullet fillets into Varoma dish, making sure some holes remain unobstructed. Insert reserved Varoma tray, place Varoma dish and tray back into position and steam 7 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside.

Transfer fish stock to a jug. Place 150 g fish stock back into mixing bowl and add cooked red peppers of simmering basket. Blend 30 sec/speed 7. Transfer couscous and red mullet fillets to individual plates. Cover with red pepper sauce and sprinkle with fresh coriander before serving.
tips: This recipe can be made with any type of thin white fish fillets, cut into pieces of approx. 6-8 cm.
This recipe can be made with any type of thin white fish fillets, cut into pieces of approx. 6-8 cm.

title: Summer seafood soup
ingredients: 330 g winter melon, peeled, cut into pieces (3 cm)
100 g scallops, fresh, cut into cubes (1 cm)
100 g raw prawns, peeled, cut into cubes (1 cm)
5 g celery stalks, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place winter melon into mixing bowl, cook 11 min/100°C/speed 1.
Purée 30 sec/speed 5.
Add water and chicken stock powder, cook 10 min 30 sec/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, mix cornflour and 2 tbsp water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add reserved cornflour mixture, cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add scallops, salt and white pepper powder, cook 2 min/100°C//speed .

Add prawns, cook 1 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, pour egg whites slowly onto mixing bowl lid, let it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream into the soup. If necessary, lift measuring cup up slightly to assist egg whites drizzling down. Garnish with chopped celery and serve hot.

title: Nasi Kampung (Kampung-style fried rice)
ingredients: 60 g yardlong bean, diagonally cut into thin slices (3 cm)  o 60 g water spinach, cut into pieces (3 cm)
fried dried small anchovies, to garnish
steps: Place garlic cloves, shallots, red chillies, bird‘s eye chillies, dried anchovies and salt into mixing bowl, chop 4 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cooking oil, sauté 5 min 30 sec/120°C/speed .
Add long beans, sauté 2 min/120°C/speed .
Insert butterfly whisk, add cooked rice, without measuring cup, stir fry 1 min 10 sec/120°C/speed 1. Remove butterfly whisk, garnish with toasted dried anchovies and serve hot.
tips: The ingredients in step 1 can be replaced with 100 g of green chilli sambal. Skip step 1 and go straight to step 2, reduce sautéing time to 3 minutes.

Cooked rice preparation: Insert simmering basket, place 300 g of long grain white rice (eg. parboiled, basmati or jasmine) and 1200 g of water into mixing bowl, cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove simmering basket with spatula. Cool completely before using in step 3. Do not refrigerate overnight.
